The Cotton Mathers produced 14 children; seven died immediately, but five of the six who reached adulthood failed to reach age 30. Andrew Eliot of Boston saved the gloves that people sent to invite him to funerals (as was the custom then); in 32 years he collected 3,000 pairs.

title: Many New Steps for the Joffrey
description: The Joffrey Ballet returns to the City Center this week after a season's absence, with virtually the widest range of new productions offered by a company in a single seasonone that Robert Joffrey, the troupe's director and founder says, I hope will be our best ever.

title: The Consumer Office That Isn't
description: STAMFORD ATTEMPTS by the state's Department of Consumer Affairs to set up a regional office in Fairfield County, which have been backed by Governor Grasso, are srea Commerce and Industry Association, the area's dominant business spokesman.

title: VEHICLE ON AIR CUSHION TO BE TESTED ON RIVER ICE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct 8 (AP)The Coast Guard is going to test a machine that rides a cushion of air to see if it can break up river ice such as the ice that trapped hundreds of vessels in the harsh winter of 197677.

title: Removing Raccoons
description: MAMARONECK ATHRIVING raccoon population is presenting Westchester homemakers with problems as the little pranksters of the animal kingdom uproot plants, turn over garbage cans, tear screens from windows and leave other mischievous traces.

title: Colombia Is a Nation in a State of Urban Crisis
description: BOGOTA, ColombiaWhen the blaring horns of the many 1950'svintage cars quiet down in this bustling city, the sound of wooden pushcarts with grating metal wheels is easily heard in downtown streets. Bogotanos barely pay attention to the sound, but it unnervingly illustrates the overcrowding, population growth and poverty that is inspiring social unrest and last week indirectly led to a government realignment in this Latin American nation.

title: Jan Babson Bride Of David Anderson, A Banking  Aide
description: Jan R. Babson was married yesterday in Greenwich, Conn., to David E. Anderson, who is with the New York office of the Continental Illinois Bank and Trust Company of Chicago. The Rev. Bradford Hastings performed the ceremony, with the Rev. Stephen Jacobson, in Christ Episcopal Church.

title: Irish vs. Army: A Stadium First
description: EAST RUTHERFORD FOR more than 25 years, it was New York City's own football game. No near homeandhome series, the ArmyNotre Dame clash was played annually in the big city, the home of Notre Dame's famous subway alumni.

title: The Lessons of the Bitter Yonkers School Strike
description: To judge the acceptability of the new agreement between the Board of Education and the Yonkers Federation of Teach ers, one has to go back and examine the agreement that expired June 30, 1977.

title: Red Smith
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 8A threat of rain was in the air and a breeze out of the east was freshening when Don Sutton left the Dodgers' hotel here today and set off at a run across the grassy areas and through the parking lots near Veterans Stadium. At that hour he couldn't foresee how emphatically the threat would become reality or how wretchedly the day would end for the biggest baseball crowd ever assembled in Pennsylvania. That crowd, numbering 64.924 drenched bodies, was destined to sit for hours tonight in remorseless rain unfit for ducks while the Phlilies' hope. for their first pennant in 27 years expired in a bog.

title: GARDENING
description: IF YOU need new trees, shrubs or perennials for your garden, you may wish to consider planting them this fall. The Long Island climate is such that this time of year is satisfactory for planting most hardy plants, and plantings now will have distinct advantage over plantings next spring, in that they will have had longer to become established before the next growing season.

title: F.B.I. ASSERTS CUBA AIDED WEATHERMEN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 8Cuban espionage agents operating in the United States and Canada supplied limited aid to the Weather Underground, a militant antiwar organization, in the late 1960's and early 1970's, according to a topsecret report of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Hope S. Washton Is Bride
description: The marriage of Hope S. Washton, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arnold A. Washton of New York, to Jules H. Augus, son of Mrs. David Augus of New York and the late Mr. Augus, took place yesterday afternoon.

title: Picture Credits
description: 1IAN PATRICK

title: The Ups and the Downs Of the World of Boxing
description: I always took a dive when I felt I could not win. It is easy to make your nose bleed, you know. Then I would smear it all over my face in between rounds. After that I went down  alors brave Georges.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Great Wild Turkey Hunt
description: EDGEFIELD, S. C.Gathering in the venerable county seat community of Edgefield, which has produced more governors of the state than any other and which is also the headquarters of the National Wild Turkey Federation, we waited for Tom Rodgers, executive vice president of that organization, to assemble the group that would go for dove shooting in midafternoon.

title: BURMA REPORTS GAIN IN ITS WAR ON OPIUM
description: RANGOON, BurmaBurma, the leading opium producer in the Golden Triangle where its borders join with those of Thailand and Laos, is reported by diplomatic sources to have significantly reduced the amount of the narcotic grown in the remote mountain region while striking hard at the caravans that carry it to market and at the refineries that turn it into heroin.

title: In Later Years, A Shared Hearth
description: WANTAGH UNTIL recently Nettie Heule considered herself a lonely senior citizen. Although happily married, Mrs. Heule, after her husband left for work each morning, found herself constantly craving companionship in a community she moved to one year ago.

title: STAMPS
description: Nathan Hale, among the first of a long line of Americans who gave their lives in the cause of liberty, has been added to the roster of patriotic figures who played sig nificant roles in the American Revolution being commemorated in the current Patriots Postal card series of the United States.

title: Troubled Town
description: NEW STANTON, Pa.It's an unlovely little town, a plastic blister of gas station signs as high as church steeples, slabs of cinder block motels and fastfood bazaars. Against the pure bluegreen of the hills beyond, New Stanton jarsa Mickey Mouse decal pasted on a landscape by Watteau.

title: Harmonizing Housing Subsidies
description: Since 1937, when the Government undertook to improve American housing conditions, Federal programs have pursued two essential but sometimes conflicting goals. One is to increase the production of housing units, by new construction or rehabilitation. The other is lower the cost of housing to the consumer. The result often resembles piano music in which one hand plays waltzes while the other plays fox trots.

title: INTERVIEW
description: WHEN Pel,the brilliant soccer star of the Cosmos, said goodbye to New Jersey a week ago yesterday, a future hero of the state was among the 75,646 fans applauding the Brazilian at Giants Stadium in East Rutherford.

title: INTERVIEW
description: HARTFORD PETER Gruden, a 36yearold native New Yorker, has spent the last 14 years enmeshed in the often dangerous and seldom rewarding business of trying to rid the public of organized drug smuggling rings as well as individual dealers in heroin, cocaine and thrill pills. agent in charge of the Drug Enforce ment Administration for Connecticut and western Massachusetts, but he has also studied the ugly side of New York, Boston and Bangkok as a line agent.

title: University's Ban on Fat Students Is Not Discriminatory, Dean Says
description: TULSA, Okla., Oct. 8 (AP)The academic dean at Oral Roberts University denies that a strict policy against fat students is discriminatory.

title: Sneva and Parsons Near Goals at Charlotte Today
description: Today's NASCAR National 500 at Charlotte (N. C.) Motor Speedway is a stockcar race of note for several reasons. Tom Sneva, the United State Auto Club's national Indycar champion, will make his stockcar debut in it; the veteran Benny Parsons could go over the $1 million mark in career earnings; two Wisconsin shorttrack stars will get their day in the big time, and wily A. J. Foyt says he will compete. Considering what he has done since he won his fourth Indianapolis 500 this year, that in itself is news.

title: LETTER FROM STONY BROOK
description: THOUGH a poll has never been taken, it's a safe bet that Susan Kahan, who is starting her fourth year at the State University here, has sliced open more bagels, spread more cream cheese and poured more coffee than must people do in a lifetime.

title: FollowUp on the News
description: Keeping pace with the surge toward cashless society Governor Carey signed into law last Aug. 10 a bill allowing parking violators in New York State to pay their fines by credit card. Localities that agreed to the arrangement would have to pay the creditcard company the customary commission.

title: SUFFOLK DEMOCRAT RULED OFF BALLOT IN NOVEMBER
description: YAPHANK, L.I., Oct. 8 (UPI)Robert, Spruill, who was convicted of a felony last March, has been ruled off the ballot as the Democratic candidate for Babylon tax receiver, it was announced yesterday.

title: PAPERBACK TALK
description: Playboy's romance. It's about a year now since Hugh Hefner hired a veteran newspaper executive to take charge of his bunnyoriented Playboy Enterprises, with power to take all steps necessary to shore up the wobbling. overextended empire. It's about a month now since there was a bloodbath at the corporation's Chicago headquarters, with nearly onetenth of its administrative personnel receiving pink slips while plans were being announced to dispose of all unprofitable ventures.

title: Extent of University Work for C.I.A. Is Hard to Pin Down
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 8Despite three days of Congressional hearings, no one yet knows the degree to which some of the nation's most prominent universities were compromised in the Central Intelligence Agency's secret mindcontrol research in the 1950's and 1960's.

title: LETTERS
description: I am writing this letter not so much in defense of my own first novel, A Wreath of Pale White Roses, which Joyce Carol Oates attacked with a rare vengeance (July 24), but in protest against a system of reviewing that allows a single critic's personal bias (in this case against exaggerated imagery and layered language) to cut off the life stream of a work and keep an unknown writer from finding the proper audience.

title: Marsh Walks Are the Ticket to Unending Drama on Nature's Stage
description: PECONIC, L.I.,There was a time when Aline Dove thought she might become an actress, and she even enrolled at the American Academy of Dramatic Arts. But the Great Depression spoiled that plan.

title: Riverside Park Mugging
description: Don Welch, a 31yearold writer, was robbed and stabbed when he resisted his assailant in Riverside Park. Mr. Welch, who lives at 60 West 67th Street, was admitted to Foosevelt Hospital in fair condition.

title: Portents of an Incomes Policy
description: The signs suggesting that we are heading toward some form of incomes policyattempts by the Federal Government to influence individual wage and price decisions by direct actionare unmistakable and disturbing.

title: Future Events
description: Tickets to the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Carter Score, Castiglia Kick Stop Paramus
description: Gib Carter's 20yard touchdown gallop and Patsy Castiglia's placement lifted undefeated Bloomfield (30) to a 76 victory over Paramus. Carter set up his firstperiod touchdown sprint by running for 27 yards on a quarterback keeper on the preceding play.

title: Study Sees Commercial Nuclear Power Stalled by Quest for Prestige
description: SANTA MONICA. Calif., Oct. 6 (AP)The comercial success of nuclear power has been delayed, in part, because nuclear plants were built to enhance national prestige rather than produce cheap power, the Rand Corporation said in a report released today.

title: Power of State's Attorney
description: HARTFORD IF, AS Plutarch suggested, the concentration of power arouses the passions, some members of the Democratic political establishment in Connecticut, with their eyes on the office of the chief state's attorney, seem headed for impassioned times.

title: TOP BASQUE OFFICIAL AND TWO AIDES SLAIN
description: MADRID, Oct. 8The chief administrative official of the Basque Province of Vizcaya and two police bodyguards were shot to death this afternoon in the ancient city of Guernica.

title: Girls' Sports: Yorktown Rates Oscar in Volleyball
description: The room is dark except for the light from the projector. The team is watching the film again and again, while the coach points out the players' mistakes and tells each where to implement new strategy.

title: Beaux Arts Trio Returns in Form
description: The Beaux Arts Trio has been so well known for such a long time that there is probably a tendency to take its excellence for granted. If so, Friday night's concert at the Metropolitan Museum was a welcome corrective.

title: Convenience Stores Doing Well in State
description: LIVINGSTON ALTHOUGH New Jersey is known for its large shopping centers, the state still is a bastion for small merchants. The corner grocery store has been replaced by what are called convenience stores, usually parts of franchised operations, but many of these outlets are familyrun affairs.

title: One Week in Ireland Charms a Skeptic
description: It's not truejust a bit of the old blarneythat every Irishman you meet will greet you with a grin and charm you with his chatter. During a week spent arming through the Irish countryside and exploring the byways of Dublin I met one who didn't. He was a man in his 80's, sitting on a wooden bench outside a oneroom post office and general store along the Ring of Kerry. He was gazing across the road, across the rocky cliff beyond and out over the misty sea. My stamps bought, I joined him on the bench, but he barely, looked at me. I talked about the weather (inandout sun), and he grunted noncommital responsesand then I realized he was staring at my sneakers. Not bad for walking, he said at last, but you'll not beat shoes with nails for climbing.

title: Ogaden Conflict Termed Threat to Africa's Stability
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Oct. 8African leaders are expressing fears that the fighting between Ethiopia and Somalia in the Ogaden region has seriously endangered the delicate stability of the entire continent, the cohesion of the Organization of African Unity and the continuance of ArabAfrican cooperation.

title: South Shore Triumphs Over Lafayette by 60
description: South Shore, having its most successful season since losing to Bayside in the 1973 Public Schools Athletic League title game, had three unsuccessful quarters yesterday at Lafayette before a turnover by the Frenchies led to the lone score of the game and a 60 victory for South Shore.

title: James B. Hochron Will Marry Jean L. Hochheimer
description: The engagement of Jean Linda Hochheimer, a senior assistant in the United States Public Health Service, to James Barry Hochron, son of Mr. and Mrs. Manuel R. Hochron of Binghamton, N.Y., has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Kurt Hochheimer of Teaneck. N.J. The wedding is planned for next spring.

title: Public and Private Games
description: ANTHONY KEATING, the central figure of Margaret Drabble's The Ice Age, is waiting as the novel opens. Waiting for his heart to heal after a slight attack, waiting for his love, Alison Murray, to return home, waiting for the recovery of his fortune, and waiting to read a letter he

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox: Black Athlete as a Model
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Florida School Told To Hire Blind Man
description: GREEN COVE SPRINGS, Fla., Oct. 8 (AP)The Clay County school board has been ordered by a judge to hire a physical education teacher even though the man is blind.

title: THE LITERARY VIEW
description: THERE was one thing about Robert Coover's new novel, The Public Burning, that struck one as particularly remarkable. This pyrotechnic satire of the Rosenberg atomspy case employs practically every form of literary artifice imaginable from verse through half a dozen varieties of parody and satire to outright hallucination. One could pore over it charting the various techniques Coover employs, almost as if one were back in Modern Lit IA diagramming Ulysses. And yet, what sustained my interest throughout the book was not the author's rhetorical fireworks but the firstpersonsingular voice of the novel's central character.

title: Harvard's Passing Conquers Cornell; Dartmouth Beats Yale; Princeton Wins
description: ITHACA, N.Y., Oct. 8Heavy favoring winds, some fine firstperiod passing by Larry Brown and costly mistakes by its opposition were the key factors in Harvard's 11th triumph over Cornell, 177, today at SchoellkopfField.

title: Containerporf Rises On the Bronx River
description: WHITE PLAINS EVERY day, a fleet of 145,000 brightred shipping containers bearing the initials C.T.I. are snaking their way through dockside yards and out along streets in Hong Kong, Milan, London, Yokahama and other cities all over the world.

title: Priscilla Hubert Is Affianced
description: Mr. and Mrs. James Post Hubert of Morristown, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Priscilla Downey Hubert of Newton, Mass., to Philip Hastings Grover, son of Mr. and Mrs. C. Stuart Grover of Lincoln, Mass. Miss Hubert and her fianc graduated from Colgate University in 1975.

title: UPGRADED VETERANS FACE AID LOSS IN BILL SIGNED BY PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 8President Carter signed today legislation that would deny veterans' benefits to military deserters and other servicemen from the Vietnam era who received upgraded discharges under the President's program designed to heal the wounds of the Asian war.

title: LETTER FROM WASHINGTON
description: LESTER L. WOLFF has a new job, and he sounded like a kid bringing home his first straightA report card. I'm going to moonlight, he said. I'm holding two jobs. Representative Wolff, Democrat of Great Neck, has been appointed by President Carter as a delegate to the 32d session of the United Nations.

title: LETTERS TO THE LONG ISLAND EDITOR
description: Manhasset, a Republic an stronghold in Republican Nassau County, presents an interesting picture for the political observer. In the primary for County Executive, Senator John R. Dunne carried Manhasset 2 to 1; Ralph G. Case was badly beaten; Francis T. Purcell did not do much better. Manhasset's registered Republicans spoke clearly and independently.

title: Miss Baker, Sculptor, Wed
description: Susannah Pitman Baker, a sculptor, was married yesterday to Howard Clay Story 3d, a commodities specialist with Drexel Burnham Lambert Inc., Philadelphia stockbrokers.

title: Tigers' Farm Aide Quits
description: EVANSVILLE. Ind. (AP)Gary Jones has resigned as general manager of the Evansville Triplets of the American Association. Jones, 34 years old, was appointed general manager last fall after Don Labbruzzo resigned. Jones had been with the Triplets, the AAA farm club of the American League Detroit Tigers, since 1972.

title: The Old Guard
description: WHITE PLAINS ON Oct. 5, 1954, 38 retired business executives and professional men met here and formally organized themselves as the Old Guard of White Plains. After meeting weekly without a single break nearly 2,000 timesthe Old Guard marked its 23d anniversary on Tuesday. That was the 4th rather than the 5th, but the Old Guard has always met on Tuesday, unless a major holiday forced it to switch.

title: DINING OUT
description: THE colors of fall will soon surround us, and you're planning a weekend drive north to enjoy them, we suggest you end your day at Beausejour. Its magnificent vistas of woods and water will prolong the joy of nature watching while you're being served a fine dinner is the best tradition of the French country inn.

title: Rosemarie Mazza Is Bride
description: Rosemarie Mazza, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Peter A. Mazza of Wilbraham, Mass., was married yesterday afternoon to Ronald Edward Fass, son of Mrs. Joseph Fass of Sunrise, Fla., and the late Mr. Fass. The Rev. Paul Moore, pastor of the Manhattan Church of the Nazarene, performed the ceremony at the Roger Sherman Inn in New Canaan, Conn

title: The ThinkerEntertainer
description: WHEN G. K. Chesterton joined the Catholic Church in 1922, he left the front ranks of English thinkers, such as they are, for goodand retroactively. At that particular time and place, the move could not be taken seriously. Popery was simply sealed off by history from the mainstream English sensibility (which suited popery fine) and those who went over to Rome became, like Jews for Jesus, exotic but homeless.

title: A Ray of Hope for Battered Women
description: Trenton ARECENT statewide conference on battered women, although planned for 300 participants, attracted 750, a figure that surprised almost no one in the field. Domestic violence is turning out to be a priority issue, not only among women but also among those involved in family services, hospitals, the courts and lawenforcement agencies.

title: ABOUT WESTCHESTER
description: SCARSDALE THE frail, whitehaired woman on the stage hardly seemed the type to seek high adventure in dark English basements. Yet, there she was, speaking clearly ana proudly into the microphone, describing how she had waded through a pile of chaff in a London bookseller's netherland to find The Golden Wheatone of the rarest books ever published.

title: The Pumpkins of Circleville: A Festival Like the Old Days
description: The minute I arrived at the Circleville Pumpkin Show in Ohio I sensed there was something special about it, something that made it different from the other harvest festivals I had attended.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: THE apartment complex where I hang my hat is an enclave of red brick buildings spaciously strewn about a number of attractive green acres in an area otherwise occupied entirely by private homes. I have lived there for a number of years, and although both it and I have worn inevitably, the project and I make few demands upon each other. Unless you count the first of the month, when questions of payment arise. Or the times when I am in search of a repair that seems beyond the shortorder talents of the maintenance force.

title: Tax: Exercise In Futility?
description: SINCE the state income tax has been with us for a little more than a year, perhaps the time has come to draw some conclu sions about its effectiveness. The most charitable conclusions that I can draw are that the tax is an exercise in futility and that it is a dismal failure as a wealth redistribution mechanism.

title: A Clinic for Men On Birth Control
description: HACKENSACK MEN at Planned Parenthood? Well, why not? Women have traditionally had more outlets to discuss their feelings and learn about their bodiesthrough clinics, selfhelp groups and gynecologists, said Adalyn Hixson, executive director of Planned Parenthood of Bergen County.

title: CIVILIAN PATROL CARS TO USE AMBER LIGHTS
description: Members of the New York City Police Department Civilian Observation Patrol may now display amber lights on their cars while partrolling in their precincts under a new section of the state traffic and vehicle law that went into effect last Monday.

title: PHOTOGRAPHY VIEW
description: There is one thing I do not fully understand about the exhibition Panoramic Photography at New York University's Grey Art Gallery, 33 Washington Place at Washington Square East, through Nov. 2. I do not fully understand why it was organized.

title: Carter Can Do A Lot on His Own in Energy
description: WASHINGTONLast Sunday, the new Secretary of Energy, James R. Schlesinger, bluntly threatened on national television to impose huge new import duties on foreign oil if Congress refused to go along with the President's proposed tax on domestic oil. And although Congress might act to block such duties, there are other important changes in energy that the President could make on his own. In fact, under a variety of laws, the President and various Cabinet departments have broad powers that could accomplish much of the energy program without legislation. Some of this authority has been available for decades, but new power was given to the White House with the passage the Energy Policy and Conservation Act, an attempt at a national energy policy in 1975.

title: Baugh Excels As Deer Park Tops West Islip
description: Deer Park handed West Islip its first loss in Conference AAA1 by scoring a hardfought 148 victory yesterday behind the running and passing of Kevin Baugh.

title: The Inmate as Designer
description: EAST MEADOW WHEN the daily caravan of officiallooking bright white vans emerges from behind the foreboding Nassau County Correctional Center here, passersby know they are filled with inmates en route to the courthouse a few miles down the road. What they probably don't know is that the art work on the vansa large gold sheriff's shield adorned by handsome gold and black letteringwas produced by the inmates themselves.

title: FISHING
description: PERHAPS you've envisioned yourself standing in the surf at sunrise, casting out to sea and connecting with a big striped bass. Or, maybe you've heard stories about how exhilarating it is to hook into a fighting bluefish, but somehow never got around to it on your vacation.

title: A Nudge by the Fed
description: When the money market acts up as that esoteric place does every so often  it annoys about everyone because interest rates climb. The stock market drops nervously. Populist Washington worries. And sound money men in New York nod approvingly.

title: Film Festival Today
description: THAT OBSCURE OBJECT OF DESIRE. The Frenchmade drama directed by Luis Buuel and featuring Fernando Rey is the final offering of the 15th annual festival. 8:30 at Alice Tully Hall. Closing night prices! $10, $7, $5. A few obstructedview seats remain.

title: BERKELEY IS TRYING INFORMAL APPROACH
description: BERKELEY, Calif.The first time that Pam Reinhard ??at as an observer in a seminar at Strawberry Creek College on the Berkeley campus of the University of California, she got into a heated debate about Marxism with someone across the conference table.

title: The Curtain Rises on a Theater
description: HART FORD After seven years of planning and fundraising, the Hartford, Stage Company is scheduled to open the doors of its new $2.5million theater this weekend. A series of private previews is to continue this week until the gala grand opening next Friday night.

title: A Pioneer Flyer Remembers
description: Scarsdale ITAKE this opportunity of greeting you as we retrace the voyage of Columbus on the wings of modern Pega sus . . . These words were spoken in 1928 by Cesare Sabelli, who was then living in Scarsdale. Mr. Sabelli, now 81 years old, an owner of an artand antiquesreproduction studio in Larchmont, was behind the controls of the airplane Roma, which had just taken off from Old Orchard Beach, Me., for a flight across the Atlantic Ocean, and he was relaying a radio message to his friend, the inventor Gulielmo Marconi.

title: Miss Bergeron Wed To John W. Angus 3d
description: In St. Michael's Roman Catholic Church in Indian Orchard, Mass., yesterday morning, Debora Bergeron, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur G. Bergeron of Indian Orchard, became the bride of John Wakefield Angus 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Angus Jr., of Garden City, L. I. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Edward

title: Very Cool and Very, Very Fly : That Was Clyde
description: Walt Frazier will be playing his basketball in Cleveland from now on, but Clyde won't be making the trip with him. Clyde is New York, strictly New York, just as Broadway Joe is New York and Tom Terrific is New York and the Doctor is New York. Taking Clyde to Cleveland would be unthinkable. Where would he park his RollsRoyce in Cleveland? Where would he get his mink coat cleaned? Where is the East Side, the glitter, the splash in Cleveland?

title: Late Penn State Rally Stops Utah State
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., Oct. 8Penn State, sparked by two turnovers caused by Bruce Clark, a defensive tackle, rallied in the final quarter to escape an upset and defeat Utah State today by 167.

title: Late TV Listings
description: 10 A.M. (Channel 4) Meet the People: Carol Berman, Emergency Coalition to Stop the SST; Tom Gallagher, resident of Rosedale, Queens; Norman Lornie, British Airways.

title: HIGH COURT CUTS BACK ON LAWMAKER ROLE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 8The Supreme Court is a naysayer these days much more often than it is a lawmaker.

title: TV: When Tragedy Struck The Iron Man of Baseball
description: My Luke and I is a love story. It is also a woman's story. The woman is Eleanor Twitchell Gehrig, widow of the great Yankee baseball star of the 20's and 30's who was stricken with the paralyzing disease, amyotropic lateral sclerosis, now frequently referred to as Lou Gehrig's disease. A Love Affair: The Eleanor and Lou Gehrig Story, a twohour dramatization of the book coauthored by Eleanor Gehrig and Joe Durso, will be shown on NBC tonight at 9, with Blythe Danner and Edward Herrmann in the title roles.

title: Legislature Has Come of Age
description: A QUIET revolution has been taking place in the State Legislature over the last four years. Whether or not one approves the laws we have enacted, or even of the manner in which we have enacted them, the Legislature in this period has come to accept, and to function in, the 20th century.

title: Joseph L. Greenstein, Mighty Atom
description: Joseph L. Greenstein, a fivefootfourandahalf, 145pound vaudevillian and strong man who was known as the Mighty Atom, died yesterday at Kingsbrook Jewish Medical Center. He was 84 years old and lived in Brooklyn.

title: Penny Peyser, James Jordan, Actors on TV, Are Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. Peter A. Peyser of Irvington, N. Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter Penny Peyser, to James Carroll Jordan. He is a son of Col. Carroll Jordan, U.S.A.F., retired, and Mrs. Jordan of Los Angeles.

title: Article 4  No Title
Princeton Routs Columbia by 267
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Oct.8Princeton's long drought of misery in its own Palmer Stadium came to a rousing end this gray, cold afternoon when the Tigers beat Columbia, 267.

title: 4 Demolition Workers Killed As Building Falls in S. Carolina
description: SPARTANBURG, S.C., Oct. 8 (UPI)A building being readied for demolition collapsed today, killing at least four men and burying a fifth workman under 40 feet of rubble.

title: Malaysia Reports on Plane Crash
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Oct. 8 (Reuters)The crash of a Japan Air Lines DC8 here last month was caused by the aircraft descending too soon and hitting a hill while approaching the airport. investigators announced today. The plane, on a flight from Tokyo to Singapore, crashed on Sept. 27, killing 34 of the 79 people aboard, including two ing in an effort to find out why the plane Americans. The investigation is continhad made the early descent.

title: Waiting For Carter
description: IAM standing, coat in one hand and handkerchief in the other, at the corner of Butler and Hudson Streets in the heart of Chambersburg, a heavily Italian enclave in Trenton, with an oppressively warm sun shining down on me and on several thousand other uncomfortable people who are waiting for the President of the United States.

title: Nassau G.O.P. Closes Ranks
description: MINEOLA AFTER many months of bitterness, acrimonious debate and consternation about its future, the Nassau County Republican Party is putting its house back in order.

title: Ramapo Pioneers in Aiding Handicapped
description: AS A CHILD in his native England, George T. Potter, founding president of Ramapo College in Mahwah, was handicapped by double club feet and a speech impediment. Through long hours of physical therapy and remedial services at a speech clinic, the boy overcame his handicap. But Mr. Potter was never to forget his early traumas.

title: What the Political Ratings Mean
description: RATING state legislators is favorite pastime of a variety of organizations that evaluate them on the basis of the organizations' special interests, but some Westchester legislators question the value and fairness of the process.

title: Pourquoi? Because It Was There, That's Wy;
description: Our aim: To drive from Paris to WyditJoliVillage  WycalledPrettyVillage, And we will do it on a circular tour, without using a single autoroute or national highway.

title: Around the Nation
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Oct. 8 (AP)Minnesota officials have rejected an application for reregistration of an annuity fund by the Billy Graham Evangelical Association. The Minneapolis Tribune reported today. The report said that the officials were not, satisfied with information supplied in the application for the fouryearold Charitable Gift Annuity Fund.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: AS DDay approaches for the next big economic proposal from the Carter Administrationthe longtouted tax package due this monththe apprehensions of the business and financial world seem to be heightening. They are centered not only on the elements in the tax plan itself but also on the reaction that will come from Congress toward them. And the business community wonders, too, how effectively the new tax structure to be suggested will deal with the basic problems of an economy beset by such crucial issues as slowing growth, rising inflation, lagging investment, high unemployment and intensifying trade difficulties.

title: Nazis in Midwest and Coast Clashes
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 8 (UPI)Pickets of the Nazi Party were attacked today by counterdemonstrators with pipes and poles in front of suburpan Florissant City Mall.

title: A Selective Guide to the Met Season on Disks
description: Record companies keep a sharp eye on the international opera circuit these days, timing their operatic releases to complement important live events. Tomorrow night's opening of the Metropolitan is a case in voint: Mussorgskv's Boris Godunov with Martti Talvela in the title role leads off the season and Angel had marked the occasion with a brand new recording also featuring Talvela. In fact, every opera in the Met's repertory is available on disk, most in a multiplicity of versions, and a recorded performance can be helpful in preparing for an evening at Lincoln Center as well as providing a permanent memento of a favorite opera or singer. Here is a survey of the 21 operas coming up, the dates of their first performances and one listener's preferences among the current recordings.

title: Dance: Intense Kay Wylie Group
description: There was the strange mood of an adolescent pajama party in a studio theater at 71 Eighth Avenue on Friday night where the Kay Wylie Big Apple Dance Theater is giving a series of weekend dance concerts.

title: An Emergency Room for Pets
description: WEST CALDWELL THE hour is midnight or later. A dog is struck down by a car, another goes into continuous epileptic seizures. Sometimes seems as if all sudden emergencies with pets occur in the middle of the night or on a Sunday or holiday.

title: EPISCOPAL HIERARCHY MANEUVERS FOR UNITY
description: PORT SAINT LUCIE, Fla., Oct. 7A longtime member of the Episcopal Church establishment, leaving a session of the House of Bishops where a particularly subtle set of maneuvers was under way, remarked sardonically to an onlooker, Did it ever strike you that there might be some politicking going on here?

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Tommie Lou Smith Fiancee
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert Allen Smith of Levittown, Pa., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Tommie Lou Smith, to Jeffrey V. Judson Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Judson of Flemington, N. J. Miss Smith is a senior at the University of Delaware. Her fianc is an alumnus of the University of Connecticut.

title: He Often Provideth Victory, as With Koch, and His Methods Are Simple
description: What hath Garth wrought? Mario M. Cuomo asked when he was losing to Mr. Garth's candidate, Edward I. Koch. What David Garth does is not all that hard to do, according to David Garth. The thing is that not many people know how to do it. Which is one reason why so many of the politicians he works for win and why Mr. Garth earns $250,000 or so a year for helping them.

title: After Texas and Vietnam, Johnson Finds a Home as an Eagle
description: After growing up in one of those Texas towns where the trains don't stop, and after spending nine months driving a jeep around Da Nang, Charlie Johnson would rather be in Philadelphia.

title: Texan Loses a Suit Against Mexico,
description: AUSTIN, Texas, Oct. 8The possibility of a confrontation between a state district court and Mexico, complicated by an underlying fabric woven of expropriated lands, preColumbian artifacts and foreign policy, was taken away this week by the Texas Supreme Court.

title: Strike Worries Merchants
description: As the longshoremen's strike against containership operations in ports from Maine to Texas continued through its eighth day yesterday, merchants and freight forwarders were feeling the squeeze and worrying.

title: Still at Issue Is the Role of The Palestinians
description: All the parties involved in the Middle East dispute agree that Geneva would be a nice place to visit but they differ on exactly who should accompany them and under what format any talks should be held when they get there.

title: City Opera's Rigoletto Contains Few Surprises and a Lazy Look
description: There were few surprises in, the City Opera's Rigoletto on Friday night, the second performance of the work this fall. As with most of the Frank Corsaro productions that date back a number of years and return nearly every season, the overall look of this Rigoletto has become a bit fuzzy and lacks the sharp dramatic outlines it had when new. The Act I orgy, for example, comes across witha lazy, perfunctory air, about as lascivious as a Victorian tea party.

title: THE IMPERIAL COURT
description: The Burger Court's gradual withdrawal from some of the Warren Court's civil liberties decisions is leading detected liberals to reappraise the role of the Supreme Court. Lamentations fill the air. Because the Warren Court decisions realized liberal aspirations, liberals sang its praises, glossing over the question of constitutional authority and forgetting that for many decades the Court had employed similar techniques for antidemocratic purposes, to block badly needed social and economic reforms.

title: TV VIEW
description: The delicate and highly explosive issue of how fact and fiction are used on television bounded back into public discussion with last weekend's ABC presentation of The Trial of Lee Harvey Oswald. While Robert E. Thompson's script assumed that Oswald was not killed by Jack Ruby on national television, the Richard Freed production brought the accused assassin of John F. Kennedy to a trial that was to determine his guilt or innocence and also whether he acted alone or as part of a conspiracy. A fictional device was employed in the pursuit of supposedly factual history. Most critics and commentators around the country objected strongly to the inevitable muddling of fact, reasonable conjecture and calculated distortion.

title: Jeffrey Rothman Fiance of Fran Elowitz
description: Mr. and Mrs. Norman Elowitz of Fort Lee, N. J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Fran Elyn Elowitz, to Jeffrey Mark Rothman, son of Mrs. Herbert Rothman of Bayonne, N. J., and the late Mr. Rothman.

title: Report Cites Mobsters' Aid
description: A longsuppressed report credits Charles (Lucky) Luciano and other mobsters with having aided the Navy in World War II. Page 40.

title: They've Been Fighting for a Railroad
description: PORTLAND, Me.The Spence and Bucky Showthe long conflict over whether, when and how the railroads of northern New England should be merged and rationalizedhas just come out of one crisis and is heading for another, the way a good soap opera should.

title: A Star on a Natural Stage
description: PECONIC THERE was a time when Aline Dove thought she might become an actress, and she even enrolled at the American Academy of Dramatic Arts. But the Great Depression spoiled that plan.

title: MAN ALLEGEDLY HOLDS SON HOSTAGE FOR 2 HOURS
description: A 35yearold Bronx man was charged with illegal possession of a dangerous weapon after he allegedly held his 3Yearold son hostage in a motel for nearly two hours yesterday and threatened to kill the boy if the police intervened.

title: Article 9  No Title
Princeton Students
description: PRINCETON WHEN Prof. Woodrow Wilson delivered Princeton University's sesquecentennial address in 1901it was entitled Princeton In The Nation's servicehe did not have much trouble finding material, since William Patterson, James Madison and Oliver Ellsworth were all Princetonians.

title: U.S. Club Bombed in Athens
description: ATHENS, Oct. 9 (Reuters)Bombs exploded outside a United States military dub and the offices of the Greek Communist Party in Athens today but caused no casualties, a police spokesman said. In one explosion, the front of the noncommissioned officers club at the United States Military Mission was damaged. The second bomb smashed windows and damaged the front door at the Communist offices.

title: Mandalay, a Center of Buddhism, Is Burma's BlackMarket Hub
description: MANDALAY, BurmaWhile Rangoon, Burma's capital and a city of perhaps two million, seems to be sinking into its precolonial pastits buildings mildewed and peeling, its pavements and sidewalks potholed and breaking, its traffic lights and its pedestrians languid, its rats bold and fatMandalay, only a quarter Rangoon's size, has maintained the pace of a city and the aspect of Asia in the 1930's.

title: Gushiken Keeps Title
description: BEPPU, Japan, Oct 9 (AP)Yoko Gushiken of Japan knocked out a Thai challenger, Montsayarm Mahachai, in the fourth round tonight and retained his World Boxing Association junior flyweight championship. Each fighter weighed 107 pounds.

title: The Pope Canonizes a Lebanese Monk..
description: ROME, Oct. 9Pope Paul VI proclaimed Sharbel Makhlouf, a Lebanese hermit monk, a saint today in a solemn high mass at St. Peter's Basilica.

title: Israel Establishing 2 More Settements
description: TEL AVIV, Oct. 9 (UPI)A new Jewish settlement authorized by the previous Israeli Government was established last week lust inside the occupied West Bank of Jordan near Latrun, Israel radio said today, and another will soon be built nearby.

title: Connors Routs Gottfried in Final; Miss Evert Wins Atlanta Tourney
description: KAANAPALI, Hawaii, Oct. 9Guillermo Vilas and Bjorn Borg beware. They will start playing the United States Open on a mediumfast, asphaltbased tennis surface next year and considering what Jimmy Connors did to Brian Gottfried on a similar surface today, he could be the man to beat at Flushing Meadows in New York.

title: Asia House Opens Its Season With a Koto Recital
description: Asia House at 112 East 64th Street began is 197778 season of Sunday afternoon concerts yesterday with a recital of Japanese music by Fusako Yoshida and Chikako Kawaji. One wonders when a larger public will discover the Asia House concerts, for they are informal and almost invariably delightful affairs. Yesterday's event was no exception.

title: First Woman Canon Residentiary Is Installed by Cathedral of St. John
description: Sister Mary Michael Simpson, who earlier this year became the first Episcopal nun to be ordained a priest, was installed yesterday as a canon residentiary at the Cathedral of St. John the Divinethe first woman to hold that title in this country.

title: A.I.D. CHIEF ENCOURAGING MORE COMPETITIVE BIDS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9 (UPI)The Agency for International Development will tighten its procedures for awarding some $220 million a year in foreign assistance contracts and grants to allow more time for competitive bidding, its chief executive said today.

title: Records of Philadelphia Controller Seized on Vote Illegality Charges
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 9 (UPI)  The District Attorney's office has seized financial records of Controller William G. Klenk's Democratic primary campaign, charging alleged irregularities.

title: Briton Reported Slain in Uganda
description: LONDON, Oct. 8 (UPI)Robert Scanlon, believed to have once been a friend of President Idi Amin of Uganda, was beaten to death with a sledgehammer in a Kampala prison three weetks ago, The London Observer said in its Sunday issue. In a dispatch from Nairobi, Kenya, it quoted a refugee Uganda official as a witness to the killing. Mr. Scanlon, a Briton who took Uganda nationality, disappeared four months ago and Uganda said he had been charged with spying.

title: POPULATION GROWTH IN JERSEY NEAR ZERO
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9New Jersey has shown almost zeropopulation growth, and the state's big counties including Essex, Bergen, Hudson, Union and Passaic are experiencing major population losses, according to new Census Bureau projections.

title: Belmont Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: Reprimand to Press Worries South African Editors
description: JOHANNESBURG, Oct. 9Fresh concern for the survival of a free press in South Africa has been stirred by the Government's success in obtaining a reprimand of The Rand Daily Mail for a report questioning official statements about the death in detention of Stephen Biko, the young black leader.

title: The U.N. Today
Meaning What You Say
description: In the winter of 1976, as he moved toward the nomination, Jimmy Carter was asked in an Interview what he would do about Vietnam War resisters. He staked out his position in these words:

title: Shelley Bieringer Wed To Richard Boyd Rau
description: Shelley Jan Bieringer and Richard Boyd Rau were married yesterday by Rabbi Peter Rubinstein in the Woodland Commuuity Temple in White Plains.

title: Giants Are Defeated, 2810, by Eagles
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Oct. 9Only 10 games to go.

title: COLUMBUS DAY
description: Parking  Alternatesideofthestreet parking regulations are suspended.

title: Nielsen, Star Passer for Brigham Young, Joins List of Seriously Injured
description: Gifford Nielsen's collegiate career as the spectacular passing quarterback for Brigham Young University ended Saturday on the artificial surface of Oregon State's Parker Stadium in Corvallis. The 6foot5inch athlete, who has exceled in a number of sports, suffered severe torn cartilage and ligaments in his left knee and underwent surgery at Utah Valley Hospital in Provo, Utah, less than two hours after the Brigham Young team returned from Oregon late Saturday night.

title: Woman Is Killed in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Oct. 9 (UPI)Gunmen killed a 24yearold member of the Ulster Defense Regiment early today as she slept with her 3yearold daughter in a trailer on the Irish border, the police said. The shot awakended the child, and as she screamed the gunmen fired more shots in her direction, according to the police. Two bullets hit a teddy bear the child was cuddling, but she was unhurt. The South Armagh brigade of the I.R.A. Provisionals later issued a statement saying they were responsible for the death.

title: Campaign by Sentry For Consumer Study
description: After six years as a TV advertiser exclusively, Sentry Insurance will soon be putting some money into print to offer its Consumerism at the Crossroads study to other business people.

title: Scoring and Statistics of N.F.L. Games
Deaths
description: ADESNIKMorris, beloved husband of Klara, dear brother of Charles, Sarah Abramowitz, adored father of Ira, Milton and Barry, loving grandfather of Ryan Merrick, Marcie Ann, Rayne Meredith, And David. Service was held October 9. For Information contact Brettschnelder Funeral Home, 2543818.

title: Barab Plays Barab Works
description: All the music that the cellist Seymour Barab performed Saturday night at Carnegie Recital Hall was either written for or dedicated to Mr. Barab himself. It was an impressiveand stimulating collection, representing nine wellknown American composers and spanning a broad spectrum of styles.

title: Businessmen Predict Halt In Economic Growth by '79
description: The nation's economic expansion will continue next year at a slower rate than this year, but growth will probably halt and the economy will turn down by late 1978 or 1979, according to a survey of business economists.

title: MXing Up SALT
description: While President Carter has been working toward a new agreement with Moscow to limit strategic missiles, the Air Force has been burrowing away in the Pentagon with plans for a new giant and mobile missile. If it should ever see daylight, it will profoundly change American strategic policy and increase the risk that a diplomatic crisis might escalate to nuclear war.

title: MOST CITY TEACHERS WHO WERE LAID OFF REJECT RETURN OFFER
description: Two out of every three laidoff New York City publicschool teachers who were asked last month to return to the classroom rejected the opportunity, citing the fear of future layoffs, enthusiasm for newfound careers and anger over the assignment of teachers by race.

title: IRVING LINN OF YESHIVA; ON FACULTY FOR 40 YEARS
description: Irving Linn, a professor of English at Yeshiva College and a member of its faculty for 40 years, died Wednesday of an apparent heart attack. He was 65 years old and lived at 120 East 81st Street.

title: New Railroad Is Among Factors In Study of Soviet Export Patterns
description: One of the most important and least known factors in international trade patterns for the next dozen years is the extent to which the Soviet Union will become a major exporter of raw materials.

title: Milton C. Weisman, 82, Lawyer; Corporate Receivership Expert
description: Milton C. Weisman, a founder and senior partner in the law firm of Weisman, Celler, Spett, Modlin, Wertheimer & Schlesinger, died Saturday at Mt. Sinai Hospital after a long illness. He was 82 years old and lived at 575 Park Avenue in Manhattan.

title: Defense Denies Bribes in Chicago Contract Case
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 9Defense attorneys have begun arguing their side of the case in the trial of eight men accused of a $1.2 million bribery scheme to help the Ingram Corporation of New Orleans obtain a multimilliondollar contract from the Metropolitan Sanitary District of Greater Chicago.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Holiday Closings
description: Most banks in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut will be closed today because of a legal holiday in observance of Columbus Day.

title: Series Bleacher Seats Being Sold This Morning
description: The Yankees announced last night that reserved bleacher seats for games 1 and 2 of the World Series would go on sale at the Yankee Stadium advanceticket window at 9 A.M. today. The tickets will cost $4 each, and there is a limit of four per game per person.

title: STEIN AND WAGNER RUN $1 MILLION RACE
description: Assemblyman Andrew J. Stein and City Councilman Robert F. Wagner Jr. are spending a total of more than $1 million for the Manhattan borough presidency, a post that pays $45,000 a year and has limited power.

title: ADMINISTRATION DATA ON GAS CHALLENGED BY TEXAS PRODUCERS
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 9Natural gas producers and energy economists here are charging that the Carter Administration, in its fight to retaing Federal price controls on natural gas, has resorted to grossly exaggerated cost projections for unregulated new gas an derroneous assumptions about the rate of future gas discoveries.

title: Events Today
description: HOT GROG, written be Jim Wann and Bland Simpson; directed by Edward Berkeley; presented by the Phoenix Theater; at the Marymount Manhattan Theater, 221 East 71st Street, 4:45.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: CARTER AIDES DEVISE EXPANDED TAX CUTS TO SPUR INVESTMENT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9Increasingly concerned about the sluggish pace of investment, Administration planners have expanded by several billion dollars the tax reduction for business that President Carter is likely to propose to Congress as part of a broader tax reform package, Administration sources said today.

title: 22 Are Reported Killed in India As Train Is Flit From Behind
description: NEW DELHI, Monday, Oct. 10 (UPI)A passenger train rammed into the rea?? of a stationary freight train southeast of New Delhi today, killing at least 22 people and injuring 150 others, Samachar, the national news agency, reported.

title: Chess:
description: MENTOR, OhioGrandmaster Walter Browne survived a sharp defeat at the hands of Grandmaster James Tarjan in the sixth round in a NimzoIndian Defense to hold onto the lead in the United States Championship Tournament after seven rounds here in the Mentor Inn.

title: Donna M. Zucchi Married
description: Donna Marie Zucchi, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Zucchi of Cherry Hill, N.J., was married there yesterday to Dr. Harold A. Sackeim, son of Mrs. Alexander Sackeim of Bayside, Queens, and the late Mr. Sackeim. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi Seymour Rosen of Margate City, N.J., in the Hawaiian Cottage restaurant, of which the bride's father is executive vice president and general manager.

title: Supplementary OvertheCounter Listings
description: Week ended Oct, 7, 1977

title: L.I. Couple Plans to Sue Manhattan Prosecutor Over Police Search That Ripped Home and Lawn Apart
description: A Suffolk County couple, charging that their house and lawn had been ripped apart Saturday in a police search for stolen money and that their foster children had been removed by the supervising agency, said yesterday that they would sue the Manhattan District Attorney's office for wanton destruction.

title: As Theater, Senate Hearings on Panama Canal Treaties Fail to LiveUp to Advance Billing
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9The Senate Foreign Relations Committee had been expected to provide the greatest show in town with its hearings on the Panama Canal treaties, and it booked the cavernous caucus room in the Old Senate Office Building for the event.

title: Cost of Stein and Wagner Race Expected to Exceed $1 Million
description: Assemblyman Andrew 3. Stein and City Councilman Robert F. Wagner Jr. are spending a total of more than $1 million for the Manhattan borough presidency, a post that pays $45,000 ay ear and has limited power.

title: Beth Meltzer, Analyst, Bride Of Philip Binder, City U. Aide
description: Beth Alison Meltzer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Stanley Meltzer of Yorktown Heights, N.Y.. was married yesterday to Philip Alan Binder, son of Mr. and Mrs. Morris Binder of Brooklyn. Rabbi Norton D. Shargel performed the ceremony in the Jewish Community Center of Harrison, N.Y.

title: Slide Mule Going the Way of Abacus as Pocket Calculator Moves In
description: The venerable slide rule, once a badge of the engineering student, has become a scientific relic, as outmoded as the astrolabe in the electronic era that has produced its successor, the pocket calculator.

title: Saigon Archbishop Says Coexistence With Reds Is Vital
description: ROME, Oct. 9The Archbishop of Saigon has told the Synod of Catholic Bishops that Vietnamese Catholics are determined to coexist with the country's Communist regime and that priests must find a way to speak in a new language that will be understood by congregations steeped in Communist concepts.

title: ...As Pilgrims Report Miracles at Saint's Tomb
description: ANNAYA, Lebanon, Oct. 9Thousands of the faithful gathered on this austere rocky peak of Mount Lebanon to honor the peasant monk who was canonized today at a Vatican ceremony as Lebanons first saint.

title: The Ghost Sonata Proves Difficult As Yale Actors Tackle Strindberg
description: With its swings from naturalism to a supernatural expressionism and back againa dead man slides down a rope and a mummy emerges from a closet to take part in a family argumentStrindherg's The Ghost Sonata is generally accounted a difficult play.

title: Conference and Marathon Stress Women's Fight for Equal Rights
description: CALDWELL, Oct. 9While a fleetfooted New Jersey torch bearer raced along a 75mile course toward the Pennsylvania line yesterday, participants in a women's conference here scrutinized history and discussed why it has been shaped by men who, in many cases, steered away from serious treatment of women's accomplishments.

title: Lebanese Monk Is Canonized by the Pope
description: ROME, Oct. 9Pope Paul VI proclaimed Sharbel Makhlouf, a Lebanese hermit monk, a saint today in a solemn high mass at St. Peter's Basilica.

title: New Delhi Seeking Improved Relations With Its Neighbors
description: NEW DELHI, Oct. 9In an effort to improve relations with a neighbor. India has reached a compromise agreement with Bangladesh on sharing the waters of the Ganges.

title: Spain, in Apparent Shift, Asking SelfDetermination for Western Sahara
description: MADRID, Oct. 9Under pressure from leftist parties, the Government of Prime Minister Adolfo Suarez has begun to alter its position on the issue of the former Spanish Sahara, which Madrid hurriedly abandoned to Morocco and Mauritania in 1975 without consulting the inhabitants as to their preference.

title: A Team of American Women Seeks to Scale Nepal's Heights
description: Women's mountaineering in America is finally coming of age. In the fall of 1978 the American Women's Himalayan Expedition will attempt Annapurna, a major peak of 26,504 feet. Not only will it be the first American attempt on the Nepalese mountain, but the first American Women's Himalayan Expedition ever.

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, OCTOBER 10, 1977

title: U.S.Canada Commission Urges Halt to Federal Irrigation Project
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9  A United StatesCanada commission, in an unusual action, is recommending to the State Deipartment that a controversial Federal irrigation project in North Dakota be halted because of the adverse effects that its drainage, flowing north across the international boundary, would have on Canadian fish, wildlife and water quality.

title: Lefley, Blues' Forward, Shocks Club by Retiring
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 9 (UPI)  Chuck Lefley, a 27yearold forward who set a St. Louis Blues record with 43 goals two seasons ago, stunned the team last night by announcing his retirement.

title: Bombings Reported in Rome
description: ROME, Oct. 9 (Reuters)A bar frequented by leftist extremists and the offices of a rightwing party were seriously damaged in two separate bomb attacks early today, the police said. There were no injuries. The explosion inside a youth branch of the neoFascist Social Movement Party ripped out a wall. Tables, windows and doors were smashed at Ciampini's bar, which is known as a favorite meeting place for leftists.

title: Knicks Lose to Nets in Overtime, 127117
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., Oct. 9It was a night of glory and learning for the Net and Knick rookies.

title: Linda Pembrook Wed To Michael Avgerinos
description: Linda H. Pembrook and Michael T. Avgerinos were married yesterday evening at the Park Avenue Methodist Church by the pastor, the Rev. Phillip A. C. Clarke. The bride is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harold E. Pembrook of Chatham, N.Y. Mr. Avgerinos is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Theodore M. Avgerinos of Athens.

title: JetsBills Scoring
description: FIRST QUARTER

title: The Sound of WNEW
description: This week WNEW Radio will launch a $200,000 fiveweek ad campaign, its first by an outside agency. And the theme created by Kelly, Nason Inc. is WNEW1130 AM with sounds you love to hear. The advertising will run on all New York's television stations as well as in The New York Times, The New York Daily News and some suburban newspapers.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of a typographical, error, the terms of a proposed settlement involving control of the Piper Aircraft Corporation were given incorrectly in The Times Saturday. A corrective article appears on Page 47.

title: Carter's Goals  Chances Get Slimmer
description: If President Carter is to achieve the economic goals that he proclaimed at the start of his Administrationlow unemployment, reduced inflation, a shrinkage of Federal spending's share of the national economy and a balanced Federal budget by fiscal 1981  he is going to need extraordinary luck. The chances that he will be so lucky are fading fast.

title: Yankees Capture Pennant, Winning Playoff Final, 53
description: KANSAS CITY, Oct. 9  Just as they did a year ago when Chris Chambliss socked a ninthinning, fifthgame home run, the Yankees rallied in their final turn at bat in the fifth game tonight and won their second consecutive American League pennant.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Peace Prize Winner Will Be Named Today
description: OSLO, Oct. 9 (Reuters)The winner of this year's Nobel Peace Prize, selected from among 54 candidates, will be announced here tomorrow.

title: Bell Seeks Way To Get Around E.R.A. Deadline
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9  Attorney General Griffin B. Bell said today that the Justice Department was trying to determine whether it would be possible to extend the ratification period for the equal rights amendment Nit its deadline of March 22, 1979.

title: Couple and Friend Found Slain In Apartment in Newark Project
description: NEWARK, Sept. 10 (AP)The bodies of a couple and their friend have been found in their bloodspattered apartment at the Columbus Homes housing project, the police said.

title: A NewLook Miss Comaneci at the Garden
description: Offering a decidedly mundane and brief exhibition, Nadia Comaneci the Rumanian gymnastics prodigy, drew nearsellout crowds yesterday to two performances at Madison Square Garden.

title: Hogan Victor in Final
description: WESTBURY, L.I., Oct. 9 (UPI)Topseeded Marty Hogan of St. Louis defeated Charlie Brumfield of San Diego, 2114, 2119, in the men's final of a $20,000 national tour raquetball tournament today. Peggy Stedding of Odessa, Tex., downed Janell Marriott of Salt Lake City, 2118, 1921, 119, in the women's final.

title: Market Place
description: For the taxconscious investor, some mutual funds battered in the bear market of the 1970's new offer an unusual kind of shelterespecially if they are currently wellmanaged.

title: FRENCH SOCIALISTS OFFER TO TALK WITH COMMUNISTS
description: PARIS, Oct. 9 (AP)The French socialist Party offered some concessions to the Communist Party today and formally proposed that the leftist parties resume negotiations toward restoring their shattered alliance for next March's national elections.

title: Commodities
description: We are in a worldwide textile depression, Edmund Whitten, a cotton trader at Conticommodity Services Inc., commented Friday.

title: Five Opulent WagonsLits Get a Final Fare of $302.000
description: MONTE CARLO, Monaco, Oct. 9In the head?? and hermetic atmosphere of moneyed elegance that is the chief attraction here, five opulent WagonLits that for decades rode the rails as part of the Orient Express were auctioned yesterday for $302,000 in what Sotheby Parke Bernet, the auctioneer, believes to be the first: train auction ever held.

title: Dodgers, Having Time Off, Savor Their Happy Season
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 9While the New York Yankees beat the Kansas City Royals in their drama tonight half a continent away, the Los Angeles Dodgers watched, waited and prepared to pitch Don Sutton against the Yankees in the opening game of the World Series on Tuesday.

title: JazzRock:Ponty
description: The formula playing and gimmickry that are the principal pitfalls of the jazzrock idiom may be about to claim another victim, if JeanLuc Ponty's show at the Palladium on Saturday night is any indication. Mr. Ponty is an extraordinarily gifted jazz violinist, and his Palladium show last year, with what was basically the same group, consisted of lyrical, honest, nononsense improvising. Friday's performance seemed superficial and calculated by comparison.

title: LOBBYISTS IN CAPITAL BRINGING FLAIR TO JOB
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9At a key point in the Senate debate on President Carter's energy proposals, a group of men huddled in the hallway just off the Senate floor. A burly figure with thick, graying hair knelt in the middle and, like a quarterback calling signals, told his team what to do.

title: Heavy Weekend Rainfall Causes Brooklyn and Queens Blackouts
description: Rain produced a dank Columbus Day weekend, with a cheerless cloak draping itself across the metropolitan region from 7 P.M. Saturday until almost 4 P.M. Sunday.

title: Dividend Meeting
description: Partial list of scheduled meetings for week follows;

title: Making of Judges: How Rare Method Works in New York
description: At 1:30 A.M. on Wednesday, Sept. 21, stopping over at Miami International Airport on his way to a business appointment in Chile, Patrick J. Cunningham telephoned one of his lieutenants in the Bronx County Democratic organization.

title: SeaLevel Canal Could Imperil Marine Life at Either End, Biologists Say
description: BALBOA, Canal Zone, Oct. 6The revival by President Carter of the proposal for a sealevel canal across Central America has evoked renewed concern among marine biologists about the effects of unimpeded access between the tropical Atlantic and Pacific.

title: Topics
description: Should an American go to jail for exercising a fundamental right? Susan Vanhattum, a University of Michigan junior, is caught in a Catch22 situation. Miss Vanhattum inadvertently voted illegally in an Ann Arbor, Mich., mayoral election that was decided by a single vote. She was one of 20 voters who live in Ann Arbor Township and therefore should not have been casting a ballot in the city of Ann Arbor. The boundaries are unclear and mixups have apparently occurred before. In the ensuing complications, a judge asked how she had voted because he wanted to know whether the illegal votes had affected the outcome. Miss Vanhattum properly refused to answer, citing her belief that a secret ballot is fundamental to the American system. This earned her 90 minutes in handcuffs and the threat of jail for contempt of court. This young woman may have violated the law by mistake, but she is defending a fundamental principle with great care. She deservesreward, not punishment.

title: Knicks' Box Score
description: RefereesJohn Vannak and Wally Rooney. Attendance4,231

title: Trying To Make Sense of It
description: Is it possible to make sense of what is going on in the world, to set oneself for the future? Of course we cannot predict the sudden storms of history. But history is more than storms; it is also a great Gulf Stream, carrying us along on its broad currents. Here are a few dead reckonings on the directions in which I think that stream is moving, and a few reflections on what we must anticipate as we go with its currents.

title: In the New York Area, Immigrants Are Looking Beyond the Melting Pot
description: The secondlargest Korean Christian community.in the UnitedStates is in the New York metropolitan area, where ap?? proimately 40,000 Korean immigrants at?? tend 70 churches, according to the Rev?? Kwon Suk Kim of Woodside, the eastern moderator.

title: Population Growth in New Jersey  Found Near Zero in Census Data
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9New Jersey has shown almost zeropopulation growth, and the state's big counties including Essex, Bergen, Hudson, Union and Passaic are experiencing major population losses, according to new Census Bureau projections.

title: SST Foes Roll at Speed of Snail And Tie Up the Roads to Kennedy
description: Thousands of weekend travelers were delayed yesterday afternoon as about 200 motorists clogged traffic in and around Kennedy International Airport to protest the planned landings of the Concorde supersonic jetliner.

title: Noise Rules and the Concorde
description: Opponents and supporters of the supersonic Concorde airliner are offering all kinds of theories about the motives of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey in submitting alternative propoSals for noise rules governing the use of Kennedy International Airport by the airliner. Is the agency bowing to what it feels is inevitable and going through procedural motions deemed a necessary prelude to final acquiescence in Concorde operations? Or is it playing a subtler game aimed at impressing the United States Supreme Court with its reasonableness and at inducing the courts to grant a lengthy extension of the 19monthold ban on. Concorde operations in New York.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: NILE STYLE Shepheard's is reopening tonight  with a difference. This is not, of course, the famed old English hotel long gone from Cairo but its namesake entertainment sanctum in the Drake Hotel, Park Avenue at 56th Street, which in recent years has centered on disco dancing.

title: Jackson Surprised at Benching, but Excuses Martin
description: KANSAS CITY, Oct. 9In the 167th and last game of the American League season, with the championship at stake, Manager Billy Martin of the New York Yankees decided tonight to bench Reggie Jackson, the highestpriced player in the history of baseball.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: Large puddles of rain reflected colorful floats, traditional costumes and swirling, swaying dancers as thousands of Hispanic Americans marched proudly up Fifth Avenue yesterday in celebration of the discovery of America by Cristbal Colon.

title: Paradox in Foreign Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9The failure of the SovietAmerican statement on the Middle East to win significant support on Capitol Hill or from the American public at large has underscored the serious problem the Carter Administtation faces in trying to improve relations with Moscow. President Carter and his top foreign affairs aides seem to have learned in the last week that it is easier to gain a solid base of political support when the United States is at odds with the Soviet Union than when the two countries agree.

title: The Great Tandoor Debate (Cont'd)
description: In answer to a reader inquiry about something called a tandoor spice, I stated recently in this column that to my knowledge no such thing existed.

title: Theater: Survival a Political Act
description: Unlike Sizwe Bansi Is Dead, Survival, the new South African play with music that opened last night at the Astor Place Theater, is not so much an actual play as an act of political theater. As such, it is closer to El Teatro Campesino and the San Francisco Mime Troupe than it is to Athol Fugard and his gifted collaborators.

title: Bonn Official on Way to Far East
description: BONN, Oct. 9 (Reuters)  Foreign Minister HansDietrich Genscher of West Germany and a group of leading businessmen left here today on a sevenday trip to Japan and China.

title: Fire Bombing Severely Damages Offices of Farmworkers' Union
description: A week of mysterious harassment that began with rock throwing culminated yesterday in a fire bombing that severely damaged a West Side building used by the United Farmworkers of America.

title: CITY BENEFIT CUTS URGED BY GOODMAN
description: A sufferer from heartwalletitis, New York City will have to trim pensions, fringe benefits and workrule expenses in the next administration, State Senator Roy M. Goodman said yesterday.

title: William S. Honneus, ExDirector Of Advertising Sales at Time Inc.
description: William Stone Honneus. a former adI vertising sales director for the international edition of Time magazine and a former assistant managing director of Time International, died Saturday of a heart ailment at Lawrence Hospital in Bronxville, N.Y. He was 74 years old and lived at 9 Wyndham Road in Scarsdale.

title: The Making of Judges in New York
description: At 1:30 A.M. on Wednesday, Sept. 21, stopping over at Miami International Airport on his way to a business appointment in Chile, Patrick J. Cunningham telephoned one of his lieutenants in the Bronx County Democratic organization.

title: That Big, Blue Wrecking Crew
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 9  Reggie Smith, the right fielder, led the litany in the visitors' clubhouse in Veterans Stadium. He stood facing a knot of Dodgers locked in a tight semicircle, arms about shoulders. Chunky Glenn Burke was in the group, lean Lee Lacy, Rick Rhoden, Lance Rautzhan and others, all unkempt, all grinning. Some were bare to the waist, some stripped down to sweatshirts drenched in spilled champagne. The faces glistened. Smith: Tell me about the Reds. Acolytes: The who?. The Reds. The Reds who? The Red machine. What Red machine? The big mean Red machine. No, tell me about the crew. The who? The blue crew. What blue crew? The big blue wrecking crew! Wahoo!

title: Prof. Phyllis Rise Freeman Wed to Prof. David Krikun
description: Phyllis Rise Freeman and David Krikun were married yesterday in the garden of their home in Highland, N.Y., by Rabbi Arthur Zuckerman of New York.

title: Jets Defy Odds Again, Conquer Bills by 2419
description: ORCHARD PARK, N.Y., Oct. 9For the first time since 1974, the Jets reached 500 today, making fools of the oddsmakers for the second straight week in a 2419 victory over the Bills.

title: Advertising
description: Traditional corporate advertising was attacked as counterproductive on Friday by Alexander S. Kroll, president of Young & Rubicam U.S.A. I think the public has drawn a bad cold feeling from it, he said.

title: Article 1  No Title
SOUTH KOREA BUILDS A DEFENSE INDUSTRY
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Oct. 6South Korea celebrated its National Defense Day here last weekend with shiny displays of military hardware rumbling through the streets that witnessed bitter fighting a quarter century ago.

title: Yanks Take 2d Straight Pennant; Defeat Royals, 53, on 3Run Ninth
description: KANSAS CITY, Oct. 9Just as they did a year ago when Chris Chambliss socked a ninthinning, fifthgame home run, the Yankees rallied in their last turn at bat in the fifth and final game of the playoffs tonight and won their second consecutive American League pennant.

title: 2 Soviet Astronauts in Soyuz Head Toward  Linkup With Orbiting Salyut
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 9Two Soviet astronauts aboard a Soyuz spaceship were moving toward a rendezvous with an orbiting scientific research station today in a mission apparently aimed at celebrating the 60th anniversary of the Russian Revolution next month.

title: Fine Concert by Guarneri Quartet
description: This listener has never been quite the fan of the Guarneri Quartet that some others have been. Of course it is a major ensemble, possibly this country's best. But the Guarneri's performances have seemed too often to sound either plushly polished orif more intensestill not very probing. They never, ever played poorly. But they weren't somehow very significant, either.

title: H.U.D. Lauds Newark Restoration Project
description: NEWARK, Oct. 9Less than a week after President Carter walked through a deteriorated neighborhood in New York City's South Bronx, an official of the Federal Department of Housing and Urban Development joined Representative Peter W. Rodino Jr. today on a tour of two sections of central Newark that had been rejuvenated by an urbanredevelopment program.

title: FIRE BOMB DAMAGES UNION HEADQUARTERS
description: A week of mysterious harassment that began with rock throwing culminated yesterday in a fire bombing that severely damaged a West Side building used by the United Farmworkers of America.

title: Brickman Moves to Frank
description: Paul Brickman, who was president of the Chicago office of Fuller & Smith & Ross and later of the office of Creamer/FSR, is moving into Clinton E. Frank Inc. as an executive vice president and chairman of the strategy review and operating committees. He'll be in charge of all client service.

title: GiantsEagles Scoring
description: FIRST QUARTER

title: Cordial StandIn for President Brezhnev
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 9  Vasily Vasiliyeyevich Kuznetsov, the new First Vice President of the Soviet Union, is a 76yearold metallurgist turned diplomat whom colleagues at the Foreign Ministry have learned to appreciate over the last 22 years as a considerate and kindly the boss.

title: Harvard of the West Climbing in Ratings
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Oct. 8Freshman students at Stanford University tell of a professor here who opened the term last week with the greeting: Welcome to everyone who decided not to go to the Stanford of the East.

title: Erle Cocke, 82, ExChief of F.D.I.C.
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 8 (AP)Erle Cocke Sr., a former chairman of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation and past president of the American Bankers Association, died here Friday. He was 82 years old.

title: Miss Korniewicz Wed to Ralph J. Lamparello
description: HelenMarie Korniewicz, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. John Alexander Korniewicz of Brooklyn, was married there yesterday in the Roman Catholic Church of Our Lady of Angels to Ralph James Lamparello, son of Mr. and Mrs. Patrick J. Lamparello of Bayonne, N.J. The bride and bridegroom are lawyers, she with the Staten Island law firm of John S. Zachary and he with the prosecutor's office in Jersey City.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Books of The Times
description: Throughout, the Bert Lance affair, I felt that reading the newspapers was pretty much like rereading William Safire's novel, Full Disclosure. During this period, of course, Mr. Satire was using Mr. Lance's head as a torntom in his wigwam on the OpEd Page of The Times. But it was his novel, not his columns, that seemed to be running serially everywhere else in the paper. Full Disclosure may be the best account we have of Presidential

title: G.O.P. Expected to Maintain Strength In Morris, Union and Essex Counties
description: MORRISTOWN, Oct.9Despite an influx of Democrats in recent years and some inroads in offices at the municipal level, the ruralsuburban areas of Morris, Union and Essex Counties are expected to remain largely in Republican control in the state legislative elections Nov. 8.

title: Hard Winter Forecast By Farmer's Almanac
description: DUBLIN, N.H., Oct. 9 (AP)Abe Weatherwise, whose forecasts of Western drought and Eastern blizzards were accurate for 1977, predicts a hard winter for the Northeast and occasional spells of cold, much snow and a late spring for the rest of the nation in 1978.

title: 6 Die in French Bus Crash
description: BORDEAUX, France, Oct. 9 (Reuters)Six Spanish women were killed and 19 people injured when the bus they were riding in crashed and overturned on a highway just south of here, the police said today.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Music: Tribute
description: The American Symphony Orchestra opened a series of eight concerts at Carnegie Hall yesterday afternoon with an overflowing but interesting program dedicated to the memory of its founder, Leopold Stokowski.
