title: Jane Stevens Chooses Rare Songs
description: Jane Copeland Stevens. accompanied by Gene Sabo. earned high marks for imaginative programming and lofty goals in the selection of vocal music she sang Friday night in Carnegle Recital Hall. A contralto currently on the faculty of Western Connecticut State College, she clearly has an inquisitive musical mind, and is willing to give her audiences something different.

title: School Custodians Ordered by Court To Show Records
description: The State Court of Appeals has upheld a lowercourt decision that the business records of school custodianswhose operations have been the subject of several recent investigations involving alleged kickbacks. payroll padding, rampant nepotism and noshow jobsare public documents and not private property.

title: Trials and Traumas Of the BigBudget TV Commercial
description: At 6:05 P.M. on a sunny day early last month, after 17 rehearsals and 78 retakes of a 12second scene shot in Central Park and on Fifth Avenue, assistant director Jonathan Bernstein told a weary assemblage, Ladies and gentlemen, that's wrap. Filming had been completed on an elaorate 60second Dr Pepper commercial, conceived by the Young and Rubicam advertising agency, that combines seven locations coast to coast, 36 principal performers, 69 extras and a robust young actor known unofficially as the Pied Pepper. Although much work remained to be done in editing rooms and sound studios, the crosscountry odyssey of the Pied Pepper had come to an end. The finished commercial will be the centerpiece of a new advertising campaign for the soft drink to be unveiled on television programs targeted at the 13 to 34 age group, beginning with the Miss Teenage America pageant late next month and a Paul Simon special scheduled for Dec. 8.

title: TV VIEW
description: For too many Americans, the popular image of Puerto Rico tends to fall somewhere between a funny accent and a teeming slum. Puerto Ricans represent one of the most recent waves of impoverished immigrants to these shores. Depictions of them on television are largely limited to situation comedies, in which they live in slums, fill menial jobs, eat little other than cuchifritos and inflate crime statistics. Tins stereotypical portrait provides the classic excuse for neglect and condescension. But something is happening, and if Bob Dylan's Mr. Jones doesn't know precisely what it is, he is at least beginning to get curious. When a group called the F.A.L.N. can paralyze a large area of Manhattan with terrorist bombings, when the United Nations considers a debate on whether Puerto Rico's commonwealth status is only a form of U.S. colonialism, mainlanders begin to perceive, however dimly, that La Isla Verde (the green island) may be considerably more than a stopover for luxury liner tourists shopping for jewelry.

title: To Know Your Place in Life, Get a Map; Know Your Place? Get a Map; Energy Seminar
description: To survey or not to survey is a question that in a time of runaway housing and land prices becomes increasingly critical for consumers Dressed to find their own answers.

The main topic of their discussion will be when, where and how they may question Tongsun Park, a Korean businessman who has been indicted on charges of improper lobbying activities in Washington.

description: Travelers on the Connecticut Turnpike notice with curiosity the large posted signs that inform both Connecticut residents and visitors of the quickest routes to the ocean beaches of Rhode Island.

Yes, it was too bad that she had to sell it, but after all, it costs a lot to own any car in Manhattan, and if anything sounded too expensive it was nineyearold sports car with 76,000 miles.

title: The Road They Love to Hate Is a Lifeline for the Island

Not a romantic beginning to a journey, but, to most, it's not a romantic journey.

title: ART
description: TWO exhibitions in Manhattan galleries are lively demonstrations that Westchester is a dynamically active art communi ty. In one display at the Lever House, Park Avenue at 53d Street, 18 different groups from the Visual Arts Affiliates of Westchester are represented. The groups include associations from Mamaroneck, Mount Vernon, New Rochelle, Scarsdale and Rye as well as various cooperatives, workshops and faculty organizations.

title: INVESTING
description: Manny Korman, who works in Wall Street, thinks that a lot of investors ere missing a good bet this time of year by not taking losses on certain stocks in their portfolios.

title: Carolyn Hammond Affianced

title: Starting Out Submissive
description: IN order to appreciate the fine writing in The Women's Room, you should do your best to forget any recent books you may have read about women's liberation. It's not, after all; Marilyn French's fault that others before her have gone on and on about the same subject. Pretend you're from Mars, you haven't heard a word, and you want know something about the lives of certain women in midcentury America. The Women's Room is mood place to begin.

title: Arkansas Bows, 139, To Texas
description: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark.,Oct. 15 (UPI) Randy McEachern completed three passes in an 80yard drive capped by Johnny Jones 1yard touchdown with less than five minutes remaining today as Texas defeated Arkansas, 139.

title: FILM VIEW
description: Little things keep interrupting Mathieu (Fernando Rey), the charming, urbane, 50ish French businessman who's the hero of Luis Bunuel's effervescent new comedy, That Obscure Object of Desire. While Mathieu is in his elegant library in Paris, in the middle of some delicate negotiations with the mother of Conchita, the maddeningly fickle, changeably beautiful, 18yearold Spanish dancer he wants to make his mistress, there is a sudden, very loud snap, just offscreen. Mathieu's eves betray the tiniest flicker of impatience as his everready valet, Martin, enters the room and, most discreetly, without a word, removes the body of the mouse that's just been trapped while Mathieu was talking solemnly of love, respect and financial security.

Two Frenchmen, Eugene Rogalle and Yves Buso, took it over and are in the process of changing everything for the better. Give them a little more time and the restaurant's threestar potential may become a reality.

title: Is Anybody Listening?
description: In the six months since he announced his energy program, President Carter has alternately played Mr. Nice Guy and Mr. Bad Guy in shepherding the package through Congress. With the program shredded by the Senate and its committees, he decided last week, no more Mr. Nice Guy.

title: Ruth S. Hochberger Is Bride of Martin Flumenbaum
description: At the Main Line Reform Temple in Wynnewood, Pa., last evening, Ruth Susan Hochberger, a feature reporter for The New York Law Journal, was married to Martin Flumenbaum, a lawyer with the New York firm of Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison. Rabbi Max Hausen performed the ceremony.

title: Polluting a Pipeline Decision
description: Nobody paid much attention on Oct. 4 when Senator Magnuson of Washington introduced an amendment to a marine mammal protection bill. Its aim seemed laudable: to protect the waters of Puget Sound, a. fragile and important national asset, from oil pollution. And the means seemed reasonable: a prohibition against Federal approval for any expansion of oil terminal facilities in the threatened areas. Not a single Senator even questioned the amendment as it was hurriedly approved by voice vote. The amendment also sailed through the House almost without question. And then the realization sank in: Congress, without understanding the implications, had wiped out a major proposal for distributing Alaskan oil to the energyhungry interior states. That oil is being brought by tanker to the energyrich West Coast and is to be piped inlandby a northern and a southern route. Three alternatives have been proposed for the northern route, but by approving the Magnuson amendment, Congress has now virtually eliminated one, of them.

title: Federal Hand Guides Detroit

title: Margie Grace Is Betrothed
description: The engagement of Margie Mary Grace to John Prentice Shethar has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. J. Peter Grace of Manhasset, LI., parents of the future bride. Mr. Shethar is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Prentice Shethar of Amherst N.H.

title: Alternate Schools
description: YORKTOWN DANNY FANSELOW, a 13yearold ninthgrade student who wants to be a lawyer, said, between bites of a sandwich, that he did not care if he ever went back to his school again.

title: A State Park Gone, but Not Forgotten
description: BERKELEY TOWNSHIP

title: Michigan Makes First Wisconsin Loss 560 Rout
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Oct. 15 (UPI)Roosevelt Smith, a sophomore tailback who had carried the ball just eight times before today, scored two touchdowns and Rick Leach passed for two more as the two led Michigan to a 560 victory over a previously unbeaten Wisconsin team that it was expected to have trouble with.

title: Allison Brennan Married To Frank Dwyer, Actor
description: Allison Dorothea Brennan and Frank Dwyer were married yesterday in the Judson Memorial Church in New York by the Rev. Howard R. Moody.

title: Levittown Division Coach Notches No.100
description: Jerry Jewell has witnessed a number of games worthy of a place in his memory bank during his 20 years as coach of Levittown Division, but yesterday's 288 verdict over Elmont will always be on instant recall. Division presented Jewell with his 100th coaching victory end it came against an undefeated team that had permitted only 6 points in winning three games.

title: West Europe Trying to Curb Moonlighters
description: PARIS,Oct. 15A few weeks ago in Le Marais, an increasingly fashionable neighborhood on the right bank of the Seine River near Notre Dame Cathedral, the police handed a summons to a restaurant owner for employing two moonlighting workers to help paint his bistro.

title: Giants (13), 49ers (04) Battle Today
description: The Giants play the San Francisco 49ers today at the Meadowlands, creating a good opportunity to discuss pro football in Canada.

title: INTERVIEW
description: IN 1931, Charles R. Bergmann was freshman at Newark College of Engineering. He remembers being personally interviewed by Allen Cullimore, the stern, dedicated president of the college, and hearing him tell the freshman class that that only half of them would last the next three months.

title: A Great Smokies DetourIn Search of Clogging
description: The couples file onto the dance floor, hands joined or on hips. Their feet never stop shuffling, tappingclicking out a rhythmic accompaniment to the guitars and fiddles of the mountain band. Suddenly a couple breaks away from the line and lets loose, to the cheers and whistles of the spectators. Knees rising high, they twirl and kick and spin, their metaltapped shoes never missing the beat.

title: Bruins 213 Victors over Cornell Team
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I.,, Oct. 15 (AP)Mark Whipple ran for two touchdowns and Ron Brown recovered a fumble and intercepted two passes today as Brown toppled Cornell, 213, In a mistakeridden Ivy League football game.

title: A Novice in Affliction
description: DYLAN THOMAS's famous poem Do Not Go Gentle Into That Good Night is about death: it is a surpassingly beautiful admonition against the acceptance of death, written by the poet to his dying father. Yet its repeated imperativeRage, rage against the dying of the light'is as much applicable to other forms of death and loss that can be experienced by any of us, well before actual extinction.

title: Eve and Snow White's Apple
description: 0N MY more optimistic days, you can count on me as a believer in human progress. Despite Dark Ages, Inquisitions, Holocausts and Richard Nixon, I like to feel that, in its sojourn on this planet, the race of Homo sapiens has, in general. shown a steady movement forward.

title: Lois Stockton Becomes Bride Of J.J.Gonzalez
description: Lois Boudinot Stockton, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. H. Haines Stockton of Englewood, Fla., was married yesterday in the Madison Avenue Presbyterian Church to Joaquin Juan Gonzalez, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joaquim Gonzalez of New York, formerly of Havana. The Rev. Dr. David H. C. Read performed the ceremony.

title: Citicorp Towers Over. St. Peter's But the Church Is Not in Shadow
description: Even though the new Citicorp Center looms above them on Lexington Avenue, the leaders of St. Peter's Lutheran Church say they do not feel dominated by the skyscraper.

title: Pettiford Keys Rout of Nyack
description: Rudy Pettiford scored touchdowns on runs of 85 68, 38 and 20 yards as undefeated North Rockland registered its fourth straight Rockland County P.S.A.L. triumph, 530, over Nyack yesterday.

title: House Votes Bill to Ban Dumping Of Sewage Sludge in the Ocean
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15 (UI)Dumping of sewage sludge in the ocean would be banned, starting in 1981, under a bill passed by the House yesterday and sent to the Senate.

title: Trumbull Lifts Record to 50
description: Trumbull scored all its points in the first half as it handed Greenwich its first loss of the season by 360 in a key Fairfield County game yesterday. Greg Myers scored on a pair of short runs and Curt Pistey, the quarterback, ran for one score, passed to Joe Markus for another and connected with Bill Petroccio for a pair of conversions to lead Trumbull, which raised its wonlost record to 50.

title: Sunday's Softball Game on Long Island: Laurel and Hardy Would Have Loved It
description: As I stepped to the plate, I acted in the best interests of the game.I stripped off my Tshirt and flexed my muscles like Superstar Billy Graham, the professional wrestler.

title: The World
description: It's not our purpose to jam anything down anyone's throat, an American official explained. The neutron bomb was not going down too well among United States allies in Europe and when the meeting was over the nu clear planners of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization put off a decision on developing the controversial weapon. The United States had hoped for a quick goahead.

title: Mary Esther Johnston Wed
description: Mary Esther Johnston, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred G. Johnston of Roscoe, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Robert Stephen Austin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Stanley Austin of Needham, Mass. The Rev. Timothy Quinn performed the ceremony at the Gate of Heaven Mission of St. Aloysius Roman Catholic Church in Livingston Manor, N.Y.

title: BROWNE WINS 1977 TITLE AT U.S. CHESS CONTEST
description: MENTOR, Ohio, Oct. 15 (AP)Walter Browne of Berkeley, Calif., won his third straight United States Chess Championship when his opponent conceded less than 12 moves into the game.

title: Bridge Plan Fails Test of Time
description: YONKERS THE state has recently completed an impressivelooking overpass at a cost of more than $4million in the northern part of this city. But at least part of it may be in the wrong place at the wrong time.

title: BRIDGE
description: When tournament bridge began to use the word contract instead of auction almost half a century ago, there were many bright youngsters in New York eager to master the new game. One was John Rau, who used to drive older opponents crazy with impertinent psychic bids, then a new idea. He won his first national title at the age of 22, playing on a team led by Ely Culbertson.

title: Headliners
description: Sharbel Makhlouf, a 19th Century LebaneseMaronite monk and hermit, has been canonized by the Roman Catholic Church. The ceremonies in Rome were regarded by the Maronite Christians not only as being a significant religious event but also as a reaffirmation of their ties to the West as well. The Maronites, Christian Arabs who broke with Rome in the seventh century and returned to it in the 12th century, have proclaimed their own saints in the past, but Father Sharbel is the first to be canonized by the Vatican.

title: Unveiling New Cars: The Message Is SELL!
description: PHILADELPHIA

title: Behind Bars
description: A savvy prison novel that takes the temperature of life behind San Quentin walls and remains gripping without peering into every dark corner in search of plot. Edward Bunker himself has spent most of his adult life in prisons, with stretch in San Quentin. Judging from his novel, he detests the place (well over 30 convicts are murdered there yearly) and thinks it an abyss where Satan reigns. His young hero, a prettyboy pot and cocaine dealer, is hardened by his time there, and remorseful only that he got caught. Worse, while there he makes a life commitment to crime, so that he will have no soft spots, and even severs the spine of a hillbilly gorilla who fondles his buttock. When the man dies, it's forgotten in the flood of murders the animals.

title: Andrew C. Quale Jr. Marries Sally Ellis
description: Sally Sterling Ellis, director of special sales for the Viking Press and Penguin Books in New York, was married yesterday to Andrew Christopher Quale Jr., a lawyer with the New York firm of Coudert Brothers.

title: Engagements
description: BrodskyRothkopf

title: Creating Jobs for Youth
description: Reputable statistical studies suggest that if cyclical unemployment could be reduced from 7 to about 5 percent, in today's national economy, something like full employment would have been reached. But that leaves out of account the structurally unemployed a more delicate way to describe them than unemployable.

title: Sarah R Fitzgerald Wed to Peter R. Blum
description: Sarah Randolph Fitzgerald, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Peter Crumbly Fitzgerald of Milton, Mass., was married there yesterday in St. Michael's Episcopal Church to Peter Robert Blum. son of Mr. and Mrs. Roger G. Blum of Greenwich, Conn. The Rev. Robert Bracewell Appleyard performed the ceremony.

title: ABOUT NEW JERSEY; Getting Into the Swing of (Bio)rhythm
description: ABOUT this time of year, when the morning travel at the Lincoln Tunnel thickens again because all those people who went away from New Jersey for vacations have come back, when I know I have to begin again my annual cycle of attendance at the Parents Liaison Committee of my children's school and when the time approaches for me to choose from among my state's 18 candidates for Governor, I start to feel what I have come to call my fall Garden State depression.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY;
description: IT WAS a fall Saturday. I parked my car a block from the Edward Cooper Athletic Field in Linden and walked toward it past the clean, welltended, onefamily frame homes.

description: Richard Lippert defeated Jesse McCutcheon in a disputed race and Walt Whitman High of South Huntington, L.I. won its third title of the season yesterday in the St. John's University interscholastic crosscountry meet at Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx.

description: WHITE PLAINS MORE than 50 years ago, when Edmund F. Ward was in his early 30's and a wellknown illustrator, he completed an impressive oil painting., entitled Enter the Law. It depicted a sternlooking marshal coming into town on horseback.

description: Mr. and Mrs. Milton Gladstone of greenwich, Conn., and New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Margaret Jane Gladstone, to Robert E. Ferguson, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Ferguson of Houston.

title: Kennedy Names Judgeship Choice
description: BOSTON, Oct. 15 (AP)Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, announced today that he would recommend that Judge A. David Mazzone of Superior Court be appointed by President Carter to a vacant Federal judgeship in Boston. Mr. Mazzone, 49 years old, was an Assistant United States Attorney from 1961 to 1965, practiced law privately for 10 years, and was named to the Superior Court bench in 1975 by Gov. Michael S. Dukakis.

title: FollowUp on the News
description: The $116 million Tellico Dam 20 miles west of Knoxville, Tenn., was more than 90 percent completed when a United States Court of Appeals ordered the Tennessee Valley Authority to halt the project. What caused the halt last February was a threeinchlong fish called the snail darter.

title: Divorced Men Organize
description: NO MAN Is an Island. . . Fight for Equality and Family Stability. These slogans on the bumpers of cars throughout the state call attention to the twoyearold Divorced Men's Association of Connecticut. With its 850 members, it is determined to help men get what it calls a fair shake in the long, trying process of divorce.

description: PORTLAND,Me.Parole may be an idea whose time has gone.

description: GEORGE J. MARLOWE

title: Morris Knolls Rally Achieves a Tie
description: Tom Angle's 2point conversion pass to Bob Halm after a 3yard touchdown burst by Bob Ciampaglio with 10 minutes remaining lifted Morris Knolls (301) to a 1414 tie with Morristown (211). Ciampaglio, who finished with 171 yards in 15 carries, opened the scoring with a 91yard firstperiod scoring run. Morristown tied it on Daltell King's 31yard interception return, and moved in front on Hugh Geraghty's 7yard touchdown pass to Rich Goryeb and Charles Tillman's conversion run.

title: New California Retirement Rules Cause Contention
description: SAN FRANCISCO,Oct. 15If I don't retire, how does anybody move up? said Frank Haven, the managing editor of The Los Angeles Times. It would be a big letdown for about four people if I suddenly decided I didn't want to quit.

title: LANCEGATE: WHY CARTER STUCK IT OUT
description: President Carter's supporters and critics are asking themselves the same question: How could group of intelligent men, led by a man clearly sensitive to the wishes of the American people, so quickly enmesh a honeymooning Administration in the Lance affair'? In less than two months, the image a smiling stroll down Pennsylvania Avenue was replaced by the sight of Senators squabbling with an Administration witness on television. The warm feeling felt by taxpayers when White House aides were denied luxurious perks was replaced by the chill that comes when a Government official tries to explain why his privateplane trip to the Mardi Gras should have been permitted as a tax deduction.

title: Not a Road for Amateurs
description: THE DRIVERS on this thing are crazy abts_ lutely out of their minds, the truck driver moaned dejectedly. He leaned against his rented van, which had wheezed to a halt and was now stranded on the eastbound shoulder of the Long Island Expressway near Exit 38. You gotta be crazy to ride this thing.

description: The Yankees, behind the fourhit pitching of Ron Guidry, defeated the Dodgers, 42, in Los Angeles yesterday and took a lead of three games to one in the 74th World Series.

title: Chris Hynes, Miss Moseley Are Married
description: The marriage of Margaret Beall Moseley to Chris Hynes, a vice president of the Drysdale Securities Corporation, took place yesterday at the Riverside (Conn.) Yacht Club. Justice of the Peace Robert Mowbray performed the ceremony.

title: Vitalia Boursouk, Pianist, Warms to Her Task
description: Vitalia Boursouk's ChopinLiszt piano recital Thursday evening at Alice Tully Hall was one of those occasions in which an artist gives one some cause for concern at the outset, then steadily warms to her task.

description: THERE are about 2,500 fewer family physicians in the state than, according to the New Jersey Academy of Family Physicians, there should be. This shortage creates a crisis for both patients and doctors and demands immediate action.

title: Suffolk Burglaries: A New Defense
description: RMED with a slim, fourinchlong electrical etching tool, the Suffolk police have begun an attack on the increasing number of burglaries in the county14,545 last year and 10,846 as of Aug. 31 this year.

title: Joan Little Escapes
description: Joan Little, a black who was acquitted of slaying a white jailer in 1974, escaped last night from a correctional center in Raleigh, N.C. Page 19.

title: Last of the Great Masters
description: TONI MORRISON, that handsome and perceptive lady, once remarked that, in spite of all the other elements which more immediately meet the eye, she was struck by the quantity of sheer intelligence which went into the forging of black life in Americawithout which intelligence, simply, none of us would have survived. Similarly, while reading Earl Fatha Hines's vast and beautiful document. I am struck by the sheer generosity of the man, and the people he lived with, whom he shares with us. Hines is describing hard trials, good times, bad times, narrow escapesbut the book is never petty or mean and never bitter. Such generosity may also be a function of the intelligence; it gives life, certainly, heals, and saves.

title: ART
description: HUNTINGTON WHEN we see the glories of American art of the 19th century in an exhibition at the Heckscher Museum, it is difficult to understand why such a superb achievement was overlooked, neglected and even decried for such a long period of time.

title: Bank Holdup Foiled As Teller Asks Slip
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 15 (AP)A bank teller's insistence on a withdrawal slip foiled an attempted robbery here yesterday in which the suspect allegedly demanded $6 million.

title: The Delicious Monster Is a WellKnown House Plant
description: A friend in south Florida sent me an unusual package one day. It contained several fully ripened fruits of the wellknown house plant, Monstera deliciosa. He included a note, How to Eat These. By the time I opened the surprise parcel, some fruits were already overipe and the U.P.S. truck smelled like a market bus in Jamaica.

title: WINOGRAND'S THEATER OF QUICK TAKES
description: A photographer's studies of the rituals of public events, from press parties to peace demonstrations, are exhibited in a show called Public Relations, opening this week at the Museum of Modern Art.

title: Assignment of Teachers by Race Wins Acceptance in Major Cities
description: The assignment of public school teachers on the basis of racean issue that has sparked a controversy everywhere from political forums to school cafeterias in New York Cityhas become an accepted educational practice in major school districts across the country.

title: Stage: I, a OneCharacter Work
description: You can ??erally make what you will of I rederic Baal's ?????long onecharacter theater piece. which the Treatre Laboratoire Vicinal of Belgium is presenting from Tuesday through Friday at the Lepercq Space at the Brooklyn Academy of Music. Performed by Anna West an American actress, I, is, an organized and controlled combination of words and gestures designed to give an effect of randomness, of oblique movement and tangential utterance.

title: Votes in Congress
description: Senate

title: Connecticut /This Week
description: BRIDGEPORTAnnual faculty exhibition, Carlson Gallery, Bernhard Center, University of Bridgeport. Weekdays 11 to 5, weekends 1 to 5.

title: LETTERS TO THE LONG ISLAND EDITOR
description: I've lived in a suburban home on a 60by100plot for the last eight years and, so far as I have been able to observe,I am the only one on the block or, for that matter, on a wide expanse of neighboring blocks, who cuts the lawn with a hand mower. If there should be another stray eccentric like me up or down the block, I've missed him or her.

title: FRANK A. STUBBLEFIELD, A FORMER CONGRESSMAN
description: MURRAY, Ky.,Oct. 15 (AP)Frank Albert Stubblefield, a Kentucky Democrat who served 16 years as a United States Representative, died last night in MurrayCalloway County Hospital, where he was hospitalized since Sept. 21 with a lung condition similar to emphysema. He was 70 years old.

description: Decisions are now being made offstage that will determine how New York City's finances are run for years to come

title: Dvorak on Disk Delight and Discovery
description: It's a safe bet that no one, least of all Ken Russell, would want to make A movie about Antonin Dvorak. Among the most modest and unassuming of composers, Dvorak led A quiet, happily married life, plying and refining his craft with a minimum of fuss and struggle for recognition.

title: Wall Street Mergers (Continued) Three Into One
description: The ailing securities industry, battered by the elimination of fixed brokerage fees and the retreat of individual investors from a sickly stock market, is adjusting to adversity the way many industries doby consolidating. The underlying trend toward concentration in Wall Street surfaced anew last week, with the announcement that Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette plans to acquire Pershing & Company and Wood, Struthers & Winthrop.

title: Medical Center in Manila Treats an Unending Stream of Children
description: MANILA, Oct. 15At the children's medical center on suburban Banawe Street, the stream of patients is unending, for this is a country where 12 million children, are unreached by medical care.

title: Flyers Set Back Penguins As Kelly And Dailey Star
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 15 (AP)Bob Kelly and Bob Dailey scored two goals each and Bobby Clarke, the team captain, had a goal and four assists as the Philadelphia Flyers defeated the Pittsburgh Penguins, 82, tonight.

title: Couple Selling Divorce Kit Sue L.I. Bar Association Over Alleged Harassment
description: A Bellmore, L.I. couple who have been selling doityourself divorce kits since 1974 have filed a $900,000 damage suit against the chairman and eight members of the Nassau County Bar. Association's Unlawful Practices Committee, charging harassment.

title: STAMPS
description: An exhortation to all Americans using the mails to conserve energy is being delivered by the United States Postal Service through a new issue of stamps and stamped envelopes backing up President Carter's efforts to save and develop energyan effort which he describes as the nation's No. 1 priority and the moral equivalent of war.

title: NEW ORLEANS STRIKE IS ORDERED LIMITED
description: NEW ORLEANS, Oct. 15 (UPI)Officials of the dock worker's union here, under pressure from Thomas J. Gleason, president of the International Longshoreman's Association, ordered their members today to return to work and limit their strike to container ships.

title: Tarantola's Efforts Help Bloomfield Post Victory
description: Bob Tarantola, a 185pound senior halfback, rushed for 168 yards and three touchdowns as Bloomfield (40) trimmed Bergenfield, 206. Tarantola scored on runs of 7, 1 and 85yards, helping Bloomfield to a 20.0 lead. Bergenfield, which had won its first three games, averted a shutout when Jose Zambrano ran 3 yards in the third quarter.

title: Notes: On DutyFree Limits and Preclearance
description: Help may be on the way for American tourists traveling abroad, and the magic words are dutyfree allowslice and preclearance.

title: Yeshiva University Starting Major Reorganization
description: Dr. Norman. Lamm, the president of Yeshiva University, has announced a major restructuring of the university and the appointment of five new administrators, including the first woman in the school's 92year history to serve as a vice president, and a 28yearold State Department officer as dean of Yeshiva College.

title: SELECTION
description: This is an excerpt from the opening of an essay written by Robert Lowell during this summer at Castine, Me. It will appear in a book of his prose writings scheduled for future publication by Farrar, Straus & Giroux. The essay, entitled New Englandand Further, is concerned with New England writers from the earliest times to T. S. Eliot and Wallace Savantes. The following passage was read by Meyer Schapiro at the memorial for Robert Lowell at the American Place Theatre on Sept. 25.

title: Edward Menzer Plays Ambitious Piano Program
description: Edward Menzer, a graduate of the New York College of Music and a frequent piano recitalist in the last few years in the New York area, made his official debut last Sunday afternoon in Carnegie Recital Hall. From the opening selection, the BachSiloti Prelude in G minor, to the final group of Liszt fingerbreakers, Mr. Menzer played an ambitious program, more perhaps than he can quite encompass at this point in his career.

title: Woolfolk, Brand Excel As Westfield Triumphs
description: Westfield, stung by Gary, Lepinski's 28yard touchdown jaunt onthe second play from scrimmage, rolled. to a 416 victory over Scotch Plains in posting its fourth victory in as many starts. Herold (Butch) Woolfolk plunged 4 and 3 yards for touchdowns and Owen Brand. went 42 and 8 yards for scores as Westfield extended its. unbeaten streak to 17 games, including 14 victories in a row.

title: to Tour the U. S.
description: Mr. Crane said that the Newark Museum might be interested. It was, and eventually purchased nearly 500 objects from Mr. Shelton, forming the nucleus of its collection.

description: I.LIFE MAGAZINE OTIME I NCJ LARRY BURROWS

title: Miss van den Heuvel Is Engaged to Marry
description: Mr. and Mrs. Stanley van den Heuvel of Darien, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Elizabeth van den Heuvel to Daniel G. Ehrgood, son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas A. Ehrgood of Lebanon, Pa.

title: Long Island/This Week
description: ALBERTSONWatercolors by Eleanore Paris and sculpture by Linda Sirow; through Oct. 30; Shelter Rock Public Library, 165 Searingtown Rd. For hours call CH 87363.

title: Another Life for SALT
description: The United States and the Soviet Union appear to be moving toward a sensible compromise on the next agreement to limit strategic nuclear arms. It builds on the first SALT accord, which expired this month but has been voluntarily kept in force pending the nest pact. It falls well short of the proposals that Secretary of State Vance took to Moscow last March for comprehensive reductions in strategic weapons. The Soviet leaders took offense at that sudden detour from the path of previous negotiationsand at the apparent advantages the United States proposed for itself. So the Carter Administration wisely moved back to the principles worked out by Presidents Ford and Brezhnev at Vladivostok in 1974, and in subsequent talks to achieve the present compromise.

title: At Home and Abroad, They Dance to the Tune of the Steel Drum
description: In the most intensive campaign against imports seen in this country in decades, the steel industry is escalating its demands for some form of protection against what it argues is unfair foreign competition. Last week the steel producers carried their case into the White House, where they got some assurance from the President that the Government was prepared to offer relief.

title: Music
description: There are many anticipations of Turandot in La Fanciulla del West. The firstact chorus, starting with the miners singing Quanto piangera, is strongly reminiscent of the Moon Chorus in the later opera. The slithery harmonies Rance's Minnie, della mia casaa gorgeous piece musicare new to Puccini and those, too, were to find their echo in Turandot. There are some breathtakingly beautiful things in Fanciulla, and it deserves to be a repertory piece.

title: The Political Families of Bergen
description: HACKENSACK WHEN mother is in politics, the whole family is involved. That's the experience of the families of the three female members of the Bergen County Board of Chosen FreeholdersDoris Mahalick, Joan Lesemann and Joan Steinacker.

title: NONFICTION IN BRIEF; THE CONTINUUM CONCEPT ; THE PSYCHOTHERAPY MAZE ; SURPRISE! SURPRISE!
description: When my children were very young, I was reminded, from time to time, of Freud's belief that the complexity of the civilized environment, together with the prolonged period of children's dependency (on people whose will and whims often seem at odds with their charges), are the crucibles in which neuroses are forged. The perception of the world as overwhelming, and of ourselves as inadequate to cope with it effectively, to some extent afflicts almost everyone in our culture: it's as if we had been robbed of that harmony of, self with surroundings which was the birthright of our antecedents and which still belongs to our mammalian counterparts.

title: Jacob Jacobs, Yiddish Lyricist, Playwright and Actor, Dies at 86
description: Jacob Jacobs, a major figure in the Yiddish theater died Friday at his daughter's home, where he lived, in the Sheepshead section of Brooklyn. lie was 86 years old and recently underwent surgery.

title: Carol Spielman Engaged
description: Mrs. Donald Spielman of East Orange, N. J., has announced the engagement of her daughter, Carol Ray Spielman, to Joel Eugene Ewan, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul E. Ewan of San Diego, Calif. Miss Spielman, the daughter also of the late Mr. Spielman, graduated from Smith College. She is a research scientist with the New York State Office of Drug Abuse Services. Her fianc. a graduate of the University of California at Los Angeles, is vice president of Basic Togs, a children's sportswear concern in New York. The wedding is planned for March 12 in West Caldwell, N. J.

title: Origins
description: The employee publication has ancient origins. During the 11th century Chinese feudal lords issued monthly bulletins to their civil and military personnel. They dealt with everyday events: births, deaths, weddings, beheadings.

description: Pity poor Preston Pearson. This fine running back, who has done a lot for the Dallas Cowboys the last two seasons, not only hears footsteps but sees them too the footsteps of Tony Dorsett. Both play the same position, and

title: Realty News
description: The Prudential Insurance Company of America has made a number of major changes in its portfolio of commercial real estate in the New York metropolitan area.

title: Case Nears Jury in the Civil Trial Of Oilman in SoninLaw's Death
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 15When William Friedkin, director of the 1973 film The Exorcist, appeared in a courtroom here this week, it only underscored the show business element of an eightyearold murder drama.

title: DINING OUT
description: JUST a little bit off the Bloomfield Avenue beaten path, but close enough to the Broad Street shopping core of Bloomfield, sits the browntrimmed, creamcolored stucco house with the old roof of hexagonal tiles that has been made into Proud Mary's.

title: Soft Energy, Hard Choices

But another debatepotentially far more significantis raging below the surface. It speaks to fundamental sociopolitical questions, and it centers more and more on a controversial scientist named Amory B. Lovins.

title: Once Established, Says Jasper Johns, Ideas Can Be Discarded
description: Not untypically, Jasper Johns seems ambiguous about his retrospective show that opens Tuesday at the Whitney Museum, a fullscale affair that covers 22 years of his artistic output and exposes, some 200 workspaintings, sculptures and drawings made between 1955 and 1976.

title: Kim Lester Fiancee Of Steven R. Sommer
description: Judge and Mrs. Sherwin D. Lester of Englewood Cliffs, N. J., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Kim Abby Lester, to Steven Richard Sommer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Morton Sommer of Scarsdale, N. Y. A wedding in December is planned.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: All systems are go to finish planting of bulbs, new evergreens, perennials . . . . Keep ahead of the falling leaves . . . . If cuttings taken from border geraniums, impatiens, coleus, lantanas, etc. have rooted, pot them up in a fertile potting soil and keep out of sun for a few days.

title: ONE CRITIC'S FICTION
description: I have always felt that Jorge Luis Borges appeals to the sort of people who want fiction to transcend itself, who are ashamed of believing, even for the space of a short story, and take a snobbish pleasure in seeing through fiction, in unmasking (one of Borges's favorite Borges. words) fabrications instead of experiencing them. Borges's fiction is exegesis before the fact, criticism standing over the story and intimidating it before it can establish itself.

title: A Niche for Tourist Cabins, Relics of a Plainer Age
description: Remember the little tourist cabins of the 1930's and 1940's, dotted in lawns that were often uncut, looking like oversized chicken coons?

title: HOME CLINIC
description: MANY homes have screenedin porches or partly enclosed sunrooms along the side or back of the house that are unheated, and thus unused, during the winter. Since these porches only have screens to enclose them, winddriven rain and snow accumulates on the inside, and anything stored out there takes a beating from the weather.

title: Rabbi to Hold Daily Prayer Services Aboard L.I .R.R.
description: Subways may be for sleeping, but is a Long Island Rail Road train a place for praying?

title: Derrick Brandon Graves Fiance of Mary Robinson
description: Dr. and Mrs. Clarence G. Robinson of Brooklyn have announced the engagement of their daughter, Mary T. Robinson. to Derrick Brandon Graves, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Graves of Philadelphia.

title: Cider
description: IT'S A SURE sign of autumn when the maple leaves start turning red and the cider mills throughout the state start churning out thousands of barrels of the tangy apple drink.

title: DePaul Tastes Defeat, 30, On McBain's 50Yarder
description: Barry McBain, who holds the New Jersey record for career field goals, booted a 50yarder yesterday to give Pompton Lakes a 30 upset victory over previously undefeated DePaul of Wayne. McBain's 13th career 3pointer. and his first this year, came in the third period after a pass interception by Rich Mendes. DePaul enjoyed a 13384 advantage in total yardage. It marked the first time this season that DePaul was scored upon.

title: The Other Side Of Budget Fight In Greenburgh 7
description: IT was with great sadness that I read the article by Bernd Brecher, president of the Greenburgh's School Board 7, in the Sept. 25 issue of Westchester Weekly. Sadness, because I believe if he had waited for the results of the fifth budget vote, on Sept. 27, in which the budget was finally approved, he might have avoided writing an article full of contradictions.

title: Centereach Builds Latest in Firehouses
description: CENTEREACH I IF MY father were alive today, he wouldn't believe it, said Coles Williams, a thirdgeneration volunteer fireman, as he walked through the nearly completed $2.5 million Centereach firehouse.

title: SENATE LEADER SAYS CLARIFICATION HELPS CANAL PACT CHANCES
description: WASHINGTON,Oct. 15Senator Robert C. Byrd. the majority leader, said, today that the statement of understanding on the Panama Canal treaties issued yesterday by President Carter and Brig. Gen. Omar Torrijos Herrera, the Panamanian leader, was a very important diplomatic achievement that improved the chances of Senate ratification of the accords.

title: POLITICS
description: COLOGNE, West Germany

title: Christine Hobson Kjellstrom Is Married In South to Alexander Douglas, Bank Aide
description: Christine Hobson Kjellstrom, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Nils David Kjellstrom of Richmond, was married there last night to Alexander Douglas, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Waldo Douglas of Danbury, Conn. The Rev. Don Raby Edwards performed the ceremony in St. Stephen's Episcopal Church.

title: Care for Retarded: The Hope and the Reality
description: AT the Lower Fairfield Regional Center for the mentally retarded in Norwalk, every resident is taken every day to the big yellow gymnasium for games and physical therapy. Even the young man in the wheelchair who drools constantly and cannot hold his head up is not without hope. He smiles as the young therapist, who keeps talking to him, massages his neck and shoulders trying to strengthen the muscles.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: AMERICAN LEGEND (USL). Rotterdam Oct. ???? Felixstowe 30 and Hamburg Nov, 1, sails from Howland Hook, Staten Island, Letters, Prints and Parrel post for the Netherlands, Great Britain and Northern Ireland.

title: Greece's AntiU.S. Virus
description: ATHENSAmericans are welcome here in a personal and nonofficial way and American tourists, airplanes and ships are received with open arms. There have been no recent violent incidents, like stonethrowing mobs seeking to wreck the United States Embassy or murderers stalking United States officials. Nevertheless, United. States policy is widely disliked by Greece and, from an official viewpoint, we are about as unpopular here as we are (officially) in Turkey.

title: Bridal on Dec. 17 Set By Miss Stringfellow
description: Mr. and Mrs. Frank Hargrave Stringfellow of Greensboro, N.C., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Elizabeth Lenox Stringfellow, to Edward Vernon Ferrell Glenn, son of Mrs. Douglas Dillard of WinstonSalem, N.C., and the late Joseph Henry Glenn Jr.

title: LETTER FROM WASHINGTON
description: THOMAS J. DOWNEY, the 28yearold Second District Representative from Suffolk County, is working his way through college again. The first time aroundat Cornell in the late 1960'she did cleanup work in the science lab and earned his room and board by being house manager of his fraternity. This time his $57,500 salary as a Congressman serves rather nicely to pay for his studies at the American University Law School here.

title: Today's Probable Pitchers
description: Don Gullett, 26yearold lefthander from Lynn, Ky. . . .Six feet tall, 190 pounds. . . .Pitched opening game of last year's World Series for the Cincinnati Reds against the Yankees, then became a free agent, signed with New York for nearly $2 million and won 14 games and lost four this season. . . .Has suffered injuries often during eightyear career in major leagues. Was forced to leave first playoff game against Kansas City after two innings with sore shoulder, but returned to pitch into ninth inning of World Series opener, which was won by the Yankees in the 12th. . . .Married, father of two children, lives in Kentucky.

title: THE GOSPEL ACCORDING TO WILLIS
description: It will be a coronation. It will be Tuesday night at Madison Square Garden, and it will be well attended. From the past, there will be the likes of Bill Bradley of Princeton, Oxford and maybe the White House; and Dave DeBusschere, the white knight of deefense . For the present and future, there will be such as Earl Monroe, the black pearl of offense, and Lonnie Shelton, full with baby fat and promise. The organist will play and the paying guests will stand and cheer as Willis Reed receives his investiture as head coach of the new New York Knickerbockers. Under a rain of spotlights and a cloud of tobacco smoke, he will stand on the Garden floor, drinking all in until the pores of his skin glisten with sweat and the beat of his heart muffles their applause. Then, buzzer will sound, and for the first time Reed will send his team on the court for the opening game the National Basketball Association season.

title: Andrzej Anweiler Shows Stolid Piano Temperament
description: Andrzej Anweijer got off to an unfortunate start in his New York debut recital Wednesday night at Carnegie Recital Hall. His performance of Mozart's Sonata in B flat (K. 333) came apart, owing to memory slips in the opening and closing movements, was marred by wrong notes, and suffered from rhythmic disturbances. It may have been a case of debut nerves. The recitalist recovered and the remainder of the program held to a level of proficiency well above the Mozart.

title: Strindberg: The Precursor of Pinter, Albeeand Serban
description: NEW HAVEN

title: Rock: Nader's Show at Garden
description: Richard Nader's RockandRoll Revival shows, by their very nature, are put together with little regard for pure artistry. Their purpose is to sell a kind of music and to play on an almost universal emotion, nostalgia, and for them to accomplish these ends the performers they present must have been responsible for at least two or three extremely popular rockandroll records. The more performers there are, the more hits, and the more hits there are, the more tickets will be sold, or so the reasoning goes.

title: POLITICS
description: ROSALYNN CARTER and Gerald R. Ford will visit New Jersey this week to lend their personalities and fundraising abilities to the campaigns of Governor Byrne and Senator Raymond H. Bateman. respectively.

title: MARKETS
description: When the sky seemed to be breaking into small pieces above Wall Street one afternoon last week a stockbroker was asked: How are you doing?

title: As Opposite as They Are, the Two Parties Clearly Need Each Other
description: The Liberal Party has come through one of the most tumultuous years in its 33year history by at least temporarily disproving the notion that, without the mirrors, the party consisted entirely of Alex Rose and his telephone.

title: House Panel Votes to Bring Up Coal Slurry Pipeline Measure
description: WASHINGTON,Oct. 15 (AP)The House Interior Committee decided Wednesday to move the hardfought coal slurry pipeline bill before the full committee for action early next year.

title: A Very Quiet Revolution
description: The legendary dealmakers of Wall Street, with their personal razzmatazz and their flair for singlehandedly creating and pulling off all but impossible financings, are mostly gone now. In their place, the managers have quietly settled incontrolling costs, setting goals, meeting obiectives.

title: Scientists Now Call Multiple Sclerosis Test Useless
description: Two teams of American scientists, who reported development of a test that others heralded as a milestone in multiple sclerosis research, said yesterday that the test should not be used because it was unreliable.

title: 2 Burned to Death  In Truck Accident Near Lake in Park
description: Two men burned to death yesterday when a stolen truck in which they were riding burst into flames after skidding over a viaduct and landing in a ravine near a small lake in Central Park

title: MUSIC
description: AT a time when zooming costs are forcing opera impresarios all over the country to emulate the mad scenes of some of their stage heroines, and exorbitant ticket prices are threatening to send mutinous opera buffs back to their phonographs, a

title: Alabama Beats Tennessee 7th Time in a Row, 2410
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Oct. 15 (AP)Jeff Rutledge scored two touchdowns and threw a 30yard scoring pass to Ozzie Newsome as Alabama defeated Tennessee, 2410, in a Southeastern Confrence football game today.

title: Economic Indicators
description: WEEKLY COMPARISONS

title: Woman Sentenced in Son's Death
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 15 (UPI)Shirley Ellenburg, 35 years old, has been sentenced to five years to life in state prison in the seconddegree murder by starvation of her 11yearold son, Gary. Judge Donald Constine of Superior Court earlier rejected h'r attorney's plea for probation. Mrs. Ellenburg is six months pregnant. A codefendant, Charles Nakao, a former policeman, was also convicted of seconddegree murder and will be sentenced Oct. 28.

title: A Price Hint on Oil?
description: While President Carter was trying to salvage his mangled energy program in the Senate last week, new talk of oil price increases came from the headquarters of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries in Vienna.

title: Soccer: Suburban Strongholds Getting Stronger
description: Dumont's superintendent of schools was flabbergasted when 72 fairly skilful players turned out for his high school'.s soccer team seven days before the school opened this year. He recalled the year only 14 had come out to make an acquaintance with the soccer ball.

title: Defense Helps Kentucky Beat L.S.U., 3313
description: BATON ROUGE, Oct. 15 (AP)A defensive end, Art Still,rambled 52 yards with a blocked fieldgoal attempt and Dallas Owens lugged an intercepted pass 81 yardstonight as 12thranked Kentucky rolled to a 3313 Southeastern Conference victory over 16thrated Louisiana State.

title: Money and Schools
description: THE current statewide drama over who is to finance public schools in New Jersey is an interesting, lavish production. But it can become quite disheartening once it is apparent that former, more substantive stars in educationCurricular Revision, Student Rights, Accountabilityhave relinquished top billing and are now forced to play a quiet, somber second banana to Hard Cash.

title: Groton and Mears Are Too Much for Middlesex
description: Doug Mears, a senior quarterback, put on a oneman offensive show for Groton and the result was the Massachusetts team's third straight victory. Mears tallied on runs of 6, 35, and 2 yards, and completed a 28yard scoring pass to Dave Rimmer as Groton downed Middlesex, 3820.

title: Americans Behind West Germans In Spending on Vacations Abroad
description: PARIS. Oct. 15 (Reuters)Americans are second behind West Germans in spending on overseas vacations.

title: Jean Sandman Fiance Of D. Bradley Peck 3d
description: The engagement of Jean Sandman to D. Bradley Peck 3d. son of Mr. and Mrs. Peck Jr. of Holden, Mass., has been annnunced by the future bride's parents. Mr. and Mrs, Edgar A. Sandman of Harrison, N.Y. A summer wedding is planned.

title: Events Today
description: Street Festival and Ragamuffin Parade: ?????? ment, sports, crafts, food; 11 A.M. third Avenue from 65th Street to 100th Street, Brooklyn.

title: Patricia M. Sullivan, A Nurse, Is the Bride Of W. J. McGuigan Jr.
description: In Holy Cross Roman Catholic Church in Rumson, N. J.. yesterday afternoon, Patricia Marie Sullivan, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George Joseph Sullivan of Rumson, became the bride of Walter Joseph McGuigan Jr., son of the late Dr. and Mrs. McGuigan of WilkesBarre, Pa.

title: Behind the Best Sellers: Cyra McFadden
description: In Marin Countyese, people talk of being laid back, mellow, hanging loose and getting their thing together.

title: Martha Friel Becomes Bride
description: Martha Whiting Friel, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Daniel D. Friel of Greenville, Del., and Richard T. Wilson 3d, son of Carmel Snow Wilson of New York and R. Thornton Wilson of New York and Bernardsville, NJ., were married yesterday by the Rev. John A. Cartmell in the Westminster Presbyterian Church in Wilmington, Del.

title: ART
description: TWO exhibitions in Manhattan galleries are lively demonstrations that Westchester is a dynamically active art communi ty. In one display at the Lever House, Park Avenue at 53d Street, 18 different groups from the Visual Arts Affiliates of Westchester are represented. The groups include associations from Mamaroneck, Mount Vernon, New Rochelle, Scarsdale and Rye as well as various cooperatives, workshops and faculty organizations.

title: Westchester Hunt Widens for Woman, 77, Missing Since Oct. 7
description: NORTH SALEM, N.Y., Oct. 15Sixty volunteers from local, county and New York State agencies joined the search today for a 77yearold woman who left her home here at noon Oct. 7 to take a walk and has not returned.

title: Best Sellers
description: The listings above are based on computerprocessed sales figures from 1400 bookstores in every region of the United States.

title: Sunday Observer
description: My brother and sisterinlaw recently told me that Im about to become an uncle, writes Mr. B.E. of Topeka. Would you have any suggestions on unclehood or thoughts on the subject you could pass along?

title: Storm Signals for Municipal Bonds
description: WASHINGTONBank purchases of municipal bondslong a favorite bank investment because of their untaxed status and relatively low riskhit a record last year, according to The Daily Bond Buyer, and such sales so far this year are running 40 percent ahead of last year.

title: The Brothers Behind Padre Padrone
description: Imagine, if you will, two brothers who codirect neorealist films and who are in such exquisite accord that when we are directing, we take turns doing things, sequence by sequence. Imagine two such brothers who have codirected filmsbeginning with documentariesin this manner since 1954 and whose current work, Padre Padrone (which will open here soon), is so fine that it was recently exhibited at the New York. Film Festival where critics acclaimed it, and, earlier this year, at Cannes where it became the first film to win both top honorsthe Golden Palm and the International Critics Prizeand drew from the late Roberto Rossellini, who knew a thing or two about neorealist filmmaking, the tribute that this film reconciles me to the cinema. Imagine these gentle, cultivated, synchronized brothers traveling to New York from their native Tuscany and being interviewed through one interpreter, answerable to both, during which interview they take turns answering questions without once interrupting each other.

title: J. Mark Fisher Fiance Of Shari Rossmann
description: Mrs. Frederick L. Rossmann of New York and Bucks County, Pa., has announced the engagement of her daughter, Shari Kathranne Rossmann to J. Mark Fisher, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph P. Fisher of Pittsburgh. The marriage will take place in the spring.

title: Alternatives to Armaments: Nine Days in October
description: WESTPORT

title: Jane Strunsky Wed To Rev. G.D.Wood
description: The marriage of Jane Bertha Strunsky. daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Strunsky of New York, to the Rev. Gregg Douglas Wood. Protestant chaplain at the Brooklyn Development Center and an Episcopal priest in the Diocese of Low, island. took place yesterday in New York. The Rev. Neale A. Senor performed the ceremony in St. Mary's Episcopal Church.

title: What's Doing in PHOENIX
description: VALLEY OF THE SUNAt the Chamber of Commerce they tell you the sun shines more than 4,000 hours a year in Phoenix, the center of Arizona's Valley of the Sun. It's true. But although the 100degreeplus summer temperatures are comfortable because it's eood. dry heat. visitors should plan trips to Phoenix in the winter or spring. Arizona's average temperature is a balmy 72 degrees and the leisurely pace can be a welcome change from the hectic bigcity life of the East.

title: Lindsay Schick Is Wed To Robert J. Byrnes Jr.
description: The marriage of Lindsay Young Schick, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Henry J. Schick of Wayne, N.J., to Robert Joseph Byrnes Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Byrnes of Devon, Pa., took place yesterday in the Pompton Reformed Church in Pompton Lakes, N.J. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. William Gaston, who was assisted by the Rev. Thomas F. Walsh, & Roman Catholic priest of New York and an uncle of the bridegroom.

title: $100 Million Bond Sale Approved For an Industrial Park in Suffolk
Amid Debate at Belgrade, Quiet Change of Aims and Style
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia,Oct. 14Another quiet metamorphosis in aims and attitudes began to develop as the Belgrade review conference on European security settled down to the long haul of daily argument after its first week.

title: 5,000 Run Next Sunday in FiveBorough Marathon
description: Ron Hill and Chris Stewart will arrive from England tomorrow night. Lasse Viren will fly in from Finland on Thursday with his wife and child. Bill Rodgers will be here for a week of preparation and promotion.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: When the Metropolitan Opera brought back Puccini's La Fanciulla del WestThe Girl of the Golden Westto open its 196162 at season, this column wondered if the time was ripe for the opera to capture the public's imagination. It may have been a tearjerker, of impossible melodrama, but perhaps it would be possiAle to accept it as a period piece. And there was some wonderfull of impossible melodrama, but perhaps it would be possi ble to accept it as a period piece. And there was some wonder ful music in it.

title: Skeptical About Skepticism
description: PHILIP SLATER is a psychotherapist (of the groupencounter persuasion) and a selfproclaimed skeptic who has come to the realization that there are more things in heaven and earth than were dreamt of in his former philosophy. He apparently feels a compulsion to share this insight with the rest of us. However, unlike Carlos Castaneda, Charles Fort. John Lilly, Immanuel Velikovsky and Erich von Danikenall of whom figure prominently in his textSlater has no mass of new facts to reveal, no personal theories to propound, no particular viewpoint to press. All he wants to do is take what most people call skepticism and stand it on its head.

title: East Islip Wins; Patchogue, Too
description: East Islip and Patchogue remained unbeaten in AAA2 yesterday with their fourth victories of the season. The Redmen defeated Deer Park, 86. and Patchogue beat Brentwood Sonderling, 80.

title: Dumping Notes: 2 Sides Differ On Banks' Role
description: After three days of hearings on the role of the banks in the New York City fiscal crisis, one of the main accusations against the banksthat they dumped billions of dollars in city securities in 197475remains subject to differing interpretations.

title: Lawyer Ads
description: An incurable sentimentalist about the traditions of the law, I have not been finding it easy to adjust to the ramifications of the recent United States Supreme Court decision on lawyer advertising.

title: In God's Capacious Hand
description: The stories in Over By the River, William Maxwell's new collection, have copyrights dating as far back as 1941yet there is a remarkable sameness to the whole. Six of the twelve pieces take place in or near New York City, two in tourist's France, and the rest in that ancestral Midwestern town Max

title: Dance UmbrellaModern Dance's Big Top
description: The Dance Umbrella, after only two seasons of operation, has managed to become an institution overnight by virtue of its service to the field. This season it will present 20 modern dance companies in two, fiveweek fall and spring installments, at the newly refurbished Entermedia Theater. What, you may ask, is that and where is it?

title: A Westchester Girl's Battle to Compete in Soccer: She Finds Rules May Speak Louder Than Ability
description: For Valerie Robin, playing soccer with boys is something she has done for seven yearssomething familiar, not something to be feared. Now at the age of nearly 14, Valerie has found that she may have to go to court or have some rulebooks altered before she can pursue her simple goal. Valerie Robin of Chappaqua, qua, N. Y., a freshman at Horace Greeley High School, is a member of the boys freshman soccer team. When Valerie realized she was too advanced to play on the newly formed girls team, she sought a place on the boys freshman team. It made sense to Valerie, perfect sense. She had learned to play soccer as a youngster in Uruguay and Argentina, where her father, an I.B.M. executive, was assigned. In South America, Valerie recalled, pickup games in the streets with young boys were common.

title: Deaths
description: AUCHFrederick H. October 14, 1977. Of Manhasset. Beloved husband of Florence. Devotee father of Joan Auch. Longtime member of the New York Athletic Club. Service at The Fairchild Chapel, 1570 Northern Blvd., Manhasset. L.I., Monday, 10 A.M. In terment Pine Lawn Memorial Park, Pine Lawn, L.I. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to the Manhasset branch of The American Red Cross. Visiting hours Sunday 35 and 79 P.M.

title: Will Government Become the Modern Medici?
description: Will Government Become the Modern Medici?

title: New Rochelle Seeks an Arts Image
description: NEW ROCHELLE IN Seattle, this year's Bumbershoot Festival attracted more than a halfmillion people in 10 days. In Louisville, the annual Blue Grass Music Festival drew 140,000 in two days. These and other cities would appear to be models for a recently released Ruder and Finn report entitled The Renewing of New Rochelle. The report recommends a variety of imagebuilding programsoutdoor festivals, neighborhood fairs, public art competitions, beautification projects and special celebrationsthat have been used successfully by large and small cities in revitalization programs.

title: Daley Remembered Fondly at Chicago Symposium
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 15When someone at Wozniak's Casino on the Southwest Side suggested the other day that the late Mayor Richard J. Daley should perhaps be considered the last of the oldtime reformers, Vito Marzullo, the venerable 25th Ward Alderman, could scarcely contain himself.

title: IN BRIEF
description: A RECORD CORN CROP of 6.3 billion bushels was forecast by the Department of Agriculture, which raised its estimate 1 percent above last month. The soybean crop was estimated at a record 1.65 billion bushels in the denartmenrs monthly crop report and the wheat harvest at 2.03 billion bushels, down from last year's record 2.15 billion harvest. Strong grain harvests can be expected to dampen the prices of consumer food over the next year. . . . Prices for aluminum sheet, plate and coil will rise about 4 percent on Oct. 17, the Kaiser Aluminum and Chemical Corporation confirmed.

title: Elis Capitalize on Lions Fumbles
description: Georgia Gavric, a manager of the Columbia football team, dropped Shakespeare's A Midsummer Night's Dream on her subway trip with the Lion from 116th Street to Baker Field yesterday.

title: DINING OUT
description: AFTER extolling the virtues of the Bully Boy Chop House, a friend said, Take money. But far more important than money at this Rockland County standby is a large appetite. Considering the generous portions, the reasonably priced wines, the extras provided and the generally high quality of the food, we judge Bully Boy one of the best values for the money in the area.

description: The other day, my son Jack asked me:

description: The marriage of Ellen Mary Blewitt daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bertram Joseph Blewitt of Essex Fells, N.J., to Peter Myles Dotto, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles F.Dotto of Livingston, N.J., took place yesterday in the Immaculate Conception Chapel of Seton Hall University in South Orange, N.J. Msgr. Vincent P. Coburn, pastor of St. Thomas the Apostle Roman Catholic Church in Bloomfield, N.J., performed the ceremony.

title: Nancy Pratt Is Wed To B. H. Heckscher
description: Nancy Turner Pratt and Benjamin Hallowell Heckscher were married yesterday in the Bryn Mawr (Pa.) Presbyterian Church. The Rev. David Watermulder and the Rev. David Coleman of Doylestown, Pa., performed the ceremony.

title: Amy Parks Is Affianced
description: Mr. and Mrs. Daniel L. Paris of Peekskill, N. Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Amy Eleanor Parks, to Daniel Joseph Flanagan, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Flanagan of Nantucket, Mass. The future bride is a student at the Culinary Institute of America in Hyde Park, N. Y., from which her fiance graduated.

title: Vietnam Erasing American Imprint, but Vestiges Remain
description: SAIGON, VietnamFrom the old imperial capital of Hue in the north to Saigon in the south the Communist Government of Vietnam is busily eradicating the imprint of the American era.

title: Penn State Wins, 3124, In Syracuse
description: SYRACUSE, N. Y., Oct. 15 (AP) Playing without Joe Patenrno, their coach, on the sidelines, Penn State got two touchdowns from Steve Geise and held off a fourthquarter rally to beat Syracuse, 3124, today.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: As the annual economic forecasting season opened officially last week with the issuance of two major surveys from the business world, the consensus showed expectations of moderate gains in real growth, employment and capital spending for 1978, but a slight worsening of the inflation picture.

title: Helene A. Pepe Wed To Martin Lebouitz
description: Helene A. Pepe and Martin F. Lebouitz were married yesterday afternoon in New York's Universalist Church. The Rev. Joel E. Scholefield performed the ceremony.

title: Lucile McM. Howard Is Married
description: Lucile McMillan Howard and Thomas Henry Tamoney Jr., 1972 graduates of Trinity College in Hartford, were married yesterday afternoon in Locust Valley, L.I. The Rev. Charles G. Newberry performed the ceremony in St. John's of Lattingtown Episcopal Church.

title: Angels Hire McNamara
description: LOS ANGLES,Oct, 15(UPI)Jonn McNamara, former manager of the San Diego Padres and Oakland A's, has been hired as a coach by the California Angels, replacing Del Crandall.

description: Pamela Campling Jenner, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George A. Jenner of Brooklyn and West Sandgate, Vt., was married yesterday afternoon to Jerome Leo Jarding, son of Mr. and Mrs. Raphael Jarding of Alexandria, S. D.

title: Writer's World
description: AMONG the heirs, executors and surviving friends of recently dead authors candor is now in fashion; it is no longer the custom to keep counsel but, subject to the laws of libel, to tell all. Letters, diaries, confessions appear many volumes. Evelyn Waugh is 11 years dead, and

title: Editors Choice
description: ADLAi STEVENSON AND THE WORLD, by John Bartlow Martin. (Doubleday. $15.) The second and concluding volume of Martin's prodigiously researched biography.

title: California Paper Names Editor
description: SAN BERNARDINO, Calif., Oct. 15 (AP)  Paul H. Finch, an Associate Press general executive and former A.P. bureau chief in Los Angeles and San Francisco, has been named executive editor of The San Bernardino SunTelegram.

title: LEADERS BACK CHANGE FOR SOCIAL SECURITY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15The House Democratic leadership is backing an amendment to the Social Security financing bill that would increase the payroll tax by onetenth of 1 percent and the taxable wage base by $1,800 over the committee version.

title: The Face of Age
description: Imogen Cunningham, who died last year, was a photographer for 75 years and one of the founders of the f/64 Group, which included Ansel Adams and Edward Weston. After she turned 90, she began photographing others who had achieved that age. The results are collected in her last book, After Ninety (University of Washington Press, $14.95 until Dec. 31; $17.50 thereafter), and the pictures testify that her powers were undiminished. (The top left photograph is of Miss Cunningham, taken Tom Eckstrom in 1973.) After Ninety is a testament to the durable beauty of the human face left a woman who, when asked three days before her death to state her religion on a hospital form. wrote: Haven't chosen one yet!

title: Edward V. Gold, 70, the Founder Of the Wimpy's Restaurant Chain
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 15 (AP)Edward V. Gold. the founder of Wimpy's Grills Inc., has died of an apparent heart attack. He was stricken yesterday at one of his restaurants in downtown Chicago. He was 70 years old.

title: Prejudices Undisguised

title: Charles RosenThe Ph.D. At the Keyboard
description: Charles Rosen, who will appear Thursday night at Tully Hall with the St. Paul Chamber Orchestra, is far from the first wellknown performing musician to achieve fame as a writer. Any number of singers, conductors and instrumentalists have left valuable memoirs and autobiographies. The conductor Felix Weingartner wrote a useful book about Beethoven's symphonies. Among Rosen's fellow pianists, Paul BaduraSkoda is the coauthor of a widely read study of Mozart's keyboard music.

title: City Council Agenda Of Public Hearings
description: Public hearings to be held this week by New York City Council committees are as follows:

title: A FAREWELL TO MACHISMO
description: Hemingway, as novelist and public heman, still haunts our culture. His unpublished works, just given to the Kennedy Library, show him beset by conflicting ideas of masculinity and femininity. This new Hemingway may reclaim a lost generation of readers.

title: Relph, White Lead 3113 Victory
description: PRINCETON, N.J. Oct. 15Undefeated Colgate, ranked No. 1 in Lambert Trophy balloting emblematic of supremacy in the East, easily won its sixth straight game today, defeating Princeton, 3113, before a crowd of 14,940 at the Tigers Palmer Stadium.

title: INTERVIEW
description: To BE very honest, said Donna Karan, I wasn't expecting it. But there she was anyway, wearing her toastcolored chiffon georgette gown, sitting in an auditorium at the Fashion Institute of Technology among the other nominees for the Coty Awards, the fashion industry's equivalent of Oscars.

title: Wine
description: NANTES, France. What do you drink with a Terrine aux. Trois Poissons de Loire at Charles Barrier's restaurant in Tours? Or with an Estouffade de Turbot at Jean Delphin's restaurant just west of Nantes? Or with practically any fish dish at any restaurant in Brittany? There is really only one answer  muscadet.

title: Body in Gem Death Lost in Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Oct. 15The charred body of a murder victim, believed to be that of a missing New York City diamond dealer, has disappeared, officials acknowledged here today.

title: CHANGES ARE SOUGHT IN CONGRESS RECORD
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15Despite repeated setbacks, there is still a chance that, by as early as next year, some of the speeches that fill the columns of the Congressional Record each morning will be set off with a printed symbol, such as a dot, or bullet, to indicate those speeches not actually delivered on the House or Senate floor.

title: Around the Nation
description: MARIETTA, Ga., Oct. 15 (AP)An official of the local machinists union, which is planning a strike vote tomorrow, has denied an allegation by LockheedGeorgia that union leaders have rendered local negotiators powerless to reach a contract settlement with the company.

title: Gibson Steers Oceanside to 356 Victory
description: Oceanside continued to eliminate challengers in Nassau Conference I. Yesterday it was Hicksville that fell before the Sailors, 356, with Oceanside unleashing a hurricane offense that shocked Hicksville with 28 points in the second period.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: IT SOMEHOW seemed appropriate that the invitation to the 50thbirthday party should come in autumn. There has been a fair run of such invitations in recent years as my generation has been passing the halfcentury mark. Maybe 50thbirthday parties have been going on for generations, but until the 1970's I never heard of them.

title: What's Wrong With Hockey and How to Make the Game Better
description: The trouble with watching the National Hockey League operate is that one begins to suffer from 2020 deja vu, and there are no corrective lenses in sight.

title: Sect Leader Tours Soviet As a Fugitive
description: MOSCOWWith his neatly pressed suit, pink shirt and sober tie, he does not look like a fugitive. His ruddy features are suffused with a serenity that is rare for someone only 28 years old.

title: Tougher Than Hammett
description: AHASTY way of describing this extremely good novel would be to say that it was something like The Bells of St, Mary's worked over by Dashiell Hammett. But True Confessions is tougher than anything by Hammett, looser in its language, and more up to date in its violence and its suspicions. And in spite of its constant allusions to other novels, and to all kinds of movies, it is not a pastiche or an imitation or a parody.

title: Sissy Farenthold: A Role Model on Campus
description: AURORA, N. Y.When Frances T. (Sissy) Farenthold walked into the threeroom presidential suite at Wells College for the first time last year, she was greeted by a row of portraits of her 12 male predecessors.

title: A Sad Comedy About Actors
description: Iomcewould sit around my tattlers omce in ChicagoI was between jobs and didn't have any prospects, and I didn't feel like writing ( which was a serious occupation and which, at that time, I did mainly in restaurants). So I would go down to his office, as it gave some structure to the day, and I'd write letters to my friends or to producers urging them to stage my plays, and sometimes I would write scenes on his electric typewriter.

title: Dominant Party No More
description: JERUSALEMNearly five months after its sudden fall from power, Israel's Labor Party is semicomatose.

Buckley, a trifle embarrassed by the political inexperience of its New York City mayoral candidate, Barry Farber, a legislative loser last year when it failed to forestall liberalization of laws curbing marijuana, the Conservative Party would seem to have fallen on barren days.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Impossible Fish Dream
description: MINOCQUA, Wis.Fishing for muskellunge is nearly akin to the pursuit of an impossible dream. But for reasons not immediately recognized by the occasional musky angler, there are men and women who go after this most recalcitrant freshwater game fish year after year with unabated fervor.

description: HAUPPAUGE IT WAS showandtell time for the Suffolk County Police Department last Tuesday at the County Legislature's hearings on next year's county budget.

description: THE STUDENTS listened intently the other night as the teacher gave his lecture. They asked good questions and the teacher, Lubomir Mesticky, looked pleased at the prospect of having a class that would test his grasp of the subject.

title: How a Lifeline Came of Age
description: THE Long Island Expressway existed in people's mindsas a farmtomarket road, a stagecoach line, even a canalfor more than two centuries before it was completed to Riverhead five Years ago.

title: Imports Confident Despite Challenge
description: FOREIGN AUTO makers appear unintimidated by a recently stated Ford Motor Company view that America's new small cars will drive imports back to the shores. By the time that is accomplished, the foreign manufacturers suggest, the innovative imports may be featuring models that drive on waterstraight back to American shores.
