description: Stock prices staged a mild recovery yesterday afternoon amid Wall Street estimates that weekly moneysupply figures would show a decline after soaring $4.9 billion in the preceding reporting week.

title: 2 Views of Fiscal Crisis: Bankers and Their Critics
description: One after another, the senior executives of the major New York City banks asserted before legislative hearings last week thatdespite all the expertise at their disposalthe banks had no more information about New York City's fiscal problems in 197475 than was available to the public. News Questioners at the hearingsAnalysis members and staff of the Assembly Banking Committeepolitely but firmly responded that they found it hard to believe what the witnesses were saying.

title: And a Good Deal That Is Positive
description: CAPE TOWN, South AfricaHuman rights is a complex issue that is in danger of becoming just a politically useful slogan. I should personally be very distressed to see this valuable concept reduded to sanctimonious political cant.

title: Somalis Fearful of Retaliation by Terrorists
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia, Oct. 20 (AP)The people of this hot and humid captal on the Indian Ocean are jubilant over their Government's part in rescuing 86 hostages from a hijacked Lufthansa jet three days ago. But the jubilation is tempered by fear of terrorist revenge.

title: Fall Fair on Waverly. PI.
description: Tomorrow from 11 A.M. to 5 P.M. Waverly Place between the Avenue of the Americas and Grove Street will be the setting for a fall harvest fair. Sponsored by the Waverly Block Association to raise funds to beautify the area.

title: Ford, Stumping in State for Bateman, Scores Byrne
description: NEWARK, Oct. 20Sounding very much like a candidate himself, former President Gerald R. Ford put in a full day of campaigning in North Jersey for the state's Republican choice for Governor, Senator Raymond H. Bateman; called Governor Byrness record dismal and found time to take jabs at the Carter Administration.

title: At the Philharmonic: Deja Vu for the First Time
description: WHAT WITH Mark Zeltser's massive onslaught as soloist in the Second Piano Concerto by Prokofiev, and with the four percussionists of the New York Philharmonic disporting themselves among a variety of instruments in Dj Vu by Michael, Colgrass, it was a noisy evening last night in Avery Fisher Hall.

title: WEEKEND MOVIE CLOCK
Chinese Leader Meets With Heath
description: PEKING, Oct. 20 (Agence FrancePresse) Chairman Hua Kuofeng, in talks with former Prime Minister Edward Heath of Britain, reaffirmed today Peking's interest in seeing a Unitd and Strong Europe, the Chinese press agency, Hsinhua, reported. Mr. Heath declined to comment on his talks with Chairman Hua and other Chinese leaders.

title: Theaters, Times and Tickets
description: Following is an alphabetical list of Off Off Broadway shows discussed, with ticket information:

title: SST's New York Route Expected to Help Cut Costs
description: PARIS, Oct. 20With Concorde service linking Paris and London with New York, which is expected to start next month, British Airways and Air France move closer to the day when they will no longer be flying the world's first supersonic airliner at a loss.

title: Another Coup in Thailand
description: Only in the narrowest sense was yesterday's coup Thailand a military purge of a civilian government. The deposed Prime Minister, Thanin Kraivichien, was a civilian, and so were most of those who held portfolios in his Government. But they owed their power entirely to the junta of military leaders who placed them in office after sweeping aside an elected Government a year ago. What the junta created it has now disbandeda familiar pattern in Thai politics over the past three decades.

title: AGRICULTURE OFFICIAL REPORTED RESIGNING
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20Agriculture secretary Bob Bergland said tonight that alssistant Secretary Robert H. Meyer, who had been criticized for seeking Federal favors for landowners in the Imperial ttalley in California, where Mr. Meyer has Sthstantial holdings, was resigning effecttve immediately.

title: Label of Villain Called Unfair By Raiders Aide
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Oct. 20The Jet coach's eyes narrowed today when someone mentioned the Oakland Raiders.

title: Woman Charged in Auto Deaths
description: POINT PLEASANT BEACH, N.J., Oct. 20 (AP)A 19yeartold woman whose automobile struck and killed three elderly women from Spring Lake Heights has been charged with death by autmobile, the police said. The car, driven by Katherine H. Leisantritt, struck and killed Elizabeth Quinna, 75; F. Roberta O'Neill, 62, and Rita A. Watson, 63, as they stood in restaurant parking lot here.

title: Bank Earnings Listed for Quarter
description: For periods ended Sept. 30. (N) Indic atesstock Is traded on the New York Stack Exchange, (A) American Stocki Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: Theater: An Elegant, Bloodless Dracula
description: ASTAGE representation of Dracula is a challenge not so much to modern performers as to the modern audience. It comes to us with a stake through its heart, beyond real revival although capable of useful adornment.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Article 4  No Title

title: MITE HOUSE WARNS FED AGAINST LIFTING OF INTEREST RATES
description: By JOHN H. ALLANIn an unusual move, the White House yesterday warned the Federal Reserve Boardwithout addressing it directlyagainst raising interest rates and thus hurting the economy.

title: The YesBut Retirement Act
description: Congress is rushing ahead to a new retirement law and the country had better pay close attention. Hardly anyone can be sure about the consequences of the pending act, portions of which came into being without even a committee hearing.

title: fond Prices Decline Moderately; Unchanged Money Supply Is Cited
description: Bond prices declined moderately late yesterday afternoon as traders became disappointed that the money supply this week remained unchanged instead of declining, as much as Wall Street had expected.

title: Victim Dead 36 Hours Before He Was Found
description: PARIS, Oct. 20  HannsMartin Schleyer, the West German industrialist. was killed 36 hours before his body was found yesterday in the trunk of a car in the Alsatian city of Mulhouse, according to an official announcement made there tonight.

title: The Fed's Chairmanship: Deadline for Carter Nears
description: The deadline for President Carter's decision on whom he wants to preside over the nation's monetary policy after next January is fast approaching without any indication of his choice. In view of some puzzling economic factors, diverse viewpoints and a critical technical issue to consider, it will not be an easy decision. In the spring, shortly after the Federal Reserve Board initiated moves to moderate the growth of the money supply by pushing shortterm interest rates upward, there was speculation that Arthur F. Burns would not be redesignated as chairman of the central bank when his fouryear term expires next Jan. 31.

title: Books: Journey Into the Primitive Past
description: WHEN AMERICAN FORCES began operating in the New Hebrides during World War II in the South Pacific, they were warned that those inhabiting the mountainous jungles of Malekula Island were savage and treacherous, occasionally resorting to cannibalism. Those of us who repeatedly sailed past that island, gazing at its savage, volcanic landscape, were moved by a special awe and curiosity.

title: Levitt Says ExpenseAccount Cheats Bilked Port Agency of $1 Million
description: The New York State Comptroller's office charged yesterday that at least 35 executives and employees of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey had bilked the agency of an estimated $1 million or more over the years through apparently fraudulent, inflated or improper expenseaccount claims.

title: Events and Openings
description: Films

title: U.S. Jury Charges 4 ExPolicemen In Death of a Prisoner in Houston
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 20For the second time this year, the Department of Justice has brought charges against Texas law enforcement officers who received what was termed inadequate punishment for their involvement in the death of a MexicanAmerican in their custody.

title: Tenants Still Cling to Last Building on the Block
description: George Lascu, the 82yearold superintendent at 1500 Boston Road, the only apartment house in the Charlotte Street neighborhood in which people still.live, would not, dream of being anywhere else.

title: New College Conference Formed: the Big Apple
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y., Oct. 20 (AP) Six schools have formed a new basketball league that will be called the Big Apple Conference, officials at Marist College said today.

title: L.I.R.R. Strike Is Averted as Unions Announce New Developments in Talks
description: A strike on the Long Island Rail Road today was averted yesterday when its unions announced a number of major new developments in their stalled contract negotiations.

title: New CBS Chief Warm to ABC Format
description: Three weeks ago, while he was still president of CBSTV, Robert J. Wussler broke with convention, and shocked the industry by attacking a rival network's programmingABC'sas junk.

title: Open Interest; Thursday, Oct. 20, 1977; (In bushels. 000 omitted)
Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS, SOUTHERN DISTRICT Thursday Oct. 20, 1977 Petition Flied By:

title: DR. CHINCHAO LIANG
description: Dr. Chinchao Liang, who retired in 1975 as associate professor of East Asian Studies at St. John's University, died of a heart attack Wednesday nght in his home at 78.40 164th Street, Flushing, Queens. He was 72 years old.

title: Panel to Grade Ombudsman
description: Paul O'Dwyer, the New York City Council President, has appointed a sevenmember panel to report on the performance of the city's new ombudsman office during its 10 months of operation. The new office, headed by Mr. O'Dwyer, reviews complaints about city services, and since January has handled 12,000 complaints.

title: News Summary
description: A major hunt for terrorists was begun by West German authorities to find 16 persons, 10 of them young women, believed to be implicated in a series of terrorist. crimes. Detailed descriptions of those sought were given in posters, on television and in the press, and police set up many roadblocks and checked vehicles. The search was prompted by the, mlirder of an industrial leader after West German commandos rescued the hostages on a hijacked Lufthansa jet. [Page AI, Col. 1.)

title: Facing Senator No
description: GREENSBORO, N.C., Oct. 19Can you imagine, State Senator McNeill Smith asked an audience recently, anyone voting against education for handicapped children? And just as he expected, shocked gasps came back from the crowd when he told them that North Carolina's rightwing Republican Senator Jesse Helms had done just that.

title: In Memoriam
description: EARTLETTElla Herbert. The 4th Anniversary. The dead are like the stars by day withdrawn from mortal eve but not extinct they hold their way in glory through the sky. Chershed memories, Rose.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: WEDNESDAY NIGHT'S GAME

title: Police Head Agrees He Lacks Evidence In Peter Reilly Case
description: The commander of the Connecticut state police, Commissioner Edward P. Leonard, said yesterday that troopers appeared to be overzealous in pursuing the prosecution of Peter A. Reilly and that he now agreed that there was insufficient evidence to require Mr. Reilly to stand trial again for the murder of his mother four years ago.

title: 58 Held as 3 Illegal Queens Drug Plants Are Shut
description: Three illegal laboratories that had produced several millions of dollars worth of a hallucinogenic drug annually have been closed and 58 persons arrested, according to the Queens District Attorney, John J. Santucci.

title: Vorster Terms Warning by U.S. On South African Ties Irrelevant
description: JOHANNESBURG, Oct. 20  Prime Minister John Vorster said today that any move by the United States to review its relations with South Africa because of the crackdown on blacks was irrelevant since he was more concerned with internal security than with international standing.

title: PHILIP J. BRENNAN, 63, OF THE TIMES IS DEAD
description: Philip J. Brennan, a statistician in the business/financial news department of The New York Times and a former international vice president of The Newspaper Guild, died early yesterday at St. Vincent's Hospital following a short illness. He was 63 years old.

title: DR. CHIANG YEE, 74, AUTHOR AND TEACHER
description: Dr. Chiang Yee, an author, poet, painter and professor emeritus of Chinese at Columbia University, died last Monday in Peking during an extended visit to China, his homeland, according to a Columbia spokesman. He was 74 years old and lived at 520 West 123d Street.

title: Allison Earns Pole
description: ROCKINGHAM, N.C., Oct. 20 (UPI)Donnie Allison turned in a lap of 138.685 miles an hour today to win the pole position for Sunday's $137,000 American 500 stock car race. Cale Yarborough, in another Chevrolet, captured the outside front row position for the 13th running of the race at the North Carolina Motor Speedway.

title: Art People
description: IN THIS BLOOMING new era of alternate spaces, there's no telling where culture is apt to roostin an empty firehouse, an abandoned office building or a deserted public school. So it should come as a surprise to no one that the muses are now invading the old police headquarters building on Centre Street. left by the bluecoats several years ago for the move to Police Plaza downtown and recently leased by the city for $1 a month to the Little Italy Restoration Association (LIRA, get it?).

title: A Conference on the Future of Housework
description: A daylong conference on the future of paid and unpaid housework, the role of the housewife and sharing arreingements for child care will be held tomorrow in the new Harlem State Office Building at Seventh Avenue and 125th Street, sponsored by the Sarah Lawrence College Women's Studies program.

title: National Steel Charges European Nations With Dumping
description: The National Steel Corporation, with headquarters in Pittsburgh, has filed a complaint about dumping of steel with the Treasury. National charges manufacturers from six European nations are dumping coldrolled and galvanizedsteel sheets in the United States at less than fair value. The United States company said it was charging that the dumping margins are as high as 47 percent on galvanized sheets and as high as 43.5 percent on coldrolled sheets.

title: Aide Leaving White House
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 (AP)Walter Duka is resigning as assistant press secretary at the White House to become Assistant Postmaster General for communications. Announcing this today, Jody Powell, the White House press secretary, said that Mr. Duka, who moved to the White House from the Postal Service in January, would be succeeded by Claudia Townsend, a former reporter for The Atinta Journal and Constitution.

title: AFRICANS IN U.N. CALL URGENT COUNCIL SESSION
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 20African countries, protesting the crackdown against blacks in South Africa, requested today an urgent meeting of the Security Council. The Council will meet Monday or Tuesday on the request made on behalf of the 49 African countries by Mahmoud Mestiri of Tunisia.

title: Wednesday's Fights
description: STOCKTON, Calif.Brute Curry, 146 imnds, Phoenix, knocked out Jul;o Gomez, 147, Los Anaeies, 3 rounds; Reynaldo Varagoza, Stork. tan, 0111., 135, outoolnted Genaro Gloria, 1244, Mexico, 6; Tony Sanchez, Stockton, 132, knocked out Reynaldo Alvarez, Fresno, Calif., 129, 2.

title: Jacobson Calls for Stay in Plans For Offshore Atom Power Plant
description: NEWARK, Oct. 20Joel R. Jacobson, the State Energy Commissioner, called today for suspension of plans for a floating nuclear power plant off the New Jersey coast near Atlantic City until serious and unresolved safety questions were answered by the Federal Nuclear Regulatory Agency.

title: 2 South Koreans Said to Defect
description: TOKYO, Oct. 20 (UPI)North Korea said today that a South Korean battalion commander and his aide had defected to North Korea across the Demilitarized Zone separating the two Koreas. It was the second defection across the DMZ reported by the North Koreans in less than two weeks.

title: Jets and Giants in Accustorned Roles
description: Those who take their football by television will get a break on Sunday when the top game of the day will be seen in the New York area for a change. Channel 4 will televise Baltimore at New England starting at 4 P.M., and About Pro Football the Giants can be seen once more on Channel 2 at P.M., against the Redskins in Washington. The JetsRaiders game did not sell out by 1 P.M. yesterday, so there will be no local television of that contest at Shea Stadium.

title: Music for the Family Sundays at 92d St.
description: Beginning this weekend, Sundays at 4 P.M. will be a family affair at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A., at Lexington Avenue. A fivepart concertdiscussion series, Instruments on Trial, invites parents and children to explore the world of musical instruments with performers, who will discuss their instruments after each hourlong concert.

title: Bank America Shows an 18.7% Rise For Quarter Operating Earnings
description: The Bank America Corporation, the holding company for the Bank of America, the nation's largest bank, reported an 18.7 percent advance in operating earnings in the third quarter.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: It wasn't too many years ago that the steel industry was seeking tax relief to modernize production facilities to keep pace with the new plants and equipment of foreign competitors. The politicians sold the voters on the idea that tax relief would be unwarranted favoritism which would simply put additional profits in the pockets of the steal manufacturers.

title: Market Place
description: The latest wrinkle in money market funds produces variable interest income depending upon what is happeninz in the money market.

title: Philadelphia Joining Linkup of Exchanges
description: The proposed electronic link between the floors of the New York Stock Exchange and the Pacific Stock Exchange will be broadened to include the Philadelphia Stock Exchange, according to a preliminary agreement announced yesterday. With its implementation, members of the three exchanges would be able to shop all of these markets simultaneously for the best prevailing prices.

title: Concorde Below the Noise Limit In First Takeoff From Kennedy
description: The supersonic Concorde airliner, in its first takeoff from Kennedy International Airport, met the legal noise limit by a wide margin yesterday, according to the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey. And Federal officials saidit proved slightly quieter than some subsonic jets when it came back in to land three hours later.

title: 15 Japanese Broadcasters Get a Look at Dumont Schools
description: DUMONT, Oct. 20Fifteen Japanese broadcasting executives seeking ideas on educational theory visited two schools in this Bergen County community today and seemed intrigued about academic competitiveness in America and the social acceptability of grouping students by intelligence levels and learning abilities.

title: News Summary
description: A major hunt for terrorists was begun by West German authorities to find 16 persons, 10 of them young women, believed to be implicated in a series of terrorist crimes. Detailed descriptions of those sought were given in posters, on television and in the press, and police set up many roadblocks and checked vehicles. The search was prompted by the murder of an indusrial leader after West German cornmancios rescued the hostages on a hijacked Lufthansa jet. [Page A1, Col. 1.]

title: For Men: Italian Copies Or the American Classics
description: For years Ohrbach's has been known for its linefor line copies of European couture styles for women. Now it is adapting the process for men's clothes. The custom tailor chosen is Angelo Litrico of Rome and the styles are not the kind that fade into the woodwork.

title: U.S. and Koreans Break off Talks In Disagreement on Tongsun Park
description: SEOUL; South Korea. Oct. 20After four days of intensive negotiations, the United States and South Korea failed to reach agreement today and broke off talks on an American interrogation of Tongsun Park, the current central figure in an alleged influencebuying scandal involving Congress.

title: Carter Tries Some OnetoOne Lobbying on Energy
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20All morning long, the White House guards were busy opening and closing the iron gates, leaning through the windows of the big cars to check credentials, and pointing helpfully up the long asphalt drive to the West Wing where the string of arriving senators had appointments today with the President of the United States.

title: Woody Allen Is Not Playing His Next One for Laughs
description: WHAT WOULD A Woody Allen movie be like without woody Allen? What would a woody Ailed movie be like without a barrelfull of belly laughs, chuckles and smiles? If we stick around until next season, we shall know the answers to these seemingly absurd questions, for the man who won fame, fortune and new neuroses as a blissfully incurable madcap is shedding his comic mask. At this very moment, Mr. Allen is laboring on Long Island, directing an unsparingly straightfaced drama, one in which he vows not to play so much as a cameo role.

title: The Richard Tucker Legend Grows
description: Rudolf Bing, the former general manager of the Metropolitan Opera, once said: Caruso, Caruso, that's all you hear! I have an idea we're going to be proud some day to tell people we heard Richard Tucker.

title: Sports Today
description: Nets vs. New Orleans Jazz, at Rutgers gyninasium. Piscataway, N.J., 8 P.M. (Radio WMCA, WGBB, 8 P.M.)

title: Rome Students Battle to Honor German Terrorists
description: ROME, Oct. 20Leftwing demonstrators fired pistol shots and threw firebombs at riot policemen outside Rome University tonight after several thousand students had gathered there to honor the memory of three German terrorists found dead, in their prison cells in Stuttgart, West Germany, yesterday.

title: An Extinct Bird Sighted in Peru
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20  The whitewinged guan, a bird believed extinct for a century, has been sighted in northwestern Peru, it was announced here today, and the American ornithologist who found it says that there may be several hundred of the birds in Peru and perhaps some in Ecuador.

title: Frazier Helps Cavaliers To Victory Over Jazz
description: NEW ORLEANS, Oct. 20 (AP)Walt Frazier, the epitome of coolness under pressure when he played with the New York Knicks, fired a fourthquarter surge tonight and, led the Cleveland Cavaliers to a 107104 National Basketball Association victory over the New Orleans Jazz.

title: Ford Stumps in Jersey for Bateman; Mrs. Carter Hailed as She Aids Byrne
description: NEWARK, Oct. 20  Sounftg very much like a candidate himself, former President. Gerald R. Ford put in a full day of campaigning in North Jersey for the state's Republican choice for Governor, Senator Raymond H. Bateman, called Governor Byrne's record dismal and found time to take jabs at the Carter Administration.

title: A Bystander's Guide for Getting the Most Out of the New York Marathon
description: The scene seems culled from a space moviea herd of humans penned in by the imposing towers and rows of metal on the VerrazanoNarrows Bridge. But in reality, it is the start of the New York City Marathon.

title: 2 Filipino Dissidents Urge U.S. To End Its Military Aid to Manila
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 (AP)Two Filipino dissidents who escaped from a Manila prison three weeks ago urged the United States today to end military as sistance to the Government of President! Ferdinand E. Marcos.

title: 4 Accidents on Illinois Road
description: SPRING VALLEY, Ill., Oct. 20 (UPI)Nine persons were injured, one critically, in four separate accidents involving 19 vehicles within minutes of each other today on Interstate 80. The state police said that traffic in both directions of the highway was halted for about 90 minutes while work orews cleaned up the wreckage, which included four semitrailer trucks.

title: Albany Yields in Welfare Case Involving Children's Savings
description: A Long Island woman who refused to deplete her children's savings and oddjob earnings to become eligible for welfare will not have to face any more legal battles for her welfare rights..

title: Silenced Opposition Editors in South Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG, Oct. 20  A few hours before the South African Government closed Percy Qoboza's newspaper and took him to jail, he and the editor of another major newspaper were consoling each other over the bind in which those arguing for peaceful racial change are Men caught. When you argue In the for negotiated reform the News radicals condemn you as an Uncle Toni, Mr. Qoboza said during a meal in a Johannesburg restaurant. But when you warn that violence is inevitable if the Government blocks the aspirations of the black man, the rightwingers call you s Marxist.

title: Golf
description: AT COLUMBUS, GA.

title: Alaska Pipeline Rate Rise Allowed
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 (UPI)The Supreme Court today granted.1 request from oil companies that own the transAlaska pipeline to temporarily charge rates higher than those set by the Government for use of the 800mile line.

title: Futures in Gold Rise by Over $2
description: December gold futures, which have fluctuated widely recently, jumped ahead more than $2 an ounce yesterday on the Commodity Exchange. The December contract closed at $1621/2 an ounce, up from $160 1/5 on Wednesday.

title: Tennis
description: Jimmy Connors, U.S., defeated Tony Roche, Australia, 6.2, 60; Nick Savlano, U.S., defeated Colin Dibley, Australia, 7.5,6.7,

title: PRESIDENT IS UPHELD AS THE HOUSE REJECTS FUNDS FOR BI BOMBER
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20Lastminute appeals by the House Speaker and a powerful committee chairman reversed an impending rebuff to President Carter today and persuaded a tumultuous House not to reinstate $1.4 billion for the B1 bomber.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Meets at 10:30 A.M. on extension of mandate of the United Nations Emergency Force in Middle East.

title: A Trenton Legislator Challenges Health Council Curb on Smoking
description: TRTNTON, Oct. 20A cigarchomping state legislator, Assemblyman Francis J. McManimon, today challenged the authority of the New Jersey Public Health Council to adopt regulations prohibiting smoking in public places.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: Because of an editing error, an article in The Times Wednesday about the cleanup of PCB's from the Hudson River, incorrectly identified the General Electric Company as responsible for removal of a hydroelectric dam near Fort Edward, N.Y. The dam was removed by the NiagaraMohawk Power Corporation..

title: Getting the Mpst Out of the Marathon
description: Participants in the New York City Marathon will gather on Sunday for a 10:30 A.M. start. The drawing shows approximate arrival times when viewers /may see the leading runners at key locations. See Page C10.

title: Notes on People
description: Arriving in Cleveland yesterday for a 22hour stay, Prince Charles of Britain shook hands in a mob at the airport after being greeted by Gov. James A. Rhodes and Mayor Ralph Perk. One woman told the heir to the British throne that her mother was English and asked, Will you kiss me? Why not? said the prince, and gave Nancy Stenerd a kiss on the cheek. Later in thecley, Charles put on a yellow hardhat and visited bluecollar workers in Republic Steel Corporation's massive mill just outside Cleveland, then was welcomed to the city by about 3,000 people gathered downtown.

title: Art: Jasper Johns Packs Them In
description: JASPER JOHNS at 47 is a lot of people's favorite American painter. More than 4,100 of those people pushed their way into the private view of his exhibition at the Whitney Museum last Monday evening; and ever since the show opened to the public a long, impatient and talkative line has been filing through the doors and keeping the cash register clacking.

title: Change at Wilson, Height
description: Having seen billings go from $3 million to $30 million during his 12 years at the tiller, Thomas R. Cox Jr., 59yearold chairman of Wilson, Height & Welch, is slipping the chief executive's title along with the president's to Carlton Hawthorne. Mr. Hawthorne, with the agency since 1961, has been vice president and general manager of the Hartford headquarters office since 1972. He is only 46.

title: APL Sets Takeover Bid for Pabst; Proposal Could Total $162 Million
description: An apparent $162 million bid for control of the Pabst Brewing Company of Milwaukee was disclosed yesterday.

title: Accord Is Reached In Music Hall Strike
description: Striking union musicians reached a tentative agreement last night with the Radio City Male Hall, easing the threat of a cancellation of this week. end's shows, which management said would have forced the hall to close permanently.

title: Hedberg, a WII.A. Star, Becoming a Free Agent
description: Anders Hedberg, who last season scored 50 goals in the first 50 games of the season for Winnepeg of the World Hockey Association, today becomes a free agent. His availability could signal a bidding war that should bring the Swedish Express into the National Hockey League next season along with Ulf Nilsson, his linemate and fellow Swede.

title: Broadway
description: THERE ARE any number of places where you can try out a show before you bring it to Broadway, but Glen Cove, L.I., straight out Northern Boulevard, has never been one of them. Now; however; Philip Rose, who is both the producer and director of the musical Look Homeward, Angel. has this idea: He will put Look Homeward,. Angel into the North Stage Playhouse on Dec. 30, keep it there some eight weeks, and then open it on Broadway in March. Among other things, Mr. Rose says he will, save a lot of money this way. If, God forbid, Look Homeward, Angel, should bomb in Gien Cove, Mr. Rose's investors will not lose any money because the North Stage Playhouse, not Mr. Rose, will he the producer there. Mr. Rose also says that if the show undergoes any rewrites, it will be far less expensive to do them in Glen Cove than Boston, say, or Philadelphia. Mr. Rose has it all figured out, and since he started Shenandoah at the Goodspeed Opera House and The Owl and The Pussycat in Paramus, N.J., who's to say he's wrong?

title: 500 Moslem Rebels Reported to Attack Philippine Forces
description: MANILA. Oct. 20A ceasefire with Moslem rebels in the southern Philippines deteriorated further today as hundreds of rebels, armed with morters and rockets, attacked troops on Mindanao i:land's Zamboanga Peninsula, according, to Government report.

title: HIJACKER FREES 30, THEN KILLS HIMSELF
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 20  An alleged bank robber who hijacked a Frontier Airlines jet from Nebraska to Atlanta in an effort to free a friend from prison shot himself to death aboard the aircraft, here tonight after releasing the last of his hostages unharmed.

title: GOLD
description: Selected world gold prices Thursday

title: After 70 Years, South Bronx Street Is at a Dead End:
description: Joseph McNevin, who is now 85 years old, knows Charlotte Street, the South Bronx block where President Carter took a walk, as it was in the 1920's, a street of fine brick apartment houses, some with elevators, with embossed tin and carvedgranite cornices, wroughtiron stair rails, polishedbrass mailboxes and marble lobbies.

title: Pro Football Statistics
description: (Based on a minimum of 60 atlempts)

title: Auctions
description: AFTER THREE DAYS of major modern art sales here, both Sotheby Parke Bernet as well as Christie, Manson & Woods will switch gears today to focus on earlier material including autographs and manuscripts as well as 19thcentury art.

title: WINIFRED DAVIS DOUGLAS
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Oct. 19Mrs. Winifred Davis Douglas, wife of Captain A. Hugh Douglas of the United States Navy and mother of A. Hugh Douglas Jr. of the State Department, died today. She was born Dec. 23, 1886 in Washington, D. C., the daughter of the late Samuel Todd and Sophie Sharp Davis. She had been a resident of Newport since 1933 when her late husband was on the staff of the Naval War College.

title: Inco's Net Plunged 63.3% in 3d Quarter
description: Inco Ltd., which produces about half of the nonCommunist world's supplies of nickel, reported yesterday that its thirdquarter earnings plunged 63.3 percent and that its quarterly dividend would be cut to 20 cents a share on the class A and taxdeferred B stocks from the 35 cents paid in the last three years.

title: JENIFER WHITE, BROUGHT NEWS OF MANILA CAMPS
description: MILL VALLEY, Calif., Oct. 20 (AP)Jenifer White, a newsman's wife who brought the first word to thousands of Americans during World War II of their relatives in Manila's Santo Tomas internment camp, died yesterday of cancer. She was 65.

title: Concert to Mark Beethoven Anniversary
description: The 150th anniversary of Ludwig von Beethoven's death will be marked with a chambermusic. concert at 8 P.M. on Sunday at Sarah Lawrence College. On. the program will be Beethoven's Duo for Clarinet and Bassoon, Serenade for Strings, and Sepfet in E flat (Op. 20),.

title: Cuomo Says Major Differences Separate Him From Koch in Race
description: Mario M. Cuomo appeared in the press room at City Hall yesterday to detail what he said were major policy differences separating him from the Democratic nominee for Mayor of New York City, Representative Edward I. Koch.

title: U.S. Agencies Told By E. P. A. to Begin AirWater Cleanup
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20The Environmental Protection Agency notified 11 Federal agencies today that they must take immediate action to end air and water pollution at their facilities around the country.

title: Bronx Unit Helps Sleepless to Sleep And Those Asleep to Wake Up
description: Elaine Cohen could not sleep at night and dragged through her days with depressing fatigue.

title: Union Leader to Be Honored
description: Lillian Roberts, associate director of District Council 37 of the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees, will be honored at an Israeli dinner on Wednesday at the Essex House. Miss Roberts wigl receive a special award from Israel for her dedicated service to the labor movement and her keen understanding of the importance of Israel bonds in developing the economic resources of our sister democracy in the Middle East.

title: 24 Die as U.S. Copter Crashes in Philippines
description: MANILA, Saturday, Oct. 22 (AP)A United States Marine Corps helicopter taking part in an amphibious exercise crashed on Mindoro Island yesterday, and rescue workers put the death toll early today at 24.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In an article Oct. 7 on Walter H. Page, wno will become chairman of J. P. Morgan & Company next January, The Times incorrectly reported that his father had founded the Doubleday Page publishing company. In fact, Mr. Page's grandfather, whose name he bears, was a founder of Doubleday Page.

title: Dividends
description: Pe record payriod Rate record able

title: Germans See Peril In Plunge of Dollar
description: PARIS, Oct. 21After another week of hectic speculation against the dollar on foreign exchange markets, two senior West German economic officials warned today that America's depreciating currency and its yawning trade gap threaten world monetary stability.

title: Britain Moves for Rhodesia Talks
description: LONDON, Oct. 21 (Reuters)Britain is inviting leaders of the parties in the Rhodesian independence dispute to a series of talks in Africa next month with Sir Michael Carver, the resident commissionerdesignate, the Foreign Office announced today.

title: Deaths
description: BIENSTOCKGeorge J. Died Friday, Oct. 21, 1977, beloved husband of Ruth Bienstock, devoted father of Patricia Thomas, loving grandfather of Laura Thomas, dear brother of Rose Van Aaron. Burial will be pdvhfe.

title: An Injury Gives Perkins a Giant Chance
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N. J, Oct. 21Emery Moorehead almost sounded excited about the prospect of not playing Sunday for the Giants in Washington.

title: Mundine Wins by Knockout
description: BRISBANE, Australia, Oct. 21 (UPI) The British Commonwealth lightheavyweight champion, Tony Mundine of Australia, knocked out Danny Brewer of the United States tonight in the seventh round of a, scheduled 10round bout. Brewer, ranked 11th by Ring Magazine, was felled by a right cross to the chin. Mundine weighed the limit of 175 pounds. Brewer was two pounds lighter at 173.

title: Berkowitz Is Ruled Fit for Trial; Declares He'll Have a Lot to Say
description: David R. Berkowitz is fit to stand trial for murder, a justice of State Supreme Court in Brooklyn ruled yesterday.

title: The Education Of jimmy Carter
description: Jimmy Carter, who got elected last year by boasting that he didn't know anything about Washington, has spent most of this year proving it. In eight months on the job, he has managed to irritate his black supporters, endanger his Southern base, offend some of the most powerful people in Congress, outrage many of his potential supporters in the Senate and alienate such formidable blocs as the proIsrael, oilgas and militaryindustrial lobbies.

title: National Press Club Sends Protest
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21 (UPI)  The National Press Club protested today the recent banning of certain newspapers and arrest of two editors by the South African Government. The board of governors of the club, the largest press club in the United States, sent a statement containingthe protest to Prime Minister John Vorster.

title: Today's Football at a Glance
description: COMMENT

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: INTO THE PAST There is a free performance this afternoon at 2:30 of Friedrich Schiller's classic drama of Elizabethan history, Mary Stuart, at the New York Public Library's Donnell Center, 20 West 53d Street. This is the latest staging by the High Star Playhouse, which recently presented Noel Coward's Blithe Spirit at various library branches and its home base in the Lincoln Center area. Barbara Boyle portrays the title role, while Barbara Sohmers appears as the English monarch.

title: Nurturing a Boom in Britain
description: Confidence in Britain's future is rising, not only in London but around the world. The pound is climbing in the international money markets, and the Bank of England is struggling to keep it from becoming overvalued and an impediment to exports. The London industrial stock index has more than tripled from its low of 146 in 1975 and reached an alltime high of 549 last month. Money is flooding into London even though interest rates have dropped to a third of last year's level. Britain's gold and hardcurrency reserves have almost quadrupled to $17 billion since December.

title: Meadowlands Jockeys
Lawyer Says Hijacker Chose Suicide Over Prison
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 21He just chose suicide over prison, J. Roger Thompson said today of the hijacker who forced a Frontier Airlines Jet to fly here yesterday from Nebraska and then shot himself to death.

title: ExGlobetrotter Admits Charge
description: MAYS LANDING, N.J., Oct. 21 (AP)The director of Atlantic City's Recreation Department has pleaded guilty to misconduct in office, stemming from an embezzlement scheme. The director, Gene L. Hudgins, said in Atlantic County Court here that he had forged the names of 11 employees of the After School Athletic Program on 26 city payroll checks, which he then cosigned and cashed. Mr. Hudgins, a former Harlem Globetrotter, was charged with embezzling about $2,400.

title: Lordi Scores Allegations of Contacts With Mobsters
description: TRENTON, Oct. 21Joseph P. Lordi said today that the fact he had rubbed elbows': with reputed crime figures when he was young did not disqualify him from his S60,000ayear job as chairman of the Casino Control Commission, which will license and oversee casino gambling in Atlantic'City.

title: U.S. RECALLS ENVOY FROM SOUTH AFRICA FOR CONSULTATIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance recalled the American Ambassador to South Africa today for consultation on what steps the United States should take in reaction to the crackdown on blacks and their supporters.

title: Thailand's Military Leaders to Rule Through Civilian Panel Until Vote
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Oct. 21Thatland's military rulers, who dismissed the yearold civilian government yesterday, said today that they would govern through a committee of civilians until elections could be held.

title: David Mamet Crafts Reunion With Skill to Stress Tenderness
description: NEW HAVENDavid Mamet's characters are not hopeful but they are trustful; very tentatively. Their world is full of a distorted wisdom; lessons learned but learned wrong because of the unreasonable ferocity of life.

title: F.C.C. Asked to Study Prohibition Of Unwanted Phone Advertising
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21The White House asked the Federal Communications Commission today to examine the possibility of prohibiting all advertising solutation by telephone to people who don't want to listen to it; including mes lages conveyed by automatic dialing machines.

title: BUELINO SENTENCED ON EXTORTION CHARGT
description: Russell A. Bufalino, described by the Government as a major figure who controls organized crime in upstate New York, northeastern Pennsylvania and parts of New York City, was sentenced to four years in prison yesterday on charges of threatening violence to collect $25,000 owed to a New York jeweler.

title: Police Inspector Accused of Lying
description: Police Inspector Robert H. Johnson, a key police official in the Bronx, was indicted yesterday on charges of having lied to a special grand jury looking into allegations of widespread bribery to overlook gambling and other illegal activities.

title: Bridge:
description: MANILA, Saturday, Oct. 22The United States team began strongly in its attempt to retain the world team title here yesterday, scoring maximum points in the first round of qualifying play.

title: South African Asserts Carter Encourages Militants
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Oct. 21Jusflee Minister James T. Kruger today defended the South African Government's crackdown on opposition elements as an attempt to halt the total disruption of blacks lives by groups using terror and intimidation to stir perpetual antiGovernment unrest.

title: Governor Is Taken Over Glowing Coals At the Byline Dinner
description: Governor Carey's political past came back to haunt him last night as people of politics and the press roasted him at the New York Hilton.

title: Dave Anderson
description: On the April day last year when Yankee Stadium reopened, he watched the ceremonies from behind the last row of the press box. He was so inconspicuous that some people did not even notice him, much less recognize him. But for those who looked twice, his sporty velour hat, his pipe and his tweed jacket gave him away. Just came up to see the new ball park, Bing Crosby explained. I also wanted to see the Yankees new second baseman, Willie Randolph. We had him on the Pirates, you know. When he left after

title: Panamanian Foes of New Treaties Charge Rigging of the Plebiscite
description: PANAMA, Oct. 21 (Reuters)The most vocal Panamanian opposition group to the new Panama Canal treaties charged today that the Government had framed the rules of Sunday's ratification plebiscite here to allow for electoral fraud.

title: QUEBEC THREATENS U.S.HELD COMPANY WITH A TAKEOVER
description: MONTREAL, Oct. 21The Quebec government threatened today to take over the Asbestos Corporation, which is controlled by the General Dynamics Corporation of St. Louis, if the American company continued to refuse to sell its interest.

title: BUFALINO SENTENCED ION EXTORTION CHARGE
description: Russell A. Bufalino, described by the Government as a major figure who controls organized crime in upstate New York, northeastern Pennsylvania and parts of New York City, was sentenced to four years in prison yesterday on charges of threatening violence to collect $25,000 owed to a New York jeweler. In addition to the prison term, Judge Morris E. Lasker of Federal District Court in Manhattan imposed a maximum fine of $20,000, saying he believed the defendant had been fencing diamonds as well as making extortionate threats.

title: UNITED STATES
description: MIDWEST

title: Notes on People
description: The Beatles were once the most famous and favorite sons of Liverpool, England, but the city fathers have turned on them. A majority of the City Council says that the _Beatles have turned their backs on Liverpool, are prodigal sons and do not deserve to have a statue erected in their honor, as was proposed. In my opinion, they are not worthy of a place in history, said Roy Stoddard, a councilman. Itwas in Liverpool that John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison and Ringo Starr first achieved notice as performers. But, said Mr. Stoddard, They made a lot of money and we have never seen them since they departed from the scene. John McVeigh, another councilman, said, They turned down requests, to appear in the city for official functions.

title: Albany Vote to Aid City Is Pressed
description: Bowing to the combined pressure of Governor Carey, Mayor Beame and the Carter Administration, Democratic legislative leaders agreed yesterday to seek passage of a bill to meet New York City's credit needs at a special session in Albany next Tuesday.

title: Miss Costanza Has 2d Thoughts On Party to Pay Campaign Debts
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21I'm sitting here with some second thoughts, Margaret Costanza, a White House assistant, conceded as she pondered the criticism she has encountered for holding a fundraising cocktail party to pay off her old campaign debts two months after she took a White House post.

title: Ecuadorean Toll Put at 23
description: QUITO, Ecuador, Oct. 21 (Reuters)The military Government says 23 striking workers were killed when the police raided a sugar mill Tuesday, not 120, as provincial labor leaders said. An Interior Ministry statement last night said the workers drowned in water vats when policemen attacked the mill with tear gas to force out hundreds of strikers.

title: News Summary
description: The American Ambassador to South Africa was recalled to Wasnington for consultations On moves the United State s'ioulci take in expressing opposition to the crackdown on bin:is and their supporters in South Africa. The recall of Ambassador William G. Bowdler was given unusual prominence by the Administration in what was interpreted as a rebuke to the South African Government. The Congressional Black Caucus issued a program of actions, inducing economic sanctions, that it said Washington should undertake. [Page 1, Column 4.]

title: LOWRISE BUILDINGS URGED IN SOUTH BRONX
description: A new housing strategy for the South Bronx that favours lowrise buildings instead of the tall apartment towers the city has been erecting there was announced yesterday by the Beame administration.

title: Bronx Police Inspector Is Indicted For Perjury in a Bribery Inquiry
description: Police Inspector Robert H. Johnson, key police official in the Bronx, was indicted yesterday on charges of having lied to a special grand jury looking into allegations of widespread bribery to overlook gambling and other illegal activities.

title: Mediterranean Nations Agree on Pollution Treaty
description: ROME, Oct. 21Mediterranean countries, prompted by fears of what pollution could do to tourism, public health and fisheries, reached agreement in principle today on a treaty that would control the discharge of industrial and other wastes into coastal waters.

title: Consumer Prices Up 04.3 Percent, Keeping Inflation Rise Moderate
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21As a result of declining farm prices, the nation's inflation rate again held at a moderate level last month with consumer prices rising 0.3 percent, the same as in August, the Government reported today.

title: New Jersey Openbid, Won by Jazz
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., Oct. 21Just about everything was new tonight with the New Jersey Nets in the home opener of their second season in the National Basketball Association: the arena, the name and most of the team.

title: Vote Board Orders Bateman to Pay $100,000 More for Republican Ads
description: TRENTON, Oct. 21State Senator Raymond H. Bateman's campaign for Governor of New Jersey will be drained of more than S100,000 in the closing weeks of the race as a result of a ruling today by the state's Election Law Enforcement Commission voiding a campaign spending plan.

title: Letter: On Auto Insurance Rates
description: To the Editor:

title: CONSUMER PRICES IN NEW YORK DIPPED 0.4% IN SEPTEMBER
description: Consumer prices rose moderately in the country but fell slightly in the New Yorknortheastern New Jersey area last month, the Government reported yesterday. It was the first September drop in metropolitan area consumer prices in 10 years.

title: Oilman Is Cleared In Houston Murder Of His SoninLaw
description: HOUSTON. Oct. 21A state civil court jury in Houston today cleared Davis Ashton Robinson a 79yearold Texas oilman, of charges that to avenge the death of his daughter, Joan Robinson Hill, he conspired in the murder of his soninlaw, Dr. John Hill, in 1972. Dr. Hill, a prominent Houston plastic surgeon, was shot to death in the foyer of his home.

title: Carter, on SixState Trip, Defends Policies, but Avoids the Jobs Bill
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Oct. 21President Carter began a sixstate journey across the country today by giving a a spirited defense of his energy policies here and by hearing poor and jobless Americans tell him of their hardships at a forum in Detroit.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: Islanders 3, Atlanta 3.

title: S.E.C. Says Traders Fixed Options Sales
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21The Securities and Exchange Commission today charged several California traders with prearranging sales of options to create the false impression of active trading of the option on the Pacific Stock Exchange.

title: Ballet: Vive jffrey 'Vivandiere
description: It has long been taken for granted that 19thcentury ballet only existed in fugitive fragmentssuch as the Danish Bournonville repertoryhandid down, foot by foot as it were by generation after generation of dancers. To a large extent, this is still true, but nowadays painstaking historical, and possibly historic, research is revealing chinks in the armor of the past that we never even suspected existed.

title: 25 MARXISTS IN PROTEST AT GERMAN MISSION HERE
description: About 25 members of the Prairie Fire Organizing Committee, described as an independent Communist organization, demonstrated yesterday in front of the West German Mission to the United Naticns. They were protesting the murder of three West German terrorist leaders in Bonn and the massacre that occurred when West German commandos stormed a hijacked Lufthansa airliner in Mogadishu, Somalia, this week.

title: Flames Get 3d Goal in Last 12 Seconds
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 20Pat Ribble's goal with 12 seconds left in the gameand Atlanta's goalie, Dan Bouchard, sitting on the benchgave the Flames a 33 tie with the New York Islanders tonight at the Omni.

title: Treasury Bill Yields Drop in 2 Maturities
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21Yields declined on Treasury bills auctioned today in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: Chinese Turmoil Produced Wide Education Gap
description: SHANGHAIEleven years ago every university and secondary and primary school in China closed down during the Cultural Revolution. Today in many major universities enrollment is still only twothirds of what it was in 1965 and China's education gap has emerged as one of the great problems confronting Chairman Hua Kuofeng.

title: College Results
description: MEN'S CROSSCOUNTRY

title: Personal Investing
description: With shortterm interest rates hovering at their highest levels in more than two years, money market mutual funds are dusting off the welcome mat for a homecoming with the thousands of individual investors who began to abandon them in 1975.

title: 2 More Witnesses Name L.1. Man As Nazi Who Beat Jews in Latvia
description: A Long Island man was said by two witnesses yesterday to have been the Latvian policeman they saw whipping Jewish children and selecting nonworkers for execution at the Dwinsk ghetto in 1941 and 1942.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: DAY OF MOURNING: Andre Thornton of the Cleveland Indians and his 4yearold son, Andre Jr., leaving church in West Chester, Pa., yesterday after funeral for Thornton's wife, Gertrude, and daughter, Theresa, who were killed in an auto accident earlier in the week. Thornton and his son were slightly injured in the accident.

title: BREZHNEV SEES GAIN ON U.S. ARMS ACCORD
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 21Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, said today that strategicarms talks with the United States recently took a turn for the better, and he expressed hope for a successful conclusion without delay.

title: Swiss GoBetween Discusses Role
description: GENEVA. Oct. 21Denis Payot, the Swiss lawyer who served as an intermediary between the West German Gover0ment and the kidnappers of Mr. Schleyer, said today he lost all hope for a humanitarian solution to the kidnapping only on learning of the deaths of the three imprisoned terrorists.

title: Business Records
description: WILLIAM F. WOLFE, 115 E. 237.51., Bronx, N.Y. Liabilities, $16,317; assets, $450.

title: Economic Paradox Seen in Carter Aims and Moves
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21  Most of Jimmy Carter's goals depend on vigorously growing economy but, paradoxically, his actions in the first nine months of his Presidency have contributed heavily to what Treasury.

title: Bonn Names Woman As Terrorist Leader In Schleyer's Killing
description: BONN, Oct. 21A 27yearold woman. who once studied psychology and sociology is suspected of having been the leader of the band of terrorists that kidnapped and murdered HannsMartin Schleyer, the West German industrial leader, police sources said today.

title: People in Sports
description: Whitey Herzog is staying in Kansas City. Herzog, who had been criticized for his pitching moves in the final game of the American League playoffs against the Yankees, signed a new oneyear contract to manage the Royals yesterday. Herzog had been subject of rumors that he might take over as manager of the California Angels. The 45yearold Herzog has guided the Royals to two straight Western Division titles and two straight fivegame losses in the playoffs to the Yankees.

title: Concorde Again Below Noise Limit On 2d Takeoff at Kennedy Airport
description: The supersonic Concorde airliner made a second proving flight from Kennedy International Airport yesterday, again having no trouble meeting legal noise limits.

title: For Australia's Aborigines, a Better Life
description: Australia's oppressed Aborigines are a deep mystery to most Americans, and the mystery prevails among many Australians who rarely see Aborigines in the larger cities. We have attempted to uncover the mystery by an exhaustive study that convinced us that the history of murder and genocide of this indigenous populations is over, that Australia, the most racist of racist countries has acquired religion.

title: CASINO PANEL'S CHIEF SCORES ALLEGATIONS
description: TRENTON, Oct. 21Joseph P. Lordi said today that the fact he had rubbed elbows with reputed crime figures when he was young did not disqualify him from his $60,000ayear job as chairman of the Casino Control Commission, which will license and oversee casino gambling in Atlantic City. Responding to a published newspaper account of his past associations, Mr. Lordi said at a news conference in the State Senate chamber that the allegations had arisen a number of times over the years, but that his honesty and integrity had never been challenged.

title: Other Games to Be Played Today
description: Bosice U.Rhode Island

title: Citibank Prime Is Lifted to 73/4% From 7% Rate
description: Citibank the nation's second largest bank, raised its prime, or basic, lending rate yesterday to 73/4 percent from 7 percent despite a White House warning that further interest rate increases could endanger the economy's recovery from recession.

title: About New York
description: Kirk Bond is a thin grayhaired man in wellaged tweed who is greatly burdened with curiosity as he lives alone in a single room in a frugal West Side hotel. He fills his days with such pleasantly perverse tasks as writing to society of Etruscan scholars in Italy to tell them that he feels they are all wrong about Etruscan and puzzling out new meanings for the grocerylistlike relics of another lost language, the Linear B dialect of ancient Crete.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The head of the transcendental meditation movement, Maharishi Mahesh Yogi, has dismissed as insignificant an order of the Federal District Court in Newark barring the teaching of transcendental meditation in New Jersey's public schools, but pledged that as a lawabiding body the organization would go by the law.

title: U. of Pennsylvania Is Suffering From an Identity Crisis
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 21  The University of Pennsylvania, inhabited mostly by climbers in the groves of American academe and retaining some of its leafcovered walls here in West Philadelphia, is suffering an identity.

title: U.S. to Start Raising $4.1 Billion New Cash Friday
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21The Treasury announced today that it would raise $4.1 billion of new cash in a conventional threepart quarterly financing to begin next Friday.

title: U.S. RECALLS ENVOY FROM SOUTH AFRICA FOR CONSULTATIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21Secretary of I I State Cyrus R. Vance recalled the American Ambassador to South Africa today for consultation on what steps the United States should take in reaction to the crackdown on blacks and their supporters.

title: U. of California Admissions Policy To Cut Rolls of Minority Students
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 21Regents of the University of California narrowly approved today a more stringent admissions policy that will effectively lower the number of minority students among entering freshmen, beginning in 1979.

title: Court Rejects Kent State Motion
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 20 (AP)The 6th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals refused today to reconsider its order for a retrial of a $46 million damage suit resulting from the 1970 shooting deaths of four students at Kent State University by National Guard troops. The appeals court, which ruled last month that the parents and relatives of the dead and wounded students were entitled to a new trial, rejected a motion that it hear the case itself.

title: Controversial Poster Removed by Postal Service
description: The poster, a generous 30 by 40 inches, depicted Al Jolson with arms outstretched, made up in blackface. His darkened face was upturned to the cantion. You ain't heard nothin yet.

title: Thursday's Fights
description: LOS ANGELES Alex Oregel, 126 pounds, Jalisco, Mexico, knocked out Mernin Vega, 127, San Francisco, 3 rounds; Mike Stuart, 174, Los Andoles, knocked out Raul Ochoa, 116, Michoacan, Mexico, 3.

title: Able St. Paul Chamber Orchestra
description: The St. Paul Chamber Orchestra, the United States only fulltime professional chamber orchestra, began threecontext engagement in Alice Tully Hall on Thursday night with solid, wellbalanced program. To start with, there was a lightly attractive Overture in D by Telemann, a seven part suite graced by extensive writing for horns and oboes. Beethoven's Piano Concerto No. 2 in B flat provided the soloist, Charles Rosen, with one of his rare New York appearances. There wasa New York premiere of William Schuman's The Young Dead Soldiers, and one of Mozart's last great symphonies, No. 40 in G minor, ended the evening.

title: Weekly News Quiz
description: 1. Ninety minutes before a threatened massacre deadline, a commando unit flown from West Germany rescued all 86 hostages held aboard a Lufthansa plane, but not before its pilot had been slain. Three of the hijackers were killed, and the fourth, a woman, was captured.

title: HILDA KATZ BLAUSTEIN
description: Hilda Katz Blaustein, widow of Jacob Blaustein, the founder of the American Oil Company and a president of the American Jewish Committee, died yesterday in her home in Baltimore after long illness. She was 85 years old.

title: Marathoners' LastDay Diet Rituals Differ
description: It was supposed to be an allyoucaneat spaghetti feast in the Scott Room of the Scarsdale Library last night, a chance for runners to load up on carbohydrates for tomorrow's NmAr York City Marathon.

title: Jersey Sets New Policy on Lasix
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Oct. 21The New Jersey Racing Commission today tightened its rules on the use of the drug Lasix and began consideration of 1978 date requests by the state's tracks. Lasix, a drug used to control bleeding by horses, is lega lin 24 states that foster racing. Seven, including New York, do not sanction it. The question that frequently arises is whether Lasix can be used to mask other drugs.

title: Television
Bonn Names W oman As Terrorist Leader In Schleyer's Killing
description: BONN, Oct. 21A 27yearold woman who once studied psychology and sociology is suspected of having been the leader of the band of terrorists that kidnapped and murdered HarmsMartin Schleyer, the West German industrial leader, police sources said today.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: CUNARD PRINCESS (Cunard). Left Bermuda Oct. 20, due A A.M. at W. 55th Street.

title: Kentucky and Prince Pay A Visit to Georgia Today
description: Prince Charles, heir to the British throne, will take in an American college football game today when he attends the GeorgiaKentucky match at Sanford Stadium in Athens, Ga. It was 20 years ago that his mother, Queen Elizabeth II, sat in on the 1957 MarylandNorth Carolina game at Byrd Stadium in College Park, Md. The Prince was only 9 years old then, so he stayed in England.

title: CHINA REVIVES TESTS TO ENTER COLLEGE
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 21Chinese universities are to require entrance examinations for the first time since the Cultural Revolution, and some highschool students are to be permitted to go directly to college without having to spend several years working in the countryside, Peking announced today.

title: Bateman Loses $100,000 in Funds for His Campaign
description: TRENTON, Oct. 21State Senator Raymond H. Bateman's campaign for Governor of New Jersey will be drained of more than $100,00 in the closing weeks of the race as a result of a ruling today by the state's Election Law Enforcement Commission voiding a campaign spending plan.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A Norwood mailorder jewelry concern has been charged with violating the state consumerfraud act by failing to deliver paid merchandise ordered by customers in 24 states and Canada,

title: BETTINA DAVIS DIES; MODEL IN THE 1940'S
description: Bettina B. Davis, who won international recognition as Bettina Bolegard, a fashion model in the 1940's and 1950's, died Oct. 9 of cancer at her family ranch near Elbert, Colo. She was 61 years bld and formerly lived in Tarrytown and Pocantico Hills, N.Y.

title: Horse Shows
description: PENNSYLVANIA NATIONAL

title: Bank Chairman Citing Lance Case Is Convicted of Misapplying Funds
description: WINSTONSALEM, N.C., Oct. 21 (AP)1 The former chairman of the Northwestern Bank, Edwin Duncan Jr., whose lawyers cited the case of Bert Lance, the resigned Federal Budget Director, in his defense, was convicted today on six counts of misaonlvine $257.000 in bank funds.

title: Earthquakes Shake Imperial Valley
description: BRAWLEY, Calif., Oct. 21 (AP)Several earthquakes rattled windows and shook beds during the past two days in Southern California's Imperial Valley. There were no reports of damage. Several minor quakes were recorded Wednesday and the first shock yesterday came at 1:18 A.M.

title: Pilots Put Off Worldwide Strike After the U.N. Promises to Act
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 21A threatened twoday international strike by airline pilots, scheduled to begin Tuesday, has been put off following assurance that the issues of plane hijacking and air safety would be taken up speedily by the 149member General Assembly.

title: 2 WITIESSES NAME WAR CRIMES SUSPECT
description: A Long island man was said by two witnesses yesterday to have been the Latvian policeman they saw whipping Jewish children and selecting nonworkers for execution at the Dwinsk ghetto in 1941 and 1942.

title: Free 9th Ave. Parking Goes Into Effect Today
description: Onehour free parking along Ninth Avenue between 46th and 53d Streets will go into effect today and will be continued each Saturday to assist West Side shoppers and merchants.

title: Cauthen Keeps Inching Up on Total of $5 Million in Purses for Season
description: Some days, even Steve Cauthen's mounts can't earn $43,789. That was the purse figure the 17yearold jockey needed yesterday at Aqueduct to become horse racing's first Five Million Dollar Man.

title: Hartford Symphony Returns
description: HARTFORD, Oct. 21Members of the Hartford Symphony Orchestra voted, 46 to 14, last night to accept major details of a oneyear contract calling for a 10 percent wage cut, thus ending an eightday strike.

title: 3 in Lynyrd Skynyrd Rock Group Among 6 Killed in Airplane Crash
description: GILLSBURG, Miss., Oct. 21 (UPI)Three members of the Lynyrd Skynyrd rock band were among six persons killed here last night when a chartered airplane reportedly ran out of gas and crashed in a thickly wooded area 200 yards from an open field where the pilot apparently had hoped to land.

title: Bronx Widow States That Husband Died Of a Police Beating
description: The widow of a Bronx driver of gypsy cab, who allegedly was beaten to death after his arrest for firing a shot at the police through his apartment door, swore on Friday that she witnessed the fatal beating administered by two patrolmen.

title: Chief U.S. Mediator Renews His Effort Tn Longshore Strike
description: The Government's mediation chief renewed his efforts yesterday to find a formula for settling the 21dayold strike of longshoremen that has halted containersbip operations on the Atlantic and Gulf coasts.

title: Sloop With 4 Aboard Reported Overdue on a Cruise to Bermuda

The House has defeated cargo preference legislation that would have required 9.5 percent of imported oil to be transported on Americanbuilt, Americancrewed tankers. The bill was a contrivance of the ship construction industry and maritime unions to fatten profits and salaries; it would have raised the price of oil by $300 million to $600 million a year.

title: Nuclear Banks and Dumps
description: If sticks don't work, try carrots. That seems to be the basis of President Carter's significant new move in his bold campaign to retard the spread of dangerous nuclear materials and technologies. To supplement the diplomatic pressures of recent months to keep reprocessing plants and atomic explosives from countries without nuclear bombs, Mr. Carter offers two inducements: Nations willing to curb nuclear proliferation would be able to draw upon a dependable international fuel bank to keep their energy reactors going and may store their spent reactor fuel in the United States.

title: News Summary
description: The American Ambassador to South Africa was recalled to Washington for consultations on moves the United States should take in expressing opposition to the crackdown on blacks and their supporters in South Africa. The recall of Ambassador William G. Bowdler was given unusual prominence by the Administration in what was interpreted as a rebuke to the South African Government. The Congressional Black Caucus issued a program of actions, including economic sanctions, that it said Washington should undertake. [Page 1, Column 4.]

title: Benson Returns Tomorrow

Benson, the No. 1 choice in this year's N.B.A. college draft, suffered a mild concussion and cuts near the eye. Films showed ne had elbowed AbdulJabbar before being punched. AbdulJabbar was fined $5,000 for the incident by the N.B.A. commissioner, Larry O'Brien.

We cannot talk to her. one, official said of the young woman, who has been hospitalized with minor wounds she suffered in the rescue operation.

title: Recital: Fortepiano for 4 Hands
description: In recent seasons the fortepiano has been brought out of the museums and given a new life on the recital platform, where its value in recreating certain music written around the turn of the 18th century has come to be understood and appreciated by a growing audience. Hearing the instrument, a smaller and less assertive version of the modern piano, throws interesting light on what composers such as Mozart, J. C. Bach and Haydn actually had in mindand in earwhen they wrote some of their most famous pieces.

At stake was President Carter's Water Resource Policy Study, which is expected to recommend sweeping changes in the nation's water resources policy.

title: CONSUMER PRICES IN NEW YORK DIPPED 0.4% IN SEPTEMBER
description: Consumer prices rose moderately in the country but fell slightly in the New Yorknortheastern New Jersey area last month, the Government reported yesterday. It was the first September drop in metropolitan area consumer prices in 10 years. President Carter expressed cautious optimism over the modest increase in the national inflation picture, and Mayor Beame hailed the lower figures for the metropolitan region. It's gratifying to hear of any indication that inflation is not rampant, Mr. Beame said. I hope the Administration will keep working hard to bring it down even further.

title: Barkum Adapts To Playing At Tight End
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. L, Oct. 21A free spirit, dancing and laughing: That was the image of the Jets' Jerome Barkum. He was a wide receiver, a position for the uninhibited. Is was a position where he could roam out in green pastures.

title: PRAGUE REPORTS DEATH OF HUSAK'S WIFE IN CRASH
description: PRAGUE. Oct. 21 (Reuters)  The wife of Gustav Husak, the Czechoslovak President and Communist Party leader, was killed in a helicopter crash in southern Slovakia last night, the official press agency Ceteka reported today.

title: Film: The End:North America Blown Up in Dead-End 'Damnation Alley'
description: Foreign powers blow up all of North America in "Damnation Alley," a movie to make anyone wish the foreign powers had made Hollywood the first town to go. After the holocaust, all that remains is George Peppard, Paul Winfield, Jan-Michael Vincent, Dominique Sanda and Jackie Earle Haley, plus a few dusty slot machines in Las Vegas and a landscape that looks as if it's been photographed through a used coffee filter.There are also hordes of giant cockroaches, and the first thing they do is eat Mr. Winfield, the only cast member who shows signs of being ready to give even a passable performance.The only real value of "Damnation Alley" is educational: This is the movie to see if you don't understand what was so wonderful about the special effects in, say, "Star Wars." Here, the sky features streaks of red and blue light that make it look like a giant Rya rug, and it actually moves in relation to the equally phony-looking landscape."Damnation Alley" is rated PG (Parental Guidance Suggested"), probably because it contains some very gory footage of actors being gnawed to death by giant insects.

title: Ban on Teaching T.M. in Schools Is Minimized by Group's Leader
description: WEST ORANGE, Oct. 21The world head of the transcendental meditation movement, Maharishi Mahesh Yogi, today dismissed as insignificant a Federal District Court order barring the teaching of transcendental meditation in New Jersey's public schools, but pledged that as a lawabiding body the organization would go by the law.

title: Boyer Hired by Braves
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 21 (AP) The Atlanta Braves today announced the hiring of Clete Boyer, a former Golden Glove infielder, as a minor league instructor for 1978. Boyer, 40 years old, played in five World Series with the New York Yankees, and was on Atlanta's Western Division champion team in 1969. Boyer has the third best career fielding percentage among major league third basement.

title: Head of German Raid Is Linked to Entebbe
description: BONN, Oct. 21 (UPI)  The West German magazine Stern said today that Lieut. Col. Ulrich Wegener, who led the commando raid on a hijacked Lufthansa airliner Monday, took part in last year's Israeli attack that freed hostages held in Uganda.

title: Oilman Is Cleared In Houston Murder Of His SoninLaw
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 21A state civil court jury in Houston today cleared Davis Ashton Robinson, a 79yearold Texas oilman, of charges that to avenge the death of his daughter, Joan Robinson Hill, he conspired in the murder of his soninlaw, Dr. John Hill, in 1972. Dr. Hill, a prominent Houston plastic surgeon, was shot to death in the foyer of his home.

title: Carter Optimistic on Arms Pact
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Oct. 21 President Carter, at a Democratic fundraising dinner here tonight, predicted an agreement with the Soviet Union on strategic arms limitation in a few weeks, but later said he did not know how many weeks. Mr. Carter said at a local farm where he spent the night, It's not yet firm. I think we have a good prospect, but it's not been firmed up.

title: Rick Nelson, At 37, Keeps Lively Pace
description: Despite his guileless gaze and his friendly lowkeyed phrasings, Rick Nelson is very much a man of mystery. He has resolutely pursued a popsinging career ever since the early days of his stardom, even though most of his later albums have sold only modestly. He has always, even during the less successful stages of his career, been able to attract topflight backup musicians. And today, ata hardtobelieve age of 37, he easily eclipses Dick Clark as the rock world's reigning incarnation of Dorian Gray.

title: IN AMERICA
description: WASHINGTON. He mounted the podium as a conductor before a concert audience for the first time in the city of Gorki, on the Volga. That was 16 years ago. Mstislav Rostropovich was already a cellist whose playing could he discussed in the same breath as that of Casals, He didn't think he was starting second career then, nor could he have had any inkling of where it might take him. Even now, when he rises by the Potomacin an exile of uncertain but possibly permanent durationRostropovich doesn't think in terms of two lives, two careers. The world he inhabits, the world of music, is undivided. Conducting isn't for him a new direction but a direction which he was moving all along. There is, therefore, straight line, a logical development in his mind from Gorki to the Watergate, where he's ensconced now with his cello, a Steinway and his scores.

title: ART
description: DIFFERENT critics use different criteria for determining what makes an artist important. The most limited of them base their judgments on only the work that an artist produces. Others take broader view, evaluating the creative production as well as making comparisons with the work of other artists, both past and present. They might also take into account the role an artist plays in the artistic communitythe influence that he or she as a personality and as an artist has on other artists.
