description: Representative Edward I. Koch, the Democratic candidate for Mayor, favors strong limits on apartment rent increases to help keep the middle class in the city and would not change the fact that there are dual systems of rent control and rent stabilization.

title: Union Clinic Makes Total Health Care. Possible for Longshoremen
description: Joseph Iacono had just made his fifth trip to the dentist.

title: Heaton and Boras Carry Delbarton to No.
description: Delbarton's Green Wave rolled over Hun School, 3413, yesterday and moved closer to clinching its second straight New Jersey prep schools title. It was the sixth victory of an undefeated season for the home team.

title: Patchogue Puts 166 Damper On East Islip
description: It was Homecoming Days for East Islip yesterday, but the PatchogueMedford Raiders did the celebrating, handing the Redmen their first loss of the season, 166. The victory was the fifth straight for the Raiders, East Islip has a 41 record.

title: GALLERY VIEW
description: At his best, Pierre Bonnard (18671947) was one of the great painters of all time.

title: TriState United Way Is Accused Of Shortchanging Black Groups
description: Charging that the black community is not receiving its fair share of the millions Of dollars in charitable funds raised in the New York inetropolitan area, coalition of black civic, business and political leaders has demanded that officials of the TriState United Way take steps to insure a more equitable distribution of funds.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: THERE are many minor furniture repairs that the patient doityourselfer can make, and they require no exceptional skills or unusual tools. Often these repairs can extend the life of furniture that would otherwise have to be discarded.

title: FollowUp on the News
description: When the National Aeronautics and Space Administration learned that the three astronauts on Apollo 15 had smuggled 400 firstday stamp covers to the moon and had sold 100 in Germany, it reprimanded the crew in July 1972. Later that month the space agency disclosed that the Apollo 14 crew had carried 200 silver medals on their 1971 flight to the moon and had kept 150 for private use. None of the medals was sold, NASA said, so this crev: w;;.s not reprimanded.

title: CHESS
description: When pinned down by mating attack on wing, one of the best strategies to follow to counterattack with breakthrough in the center.

title: Museum in Florence Is Robbed
description: FLORENCE, Oct. 22 (AP)Thieves robbed the Frederick Stibbert Museum here before dawn today and stole paintings, antique weapons, jewels and other items, museum officials said. The officials said the items were the most important part of a collection donated to the suburban Florence museum during the 1800's by Frederick Stibbert, a Briton. There was no immediate estimate of the value of items taken.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: THERE are many minor furniture repairs that the patient doityourselfer can make, and they require no exceptional skills or unusual tools. Often these repairs can extend the life of furniture that would otherwise have to be discarded.

title: Neighbors of Poet Feel Betrayed
description: WOLCOTT, Vt., Oct. 22 (AP)Like a spurned suitor, David Budbill, a poet and author, sits in the oneroom hillside cabin where he writes and puzzles over his neighbors angry reaction to a book of poems in which he intended to pay tribute to their inventiveness, creativity and backwoods genius.

title: CORRECTION
description: In the box accompanying Vermont Cider: A Lingering Flavor of the Past (Travel Section, Oct. 9), the mill that was No. 8 on the list was omitted, through a mechanical error. It should have read: Chittenden's Cider Mill, Owners: Royal and Robert Chittenden, South Burlington, Vt. 05401.

title: Animals and a Killer Society
description: IN GREAT NECK, a nice middleclass community, three boys aged 19 to 17 put a noose around the neck of a friendly, trusting collie dog and attempted to hang it from a limb of nearby tree. The branch broke, and so the boys tried the next expedient. They poured gasoline over the animal and put a match to it. On fire, the dog ran home to its owner about a halfmile away, with threefourths of its body scorched. The animal, in great pain, had to be destroyed.

title: HYMAN NAMED AS AIDE TO STATE HEALTH PANEL
description: Governor Carey has appointed Morton P. Hyman, a 41yearold shipping e,:cailive as vice chairman of the State Health Planning Commission. Mr. Hyman will :!Iso head a sevenmember task force ey ablished to reduce costs and to stream. line healthcare services and facilities, according to spokesmen in the Governor's office.

title: The Conference Committee Is a Venerable Institution
description: WASHINGTONThere was anger and amicability at the HouseSenate conference.

title: BarrackRoom Ballads
description: They had been brought to the last extremity of hope, and yet they put their hands on each other's shoulders and said with a passionate conviction that it would be all right. That's a sample of the humane understanding available in Frederic Manning's classic novel of the British First World War, published first in a limited collector's edition in 1929 (the year of Hemingway's A Farewell to Arms and Robert Graves's Goodbye to All That'), issued expurgated in 1930 as Her Privates We, and reissued now with all the dashes in the dialogue filled in. After our experience not just of contemporary literature but of President Nixon's foul mouth, few can be shocked by the language here: as sounded repeatedly by the soldiery, the twosyllable modifier beginning with f is rather musical than semantic.

title: Obedience Stars in Slump At Eastern Championship
description: SUFFERN, N. Y., Oct. 22Even Ch. oreland's Golden Tonka took a little extra rest in the ring today along with some of the other top obedience trial does in the nation.

title: At Home: Bathrooms and Bemusement
description: ITHINK I've reached a passage in my life. Overnight, I've become the sort of person who cannot be happy without a luxurious bathroom. A Jacuzzi whirlpool, a showerhead that massages, a sauna, a doublesized vanity sink with a threeway mirror, vast storage spaces crammed with proteinrich soaps, shampoos, water softeners, skin bracers, colognesI find myself yearning for these things, and I wonder what sort of dread symbolism my bathroom has assumed.

title: Are All those Hospitals Necessary?
description: There are a large number of hospitals in New York City, not counting Federally run institutions: 17 municipal hospitals, 65 voluntaries and 30 proprietaries. But more is not necessarily better and often may be worse.

title: Argentine Junta Is Divided on How to Run the Country
description: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 17 The unity of the Argentine armed forces, which established the military regime here 18 months ago, is being weakened by an interservice dispute over how the Government should be run.

title: St. Paul's Only Tastes Defeat
description: CONCORD, N.H.. Oct. 22It was a Parents Day the school officials at St. Paul's won't forget. The tables were set for feeding the parents the indoor gym cage but the caterer never showed up and the school cafeteria, not prepared for the sudden influx, was hard pressed to feed more than 1.000 hungry parents.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: CUNARD PRINCESS (Cunard). Left Bermuda Oct. 20; due B A.M. at W. 55th Street.

title: Learning the Difference Between Play and Sport
description: I like pain. This is an acquired taste and can be overdone, but pain is important to me. This rather bizarre taste makes me an avid player of all sports and a fanatic spectator. Pain raises sport from the level of entertainment to that of human achievement, and i consider it central to a humane education.

title: TV VIEW
description: Promising new forms and more substantial content, the commercial networks continue to deliver a preponderance of assemblyline mediocrity. There are always, of course, a few major productions such as Eleanor and Franklin and Roots to be put on chestthumping display at awards time, but the typical network product, strained through the anxieties of countless executives desperate to avoid open contact with a rating failure, is a thing of joyless arrogance. Production talent is usually there, and occasionally some of it is allowed to surface on screen as, for instance, recent performances by Alan Alda (Kill Me If You Can) and Piper Laurie (In the Matter of Karen Ann Quinlan). But when the primary goal is exploitation, talent and everything else tend to be devoured in the infernal machine.

title: William B. Flynn Jr. And Gail K. Giblin, Law Student, Wed
description: In Our Lady of Perpetual Help Roman Catholic Church in Bernardsville, N. J., yesterday afternoon, Gail Kemp Giblin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harold R. Giblin of Bernardsville, became the bride of William Bernard Flynn Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Flynn of Marshfield, Mass. The Rev. John R. Torney performed the ceremony.

title: The New York Times/Tyrone Dukes
description: A fivealarm fire raced through industrial buildings on the West Side yesterday, sending smoke and flames into the sky that were visible for miles and slowing the disembarkment of passengers on six cruise ships in the Hudson River.

title: New York's 2d FiveBorough Marathon: Several Stars and a Cast of Thousands
description: It stilt amazes Frank Shorter that he can run in the New York City Marathon with less mental strain than it takes to ride crosstown in a cab.

title: Margaret Burke and Robert Whitfield, Analysts, Wed
description: Margaret Elizabeth Burke, daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. James Burke of Mount Lebanon, Pa., was married yesterday to Robert Martyn Whitfield, son of Mr. and Mrs. Geoffrey Whitfield of London and New York. The Rev. Kenneth G. Jadoff performed the ceremony in St. Thomas More Roman Catholic Church in New York.

title: CASO AND 2 RIVALS STEP UP CAMPAIGNS
description: MINEOLA, L.I,, Oct. 22The threeway race for Nassau County Executive is drawing to a close with the final emphasis on candidate recognition and extensive and expensive radio and television campaigns.

title: Foster Children Placement Scored
description: The heavyset man listened edgily as a staff lawyer with the Community Action for Legal Services told a legislative hearing that New York City's Special Services for Children had deprived her client an unwed father, of his infant son.

title: Cider: The Apple of Their Eye
description: NOTHING suits pure, oldfashioned, unadulterated food like fresh cider and, when the leaves begin to show their annual gilding, you know it's cider time.

title: Not Made for the World of Moloch
description: AT the age of 26 Allen Ginsberg already could look back on a life of intellectual excitement. It had almost been catastrophic. At 14 he had wanted to be a leader of the political left and President of the United States. At 19, as he describes it, he was a practicing homosexual, an anarchist and a hipster, and he wanted to be a great poet. Then he became a mystic whose ambition was to become a saint. And at 23 he was a criminal, despairing sinner, a dope fiend. His aim was to get to reality.

title: Life at Industrial Supply Inc.
description: Corporate America has always been tempting terrain for explorers. Twenty  odd years ago, William H. Whyte Jr. discovered The Organization Man, with his allforthecompany ethic. More recently, Michael Maccoby returned to report in The Gamesman that business has become a game, which can be harmful to mental health. Now it is Rosabeth Kanter's turn to tell us how companies define and allocate authority.

title: POLITICS
description: AS THE race for Governor heads into its final stages, the campaign staffs of Governor Byrne and State Senator Raymond H. Bateman, his Republican opponent, found something they could agree on, although not publicly.

title: An Agent 007 for the Businessman Abroad
description: LONDON  Within a discreetly anonymous building three blocks south of Buckingham Palace, John Fairersmith, head of Argen Information Systems, is talking shop.

title: Where Life Retreats
description: THE first desert I ever saw was an area of the northwest Sahara that Uwe George describes in this book: an immense plain of pitchblack stones glimmering with a metallic sheen as if it had been lacquered; a few miles to the east a cluster of enormous yellow sand dunes, like an island of light in a black sea; over everything, seamless, stoneblue sky. It was a stunninphy slientdesolate place, so mineraldeadi that it seemed to live with another sort of life, such as only deserts can provide, on those rare days when the wind stops, and the air is so pure that all other air seems visible by comparison. I learn now from Uwe George that those black nuggets were not as dead as they looked. Some of them had legs, and were locusts whose coloring was mimetic. Not only that, the stones themselves were crawling with life. Their glinting black surface apparently resulting from a symbiotic exchange between species of microalgae and microfungi. They adapted so fully to desert conditions that they form an infinitesimal forest on the surface of each stone. By excreting an acid that draws out the mineral content of the stones, the forest creates an external layer of shiny black manganese oxide. The plain not only looked painted, it was painted, by microscopic mushrooms.

title: Future Events
description: Tickets it the following events may be obtained from the benejtclaries, unless otherwise indicated:

title: A New Breed At Wesleyan
description: EVERY year a new class of freshmen takes its place on the Wesleyan campus, but, there is another group of firstyear students whose arrival is not marked by the activities of freshman orientation.

title: A Junior Lincoln Center Opens In Elmira, Named After Clemens
description: ALBANY, Oct. 22A $1 million cultural center has just opened in Elmira, named after its most illustrious soninlaw, Mark Twain, under the formal title of the Samuel L. Clemens Performing Arts and Community Center.

title: Joy Elise Munkacsi Plans April Wedding
description: Mr. and Mrs. James E. Munkacsi of East Brunswick, N. J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Joy Elise Munkacsi, to Norman Dennis St. Landau, son of Mr. and Mrs. Norman St. Landau of Bound Brook, N.J. The wedding is planned for April.

title: Long Branch On Short End
description: Keith Stevens sneaked 1 yard for a touchdown and fired a 10yard scoring pass to Dave Ginda as Ocean Township (311) dropped Lung Branch from the unbeaten ranks with a 140 victory.

title: Hearing Is Set on Release Of Mine Disaster Report That U.S. Judge Withheld
description: CATLETTSBURG, Ky., Oct. 22Nearly eight weeks after he ordered its publicaton withheld at the request of the mine owners, a Federal district judge here is to hear arguments on Tuesday on a Government motion to free an official report on a coal mine disaster that is believed to be highly critical of the Scotia Coal Company.

title: Eastern Europe Is Battling to Curtail Alcoholism
description: VIENNA  When Edward Gierek, the Polish Communist leader warned in an unusually blunt speech in Warsaw that too many Poles were drinking too much vodka, he was denouncing a social ill common not only in his own country but also in others of the Soviet bloc.

title: 317 Million Gallons of Gasoline Consumed in U.S. Last Summer
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 (UPI)Licensed American drivers last summer consumed an average of 2.3 gallons of gasoline a day, according to government figures.

title: Bradford Bachrach
description: Mr. and. Mrs. David E. Morgan of New York and Providence, R. I.. have announced the engagement of his daughter, Leslie Ann Morgan, to Steven Jay Solmonson, son of Mrs. Louis 1. Solmonson of Cranston, R. I., and the late Mr. Solmonson.

title: Handicapped Youth Playing Ball Again
description: The team may have lost a battle, but Larry Carbone won the war.

title: GARDENING
description: OPEN any periodical devoted to the home and you will see photo after photo of plants on display in every room from bathroom to kitchen. Not only are these pictures found in houseplant articles, but also they are evident in ads for everything from kitchen utensils to furniture.

title: C. W. Post Gains 4th Straight Shutout
description: GREENVALE, L.I., Oct. 22C, W. Post scored its fourth consecutive shutout victory today, defeating Ithaca College, 18.0. The Pioneers defense now has gone through 252 minutes without allowing a point.

title: New Jersey/This Week
description: BLOOMFIELD COLLEGE, Franklin and Fremont Streets"A Streetcar Named Desire, in an Actor's CafTheater production. Thursday through Saturday, 8:30 P.M. Opens Friday (through Nov. 26). $2.90$4.90; students and the elderly, $1.90$3.90; group rates. (201) 4297662. Westminster Theater.

title: NONFICTION IN BRIEF
description: Long ago I found myself in a brief television altercation with the Rev. Billy Graham, in which I questioned him with vigor, if not wisdom. Much to my surprise, I found myself cited by the good reverend in one of his crusades as a troubled youth seeking wisdom from Mr. Graham.

title: An Ancient Business Ritual: Profits Fall, Heads Roll
description: Coratrisseurs of corporate anthropology appreciated the ceremonial Mastof an ancient business ritual Mlast week. What television executives call the inevitable human sacrifice was performed at three troubled coolpanies. The rationale for the rite is simple: when profits or ratings tumble, so must heads.

title: World News Briefs
description: BALLA BALLA, Rhodesia, Oct. 22 (AP) Rhodesia has added a third battalion to Its black counterinsurgency force in an effort to block an anticipated increase in infiltration by nationalist guerrillas during the comina rainy season.

title: Heating a Hen House in Wayne
description: WALTER KLAMMER says that his chickens love solar heating. Absolutely, the poultry farmer insisted recently, pointing out that 22 years are long enough to establish that as a certainty.

title: Basketball Tour of U.S. Set for 4 Foreign Teams
description: FINDLAY, Ohio, Oct. 22 (UPI)The Findlay College basketball team will be host to a national men's team from China on Nov. 10 as part of a National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics international exchange program.

title: Around the Nation
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 22The Martin Luther King Jr. Movement Coalition, after two years of violence and court suits, finally marched today to Marquette Park, which has become the symbol of a struggle between neighboring black communities and the white ethnic enclave in which it is situated on Chicago's racially tense Southwest Side.

title: Sic Semper Tyrannis
description: We are drawn even now to that Dutch ship that lay off Jamestown in August 1619. We might well wonder about the thoughts and visions of those first twenty Africans who stood there, poised on the edge of history. They foreshadow us all, white and black, into our own time.

title: Like Baseball, Petanque Has Its Enthusiasts
description: Cigarette in mouth, Lucien Banian carefully judged his distance from the target he was aiming to hit, a small rubber ball called a cochonet. He squatted raid toped his boulea metal ball weighing spout one pound, 10 ounceshigh in the air. The boule landed on a small rock and spun off in the wrong direction causing his teammates to groan.

title: Leaders in a Feud
description: THE action took place in a courtroom, not the O.K. Corral, but the showdown was just as dramatic. Armed with a legal brief and a lawyer, Sheriff Thomas J. Delaney of Westchester squarely confronted Carl Fulgenzi, chief of the county parkway police, and County Executive Alfred B. DelBello with the business end of a lawsuit.

title: Unexpected Pass by the Vikings an Uncommon Show of Flair by Coach. Grant
description: Chances are good that during tomorrow night's telecast of the VikingRams game from Los Angeles a camera will focus on Bud Grant, the Minnesota coach, a voice will describe him as conservative. insensitive. unimarinative. oran old favoriteMount Rushmore. Grant is none or these things, but rather the victim of an inaccurate image.

title: Ship Lines Make New Proposal On Job Security to Longshoremen
description: Ocean carriers made a new proposal on the critical job security issue yesterday and striking Atlantic and Gulf Coast longshoremen said it was a step in the right direction.

title: Taxidermy  All In the Family
description: MILLTOWN SI ITING in the shadow of a sevenfoot mounted Alaskan brown bear, Bruce Schwendeman worked in the back room of Schwendeman's Taxidermy Shop here, sewing up holes in a deerskin cape. He was doing just as his grandfather, Arthur, and his father, David, now chief taxidermist for the American Museum of Natural History in New York, had done before him.

description: 1NATIONAL RADIO ASTRON. NOMY OBSERVATORY

title: Union Warns Koch It Will Seek a Real Pay Increase
description: A Municipal labor union representing 15,000 Civil Service workers served notice on Edward I. Koch yesterday that the next Mayor would be asked for a real pay increasenot just a costofliving adjustmentstarting on the day he takes office.

title: Carol Lyn Proctor Bride Of Lieut. Bruce McCurdy
description: Carol Lyn Proctor, a graduate student at the University of Miami and a merchandise manager for Pop Tops, a division of the Orange Bowl Corporation in Miami, was married yesterday morning to Lieut. Bruce C. McCurdy, U.S.C.G.. who is stationed in Miami. The Rev. Phillip M. Gamache, the rector of the Episcopal Church of the Atonement in the Bronx, performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Gordon Proctor of Mamaroneck, N. Y.

description: St. Ignatius Loyola Roman Catholic Church was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Maureen Anne Carey, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James Carey of Brooklyn, to David Brian Kimball, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Gordon uttrihRII of Rollins? Hills Estates, Calif.

title: Betsy Andersen Becomes Bride
description: Usabeth Aabye Andersen, daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. John D. Andersen of Evanston, Ill., was married yesterday in Darien, Conn., to James Pierce LaFontaine, son of Mr. and Mrs. George LaFontaine of Westwood, Mass. The Rev. William Donovan performed the ceremony in St. Thomas More Roman Catholic Church.

title: Food
description: It may be one of the most boring food clichs in the books, the thought that the nearer the bone, the sweeter the meat, but it is the absolute reason why dishes made with shanks of meat are rich in flavor. The shanks may come from lamb or veal, pork or beef, but after long, almost foolproof cooking, they are something to be prized at table. Two dishes made with braised shanks are offered here.

title: Islanders Overwhelm Rangers, 72
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Oct. 22Bob Nystrom had two goals tonight, and Michel Bergeron scored twice in his first game as an Islander, a 72 victory over the New York Rangers. But Bryan Trottier upstaged them both with an unassisted, shorthanded goal; three assists, and seemingly infinite ice time.

title: A Way With Madness
description: NOT Stories, but Tales, the subtitle says; as in Poe's Tales, or Hawthorne's mossy old TwiceTold Tales, or as in lurid massmarket paperbacks with titles like Tales of the Supernatural. Because NightSide, Joyce Carol Oates's new addition to her dozen or so books of fiction, presents a gallery of people haunted, spooked, driven mad or victimized in general by invasions from outside the sane, rational borders of consciousness.

title: HIGH U.S. AIDES SEE IMPROVED PROSPECTS FOR EARLY ARMS PACT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 High Administration officials said today that although difficult problems remain to be settled in the intensified negotiations for anew agreement on limitation of strategic arms, optimistic remarks by President Carter and Leonid I. Brezhnev yesterday had underscored the likelihood of an early accord, within the next few months.

title: The Nation
description: The House ethics committee dropped the other shoe last week, but the thud may not be heard until next year.

title: Births.
description: Dr. Mrs. Arthur Egol (nee Marie Proopls) Joyfully announce the birth of Aulysa Weody October 17.

title: Headliners
description: Reggie Jackson, a right fielder of some dispute who is given to theoric that is often more effective than his hitting, put on a oneman performance last week unique in the history of the World Series. In hitting, not theoric He struck five home runs in leading the New York Yankees to victory, four games to two, over the Los Angeles Dodgers. Three of the homers came in succession in the last game. No one had ever hit five in a World Series before; the last time three were hit in a game was in 1928. Fellow name of Babe Ruth. Jackson's performance did more than bring victory. It suddenly, if only temporarily, brought together in embrace and harmony a team that had feuded with increasing fury all season long and often because Jackson, who is being paid $3 million for five years labor. Questions were raised, sometimes indelicately, about his abilityor even his desireto field his position. But last week, in the glow of victory, all was forgiven and forgotten. At least for the moment.

title: Flair in a Home May Become a Deterrent to Buyers
description: In a wooded area of Wilton, Conn., I here standson a pedestala eircambulant house.

title: A Miniature U.N. Thrives in Essex
description: MONTCLAIR THE United Nations Association of New Jersey is a private, nonprofit worldaffairs organization with 10 chapters and 1,000 members, including one prospective young member who is akin to the United Nations by birth.

title: Kentucky Beats Georgia As Passer Excels, 330
description: ATHENS, Ga., Oct. 22 (AP)Derrick Ramsey threw three touchdown passes and Joe Bryant kicked two 51yard field goals as Kentucky defeated Georgia, 330, in a Southeastern Conference football game today.

title: Iran to Release 279 Prisoners
description: TEHERAN, Oct. 22(UPI)Shah Mohammed Riza Pahievi has ordered the release of 279 prisoners from Iranian jails to mark his birthday Oct. 26, the Government announced today. The prisoners include 131 held for political offenses.

title: In The Act, The Drama Backstage Is Not An Act
description: LOS ANGELES Next Saturday night Liza Minnelli's new musical The Act opens at the Majestic, thus bringing to close one of the most rumored and casualtyprone road tryouts Broadway has seen in several yearsa tryout, ironically, that can boast not one but two backstage melodramas, the first one played onstage, the second one, off.

title: BankerWithdraws Reward for Return Of the Peking Man
description: Christopher Janus said yesterday that he would withdraw his offer of a $150,000 reward for information leading to the missing Peking Man fossils after his fouryear search produced marriage offers, death threats and chicken bones but few leads.

title: College Chaplains
description: WORRIED about the theological and human questions raised by recombinant DNA research, a revolu tionary new field of science in which genetic materials might be spliced or shifted to create new forms of life, Protestant chaplains on If we decide to do that, the decisionmaking process then becomes very important. Who decides what new creatures ought to be engineered?

title: Andretti in Pole Position For Japan's Grand Prix
description: GOTEMBA, Japan, Oct. 22 (AP)Mario Andretti of the United States will start from the pole position in tomorrow's Japan Grand Prix the final race of the 1977 Formula One motor racing series. Andretti, last year's winner of this race, drove his Lotus around the Fuji International Speedway in 1 minute 12.23 seconds in today's final qualifying session.

title: 42 Nations Press for U.N. Debate on Airline Security
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y.. Oct. 22 Forty two countries, mainly Western, citing the recent increase In airplane hijackings, jointly asked today for a General Assembly debate on Safety of International Civil Aviation.

title: Ghost of Halloween Past
description: ALTHOUGH my feet grow weary as I run back and forth to answer the door and dole out sweets, I always enjoy Halloween, perhaps because it reminds me of the chalk stockings and burned matchstick makeup of my own past.

title: Late TV Listings
description: 10 A.M. (Channel 2) Lamp Unto My Feet: The human ministry of Will D.. Campbell.

title: Engagements
description: Mr. and Mrs. Louis Paul Savel announce the engagement of their daughter Carin April to Dr. Jeffrey Warren Moses, son of Mr. and Mrs. Julian B. Moses.

title: THEATER
description: THEATERS don't just grow like Topsy, and they don't flourish merely by putting on plays that attract an audience. There's much, much more to it than that.

title: FILM VIEW
description: This time it was my turn to call himthe reporter with the tape recorder. Why don't you drop by? I said, as news sources had once said to me when I was a reporter. I might have a story for you. He didn't leap at the bait. I'm tired, he said, and I got this radio talk show to do before I meet with my agent about a possible pilot film. It's based on a series I wrote about the Mafia's infiltration of the fastfood business. Very hot right now. Suddenly remembering that this fellow, above all others, was so trendoriented that he wouldn't write about an assassination unless it were one of at least three, I stretched a point. What would you say, I said, to some heavy statements, all flat, relating to Hollywood and where it's been? Well he said. And where it's going, I added quickly. Gee, he said, I'm on my way.

title: Koch Asks Key Beam Advisers To Help Him Run New York City
description: Edward I. Koch has assembled a group of familiar City Hall people, including the current First Deputy Mayor and a former one, to help him fashion the government that he will head if as expected, he becomes Mayor on Jan. 1.

title: Sunday Observer
description: For the first time ever, there are more women than men enrolled in American colleges. The immediate implications of this are bound to upset people who need stereotypes to preserve the illusion of stability in a chaotic universe. Joe college, for example, now becomes a false metaphor for the college student. Discussing college people collectively, we must learn to call them the college woman. Woman's place is in the home went the old saw women hated. Now they can say, Woman's place is in the college.

title: Votes in Congress
description: 1. Vote on age discrimination in employment bill, to increase from 6.5 to 70 years the age limit for retirement, passed, 88 to 7, Oct. 19.

title: Weddings
description: Charles R. Leonard Jr & Mrs. and Mrs. Ray Hill announce the marriage of their sister, Laura Hazard Leonard, to Lee Addison P.ult, on Wed., Oct. 19. She is the daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Charles R. Leonard of New York City and the granddaughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Webster Leonard of Massachusetts and Mr. and Mrs. William Ayrault Hazard of New York. She is an alumna of Foxcroft School and Barnard College. Mr. Ault is the son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Lea Brownell Ault and the grandson of Mr. and Mrs. Addison Ault, both of Cincinnati Ohio. Mr. Ault Is an Alumnus of St. Paul School and of Princeton University. He is Director of Lee Ault & Company, ert art gallery In New York.

title: When the Punks Meet the Progressives
description: The brutal simplicities of punk rock (or new wave rock, as their record companies prissily prefer) are all around us these days. But that hardly means that the more complex, artsy forms of progressive rock have faded from the scene. Quite the contrary: European artrock is still beloved of FM progammers with aspirations to significance, and it is still produced and purchased a good deal more readily than the punks. And the vogue for scifi music will only be made more fevered by the success of Star Wars.

title: LETTERS TO THE WESTCHESTER EDITOR
description: 1 read with interest and enthusiasm your article on Oct. 2 on the development of youth soccer in Westchester. however, my fellow directors and I were distressed at the lack of mention of the Youth Soccer Association of New Rochelle.

title: At Home: On Plumbing the Depths
description: ITHINK I've reached a passage in my life. Overnight, I've become the sort of person who cannot be happy without a luxurious bathroom. A Jacuzzi whirlpool, a showerhead that massages, a sauna, a doublesized vanity sink with a threeway mirror, vast storage spaces crammed with proteinrich soaps, shampoos, water softeners, skin bracers, colognesI find myself yearning for these things, and I wonder what sort of dread symbolism my bathroom has assumed.

title: A Lofty Haven for Artists
description: WHEN a handful of Fairfield County artists tried to rent a loft in which to work, they found space in South Nor walk, but the lease was 22 pages long and said in part, there shall be no loud noises, noxious fumes or dust.

title: DINING OUT
description: IF YOU have ever wondered whatever became of the friendly, solicitous restaurant owner who specialized in homemade foods, worried over each dish and hovered around your table to make sure you were pleased, he is alive and well in Dover.

title: Penelope Stout Becomes Bride Of Bank Aide
description: Penelope Howard Stout, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Deming Stout of Chagrin Falls, Ohio, was married yesterday in New Britain, Conn., to Bengt Hammar Jr., son of Lieut Col. Hammar of the Swedish Coastal Artillery, kzd Mrs. Hammar of Danderyd, Sweden.

title: Urban Renewal Begins in Roslyn After 10Year Wait
description: ROSLYN, L.I.After a frustrating 10year wait, a $30 million urbanrenewal project was started last week. It will provide 208 units of moderateincome housing as well as commercial, industrial and other developments on a 52acre site here.

title: Dog Show Calendar
description: TodayNewton K.C. fall breed and obedience match, St. Paul's Abbey, Route 206, Newton, N.J.; entries from 10 A.M.; judging at noon; information (201) 6976148.

title: Is your lifescript keeping you overweight? HERE'S HOW TO CHANGE THE SCRIPT.. FOR GOOD!
description: YOU can do it. Even it you're disnudged lyen it the idea of dietrepels sou. Now the new CALIIORNIA WLIGI IT LOSS PROGRAM brings you an unusual, totally sane weightloss method that encourages sou to treat yourself well, forgive yourself for failureswhile you change your eating habits permanentlyin, nine, rewarding days!

title: LETTERS
description: The Sound That Shook Hollywood (by Guy Flatley, Sept. 25) was charmingly nostalgic. But in addition to the actors, directors, studio chiefs and cameramen thrown into an abyss when the talkies took over there were pit musicians, the men who made up the orchestras that accompanied the feature films. My dad was a pit man. I can remember helping him lay out the cue sheets, which outlined the lead lines in the movie so that the orchestra could play the appropriate music for the appropriate scene. Then came the famous Al Jolson line that broke the sound barrier of the silent movies. Gone were the cue sheets; even I was a victim. Dad had been training me to be a relief pianist.

title: Charlotte Willard, ExArt Critic And Author of Books, Was 71
description: Charlotte Willard, art critic for The New York Post from 1964 to 1968 and former art editor for Look magazine, died Thursday of cancer at her home in Manhattan. She was 71 years old.

title: U.S. Companies Helping Poland Build Large Children's Hospital
description: Poland is building one of the most advanced children's hospitals in the world and seeking help from Western businessmen to do it. More than $11 million of the $85 million required for the Warsaw facility has been obtained that way.

title: Leafs Deal Flyers First Loss, 61; Sittler Leads Attack With 3 Goals
description: TORONTO, Oct. 22 (UPI)Darryl Sittler scored three goals and Jan Turnbull, a defenseman, scored once and had two assists for Toronto as the Maple Leafs drubbed the Philadelphia Flyers, 61, tonight. It was the Flyers first loss this season after four victories.

title: Not by Work Alone
description: CONGRESS is considering a bill that would drop the certainty of retirement at 65 and raise the mandatory retirement age to 70. The big question is how many workers will opt to stay on past 65. And the Island will certainly have its share of decisions.

title: Gerard Guides an Upset of Mountain Lakes
description: Bob Gerard, a senior quarterback, sneaked 1 yard for a touchdown and flipped a 15yard scoring pass to Mike Melillo as Glen Ridge (5.0) snapped Mountain Lakes 15game winning streak. 126.

title: The Sun Also Rises in New York
description: The contest is over, and the winning entry in Hitachi America Ltd.'s employee songwriting competition has been chosen. It will be performed for the first time at the Manhattan sales company's Christmas party. One of the verses and the chorus:

title: Sailing Vacation For One
description: Last spring, I decided to yield to temptation and, for the first time, go south for summer vacation: Chesapeake Bay, a spectacular body of water edged with nooks and crannies to be explored. I didn't plan it that way, but there were adventures ahead.

title: Six New Legion Disease Cases Reported in Eastern Tennessee.
description: KINGSPORT, Tenn., Oct. 22 (UPI) Six new cases of the legionnaires disease have been confirmed in eastern Tennesce for a total of 23 Since Aug. 1.

title: Sidesaddle Riding:
description: SIDESADDLE IDESADDLE RIDING is a gloriously romantic concept. I think of Natasha, in the Russian film verion of War and Peace, riding across the meadows, and my heart leaps. I simply had to learn to ride aside, said Barbara Tober, who spends five days a week as a magazine editor in Manhattan and her weekends in South Salem, riding whenever possible, in the company of her husband, Donald. He, naturally, rides astride and she rides sidesaddle.

title: New Shanghai Literary Magazine Replaces One Banned Last Year
description: PEKING, Oct. 22 (Agence FrancePresse)  A new Chinese literary magazine was recently established in Shanghai, replacing Studies and Criticism, a publication banned after the arrests in Oct. 1976 of the socalled gang of four led by Mao Tsetung's widow, Chiang Ching.

title: POLITICS
description: HOW do you expect to break into this lineup on a longterm basis? Judge Joel M. Aurnbu, DemocraticLiberal candidate for the Westchester County Court, was asked. He holds an interim appointment by Governor Carey to that bench but is seeking a full 10year term in the Nov. election.

title: At Home: The Bath As a Cathedral
description: Ithink I've reached a passage in my life. Overnight, I've become the sort of person who cannot be happy without a luxurious bathroom. A Jacuzzi whirlpool, a shower head that massages, a sauna, a doublesized vanity sink with a threeway mirror, vast storage spaces crammed with proteinrich soaps, shampoos, water softeners, skin bracers, colognesI find myself yearning for these things, and I wonder what sort of dread symbolism my bathroom has assumed.

title: With Malice Toward Some
description: THIS is the story of two or three important relationships in T. S. Matthews's life; beginning in 1918 at Princeton, and ending now in England, nearly 60 years later. It is told with a good deal of narrative skill, the first page describing a phone call in 1958, the next jumping back to 1918, and the whole only slowly revealing the full significance gestures and tones described in the beginning. It is very readable book, until the last few pages. They are not readable, but they are the most interesting. The three main characters in the story are Matthews himself, Schuyler Jackson, a poet who was his best friend for 20 years after 1918, and Robert Graves. who in some ways took Jackson's place in his life after 1939. Important also are Matthews's and Jackson's wives, Julie Matthews and Kit Jackson, and the poet Laura Riding, who was living with Graves when they met. But the relations between the men are paramount. Their relations with the women seem more selfcontained, more limited, both intellectually and in longterm resonance.

title: Ellen Minkow Wed To Richard Liberali
description: Ellen Jane Minkow and Richard Charles Liberali were married yesterday in St. Peter of Alcantra Roman Catholic Church in Port Washington, L. I., by the Rev. Thomas Maloney. He was assisted by the Rev. GeorEe Paulin.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: Visiting conductors these days would no sooner come to New York without a concert performance of an opera than be caught with white socks under their black dress trousers. And so when the Boston Symphony makes its first Carnegie Hall appearance on Wednesday, Seiji Ozawa will brng his baton down on a Berlioz operaBeatrice et Benedict.

title: Allen ginsferg new  Drawings by Pierre LeTan
description: Allen ginsferg new  Drawings by Pierre LeTan

title: DINING OUT
description: THERE are some restaurants that are almost impervious to reviews. Their very familiarity is charismatic. Louie's Shore Restaurant in Port Washington is one of these. While the food is not outstanding, most of it is dependably decent. If you keep to the simpler dishes you will dine on good fresh seafood.

title: The New Thurmond
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.To watch Strom Thurmond these days, you might think he'd been the lifelong ally of black voters in South Carolina.

title: The Loneliness Of Tom Fleming
description: WHEN the gun sounds at 10:30 A.M. today to start the New York City Marathon, more than 600 runners from New Jersey will begin the long trek from the Verrazano Bridge to Central Park.

title: Tom Elliston, 58, Retired to Peru After Career With Voice of America
description: LIMA, Peru, Oct. 22 (AP)  Tom Elliston, a retired White House correspondent for the Voice of America, died here Thursday of a heart attack, Urnted Stales Embasgy officials said today. He was 58 years. old.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: ONCE again, a national debate is heating up about the type of stimulus the American economy may need to keep its current expansionary cycle running and to bring down the stubbornly high unemployment rate. The White House insured that economic policy would remain a live issue with its unusualand highly controversialwarning late last week to the Federal Reserve Board that further increases in shortterm interest rates could hurt the economy.

title: Beauty
description: Where do models learn how to give themselves higl cheekbones and darkly roman. tic eyes? At the Makeup Center on West 55th Street. Where do Jackie Onassis, Liza Minelli, Princess Grace, Nancy Kissinger and Cherwithhernewface see the latest beauty ideas? At Boyd's Chemists on Madison Avenue at titst Street. And where can one find Abschminke, the makeup remover thinskinned actresses swear by and that Nureyev uses in I Am a Dancer'? At the Capezio boutiques all around town.

title: DANCE VIEW
description: This, it seems, is to be the season for Romeo and Juliet. Within the space of weeks, new versions of the Prokofiev ballet have already been staged by the Pittsburgh Ballet Theater and the Joffrey Ballet; Rudolf Nureyev's version for London Festival Ballet is strongly rumored to be headed for the Metropolitan Opera House next summer, and I suppose there is always an outside chance that Michael Smuin's recent production of the work for his San Francisco Ballet will turn up in New York. This is, at the risk of repeating myself, clearly the season for Romeo and Juliet. Yet it seems only yesterday that the ballet was a novelty.

title: Oscar Araiz's Romeo Gets New Cast at the Joffrey
description: The Joffrey Ballet version of Romeo and Juliet by the Argentine choreographer Oscar Araiz, which opened the company's season last week, has now returned to the City Center for a series of consecutive performances through Wednesday night.

title: Heavy Traffic on the Road to Alimony
description: The rising number of detours otherwise known as divorces  on the road to matrimonial bliss has not escaped public notice. Now the Tax Foundation Inc. has provided the most painful kind of substantiation of the trend: statistics on alimony payments as reflected in income tax returns.

title: News Summary
description: A news arms accord to limit strategic bomber and missile forces is likely within a few months, according to high American officials. They said that major progress had been achieved though hard problem? remained to be ettled in the intensified negotiations. The officials also said that optimistic remarks by President Carter and Leonid Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, had underscored the likelihood of an early accord. [Page 1, Column 6.]

title: Common Crave Site For Dead Radicals Worries Stuttgart
description: BONN, Oct. 22 Misgivings that the graves of three dead terrorists, to be buried side by side in a Stuttgart cemetery next Thursday, may become a shrine for radicals are causing political strains in West Germany.

title: Cuomo Campaigns On Need to increase The City's Tourism
description: Mario M. Cuomo yesterday announced aplan aimed at encouraging middleclass tourists to visit New York City.

title: Best of Toy Breed to Strut Next Sunday
description: Scores of followers will be on hand, the competition will be keen, and some of the winners will undoubtedly ride home triumphantly in their gleaming trophies. Once a year the Progressive Dog Club presents the pbpular showcase or toy breeds in Man hattan. The 1977 date is next Sunday, when 280 representatives, including champions in all 19 breeds and varieties, will prance about in style at the Sheraton Motor Inn, 520 12th Avenue and 42d Street.

title: THE LITERARY VIEW
description: IN the past year or so the pages of this Review have been full of books on the Far Eastnot only the usual journalistic reports or foreignaffairs surveys, but also literary works that employ the techniques of fiction and mix travelogue, political argument and autobiography. Recent novels and stories set in India and Malaysia by Paul Theroux, Ruth Prawer Jhabvala and Paul Scott have received far more sympathetic and serious attention than their exoticism and endofempire gloom would have permitted five or ten years ago. V.S. Naipaul is finally gaining recognition as his Third World subjects become more fashionablewhich, to be sure, is often racial prejudice in reverse. But of all exotic realms China remains the most alluringa land of Oz for adults, with Chairman Mao its Red wizard, enigmatic, ferocious and benign at once. There has been a deluge of books on China: The Woman Warrior, Hermit of Peking, In the People's Republic, Chinese Shadows, to name only those that were featured on the front page.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: An Alluring Autumn Haven
description: TABUSINTAC, New BrunswickIt is difficult to know what species of fish or game to pursue when visiting the Tabusintac Camps in October.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: His father was an architect and he himself was a pilot flying B25's during World War II. But Harry Allan Jacobs Jr. landed in neither of those fields. I had no talent for architecture and I couldn't get a job as an airline pilot, he explained, with a smile. So I wound up on Wall Street ac a last resort.

title: BRONX COUNCIL RACE KEYED TO RUNNING 2D
description: Wrapped around lampposts throughout the northeastern Bronx are hundreds of signs saying: Savino for Councilman at Large. Sometimes they share the posts with signs saying: Cuomo for Mayor.

title: Architecture
description: Unusual juxtapositions are an accepted, often welcome, part of urban architecture, but to build a townhouse next to a 50story skyscraper? That is the problem architects Oliver Lundquist and John Stonehill faced when Ame Venema, a director of Schlumberger Ltd. in Houston, showed them an abandoned New York brownstone that had been left to deteriorate beside a huge glass tower and asked them to renovate it into what would be an essentially new structure. The house was attractive to Venema because it is in the Turtle Bay section of Manhattan and because it could be redesigned to include extra apartments as well as the owners duplex; he was not concerned about the proximity to such a huge neighbor.

title: Hofstra Gives $125,000 in Bonuses In Pact Linked to Enrollment Rise
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Oct. 22  Hofstra University distributed $125,000 in bonuses to 800 of its faculty members and employees this week under the provisions of a labor contract that is reported to he the first of its kind in American higher education.

title: A Greenhouse Dream Comes True for an Energetic Couple
description: Last fall we read about the construction of a home greenhouse. We had always dreamed of stepping out into our own world of glass and greenery but upon reading the cost mentioned in the article, our hopes dimmed.

title: CONSTITUTION REVIEW A SLEEPER ON BALLOT
description: Unknown to most of them, New York's voters will be asked next month to decide whether the state should make another major attempt to overhaul its 200yearold Constitution in a constitutional convention.

title: Peter K. Menke to Wed Lisa Margo Oaf fin in May
description: Mr. and Mrs. Gerald E. Gaffin of Framingham and New Seabury, Mass., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Lisa Margo Gaffin, to Peter K. Menkes, son of Prof. and Mrs. Sherwood B. Menkes of Teaneck, N.J. The wedding is Wafted for May.

title: Up and Down Park Avenue, A Concatenation Of Extremes
description: It is of course an avenue of whitegloved doormen, nannies pushing baby strollers, sleek glass office towers and landscaped stretches of potted plantsthe very essence of controlled elegance.

title: Yesterday's Navy Still Afloat at Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 22The United States Navy; Created in Philadelphia 202 years ago this month by an act of the Second Continental Congress, is still afloat here at its base on the southern tip of the city at the confluence of the Delaware River and the Schuylkill.

title: More Readers Using Clubs As Bookstores in Mailboxes
description: Despite the inroads of television, the growth of major bookstore chains and the distribution of massmarket paperbacks in thousands of outlets around the country, more American readers than ever are using book clubs as their bookstores.

title: MOROCCO IS FIGHTING SAHARAN GUERRILLAS
description: RABAT, MoroccoAfrica's shadowy other war simmers in the vast expanses of the former Spanish Sahara. Guerrilla attacks on crack infantry troops of Morocco's King Hassan II continue to take their toll, and lately have drawn the monarch ever deeper into the defense of the weakened regime of President Mouktar Ould Daddah of Mauritania.

title: Army Trounces Lafayette by 42 to
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., Oct. 22 (UPI)Greg King ran for two touchdowns today and Army, taking advantage of five Lafayette turnovers and a blocked. punt, crushed the Leopards by 426:

title: A Loose Alliance of Terrorists Does Seem to Exist
description: LONDON  Is there an international organization that coordinates hijacking and other acts of terrorism? the whole thing run by some warped mastermind out of a secret headquarters? Are the kidnappingsand assassinations carried out according to a standard manual and financed from a common fund?

title: Brooklyn Orchestra Honors Tchaikovsky
description: The Brooklyn Philharmonia's subscription season got off to a thrilling start Friday night at the Brooklyn Academy of Music. As with all five programs on the orchestra's major 197778 subscription series, the concert consisted of works by a single composer, in this case Tchaikovsky. Lukas Foss, the orchestra's regular conductor, was in charge, and Jorge Bolet was the soloist in the Piano Concerto No. 1.

title: W.P.A. Murals Get a New Deal
description: THE Rockville Centre Post Office is expanding its lockbox section. But instead of approaching the reconstruction task directly by merely eliminating a lobby wall, workers are engaged in a complicated series of maneuverscutting walls in half and moving others. The detours are designed to preserve murals that have graced the lobby since 1939.

title: Irish, Clad in Green, Post 4919 Upset
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Oct. 22Maybe it was the wearin of the green. Maybe it was just the luck of the Irish, who once again looked Irish. Maybe it was that the real Notre Dame stood up to be counted.

title: Susan Nightingale Bride of John Schumacher
description: The marriage of Susan Elizabeth Nightingale, a senior at Vassar College, to John William Schumacher, who graduated from Vassar with the class of 77, took place yesterday at the Central Presbyterian Church in Summit, N. J.

title: Field Hockey for Women Joins Olympic Movement
description: Bea Toner ig lookin,,z,, forward to 1980, when women's held hockey will he included in the Olympics for the first time. Mrs. Toner has been involved with hockey for much of her life. She played the sport as a college WOMCII In Sports student at Ade1phi and on sectional club teams doring and after college. Now a physical education teacher at Herricks High School on Long Island, Mrs. Toner also officiates at girls interscholastic hockey games. And she is the current president of the United States Field Hockey Association.

title: Marketing in a Colonial Setting
description: NEW PROVIDENCE NEW JERSEY has its share of gourmet food stores, to be sure, but Wm. Pepperell Ltd. offers the shopper something extra in the way of environment: Murray Hill Square, the charming Colonialstyled complex of restored houses and buildings in New Providence, in Union County.

title: To Each a Gunsmoke
description: THE jacket of The Media are American caricatures Mickey Mouse devouring a globe made of Swiss cheese. That's the common view of American media's influence on the world. We're gobbling up other countries cultures, dumping Disney and the Beverly Hillbillies at cutrate prices, forcing other nations to accept the lowest common denominator of American entertainment (and capitalist ideology), aborting their efforts to create programming for their own needs. Put Mickey in a military uniform or give him a C.I.A. trenchcoat and the image would be complete.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: THE art scene knows no bounds on the Island beyond the waters surrounding it. In recent years shops dealingin prints and paintings and sculptures and whathaveyou have proliferated to the point where art is no longer the cottage industry of the Hamptons and Great Neck but is also an esthetic stable.

title: French Couturiers Are Flourishing in ReadytoWear Boom
description: PARISThe late President Georges Pompidou once warned Frenchmen that the nation's future would depend on technological breakthroughs like the Concorde rather than on its traditional reputation for champagne and fashion. He could not have been more mistaken in his choice of images.

title: Gibraltar: Outpost of Colonialism
description: One of the problems of world travel is that colonies, like whooping cranes, are a disappearing species. It is not my intent to defend colonialism, but colonies, particularly British colonies, have a certain awkward charm that can be defended without defending the institution that produced it in the first place. Gibraltar, the twoandaquartersquaremile peninsula at the southern tip of Spain whose Strait divides Europe from Africa, is one example. Travelers who like a whiff of Victorian decadence and Graham Greene novels set in sweaty places will like the Rock.

title: But Last Week's Action Was So Drastic That Even Loyalists Question
description: JOHANNESBURGWhile the shock of last week's crackdown on the antiapartheid opposition was still sinking in, a senior editor at The Rand Daily Mail looked blankly out of his office window at the yellow mounds of gold slag that stand like a buffer between Johannesburg and the black ghetto of Soweto. Let's not kid ourselves, he said. We're running scared.

title: U.S. COURT RULING BARS NAZI MARCH IN SKOKIE, ILL.
description: CHICAGO, Oct, 22 (AP)  A request for a preliminary injunction to bar enforcement of ordinances prohibiting a demonstration by Nazis in the heavily Jewish suburb of Skokie has been denied by a Federal district judge.

title: Motor Sports Calendar
description: TodaySperry Sports Car Club autocross at Gateway National Recreation Area, Floyd Bennett Field, Brooklyn. Registration: A.M.; first car off 11. Seat belts and helmets required.

title: New World
description: Moreau, are beginning to haunt experimenters dreams. A Russian scientist keeps alive a twoheaded dog. At Case Western Reserve Medical School, Robert J. White transplants monicey ??? to ??? ???. ????? ???? ????????? monkey nead wiahlk: to nian ipulate its new bony, but it functions well until tissue rejection sets in. When it be comes possible to repair severed spinal cords, White tells Packard, it will be possible to transplant human heads and produce normal people. Oz buffs think instantly of Princess Langwidere (languid aid) and her collection of 30 beautiful heads, one of which she selects every morning the way women choose a dress.

title: Proposed CriminalJustice Goals Criticized
description: New standards and goals for criminal justice recommended by a task force of the New York State Divisiop of Crimin.al Justice Services were criticized at a public hearing here last week as more concerned with helping defendants than law enforcement.

title: The Bottom Line in Literature
description: The merger craze in publishing is profoundly disturbing to many writers and to such organizations as the Authors Guild. Essentially, they fear that the emerging publishing giant;, in their efforts to wring more profits from a traditionally lowprofit industry. will base their decisions more and more on bottom line considerations, rather than on writing merit. The emphasis, they argue, will increasingly be on book,:, with bestselling potential, while experimental or unknown authors will find it harder and harder to be published, as the number of possible outlets diminish.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: A beautiful new book entitled The Women of the Caesars  Their Lives and Portraits on Coins will be ready for distribution in Novem ber. Written by the Milanese numismatist Giorgio Giacosa, it was translated by R. Ross Holloway of Brown University (the Italian edition was called Ritratti di Auguste).

title: London Cabbies Disrupt Traffic
description: LONDON. Oct. 22 (Reuters) Hundreds of taxi drivers demanding fare increases caused parking chaos in central London yesterday when they blocked metered spaces and refused to pick up passengers. So far the Government, fighting inflation by restricting wage increases, has refused an increase.

title: Panamanians Voting Today on Pact
description: PANAMA, Oct. 22 Panamanian citizens will decide in a national plebiscite tomorrow whether to approve the new Panama Canal treaties signed with the United States.

title: LeDoux Holds Leon Spinks to Draw
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Oct. 22 (AP)Scott Lelloux, a Minnesota farmboy, proved today to be the first roadblock in Olympic champion Leon Spinks's path toward a crack at the world title when lw battled Spinks to a 10round draw in their nationally televised heavyweight bout.

title: New York's Fourth Major Troupe Is a Pennsylvania Import
description: The Pennsylvania Ballet occupies the unique position of being New York's unofficial fourth major ballet company. This Tuesday night it begins its fourth year as the resident ballet company of the Brooklyn Academy of Music. During the sevenpertormance tali season, BAM audiences will see two alternating programs of standard and new works, including one world premiere.

title: IN BRIEF
description: WAGES AND SALARIES of Americans increased 0.8 percent in September, after rising 0.5 percent in August, the Commerce Department reported. Personal income rose a seasonally adiusted $12 billion to an annual rate of $1.559 trillionTotal business sales in August rose 1.3 percent to a seasonally adjusted $215.7 billion, after declining 0.5 percent in July, the Commerce Department, reported. Inventories rose 0.8 percent to $319.8 billion.

title: A Personal Tour de France by Bike clad Train
description: Somewhere in France, Eddie Merckx, Bernard Thevenet and several dozen other expert cyclists were trying to outpace each other around a treacherous course that wound uphill and down for 2,000 miles. There was no way that Icruising along in my Bermuda shorts and Tshirt with a bundle of gear strapped on the back of my bikecould be mistaken for one of those pros. Still, the idea became a standard joke.

title: Fund Is Set Up to Pay Siamese Twins Costs
description: The Univesrity of Utah has established fund for donations to help defray medical expenses for the Siamese twins Elisa and Lisa Hansen.

title: DETECTIVES REFUSAL OF CASES IS STUDIED
description: The New York City Police Department is investigating reports that detectives have refused to handle difficult or seemingly insoluble cases because of their concern that failure to make an arrest would hurt their performance records.

title: The World.
description: What's in a name? Everything, the name is Palestine Liberation Organization. Egypt last week agreed to a United States proposal that a panArab delegation take part in peace talks with the Israelis but insisted that the Liberation Organization specifically be named as a participant in a Geneva conference, a demand certain to be opposed by the Israeli Government.

title: Dr. Michael Taylor To Wed MissElliott
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Clarence Elliott of White Plains and Oak Bluffs, Mass. of the engagement of their daughter, Wendy Marian Elliott, to Dr. Michael Anthony Taylor, son of Percy Taylor of Henrietta, N.Y., and Yvonne Anderson of Hyattsville, Md, The wedding is planned for Nov. 20.

title: Rules Limit Foreigners In N. A.S.L.
description: The club owners of the North American Soccer League have voted to accelerate the league's Americanization program by limiting the number of foreign players on the field at one time and by reducing the number of nonNews of Soccer citizens on a roster. The roster. The Americanization movement, promoted by Commissioner Phil Woosnam and a number of owners for years, made no progress during the 1977 season.

King sat out last week's game against ??? with a bruised snout. der huts m.althy today, and his orcse.ice made the difference in the Oldahoma wishimne attack. rushed for 141 yards on 22 carries and conlinually got the Sooners out of deep holes with his slashing runs.

title: BILLY GRAHAM ASSOCIATION ISSUES FINANCIAL REPORT
description: ST. PAUL, Minn., Oct. 22 (UPI)The Billy Graham Evangelistic Association, which has been criticized for not making its financial records public has filed a 1976 financial statement with Minnesota in a move to reregister its charitable gift annuity program.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: CAR POOLING is a way of life for many suburbanites because it makes a lot of sense to share the car expenses with others. Besides, there are other advantages: (1) you can nap while someone else drives; (2) you can read the newspaper and keep abreast of world distress, and (3) you can even chat with companions a hnut the weather.

title: I Editors Choice
description: ADLAI STEVENSON AND THE WORLD, by John Bartlow Martin. (Doubleday, $15.) The second and concluding volume of Martin's prodigiously researched biography.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: TEN years ago, if any man obviously beyond his teens was seen running through the streets he was usually wearing a business suit and carrying a briefcase, and he was propelled by nothing more complicated than a fleeting hope of catching the 8:07.

title: Finding Aches and Fun at Tennis Camp
description: Lies! Lies! All lies! We are miserable. We are sore and ache and, as battered as our old muscles feel, our egos are in as much pain.

title: Janice L. McElligott Wed to John Vasko
description: Janice Lynn McElligott, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Francis McElligott of Brookville, L.I., was married there yesterday afternoon to John William Vasko, son of Mary Vasko of Locust Valley, L.L, and the late Elmer Vasko. The Rev Mario Costa performed the ceremony in St. Paul the Apostle Roman Catholic Church.

title: Carey Asks U.S. Aid for Heavy Upstate Crop Losses
description: ALBANY, Oct. 21The cost of crop damages caused by heavy rains in central and western New York State has t.sen to more than $100 million, Governor Carey said today as he appealed for Federal disaster aid.

title: Some on Ticket Begin Departing Goodman Camp
description: The exodus from State Senator Roy M. Gcodman's faltering mayoral campaign has begun as many local Republican candidates detach themselves from the G.O.P. citywide ticket for fear they will be dragged down to defeat, too. The move is another signal of Mr. Goodman's serious problems in competing with the Democratic nominee and overwhelming favorite, Representative Edward I. Koch, and even Secretary of State Mario M. Cuomo, the LiberalNeighborhood Preservation Party candidate, who is expected to attract many Republican voters to his candidacy.

title: P.L.O. Rejects U.S.Israeli Plan For Peace Conference in Geneva
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 22 The Palestine Liberation Organization has rejected United StatesIsraeli proposals for convening a peace conference in Geneva on the ground that they neglect the Palestinian question as a whole.

title: ALBANY LEADERS AGREE ON BILL TO AID THE CITY
description: State legislative leaders ironed out] some technicalities and reached bipar. tisan agreement yesterday on a bill to facilitate New York City's return to the, public market for capital funds for the first time since 1975 with an issue vi shortterm notes this year.

title: ROY RILEY JR.
description: NASHVILLE, Oct. 22 (AP)  Roy Riley Jr., a sportswriter in Tennessee, Alabama and Georgia, died early today of heart attack in Birmingham, Ala. He was 34 years old.

title: GARDENING
description: IN LATE October, I am apt to remember the beginning of a Hoosier poet's lines to autumn: When the frost is on the pumpkin and the fodder's in the shock.

title: MARKETS
description: Wall Streets attention was focused on the Federal Reserve in Washington last week, as participants in the financial markets nervously awaited signals on monetary policy from the nation's central bank. During the wait, stock and bond prices continued their declines, while goldthe traditional haven for nervous investment fundsclimbed to a twoyear hich.

title: Bishops Synod Elects Bernardin
description: ROME, Oct. 22 (UPI)The Synod of Roman Catholic Bishops today reelected Archbishop Joseph L. Bernardin of Cincinnati, to its permanent secretariat council. The archbishop is president of the United States Catholic Bishops Conference.

title: Catholic Surveys Find Loss of Belief in Hell
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 22 (UPI)  Hell has become such an outmoded concept that even the word has lost its force as a curse, the Rev. James Breig said in the November issue of U.S. Catholic magazine.

title: ART VIEW
description: Charles E. Burchfield, who died in 1967 at the age of 73, belonged to that extraordinary generation of artists and writers who emerged from the Middle West around the time of World War 1 and decisively changed the face of American culture in the decade that followed it. He was born in the Ohio town of Ashtabula, grew up in Salem, Ohio, which then had a population of 9,000, and in 1912 went to art school in Cleveland. Four years later he entered the National Academy of Design in New York as a scholrship student. He disliked it intensely, however, and returned to Ohiojobless, and without prospectsbefore the end of the year. His roots in the landscape and nature of his native region were already deep, and spiritually, so to speak, he never again left iteven though in actual fact he spent the bulk of his adult life, from 1921 onward, in or around Buffalo, N.Y., where he died.

title: Affiliate, $12.80, Victorious at Aqueduct by 31/2 Lengths
description: Walter Vosburgh might not have been impressed by the weight the winner carried, but it's unlikely the late racing secretary would have found fault with Affiliate's time in yesterday's $83,175 Vosburgh Handican at Aaueduct.

title: Eli Rally Foils Penn Upset Bid, 2721
description: NEW HAVEN, Oct. 22For a While today, it looked as if the University of Pennsylvania was about to fashion its second major Ivy League upset. But the scrappy: Yale Bulldog rallied from 140 deficit and scored two finalperiod touchdowns for a 2721 victory before 15.000 at the Yale Bowl.

title: Colgate Rolls Up 7th in Row  White Star
description: The weather was perfect at Columbia's Baker Field yesterday afternoon for viewing the turning leaves in Inwood Hill Park, the passing traffic on the Hudson River and the numbers on the back of Henry White's Colgate uniform.

title: McVay Puts Tucker On Giant Taxi Squad
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22The Giants did not bring Bob Tucker, their disgruntled tight end, with them here for tomorrow's game against the Redskins.

title: Bringing Back the Rubber Seeds
description: Atlantic tides entering the mouth of the Amazon River reverse the current of the river a thousand miles inland. Thus, floating eastward down the Amazon, you may suddenly find yourself going into reverse and floating westward.

title: ANTIQUES
description: None of that primitivelooking pottery going on view in a Madison Avenue gallery exhibition this week would make it past the front door of a respectable china shop. But the collectionwhimsical animals, a stoneware pitcher, crustily surfaced inkwells and bodily glazed plates, cups and vases, many awash with fantastic birds, stylish flowers or Gothic letteringwould merit an honored place in a museum, and did for decades.

title: Marghretta Gilbane Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. Francis Gilbane Jr. of Rumford, R.I., and Harwichport, Mass., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Marghretta Lennon Gilbane, to John Abram Smithers Jr., son of Mrs. S. Phelps Platt Jr. of New York and Mr. Smithers of Red Hook, N.Y. The wedding is planned for Nov 12. The future bride is a graduate of Elmhurst Academy in Portsmouth, R.I., and Wheelock College. Her fianc graduated from Tabor Academy in Marion, Mass., and Hart wick College.

title: Philadelphia Schools Ask Court to Allow Loan
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 22 (UPI)In an extraordinary, hastily called hearing terday, the city's financially pressed school district asked the Pennsylvania Supreme court to overturn a tower court ruling that disallowed a $50 million loan the district had negotiated to balance it.; budget and restore drastic program cuts.

title: Files Show Hoover Continued To Believe Hauptmann Guilty
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 Newly released Federal Bureau of Investigation files on the kidnapmurder of Charles A. Lindbergh Jr. show that J. Edgar Hoover, the late F. B. I. director,, expressed certainty that Bruno Richard Hauptmann was guilty decades after Mr. Hauptman n's electrocutiondespite doubts raised by critics over the years.

title: R2: Even a Man Could Do My Job
description: PART of the indoor scenery at the large new headquarters offices here of Texaco Inc. is a messenger known as R2 but that also goes by the name of Norman the Mailer and sometimes just old blue eyes.

title: Merger Fever In Publishing
description: The book publishing business is hi the throes of a major shakeout. As result, what was once a cottage industry is rapidly becoming part of one of the world's mosthigh powered industriesthe fastgrowing media business.

title: Eve Arnold Becomes Bride
description: Eve Arnold, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Stuart V. Arnold of Hingham, Mass., was married there yesterday at the Second Parish Church to. Roderic Alan Parnell Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Parnell of Ridgewood, N. J. The Rev. Donald Robinson, assisted by the Rev. Charles Giarratana, performed the Protestant ceremony. Mrs. Parnell and her husband, 1975 graduates of Middlebury College, received master's degrees from the University of Massachusetts.

title: Topics
description: Aviation has long since come of age. Still, consider how many, of the week's headlines devolved on airplanes: German Troops Free Hostages on Hijacked Plane in Somalia  Con. corde Lands at Kennedy  Pilots Plan Strike. Hijacker Frees 30

title: INTERVIEW
description: THE first thing that Robert Wells did following his recent appointment as director of the Division of Youth and Family Services of the state's Department of Human Services was to head out into the field. A social worker himself, Mr. Wells likes to keep attuned to the activities of the frontline forces.

title: MUSIC
description: IT WAS Nagasaki in Stamford last weekend, as State Opera Inc. opened its ninth season in Connecticut with Puccini's Madame Butterfly. The 1,500seat Hartman Theater was virtually filled for the occasion, which began auspiciously (It rattier inaudibly) as Mayor Louis A. Clapes came on stage to present the directors with the city's annual contribution of $3,500 to keep the opera going and the arts growing here in Stamford.

title: No One Laughing at Dobbs Ferry Now
description: They used to laugh at little Dobbs Ferry. Now it's Dobbs Ferry and Coach Frank Violante who share the last laugh. The Eagles brought their record to 4 and 1 by defeating Edgemont, 328, yesterday and they are now 1673 since nding a 47game streak without a victory in 1974. Dobbs Ferry's defeat was a 2point loss to Pleasantville last Sunday.

title: The Race to Be Nassau's Watchdog
description: MINEOLA THE race for Nassau County Executive has all but eclipsed the contest for Comptroller, the county's second highest office and one whose watchdog aspects make it of particular importance in a year of rising public concern over the cost of county government.

title: Visitors Who Help Them Stay at Home
description: AT THE AGE of 77, Ossana Ajamian had her leg amputated several months ago and no longer needed hospitalization or a recuperative stay in a nursing home. Her family wanted to keep her at home, for psychological and economic reasons, but they worked fulltime, and she still required professional help.

title: DINING OUT
description: IN a recent feature in this newspaper, Craig Claiborne bemoaned the fact that Mexican food was rarely seen here in all its authentic flavors and varieties. The two restaurants reviewed today would not change his mindtheir presentations are limited to the most familiar of Mexican dishes.

title: FISHING
description: LAST week's stormy weather didn't stop the deluge of striped bass from pouring south around Montauk. The only question is, where will they go from here?

title: Beach Channel, New Dorp, South Shore Among Six to Nail Down Playoff Spots
description: Double your pleasure, double your fun was the theme for the Public Schools Athletic League A Division football playoffs this season. The new format has eight teams in the second season instead of four; two each from Brooklyn, Queens and Staten Island, and two teams from the ManhattanBronx'division.

title: The World Of Tolkien
description: THE power and beauty of J. R. R. Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings guarantees in advance the importance and interest of The Silmarillion, his account of all that happened earlier in his imaginary kingdoms of towers, dwarfs, elves and men. The longer we look at it, the more impressive The Lord of the Rings becomes; and the more we see of Tolkien's other work, the more miraculous it seems that the powers should have granted him that great trilogy.

title: City Council Units Set Hearings for the Week
description: TUESDAYThe Committee on Finance will consider a bill to revise a lumpsum distribution within the capital budget for transit. 11 A.M. The full Council will hold a regular meeting at 1:30 P.M.

title: Anne VanDeusen Fiancee of Guy Heinemann
description: The engagement of Anne Macy VanDeusen to Guy L. Heinemann has been announced by John G. VanDeusen of Westfield, N. J., father of the future bride. Her flaw:6 is the son of Mrs. Frank G. Heinemann of Jersey City and the late Mr. Heinemann. A January wedding is planned.

title: 17 Early Birds Talk of How They Wanted Wings
description: ANAPEIM, Calif., Oct. 22Seventeen members of the Early Birds of Aviation, survivors of the first generation of flying, gathered for their annual reunion this week and reminisced about score of the heroes of their generation the Wright brothers, Manfred von Richthofen, Glenn Curtiss.

title: Cornelia Love,Reporter, Wed
description: Cornelia Spencer Love and G. Garrett Epps were married yesterday afternoon at Ken mom the historic Fielding Lewis home in Fredericksburg, Va. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Benjamin P. Campbell, an Episcopal priest and editor of The Virginia Churchman, a monthly newspaper of the Episcopal Church.
