description: BETHELThreeman exhibition through Nov. 2. Landscape watercolors by Michael Chelminski; abstract watercolors by Baeke sculpture by W. J. Frey. Bethel Gallery, 186 Greenwood Ave. Tuesday through Sunday 11 to 5. Information, 7436644.

title: Friends of Felix FrankfurterReminisce at Exhibit Honoring the Justice
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Oct. 21In life rrepressible, in judgment restrained, elix Frankfurterprofessor, Justice, rver teacherwas restored to the life of finished memory here today.

title: Dr. Charles Scott 2d Weds Linda Tuttle
description: In Christ Church Episcopal in Harwich Port, Mass., yesterday morning, Linda Tuttle, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James N. Tuttle Jr. of Bedford. Mass., and Harwich Port, became the bride of Dr. Charles M. Scott 2d, son of Mrs. Charles M. Scott of Bluefield, W. Va., and the late Dr. Scott.

title: Ideas &Trends
description: Two years ago, several New Jersey high schools began offering courses in transcendental meditation, and many students took part in a puja, or initiation ceremony: Shoeless, they entered an incensefilled room and made offerings of fruit, flowers or a white handkerchief to a statue of Guru Dev. Gum Dev, for the uninitiated, is a Himalayan swami and the spiritual mentor of Maharishi Mahesh Yogi, the originator of transcendental meditation.

title: SelfAssured Carter Is Buoyant Despite Bruises and Frustrations
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22In the Senate, his energy bill was being mangled. After all the trumpets over his Panama Canal treaties, he conceded that morning that passage was 'in doubt. He could still hear scattered thunder over the Soviet. American communique on the Middle East. Bert Lance was gone but not the pain. His own standing in the polls was down.

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: An article in the New Jersey Weekly of Oct. 2 seemed to give a very favorable impression of sports parachuting. It mentioned that the sport was probably safer than other dangerous sports, but failed to give an accurate comparison.

title: Penn State Routs West Virginia, 49  28
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., Oct. 22West Virginia, which had failed to win in its annual game with Penn State for 21 years, provided little ammunition with which to end the drought today as it was swamped by the Nittanv Lions. 4928.

title: Victory's Never Dull For Fencers at Taft
description: It's all for one and one for all for the Lancers of Taft, a swashbuckling band of foilsmen from the Bronx wha have embellished their thrusts and parryripostes with panache and have emerged as the most potent weapons in the Public Schools Athletic League.

title: ONE CRITIC'S FICTION
description: ON KEEPING WOMEN is the kind of novel that leaves no velleity unturned. It is an anthology of all the impulses, ideas and reflections about love and marriage than might conceivably occur to a modern woman. Here is an image that occurred to me while I was reading it: In the days when men and women danced together, it was a common thing to see a woman who was far superior to her partner and who reacted to the disparity by introducing into her movements all sorts of little accelerations, embellishments and flourishes while the man labored flatfootedly through a box step. In trying to keep up with Miss Calisher, I felt like that man.

title: Allen Ginsberg Talks About Poetry
description: QWHAT do you like best about your own poetry? A. Cranky music. Q. Meaning? A. Vowelic melodiousness, adjusted towards speech syncopation.

title: Lots of Rocks
description: THE Rockefellers are, by all accounts, quite richworth something in the neighborhood of $1,300,000,000, Alvin Moscow estimates, though this sum must be shared by 84 individuals. That would boil down to a mere $15,476,190 per Rockefeller, if all Rockefellers were created equal which, of course, they were not.

title: Connors Gains Final
description: SYDNEY Australia, Oct. 22 (UPI)Jimmy Connors and Ken Rosewall advEnced in the final of the 5133.000 Australian indoor tennis championships today.

title: Frances C. Walsh Is Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. Philip C. Walsh of New Vernon, N. J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Frances Cornelia Walsh, to Robert Lincoln Cummings 3d, son of Robert L. Cummings of Laurel Hollow, L. I., and the late Dorcas Oakley Cummings. A wedding in January is planned.

title: Radio
description: 7:308 A.M., WABC: Message of Israel. To Israel With Love.

title: LETTER FROM WASHINGTON
description: O NE of the nation's biggest city dumps is right on New Jersey's front porch, so to speak, just a few miles off the state's long string of Atlantic beaches.

title: LETTERS TO THE CONNECTICUT EDITOR
description: I write to commend Senator Joseph I. Lieberman for his article in support of an independent judiciary that appeared in the opinion section of the Connecticut Weekly on Oct. 9. Clearly the Senator and the Legislative Management Committee were correct in eschewing any attempt to investigate a judge of the Superior Court.

title: Holbert, 2Time Champion, Looking for New Goals
description: Al Holbert of Warrington, Pa., has locked up his second straight title in the Camel GT Challenge Series of the International Motor Sports Association (IMSA) with one race remaining on the 1977 schedule. Like most racecar drivers who win seasonlong championships, Holbert is happy about it because it takes into account the consistency of an entire year rather than victory in One or two key races. But it also may cause him some sleepless nights before the 1978 season rolls around. Should he try for a third straight crown, or he should be moved into another area of racing while he has the chance? Right now, the 30yearold Holbert, whose father, Bob, was an outstanding driver, is leaning toward another area of racingthe Grand National circuit of the National Association for Stock Car Auto Racing (NASCAR).

title: SHOP TALK
description: THERE are those who buy fine things in fine surroundings. The look is securelush carpeting, subdued lighting, linens, flowers, framesand the dulcet tones of a salesperson guide or coordinate the ultimate choice.

title: Marychristina Louis Betrothed to Faishon Bafna, Accountant
description: Mr. and Mrs. Harry R. Louis of New York and Zurich, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Marychristina Theresia Louis, to Faishon Tara Bafna, son of Sohan Kanwar Bafna of Ajmer, India, and the late Ganesh Mal Bafna.

title: Cornell Defeated By Big Green, 1713
description: HANOVER, N.H., Oct. 22Pupil met teacher today when Coach Jake Crouthamel led his Dartmouth football team against Coach Bob Blackman of Cornell. During his. 16 years at the helm of Dartmouth (19551970) one of Blackman's star halfbacks was Crouthamel, who later became his assistant coach.

title: Levittown Division Wins Behind Sbarra's Effort
description: Levittown Division, the highest scor ing team in Nassau County through midseason, cracked a Valley Stream South defense that had permitted only 13 points in three games and posted a 2612 Conference V victory yesterday.

title: Byrd Says Seoul Risks U.S. Help Over Park Case
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 The Senate majority leader, Robert C. Byrd, predicted today that South Korea's refusal to cooperate fully with the American investigation into reported Korean influence buying in Washington would cause a reaction in Congress and could affect its votes on future United States aid to that country.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTONFor the first time in the nation's history, the Government is about to pay direct subsidies to grain farmers. And from their point of view, with prices in the first nine months of the year down 7 percent from a year ago and their costs up 4 percent, the funds can't come too soon.

title: DINING OUT
description: WARREN has always been a sleepy, picturebook Connecticut village, the sort one passes through on a dark, cricketsounding summer night without even knowing it's there. For the last few years, however, its main street has been a bit livelier, thanks to the Golden Bough restaurant, lodged in a large, white colonial house right in town. Bright, globe??? ??? lights convey a festive, inviting air. Two huge, 300yearold maples, worth a visit just for themselves, stand protective vigil, one at each door.

title: Long Islands This Week
description: COLD SPRING HARBORWorks by Christian White; through Nov. 12; Tuesdays through Saturdays 10 A.M. to 5 P.M.; Sundays 1 to 6 P.M. ; Harbor Gallery, 43 Main St.

title: Last Week, Presidents Carter and Brezhnev Spoke Optimistically About the Possibility of a New Agreement
description: WASHINGTONAccording to President Carter, the United States and the Soviet Union are now in sight reaching agreement on the terms of a new accord limiting strategic arms. Leonid Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, said so too last week. Carter Administration officials say that the guidelines for a new pact, which were outlined during the visit here last month of Soviet Foreign Minister Andrei Gromyko, reflect important concessions by both sides. However, several members of Congress are skeptical, and new accord will be certain to arouse controversy when it goes to Capitol Hill for approval. Following is a discussion of some of the key issues raised by the talks.

title: BRIDGE
description: ONE OF THE most exciting contract bridge deals ever seen in these parts was played earlier this month at the fall sectional tournament at the Holiday Inn in Windsor Locks.

title: Officials on L.I. Hope to Permit Bay Clamming
description: BABYLON, LI., Oct. 22  State and town officials hope to allow winter clamming in 1,100 conditionally open acres of Great South Bay, thereby averting repetition of last winter's disputes over clamming restrictions.

title: Peter Reilly's Friends Catch Their Breath
description: RESPONDING to recent developments in the case with a display of solidarity, concern and hope, many of the principal characters in the Peter Reilly drama gathered together last weekend in a Canaan home for a party. Spirits were high, yet underlying the outpouring of good feeling was a certain amount of tension; for still to come are the results of the investigation, ordered by Governor Grasso, into the recently released state police report that called for a reopening of the murder case against Mr. Reilly.

title: Scottish ncing Gets Jew Twist
description: READY? In time to the music, and  right hands across, set in place  right hands back across and set & first couple down the middle for a count of four, and back up for fournow cast off into secand place and  rights and lefts! Scottish country dancing sounds incredibly complex and confusing to a beginner. But what appears to be totally impossible after the first lesson seems only highly improbable after the second.

title: Authenticity Will Be the Hallmark of Public TV's The Best of Families
description: When the Raffertys sat down for breakfast that morning in 1880, they had potatoes, bread covered with lard, and tea. For the Baldwins, the meal consisted of chops, eggs, toast, muffins and coffee. That same clay the wneeters awoke CO SteaKS, chops, eggs of various kinds, oatmeal, smoked salmon, fruits, jellies and preserves. They did not have orange juice.

title: Notes: Improving Airline OnTime Records
description: Few things are more aggravating to the traveler who has to make connections at an airport or who is being met by family or friends than arriving late. In fact, not getting to one's destination on time ranks No. 4 on the list of consumer complaints filed with the Civil Aeronautics Board. There are times, of course, when weather or mechanical conditions allow no alternative, but there appear to be other times when the problem is a result of poor scheduling. How to improve the ontime record of the nation's airlines is a current concern of the C.A.B., one that points up a curious conflict in existing regulations and one on which the public has been asked to make its views known.

title: TRENTON NOTEBOOK
description: FOR those who may believe that casino gambling is not big business, it is going to cost $200,000plus just to get started in Atlantic City. The $200,000 is the license fee.

title: Peter Bernstein Plans to Marry Amy B. Daunis
description: Amy Brooks Daunis, who is working for a doctorate at Somerville College of Oxford University in England, will be married in January to Peter Walter Bernstein, an associate editor at Fortune magazine.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: John Guare is a highrisk playwright, and I salute him for it. A highrisk playwright is a man whose vision is oblique and whose methods are topsyturvy but who is stubborn enough to pursue that vision through clinker after clinker until at last he skids home safe. He's made it home just once thus far, the wild and witty sadness of The House of Blue Leaves, and he's had to endure a lot of rejection since: neither Rich and Famous nor Marco Polo Sings a Solo managed to put together the bizarre and the brutal in a way audiences found palatable or even intelligible, and he's probably going to get The Landscape of the Body, currently at the Public, thrown back in his face too. But let's not miss the importance of the moment. The Landscape of the Body may not be finally satisfactoryit isn't finally satisfactorybut it's ripening nonetheless. Mr. Guare's hand is growing firmer, his jovially jaundiced eye keener, as he draws blood with his biggest laughs, turns the palpably absurd into plain common sense.

title: Events Today
description: New York Book Fair 77: books from small publishers around the country; 10 A.M. to 7 P.M.; Bryant Park, Avenue of the Americas between 40th and 42d Streets.

title: Four Novels
description: HAROLD ROBBINS, in his way, is the laureate of postindustrial capitalism, the Horatio Alger of the generation formed by the Great Depression and the postwar boom. Why nobody thought to include a Robbins novel among the various impedimenta recently fired into the heavens to enlighten our presumed intergalactic neighbors about us is difficult to imagine. Now as much corporation as a novelist, at the rate he has been churning out books for the past several years Robbins may be trying to earn enough to finance his own space shot as a way of remedying the oversight.

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: Today through SundayWashington international, Capital Centre, Landover, 14Id. Regular, amateurowner and junior working hunters; preliminary, intermediate, amateurowner and international jumpers; regular and green conformation hunters. Arabians, Appaloosas, ponies. 9 A.M. and 7:30 P.M. daily.

title: Basketball in TenaflyFinding Youth Again
description: A FEW nights ago, I was on the telephone with a friend who is, like me, approaching the outer rim of his youth (as we would have it) or, more realistically, nearing the cortals of middle age.

title: The Secret Yank File
description: When the World Series ended, some of the Dodger players mentioned that maybe the Yankees outscouted us, too. That's something only the Dodger players would appreciate. Only their hitters knew if the Yankee pitchers were aware of their weaknesses, or if the Yankee fielders were positioned properly. Only their pitchers knew if the Yankee hitters were anticipating properly. Not that a scoutine rdoort wins a World Series; the players win a World Ser.;es, but a good scouting report helps. And a copy of the Yankees secret sevenpage World Series scouting report on the Dodgers has been obtained by a New York Times baseball intelligence agent. The author is believed to be Gene Michael, with information supplied by Clyde King, Al

title: A CANCER EXPERIMENT SPURS CONTROVERSY
description: A controversy has arisen over a prominent researcher's purpose in conducting rt experiment in which he induced carncer in a small group of rats. The Federation of American Scientists, a public interest science group, has charged in its monthly newsletter that the scientist Conducted the tests merely to make satiric point.

title: For the Next Decade, No Major Breakthroughs Are Expected
description: SEATTLEAn anniversary of sorts passed recently without notice, and without much pride, at a lowslung complex of factories along Puget Sound here: it is now more than 15 years since the Boeing Company started develonment of a new commercial airliner.

title: PAPERBACK TALK
description: Shredder. Just the sound of the word is enough to make the blood of otherwise undauntable writers turn cold. A machine that can turn thousands of printed examples of their wit and industry into unreadable shavings within a matter of seconds! For as every wellread author knows, it is the practice of all publishers and distributors of massmarket paperbacks to destroy the copies of books they have not been able to sell within a few months of publication and for which there seems to be no likely demand in the future.

title: Premieres Offered By Composers Guild
description: The Composers Guild for Performance opened its 1977.78 season at Columbia University's McMillin Theater on Thursday night with a concert that offered premieres of Maurice Wright's Chamber Symphony for Piano and Tape (1977), David Winkler's Three Pieces for Solo Cello (1976) and Bruce Hobson's Movement for Piano (1977). The program also included Robert Pollock's Geometrics for String Quartet (1974), Webern's String Trio and Ravel's Sonata for Violin and Cello.

title: Paperback Best Sellers
description: Massmarket paperbacks are softcover books sold at newsstands, variety stores, supermarkets, as well as in bookstores. This listing is based on computer processed reports from bookstores and representative wholesalers with more than 40,000 outlets across the United States.

title: Marathon Mother
description: Linda Schreiber answered the door of their brick Colonial in Greenwich, Conn., and she was up to her hips in progeny. They were beautiful kids, 4 years old, going on 5, all in corduroys and jerseys, and they swarmed. Mrs. Schreiber is the mother of five, including quadruplets, and she is going to run in the New York City Marathon today. You don't find many mothers of quadruplets racing 26 miles 385 yards, but then 8yearold marathoners are in short supply, too, and blind men who go the distance and onelegged runners. Nevertheless, today's starting list of 5,000 or so includes Wesley Patil, who is 8, and Joe Pardo, who is blind, and Richard Traum, who has an artificial leg.

title: PRESDENT DESCRIBES U.S. ROLE IN MIDEAST
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 22Moving quickly from state to state and issue to issue, President Carter continued his crosscountry trip today with a speech here tonight in which he sought to clarify the United States position on the Middle East.

title: TITO RETURNS HOME FROM TOUR ABROAD
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Oct. 22President Tito returned home last night after his second major international tour in as many months aimed at reestablishing and cementing his country's relationships as a friend of all blocs and a member of none.

title: ARCHITECTURE VIEW
description: There is a very beautiful and challenging show at the Leo Castelli Gallery (420 West Broadway, through Nov. 12) called Architecture Iso named because it is both the first architecture exhibition at Castelli and the first of a projected series on the subject.

title: An Interest in Principles
description: Against the onecent increase in the county sales tax. He also charged that Mr. Christ failed to initiate procedures to stop waste.

title: STRINGENT REFORMS HIT SNAGS IN ITALY
description: ROMEItaly's political leaders are finding it increasingly difficult to put into effect the most stringent of the economic measures they prescribed for the country only a few months ago.

title: Barbara Greenberg Wed To Leonard Schwartz
description: At Temple Shalom of Electchester in Flushing, Queens, last evening, Barbara Greenberg, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Rubin Greenberg of Brooklyn, was married to Leonard Schwartz, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry Schwartz, asst, of Brooklyn. Rabbi Joseph Spivack performed the ceremony.

title: Soccer: 2 Pacing Point Pleasant
description: Tim Dempsey and Scott Salisbury are the chief reasons Point Pleasant Boro in Ocean County (N.J.) is undefeated after 14 soccer games. Besides having scored 34 of the team's 58 goals, Coach Vito Dellegrippo readily admits that the two seniors have held the team together.

title: WHEN FAT WAS IN FASHION
description: Somewhere in the first 15 minutes of North by Northwest, Cary Grant pats his stomach, frowns, and tells his secretary to make a note: Think thin! Everybody in the audience laughs in instant sympathywe are all patting our stomachs and thinking thin as hard as we can. One glance at the art of Rubens, however, shows that this was not always soobviously, thinking fat used to be the thing. The opulent fleshy beauty of Rubens's women probably made the leaner ladies of his day frown when they patted their own meager stomachs, and wish they could compete in the big leagues.

title: IN ENGLAND NOW
description: LONDON. Like many writers, I consider myself to have been born in captivity. And after 46 years I am still there, still have not tired of examining in wonder the bars and stones that incarcerate me: their blemishes, which are like the claw marks of my own hands, the., truly terrible homeliness.

title: Strauss Taking A Leading Role As Carter Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 Robert S. Strauss, President Carter's special trade representative, is taking a key role as a political troubleshooter for the Administration on issues from energy to the Panama Canal to the steel industry.

title: MISS UNIVERSE
description: I do not find it surprising that the blacks paint the devil sparkling white, and their gods black as coal, or that certain tribes have a Venus with her breasts hanging down to her thighs, or in brief that all the idolatrous people represent their gods with human faces and endow them with all their own impulses. It has been well said that if triangles had a god they would give him three sides.

title: Doonesbury's
description: AT THEIR annual dinner celebrating the founding of Walden commune, the members are engaged in an animated discussion of whether or not their portions of Michael Doonesbury's lasagna are exhibiting signs of life.

title: Todd Sheds His Stutter As He Gains Confidence
description: A few weeks agoRichard Todd doesn't remember exactly whenhe stopped stuttering in the huddle. It's confidence, he suggests. I believe in myself. But last year I stuttered.

title: Deaths
description: ABRAMSElsie Clark, On Oct 22, 1977.of Roosevelt, L.I. Beloved wife of Howard C. Abrams. Sister of John H. Clark, Albert T. Clark, the late George W. Clark and the late Emma Giesow. Friends may call at the Clayton & Forbeli Funeral Home, 20 Lincoln Ave, Rockville Centre, L.I. 24 & 79PAA Monday. Requiem at St. Paul's Episcopal Church, Roosevelt, L.I. Tuesday 11AM: Interment Greenfield Cemetery, Hempstead, L.I.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: The signs are not auspicious for those of us who continue to hope that President Carter will propose truly meaningful Federal tax reform. Delay in making the, proposals to allow full consideration and to avoid interference with the pending energy legisflaCon can be understood. It would be unforgivable, however, if after laboring so long the proposals offered served neither simplification nor reform.

title: Andre WattsA Joyous Love Affair With the Piano
description: There are certain artists whose concerts these days seem to be consistently sold out. Andre Watts, at 31, is one example of this phenomenon. Considering the fact that there is no dearth of performing artists with exceptional technique, commitment, intelligence and repertory, what, then, is responsible for such enthusiastic public response?

title: Television This Week
description: 12 NOON (7) ISSUES AND ANSWERS. South African Prime Minister John Vorster is the scheduled guest.

title: Best Sellers
description: The listings above are based on computerprocessed sales figures from 1400 bookstores in every region of the United States.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: Unemployment remains stuck at around 7 percent of the labor force, considerably above the 5 to 6 percent that most economists define as full employment. For all teenagers, the rate is 17.5 percent and for nonwhite teenagers, 40.4 percent. By any measure, too many willing persons are still deprived of the opportunity to work.

title: MUSIC
description: IT WAS Nagasaki in Stamford last weekend, as State Opera Inc. opened its ninth season in Connecticut with Puccini's Madame Butterfly. The 1,500seat Hartman Theater was virtually filled for the occasion, which began auspiciously (if rather inaudibly) as Mayor Louis A. utapes came on stage to present the directors with the city's annual contribution of $3,500 to keep the opera going and the arts growing here in Stamford.

title: Still, Jobs Don't Go Begging Despite the Fiscal Crisis
description: My father was a barber, says Arthur Tebaldi, a 52yearold accountant and lifelong civil servant who is now treasurer of his union. He said, You need security. Work for the city. You got a job for a lifetime

title: ART
description: IT IS rare that today's artists find inspiration in the work of the ancient Greeks, but Reuben Nakian still glorifies them as among the greatest artistic talents who ever lived. The 80yearold sculptor, who is current ly the subject of an exhibition at the Stamford Museum, says: They had it allvision, fire, imagination and skill. Where else could you find such forms, such figures, such subject matter? The lives of the Greek gods have never been matched. I feel the spirit of the ancient Greeks myself.

title: Nan E. Perry Bride Of Michael W. Neff
description: Nan Elizabeth Perry. daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Albert Rowland Perry Jr. of Riverdale, the Bronx. was married there yesterday to Michael Walter Neff, son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter Neff of York, Pa. The Rev. Robert R. Rodie Jr. performed the ceremony in Christ ??? Church.

title: Peking Shows Interest in Purchasing Western Arms
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 22China appears increasingly interested in buying Western weapons to modernize its armed forces. But so far Peking has not placed any orders, and military specialists differ over what, if anything, China intends to buy.

title: State Department Blocking Visit By Dalai Lama, Exiled in India
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19Unwilling to irritate China, Taiwan or India, the State Department is quietly blocking a proposed American visit by the Dalai Lama, the exiled religious and temporal leader of Tibet.

title: FISHING
description: LAST week's stormy weather did a thorough job of mixing up the water as well as the fishing. The bluefish seem to have moved farther offshore; however, there is no particular pattern, and some schools occasionally sweep into a point just a few miles off the beaches.

title: Firing an Oven in Kingston
description: ACROSS the street from the Solar Motel here is a fiveacre unlandscaped plot, once a farmer's field, where Stella Andrassy is conducting experiments that she thinks could alter the way people all over the world live.

title: THEATER
description: THEATERS don't just grow like Topsy, and they don't flourish merely by putting on plays that attract an audience. There's much, much more to it than that.

title: The Right to Have a Coke
description: HOSEA WILLIAMS was one of the fiery characters in the civil rights movement of the 1950's and 60's, a muscular figure with a roaring voice. If Andrew Young was Dr. Martin Luther Kinz Jr.'s moderate lieutenant in the Southern Christian Leadership conterence, Hosea Williams was the militant. He went to jail 96 times. But before then he had been a nonpolitical chemist, working for the Department of Agriculture in Savannah. How did he get into the Movement?

title: This Week in Sports
description: Walt Frazier makes his first visit to New York since leaving the Knicks when the Cleveland Cavaliers play the Knicks at 7:30 P.M. Tuesday at Madison Square Garden. The Knicks meet the Detroit Pistons at the Garden at 8 P.M. Saturday. The New Jersey Nets play 8 P.M. home games at the Rutgers gym in Piscataway against the Atlanta Hawks Wednesday and the Boston Celtics Friday.

title: Editorial Cartoon 1  No Title
description: Editorial Cartoon 1  No Title

title: INTERVIEW
description: OILY GUION, a noted portraitist who lives in a 16room Victorian mansion here, went to Annapolis earlier this month to present a painting of the late Hear Mm. Henry Erben, her granduncle, to the United States Naval Academy.

title: Music In Review
description: During the first portion of their New York debut concert in Lincoln Center's New and Newer Music Series at Alice Tully Hall on Wednesday night, the Strasbourg Percussionists of France made it dear that they were a sextet of markedly energetic and efficient instrumentalists, but the music they were dealing with did not really set them apart from other enterprising percussion groups. Miroslav Kabelac's Eight Inventions were pleasant essays of a relatively conservative bent, and Yoshihisa Taira's Hierophonie V a matter of shouts and nervous eruptions of percussion comment or fury, had something of a conventional avantgarde manner about it.

title: The Ups and Downs of the Fords
description: DEARBORN, Mich.The evolution of the Ford Motor Company under Henry Ford 2d constitutes a second major period in the company's 75year history. But its first period. beginning with its founding on June 16, 1903, was perhaps more epic.

title: A Good Guy Strikes Back
description: APHOTOGRAPH accompanying a selection from this book in the current Esquire magazine shows a rather bemused Daniel Schorr cradling on his lap a portable television set which, in turn, beams a rather blurred image of the same Mr. Schorr looking, if anything, even more bemused. It is an apt illustration, both of the book's considerable merit and of its principal weakness. For Schorr's prime theme is television's inability to reflect the complex reality on whose lumpy lap it perches so uncomfortably. This he argues with passion and persuasive documentation.

title: The Priests and the Zoning Dispute
description: OYSTER BAY COVE A GROUP of conservative Roman Catholics is planning to open its United States headquarters in this tiny, wooded village, despite a recent zoning setback from the village trustees.

title: MARIJUANA BACKERS MOVE TO VOID BANS
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I.In a small town courtroom and before no spectators, defense lawyers and marijuana advocates last week began a test case that they hope will result in a United States Supreme Court deoision upsetting the laws against the private use of the drug.

title: Voters to Decide
description: TRENTON ALTHOUGH most of the attention in the political arena this fall has been focused on the gubernatorial election and on the races for the 120 legislative seats, voters going to the polls on Nov. 8 also will be asked to determine the fate of two bond issues totaling $150 million.

title: Michigan Falls, 160
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Oct. 22A sophomore placekicker, Paul Rogind, kicked three field goals and a swarming Minnesota defense stymied Michigan as the Gophers defeated the Wolverines, 160; today in a Big Ten football game. was Michigan's first loss.

title: Blumenthal: Talking the Dollar Back Up
description: When the Secretary of the Treasury. sneezes, the dollar catches cold, judging by the instant reactions in the international money markets to Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal's every utterance.

title: Linda Shulevitz Affianced
description: Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Shulevitz of Miami have announced the engagement of their daughter, Linda Shulevitz, to Dale Prentis Frenkel, son of Mr. and Mrs. Marvin Frenkel of HuntingtoA Woods, Molt.

title: Social Security: The Undernourished Giant
description: Social Security has become a giant among Federal social programs. Once a modest supplement to private disability insurance and pensions, it has gradually evolved into a massive program for the redistribution income from the young to the old and from the middle class to the poor. This year, one dollar in nine of taxable earnings$85 billionwill go to some 33 million beneficiaries.

title: Caldwell and DewhurstAn Almost Perfect Relationship
description: When Zoe Caldwell, eager to launch her first directing assignment, approached Colleen Dewhurst last year and asked her to play the lead in An Almost Perfect Person, a new comedy by Judith Ross, Miss Dewhurst read the play but then said she was not that interested.

title: AllOut Career Education in Greenwich
description: JOSEPH KAYE, a Greenwich lawyer, had nine children and an obviously vested interest in career education. In 1969, midway through his 10year stint on the Board of Education, he introduced the idea of using the community's talented adults to give volunteer career guidance to schoolchildren.

title: Mrs. Carter Campaigns in Virginia
description: ARLINGTON, Va., Oct. 22 (AP)Rosalynn Carter made a political trip to Virginia today and campaigned for Henry Howell, a Democrat who is running for Governor against Lieut. Gov. John Dalton, a Republican.

title: Will the Next Robert Redford Have to Be Canadian?
description: Atown somewhere in Canada may become the Hollywood of the future. And the next Robert Redford may have to be a Canadian.

title: Women Await SchoolBias Ruling
description: THE first complaint was filed in March. It's almost November now. This is very upsetting. Dorothy Pierce, legal affairs director of the NassauSuffolk Council of Administrative wnmpn in Education was referrine to actions filed by her group alleging sex discrimination in three Long Island school districts in the recruiting and hiring of administrators.

title: Bus Line to Aid Latins Is Sought
description: TURNERSVILLE FOR more than three years, Lester Dingee has dreamed of the day when a redandwhite Floridabound bus with his name on the side would pull out of Union City and speed south down the turnpike.

title: Carey NowOpen To Moves to Scrap Westway Proposal
description: OSSINING, N.Y., Oct. 22  Governor Carey said today that he had an open $800 million in Federal funds from the Westway project in Manhattan to masstransit improvements.

title: Abortion Foes Gain Support As They In Campaign
description: Buoyed by the recent antiabortion stands in all three branches of the Federal Government, groups across the country are mounting highly organized, increasingly broadbased and generally wellfinanced campaigns to limit access to abortion, Their longrange goal, already hacked by a dollar investment well into the millions, is to erase the Supreme Court's 1973 decision legalizing abortions with a constitutional amendment.

title: United Prees International
description: KENT STATE PROTEST BROKEN UP: ???? police ol campus of Kent State University yesterday dispersing protestors who were demonstrating against the construction of a gymnasium annex near the site where Four students were killed in 1970. Earlier in the week, nrcp Golding, university president, prohibited oncamrus rallies. Police used tear gas to scatter about 1,200 demonstrators. Two of the protestors were arrested.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: THERE are many minor furniture repairs that the patient doityourselfer can make, and they require no exceptional skills or unusual tools. Often these repairs can extend the life of furniture that would otherwise have to be discarded.

title: Carter's First 9 Months: Charges of Ineptness Rise
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22  Although President Carter has boldly attempted much and may yet gain most of it, there is a growing sense of unease and of criticism in. Washington about the Carter White House, its performance, and even its competence.

title: Joan F. Keller, Stephen Deming To Wed Nov. 26
description: Announcement has been made by Emil Gustav H. Keller 2d of Tenafly, N. J., and Millbrook, N. Y., and Jean Uppercu Keller of Alpine, N. J., and Millbrook of the engagement of their daughter, Joan Fritsch Keller, to Stephen Robert H. Deming. He is the son of Dr. and Mrs. Robert Herschel Deming of Columbia, Mo., and Aspen, Colo. The wedding is planned for Nov. 26.

title: Behind the Best Sellers: Hennig and jardim
description: It had such a stuffy title: The Mana gerial Woman. And its authors, Margaret Hennig and Anne Jardim, were both Ph.D.s from the Harvard Business School and rather overweight. Right away, it seemed, the book was bound for Remainderland, for what television talkshow host in his/her right mind would want to Interview the authors? And where on earth would the publisher find catchy blurbs for advertisements? And would the reviewers even bother to read the book, or would they dismiss it as a textbook?

title: Labor Bureau to Be Cast Off After 105 Years
description: THE VENERABLE Connecticut Bureau of Labor Statistics, which was established in 1873 and is the third oldest in the nation, has been terminated by the 1977 session of the General Assembly. It will expire at the end of 1978 unless the corning session of the Legislature reverses itself.

title: POLITICS
description: SOME $75 million of state money would go to Nassau and Suffolk Counties if the voters approve nest month a proposed $750 million bond issue for publicworks projects to stimulate economic and job development.

title: Russian Writer, Not a Dissident, Critic of Society
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 22Yuri V. Trifonov is a Soviet writer. He is not a dissident. His stories are trenchant commentaries on some of the seamy aspects of Soviet city life and the pervasive fear caused by Stalin's terror. He is widely published and eagerly read here.

title: POLLUTING THE WATERHOLE
description: Space is draped in spiderwebs of electromagnetic energy. We divide and categorize this energy according to its frequency the urgency with which the web vibrates  and we bestow names to the various frequencies, such as radio waves, light or Xrays. But all are part of a cosmic energy field called the electromagnetic spectrum. The task of the astronomer is to collect a little of this energy, analyze it and learn something about where it came from. To do this, the astronomer normally I ries to gather as much energy as possible, because it has become enfeebled in its long journey across light years of the cosmic web.

title: Williams's Passing Leads Grambling to 347 Romp
description: JACKSON, Miss., Oct. 22 (AP)Doug Williams passed for 3S1 yards and three touchdowns today as Gramblirg, the nation's top offensive team, won 347, from Jackson State, the No. 1 defensive team. statistically.

title: A Man's Castle Is Horne for a Night in Germany
description: The dungeon towers have been converted into honeymoon suites and sauna baths, the moats filled in for tennis courts and riding stables, and the ghosts, in most cases, confined to the TV screens. But modernization notwithstanding, an air of romance and mystery still clings to the piles of ancient stones that have thrown open their doors to overnight guests at West Germany's castlehotels.

title: L.I. WomeninEducation Group Cites U.S. Inaction on Bias Charge
description: The first complaint was filed in March. It's almost November now. This is very upsetting. Dorothy Pierce, legal affairs director of the NassauSuffolk Council of Administrative Women in Education, was referring to actions filed by her group alleging sex discrimination in three Long Island school districts in the recruiting and hirine of administrators.

title: Two Federal Agencies Debate Fate Of 10 Rare Birds in Smuggling Case
description: SAN DIEGO, Oct. 22 (AP)One Federal agency wants to save 10 rare birds allegedly smuggled into the United States, but another wants the evidence killed and frozen. While the agencies argue. the Tahiti blue lories, valued by collectors at $5,000 each, chirp in a guarded cage.

title: INTERVIEW
description: ROBERT MORSE is a man who knows his way around Nassau County. And it is not just because his father was born in Baldwin, his mother came from Freeport, and Mr. Morse grew up in Merrick to become Sergeant Morse of the Highway Patrol Bureau of the Nassau County Police Department.

title: Morris: The Magic of Asia
description: MORRISTOWN VIOLENCE, sexuality, love, action and mystery characterize an exhibition of the art of India and Southeast Asia at the Morris Museum of Arts and Sciences. Extraordinary artistry and beauty raise this show above the ordinary.

title: LETTER FROM WASHINGTON
description: REPRESENTATIVE John W. Wydler, Republican of Garden City, has been instrumental in establishing Washington's newest caucus: a coalition of suburban Congressmen.

title: New Hebert Hospital Offers More Room Than Navy Can Use
description: NEW ORLEANS, Oct. 22 (AP)The new $21 million F. Edward Mart Naval Hospital, with a capacity of 250 beds, had 20 patients this week. Since it opened six months ago, it has never had more than 50.

title: Trumbull Wins Behind Myers
description: Trumbull and Stamford Catholic were both hardpressed yesterday, but retained their undefeated records Greg Myers scored from 5 yards out with 23 seconds remaining to cap a 65yard drive and give Trumbull its sixth straight victory, a 1410 triumph over Wilton.

title: Crime in the State: Its Growth
description: TRENTON ALTHOUGH more than $500 million was spent on law enforcement in New Jersey last year, the level of crime remained at epidemic proportions. Just two weeks ago, a committee of lawenforcement officials called crime in the state a problem of grave concern.

title: Gregorek, Back in Stride, Finishes 80 Yards in Front
description: John Grcgo:.c1:, farted =.nothcr victory Ftreak cst. New. York Memorial of ??? von the team title yesterday at tits Fordham University Eastern int ere:lolastic crosscountry championship at Van Cortlandt Park.

title: ABOUT NEW JERSEY
description: TELEVISION commercials intrigue me. Often, they are the most diverting features of the medium in terms of production and the economical use of time to convey a message or an atmosphere. And they sell. At least, they sell me.

title: L.I. Nursing Service Provides Help for Homebound
description: At the age of 77, Ossana Ajamian had a leg amputated and no longer needed hospitalization or a recuperative stay in a nursing home. Her family wanted to keep her at home, for psychological and economic reasons, but they worked fulltime, and she still required professional helo.

title: Paperbacks:
description: ROOTS, by Alex Haley. (Dell, $2.75). This phenomenal best seller in hardcover, the basis of a recordbreaking television miniseries, will go on sale in paperback this week. In often moving prose it tells of its author's attempt to trace his ancestry back to a small West African village, then carries his forebears story through seven generations of slavery and freedom in America.

title: Letters: A Trip Worth $5,500 in Memories
description: To the Editor: The article by Robert A. Parker, Europe for FiveOne Month, $5,500 (Travel Section, Oct. 2), reminded us of a similar trip we took to Europe with our three children, ages 16, 14 and 9. We took a charter flight to London, rented a car in Calais, France, and saw seven countries in a month.

title: Dying Bass a Puzzle on Sound
description: HUNDREDS OF dead and dying striped bass have been reported washing onto beaches and floating into coves and backwaters along the western half of Long Island Sound.

title: Scrivani's Tackle Helps Parsippany Win
description: A firstquarter safety was the margin of difference as undefeated Parsippany edged previously unbeaten West Morris, 97, at Parsippany yesterday. Rich Scrivani tackled the West Morris quarterback, Dennis Murray, in Murray's end zone for the safety. Jim Pucuowski plunged 6 yards in the second quarter for Parsippany's touchdown. West Morris scored with four minutes left on Mickey Mattola's 1yard burst.

title: Tito Overlooks French Hotel Bill
description: PARIS, Ort. 22A large and unex pected hill is being forwarded to the Elysce Palace for settlement. It is for ?? threenight stay by President Tito at famr)us and expensive hotel near ?lonldeMarsnn, in southwestern France.

title: Goldin Asserts That City Has $819 Million in Debts That It Seeks to Conceal
description: New York City's Comptroller, Harrison J. Goldin, charged last week that for years the city had sought to disguise range of major debtlike commitments that he said permitted it to exceed constitutional restrictions on city debt.

title: Susan Nelson Plans Bridal
description: Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Nelson of Fairfield, Conn., have made known the engagement of their. daughter, Susan Nelson, to Frederick F. Nagle, son of Mr. and Mrs. S. Floyd Nagle of Greenwich. Conn.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Knicks Triumph, 141115, Over Bullets
description: The newlook Knicks, aided by 78 percent shooting in the third quarter, battered the Washington Bullets, 141115, last night before a Madison Square Garden crowd of 15,261. In winning their second straight National Basketball Association game, the Knicks equaled two club records and scored more points than at any time last season, with the exception of their final game, when, they scored 144.

title: Reorganization Is a Tool
description: FOUR TIMES in 40 years plans to restructure Connecticut's executive bureaucracy have been presented to the General Assem bly. Surprisingly, each one of the plans proposed similar improvements, including increased access to government services through the consolidation of agencies, more accurate accounting procedures, adoption of program budgeting, and accountability of bureaucrats to elected officials.

title: The World
description: The job is done, an aide triumphantly telephoned Chancellor Helmut Schmidt of West Germany. In a daring, almost flawless rescue, German commandos had just saved 86 persons aboard a Lufthansa jet from almost certain massacre by terrorists on a runway in Somalia. But, as Mr. Schmidt and the country knew too well, the job was far from done. Prosperous, hardworking Germany had spawned the most skillful, brutal band of political terrorists in Europe, demoralizing the people and undermining political institutions. And as the week's events unfolded, the mood of the nation shifted from joy, to shame to anger and fear.

title: Volunteers Fight Illiteracy
description: TO look at them you'd never guess. Some are successful merchants, sales personnel or tradesmen. Many of them drive cars. Others are highschool graduates. But for the 20,000 county residents who cannot read, covering up has become a way of lifeunless they are fortunate enough to have heard about one of the Literacy Volunteers groups in Westchester.

title: Questions/Answers
description: When I received my angel wing begonia a year ago, it was covered with blossoms. I rooted some cuttings in water and they are flourishing but no flowers have appeared, What am I doing wrong? Mrs. R. B., Jamesburg, N.J.

title: Sheltering Battered Wives
description: THE voice at the other end of the telephone line said: I have a friend who is running away from a husband who beats her. She is afraid to return home with her baby. Do you have any suggestions?

title: A Museum Built on a Lake of Asphalt
description: You can smell the site before you see it: The rancid odor of tar emanates from an asphalt lake the size of a football field. From a concrete observation r)latform you can look down on the muddy yellow water, the surface constantly broken by bubbles from hidden tar springs. At one end is a scum of tar into which a plaster mammoth sinks, its mouth open as if to bellow in useless rage.

title: New Berith: Haven For Women Alone
description: DROPIN centers for teenagers and the elderly have become common in many communities. Now there is a dropin center for women alone that may be the only such facility in the metropolitan area designed to assist such women in their middle years.

title: Martha Pruden Is Bride Of William McMahon Jr.
description: Martha Brothers Pruden, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Peter DeWitt Pruden Jr. of Suffolk, Va., was married there yesterday to William Coulson McMahon Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. McMahon of Manhasset, L. I. The Rev. James H. Newsom performed the ceremony in St., Paul's Episcopal Church.

title: A Prepared Reed Takes Charge And Already His Influence Shows
description: Some papers when Jim McMillian walked into the room, pondering his right thumb as if it were some kind of precious stone.

title: Three Thrillers
description: Disaster novels don't come singly these days, but in swarms, or clouds, or flocks; or whatever it is, in this instance, you call several thousand unusually large and ferocious vampire bats that are also transmitters of pneumonic plague.

title: State Dept. Fights Order to Object To Ban on Bowhead Whale Hunting
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 (AP)The State Department is appealing an order by a Federal district judge that it file an objection to an International Whaling Commission decision banning the killing of bowhead whales.

title: 71 Officers Killed by Criminals
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 (UPI)The l'c:lcral Bureau of Investigation has reported that 71 state, ccunty and local law c:iforcement officers were killed by criminni action in the United States. Puerto Rica and the Virgin Islands in the first nine months of 1977. Eightyfour were killed in the like period of 1976. The report said that 38 officers were killed in Southern states, 14 in Northern states, nine in Western states, eight in Northeastern states and one each in Puerto Rico and the United States Virgin Islands.

title: Cauthen Still $1,688 Short Of $5 Million
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Oct. 22Steve Cauthen failed to reach the $5 million milestone in purse earnings tonight in four races at the Meadowlands. Dragnet, a 281 shot, upstaged the 17yearold jockey by scoring a narrow victory in the $110,200 Nelson Handicap before a crowd of 28,130.

title: J. H. Hall Jr., Miss Monroe Wed in South
description: St. James Episcopal Church in Richmond was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Myfanwy Seaver Monroe to Dr. James Herrick Hall Jr. The rector, the Rev. Richard Baker 3d, performed the ceremony and the bride's uncle, the Rev. Derwyn Owen, a professor of the philosophy of religion and former provost at Trinity College in Toronto, assisted.

title: Students in U.N. School Bake Cakes To Help Finance Educator in India
description: With an the Weighty problems of the world waiting to be salved, the students of the United Nation's International School are busy making cakes.

title: Brooklyn College to Drop 60 to 100 Faculty Posts
description: Brooklyn College is planning to eliminate between 60 and 100 fulltime faculty positions at the end of this academic year because its projections show a decrease in enrollment for the 197879 school year.

title: Miss Micocci Will Be Bride
description: Mrs. Antonio A. Micocci of Washington and New Harbor, Me., has announced the engagement of her daughter, Rhoda Maddalena Micocci, to David R. Jackson, son of Frederick C. Jackson of Southington, Conn., and the late Mrs. Jackson.

title: CHILDREN'S BOOKS
description: Why don't we stop trying to fool children about the things that go bump in the night? They're there and that's it and there's nothing can be done about them. Oh, you can try water, handholding, a game of cards, a stuffed dog or a light on. But a child has to meet them on his own terms, in his own good time. Take Jimmy. He sees the enormous fat, soft, orange one that swallows things, and the sharp one, and the angry one The tricky, sly one that slithers like a snake, and the one where you can see his insides The fire one, the skinny one, the brownandmushy one, the sick one, the one that falls apart if you touch him The one that's nothing but a black empty space you could fall through, forever and ever. You see, it's kind of hopeless, except for Jimmy, who gives them what for and 40 whacks in a gargantuan struggle one night.

title: INVESTING
description: Taxexempt bond funds captivated investors when they first hit the market a year ago because of their handsome yields and professional management. In the last month, the yields have climbed to their highest levels of 1977, arousing even greater investor interest.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: IHAVENT traveled the downtown section of Main Street in Bridgeport for a long time, mostly because more and more spots in the old environs are rotting out. When I did take that route the other day, I got more of a trip than I had bargained for.

title: 6 of 20 Children Are Hospitalized In Outbreak of Croup in Michigan
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Oct. 22 (UPI)Area health officials reported no new croup cases today in an outbreak that has afflicted 20 children between the aces of one and seven in the past three weeks. At least six of the children were hospitalized with the common childhood ailment that causes severe coughing, and tubes were inserted in their throats to aid breathing.

title: Westchester/This Wed
description: BALDWIN PLACEJacques Brel Is Alive and Well and Living in Paris. Today at 2 P.M. Tobacco Road. Wednesdays to Saturdays at 8:30 and next Sunday at 2 (through Nov. 13). $5.50, except Saturdays $6.50, students, children and the elderly $4.50, except Fridays and Saturdays. Mahopac Farm Playhouse, Rte. 6.6281169.

title: ENCOUNTER
description: About the size of Spain, with half the population, Sumatra is the great frontier of Indonesia. I had spent some time in Bukittinggi, a beldame of a city, comfortable with its agea city of narrow streets traversed by pony carts, of grand mosques and minarets, a high and cool resort where Indonesians themselves repair to escape summer's heat.

title: WORLD BRIDGE PLAY IS LED BY DEFENDERS
description: MANILA, Sunday, Oct. 23One of the two United States teams was firmly in command at the World Contract Bridge Team Championships here last night, while the other was struggling.

title: SEEKING AN END TO COSMIC LONELINESS
description: Mao Tsetung, chatting with friends, asked, DO we live in heaven or on Earth?

title: BRIDGE
description: A successful worldwide contest in which nobody made bid or played a card ended its third and final annual run recently. It was the Bols Tip competition, sponsored by the Dutch liqueur manufacturer.

title: 93Yard Run Keys Victory By Uniondale
description: Port Washington, flirting once too often with defeat this season, was upset by Uniondale yesterday, 133, for its first loss in 13 games. Port Washington had narrowly averted prior Nassau Conference H disasters with two ties in its first four games.

title: TO BE YOUNG, BLACK AND OUT OF WORK
description: There is a sort of Clockwork Orange epidemic in the ghettos of America's cities. Its symptoms are by now well known. Nearly half of all minority youths between 16 and 19 who are in the work force are unemployed. Many of them eventually turn to a life of lawlessness and senseless violence, such as the recent rampage of black youths who were turned away from a rock concert at Madi son Square Garden. Few of them believe that the future promises any hope. (Continued on following page) Photographs by Leonard Freed.

title: BEHIND THE BERMAN LEGEND
description: The Soviets gave us Van Cliburn. In return, we gave them Lazar Berman.

title: Pate Leads by 3 Strokes On 69 for 200 in Georgia
description: COLUMBUS, Ga. (AP)Jerry Pate, the secondyear protour player who has captured three tournaments including the 1976 United States Open, shot a oneunderpar 69 today that held off Johnny challenge and maintained his lead by three strokes after the third round of the $125,000 Southern open golf tournament.

title: Options Market Under Attack
description: Thursday, Sept. 8. Imagine a prosperous young New York attorneycall him Dick Daringwho is ready to take a flyer on Wall Street. He's heard about the booming options market; it's supposed to be the way to make a quick killing. He calls a broker and ends up buying options on 500 shares of the Aetna Life & Casualty Company. Total cost: $1,156 for the options, $63 for the broker's commission.

title: Crimson Eleven Is Also in Deadlock
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Oct. 22Like the New England weather, Ivy League football is unpredictable. Here in sunny, warm Harvard Stadium this afternoon an underdog Princeton team handed Harvard its first league defeat, 207, to scramble the Ivy race even more.

title: Muscoot Farm: Fertilizing an Idea
description: SUNLIGHT breaks over the stately farmhouse and whitewashed buildings of Muscoot Park, and for a moment the visitor feels as though he has been thrust back in time. But the children frolicking in the pastures are dressed in synthetic fabrics, and they peer at the antique farm equipment with curious eyes.

title: Governor Rejects Deal in Connecticut For Park Acreage
description: HARTFORD, Oct. 22 (AP)Gov. Ella T. Grasso has rejected for the second time a plan to create a new state park on Lake Candlewood by acquiring a controversial 253acre tract in New Fairfield and Sherman.

title: The new Terrorisam
description: LONDONThe rest of Europe was almost as joyously relieved as West Germany by the rescue in a daring commando strike of 86 hostages held aboard a hijacked Lufthansa airliner grolinded in Somalia. The Europeans like people everywhere, have gradually come to perceive coldblooded terrorism as a menace to everyone.

title: In the Vortex of the State's Educational Storms
description: AS THE DEBATE over how Connecticut is going to finance and desegregate its public school system continues to swirl around him, the state's top education official increasingly focuses his attention on what he terms a perceived drop in academic standards in the system.

title: Early North Edison Scores Inflict 197Loss on CoIonia
description: Huey Stingley's 5yard burst in the first period gave undefeated North Edison (401) a 130 lead at Colonia and paved the way to a 197 victory. Al DeLuca put North Edison ahead with a 9yard touchdown pass to Mark Santangelo. Gregg Chankowski. who kicked placements following both touchdowns, added a 32yard field goal in the fourth period.

title: It Had Better Be a Better Idea
description: DEARBORN, Mich.In 1973, the year the energy crisis changed the rules of the automobile game, Ford Motor Company engineers began creating from scratch a new, hushhush car codenamed the Fox. Its form was hazy, but its character was clearly foreshadowed when the engineers literally tore apart nine small carsranging from Audi to BMW to Datsunand borrowed some of their best features.

title: CAMERA
description: In the making of motion picture films, one of the guiding principles that most filmmakers observe is that the subject should move so that some action will be depicted. However, as with most rules, there are exceptionsand one such is when an entire movie (or section of a movie) is constructed from a collection of still pictures such as slides or drawings. This type of filmograph, is often used to present the works of a famous painter, or to picture the history of an ancient culture.

title: LETTERS TO THE LONG ISLAND EDITOR
description: This letter is in response to the many criticisms leveled against the Watson School.

title: China Sweeps U.S. Team In TableTennis Tourney
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 22 (Reuters)China overwhelmed the United States, 5.0, in the opening match of the Hong Kong nternational table tennis tournament tonight. The Americans did not win a set.

title: 19 South African Editors Say Curb on Black Press Will Not Intimidate Them
description: JOHANNESBURG, Oct, 22 (UPI)Nineteen chief editors of South Africa's Englishlanguage newspapers warned the Government today that its crackdown on the country's black press would not intimidate them.

title: Of Tax Cuts and Corporate Responsibility
description: When the Commerce Department reported last week that the nation's economic growth had slowed significantly in the third quarter, speculation immediately picked up that a tax cut to stimulate economic activity may be in the cards for 1978.

title: o Brave New World
description: THE PEOPLE SHAPERS By Vance Packard. 398 pp. New York: Little, Brown & Co. $12.50.

title: Hunterdon Hospital Resolves Dispute
description: FLEMINGTON ENDING a protracted dispute, the Hunterdon Medical Center has agreed to give hospital specialists on its staff the right to open private practices in the county.

title: Realty News𠄄
description: The lease for 28,480 square feet of office space has an aggregate rent of more than $5 million. The company will move into the space that had been used by the international division of General Motors next September. It is presently located in 8,000 square feet on the 39th floor of the building.

title: SELECTION
description: IN THE early months of 1929, when I was 13, the most important figure in my imaginative life was Falcon Swift the Monocled Manhunter. Swift was a fictional detective who was regularly featured in The Boys Magazine, a thin pulp magazine with a pink cover which was Imported from England and sold for five cents a copy. I bought it every Saturday at a little store on North Main Street in Winnipeg, across the street from the semimilitary school where I nassed the long Manitoba winter.

title: Riyadh Has Strong Ties With the U.S. and Is Effective Among Other Arab Nations
description: WASHINGTONWhen President Carter receives Prince Saud alFaisal, the Foreign Minister of Saudi Arabia, at the White House on Tuesday, the United States will again be undersooring the importance it attaches to Saudi Arabia's role as a power broker in the Middle East, the driving force that one Egyptian writer calls PetroIslam.

title: Federal Arts Grant Of $569,339 Going ToBrooklyn Project
description: The National Endowment for the Humanities, the Federal Government's principal cultural agency, announced a grant of $569,339 last week to help Brooklyn rediscover itself.

title: At Home: Bathrooms And Bemusement
description: ITHINK I've reached a passage in my life. Overnight, I've become the sort of person who cannot be happy without a luxurious bathroom.

title: Arts and Leisure Guide
description: Dancers Dame Alicia Markova and Anton Dolin, who launched a legendary partnership with their performance in Giselle with Diaghilev's Ballets Russes in 1939, will be on hand at Town Hail tomorrow evening for a reminiscence of their linked careers. Dance critic and author Walter Terry will serve as interviewer initially, and then Dame Markova and Mr. Dolin will take over with walkthrough demonstrations of scenes from Swan Lake and their catalytic Giselle. Finally, putting nostalgia aside, they will present an unrehearsed coaching session with two young dancers for the adagio from Swan Lake, Act II. (See Dance)

title: Harnessing the Sun on W 81st St.
description: A sunny day makes many people happy, but none so much as Alexander Walling. He is the first private landlord. on his blockand possibly in the cityto use solar energy in his rental apartment building. (A lowincome coop on East 11th Street has a solar energy system funded by the United States Department of Housing and Urban Development.)

title: Air Cadets Get Marijuana Notice
description: BOULDER, Colo., Oct. 22(AP)Nine Air orce Academy cadets accused of possesKin of marijuana have been told to resign r request a board of officers to review telr cases, an Academy spokesman said esterday. The spokesman said that the adets, who were not identified, had been Oven until Wednesday either to notify le commandant of their intention to regn or to request the review panel.

title: Frustrated Mexido Slum Dwellers Organize
description: MEXICO CITYDust swirls along unpaved streets, faded clothes hang drying on lines strung between oneroom shacks, stray dogs roam among piles of trash and barefoot children play in the rusting ruins of abandoned cars.

title: Time for Guidance on the Hauling  Out Procedure
description: Any day now the frost will land on the pumpkin and your boat will land in drydock. Out in the brisk air with your fingers stiffening from the cold, the tendency is to take a quick look and then forget about it until spring.

title: 64Year Fight for River Grinds On
description: RENO, Oct. 22 (AP)The Truckee Rivet is drying up, but a fight over how to dole out its water grinds on in Federal Court, where it has languished for the last 64 years.

title: Giants Against Redskins: The Bitter Feelings of Rivalry Remain
description: It's there, and John Mendenhall can't pretend it's not. The Giants still have that special feeling for the Redskins, and today's game in Washington is no exception.

title: U.S. Must Pay $11,000 to Woman Who Did the Same Work as a Man
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 (AP)Federal District Judge Gerhard A. Gesell ruled yesterday that Betty V. Cayce, a retired Government employee, had been paid less than a man doing the same work and ordered the Government to give her more than $11,000.

title: An Italian Monkeys Around With Manhattan
description: The monstrous towers of the World Trade Center loom over a scene so chaotic it belongs in a mad Italian movie. Across the beach of landfill created for the future Battery Park City, four Caterpillar earthmovers are rumbling like Panzers on maneuvers. Above, a helicopter clatters into view, then out. A tugboat steams up the Hudson, its whistle tooting. A truck rolls through the sand with a portable toilet on its back. A police siren wails from lower Manhattan.

title: Graffiti Blackout
description: EVER SINCE the moving finger wrote Mene Mene, Tekel Upharsin on the throne room wall of King Belshazzar's palace in downtown Babylon (words that a less highminded prophet than Daniel, who got it right, might have translated as: For a good time, call Bathsheba) washroom graffiti has played an increasingly disturbing role in the history of civilization, making instant pornographers out of pubescent children and willing or unwilling voyeurs out of the rest of us.

title: Grace A. Warman, ExDirector Of Mount Sinai Nursing School
description: Grace A. Warman, the director of the School of Nursing at Mount Sinai Hospital from 1934 until her retirement in 1961, died yesterday at the hospital after trnke. She lived at 1212 Fifth Avenue.

title: Knight Scores 29 Points As Braves Subdue Nets
description: BUFFALO, Oct. 22 (UPI)The Buffalo Braves, suriving a scoring rampage by two New Jersey rookies, Bernard King and Mark Crow, rode Billy Knight's 29 points to a 10196 victory tonight over the Nets. Buffalo remained unbeaten in the National Basketball Association.

title: Ramapo Capitalizes On Suffern Errors
description: Ramapo capitalized on a blocked punt and an intercepted pass to score two touchdowns in the final four minutes of the game yesterday and conquered Suffern, 140. The triumph was Ramapo's fifth straight in Rockland P.S.A.L. play.

title: SILENT FALL
description: BELGRADE. The telephones that once gave voice to anger and hope are disconnected now, behind what may still he justly called the Iron Curtain, or do not answer when you call. The thousands of people Eastern Europe and the Soviet Union who, only a few months ago, were eager to speak and write in the open have withdrawn into silence. Doors remain closed when you ring, except for the tiny spy holes which eyes flicker like the eyes of animals gone ground.

title: STAMPS
description: For the first time in more than a decade, this year's Christmas stamps are in the small regularissue size as the United States Postal Service reached into the past to save money. But the stamps have floating plate numbers, missing Mr. Zips and Mail Early slogans, and unfamiliarlooking sheets that give them a contemporary touch.

title: Shamrock Is Working Hunter Victor
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Oct. 22Six years ago, Richard Zimmerman was shopping around for an inexpensive horse to enter in minor 4H shows. He found one without much trouble. The name of the horse was Shamrock and he paid $1,000 for him.

title: Jack Frost's Log
description: CREEPING down from the highlands of western Massachusetts and Connecticut is that legendary figure Jack Frost. With great stealth and waiting for just the right combination of weather factors, he inevitably leaves his first mark in northern Westchestera lacelike pattern of white on a blade of grass or damp leaf in a hollow or valley in the northeastern part of the country, the North SalemLewisboro area. By that imprint we know that the season of change has arrived and that harvest time in home gardens is nearly over.

title: Schoenberg and Bartok Revisited
description: About 25 years ago, back in the early days of the longplaying record, the JuilHard String Quartet released their pioneering performances of the complete quartets by Schoenberg and Bartok on the Columbia label. A short time later a Hungarian ensemble, the Vegh Quartet, recorded a complementary version of the Bartok works for Angel. Musicians, composers, university music departments and everyone with a taste for contemporary music bought copies and soon wore them out after repeated playings. Here at least were two mighty cornerstones of the 20thcentury repertory available for study and listeningthe impact of these works on musical trends in the 1950's was tremendous and due in no small measure to these recordings.

title: BOOK ENDS
description: AMINOR poets panic occurred recently, when rumors circulated that Doubleday was discontinuing the publication of poetry and pulping all unsold volumes left in its warehouses. As it turned out, the rumors had only half a leg to stand on, but the consternation they causedamong Doubleday poets, but others too reflects how meager are the opportunities for poets to publish with a trade house these days.

title: Arnold Horwitt Dies at 59
description: Arnold Horwitt Dies at 59; Writer And Lyricist for Broadway Shows

title: GARDENING
description: THE urgency of the energy crisis was underscored by President Carter again in his news conference 10 days ago. Those thereto scats will have to be set lower and the house temperatures will just have to be a little cooler.

title: A Pragmatic Progressive
description: WASHINGTONIn any Administration, policymaking at the top levels is like a version of Star Wars in which Cabinet officers and other luminaries of the first magnitude vie polite but ferocious competition to place their imprint on Presidential decisions.

title: South African Sentenced to Die
description: CAPE TOWN, Oct. 22 (AP)A mother of five children has been sentenced to death by hanging for the murder of her husband, it was reported today. Pauline Thlken, 40 years old, was convicted of killing her husband last year. Her mother testified at the trial that Mrs. Tolken often had been beaten by her husband and that he had spent most of his money drinking. In imposing the sentence yesterday Judge P.W.E. Baker cited evidence that Mrs. Tolken had planned to murder her husband for a long time.

title: Gabe Paul: The Calm in Yankee Storms
description: Whether he be lashed by a Flortoa hurricane, in the middle of a Kansas twister or on the deck of the Titanic, Gabe Paul could sit serenely in a rocking chair, rhythmically rocking back and forth, calmly relating old baseball tales and mechanically shoving fists full of noncom into his mouth.

title: A Man in Combat Against a Hill He Respects and Even Likes
description: We are in combat again.

title: SENATE FAVORS BENEFITS FOR WOMEN FERRY PILOTS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 (UPI)The Senate has voted to extend veterans benefits to 850 women who ferried military aircraft in World War II.

title: KENYASOMALIA TIES ARE BECOMING WORSE
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Oct. 21 Relations between Kenya and Somalia, uneasy enough to begin with, have deteriorated further because of the threemonth war in Ogaden between Ethiopian and Somali forces.

title: What's Doing in BANGKOK
description: SIAM TODAYThe City of Angels, the Venice of the East, the Land of the Smiles has fallen on hard times. The languid canals that once laced this 1, tropical capital on the banks of the Chao Phraya River have been paved over, except for a few that are festering sewers, and the longtailed boats poled leisurely by smiling boatmen have been replaced by surly drivers of myriad taxis belching black fumes into the superheated air. Coups and assorted political turmoil provide a leavening for cocktail parties and the endless newspapers that flood the streets. But if a visitor looks hard, there are still some mystical remnants of Yul Brynner's Court of Siam and enough color and pageantry, sights, smells, tastes and sounds to keep Bangkok high on the list of exotic capitals of the East.

title: Ford to Teach Again
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich,, Oct. 22 (UPI)Former President Gerald R. lord will connuct nine classes and three seminars when he returns to the University of Michign Nov. 24 as adjunct professor of political science, the university said yesterday. His visit will he his second in a teaching role since leaving office. He met with nine classes on four days last April. Mr. Ford is a Michigan alumnus.

title: W. Milford Chalks Up 6th in Row
description: Mike Legato, a junior halfback, bolted. 1 yard for a fourthperiod touchdown and undefeated West Milford hung on to beat DePaul, 72, for its sixth succes. Legato's short burst capped a 13play, 47yard drive and was set up by Bob Perieria's fumble recovery. DePaul (42) picked up a safety when the West Milford punter, Bill Dandorf, was forced out of the end zone with 28 seconds left.

title: The Region
description: The Concorde finally opened in New York last week after long tryouts in Washington, and the initial critical reaction was that its great rumblings had been made too much of.

title: New Rochelle Gets Its GMen
description: IN less ??? year, the ninth floor of the Sher aton Royal Inn here has been ??? into a sophisticated lawenforcement operation complete wilh fingerprint machines, twoway ??? coamunications, massive crimiral files, weapons and ammunition.

title: POLITICS
description: AFTER all this time, there appears to be no question that the cultural life in Cologne will survive. There is a public interest in it, and a public commitment to it that would boggle the minds of the poor, undernourished artists and writers in their unheated garrets in Connecticut.

title: Aintree Steeplechase Site Purchased for $4.5 Million
description: LONDON. Oct. 22 (Reuters)A scrap metal dealer said here tonight that a syndicate which he heads has bought Aintree Race Course home of the Grand National steeplechase for S4.5 million.

title: Reviving the Spirit of Yorktown
description: IN Yorktown, where residents describe themselves as isolated and alienated, a small group of men and women have spent the last year devising ways to revive a sense of community.

title: Sports Today
description: Jets vs. Oakland Raiders, at Shea Stadium. Roosevelt Avenue and 120th Street. Flushing Meadown, Queens, 1 P.M. (RadioIVOR, 1 P.M.)

title: CRIME
description: The trouble with so many first novels is their didacticism. Often a writer draws more on personal experience than on the exigencies of plot and character. Or he petc sn wnnnd nn in his material that he forgets he is telling a story. So it is with AMATEUR HOUR by Robert Hardin (Hobbs  Merrill, $7.95) and THE 13TH MAN by Murray Teigh Bloom (Macmillan, $8.95).

title: HOME CLINIC
description: THERE are many minor furniture repairs that the patient doityourselfer can make, and they require no exceptional skills or unusual tools. Often these repairs can extend the life of furniture that would otherwise have to be discarded.

title: GARDENING
description: THE urgency of the energy crisis was underscored by President Carter again in his news conference 10 days ago. Those thermo stats will have to be set lower and the house temperatures will just have to be a little cooler.

title: Yorktown 6 Outruns a Valley Stream 5
description: Valley Stream Central's coach, Don McIntyre, really didn't expect his girls team to do ery well in the Fordham Spike Shoe Club crosscountry meet yesterday, but as his top runner, Nancy Frank, came across the finish line first in 15 minutes 27 seconds, he knew his team was going to he a contender.

title: Alison Berns Is Betrothed
description: The engagemnt of Alison Berns to Howard Allan Stern, son of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Stern of Rockville Centre, L.I., has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Robert Berns of Sarasota, Fla. Miss Berns is a student at the Columbia University Graduate. School of Social Work. Her fianc is an announcer and production manager at radio station, WRNW in Briarcliff Manor, N.Y.

title: Police Arrest 8 in a Drug Raid. At Queens Fish and Pet Shop
description: For more than two month, the police and Federal agents had been building evidence that a tropical fish and pet shop in Jackson Heights, Queens, was a markunlacA for cocaine.

title: SUNY: Ultimate in Visual Arts
description: IT is known as The Ultimate Purchase. The new $12million Visual Arts Facility at the State University College of New York at Pur chase is roughly the size of five football fields. One of four academic buildings designed specifically for the professional training of artistsdancers, musicians, actors, painters and filmmakersit has as its prototype a welllit factory.

title: U.S. REFUGEE QUOTA VIEWED AS TOO LOW
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Oct. 22An astonishingly heavy and continuing flow of refugees from Vietnam has demolished expectations that the American decision in July to admit 7,000 such refugees as immigrants would solve the problem.

title: ColtsPatriots Scoring
description: Calhoun, 2, run at 11:31 (Smith, kick). 73yard drive in plays. Key plays: Grogan passes to Francis for 21 and offside penalty gives Pats first down at Colt 3.

title: The Bushwick Area Is Struggling In Effort Not to Be a South Bronx
description: In the midday darkness under the el tracks, three months after the blackout looting that made the onceobscure Bushwick section of Brooklyn a new synonym for urban decay, most of the storefronts along Broadway are still sealed by steel shutters or are holes where twisted grates guard blackened rubble.

title: BRUCE MITCHELL
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Oct. 23 (AP)Bruce Mitchell, former University of Arkansas football defensive back, died last night of leukemia at a hospital at the age of 23.

title: FRENCH LEFT'S HOPES HINGE ON AN ACCORD
description: PARIS, Oct. 23 The opposition alliance of Socialists and Communists here has been weakened though not destroyed by its hitter quarrel over which private businesses it will nationalize if it wins the crucial parliamentary elections next spring.

title: Earliest Life Forms Are Found in Rocks
description: The remains of the earliest known form of life to appear on the earth, microscopic onecelled creatures that are 3.4 billion years old, have been found embedded in rocks from South Africa.
