title: Aide Says Philadelphia Schools May Get $9 Million From State
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Oct. 24 (AP)The state may he able to advance about $9 million to the financially troubled Philadelphia school system to help prevent its closing Friday because of a lack of operating funds, an aide to Gov. Milton J. Shapp said today.

title: About New York
description: In truth, fatherson relationships are at the heart of politics. Root words like patronage give it away, and politicians, mostly men, routinely wait for other men to graduate or die to move into their political inheritance of an office or a designation.

title: Young in Favor Of Stiffer Steps On South Africa
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 24 Andrew Young, the United States chief delegate here, said today that he favored directing some form of sanctions against South Africa, which last week cracked down on blacks and their sympathizers, arresting hundreds and banning dissident groups.

title: Dave Anderson
description: In their current crackdown on sports violence, the deans of discipline have the athletes wondering. Kareem AbdulJabbar, basketball's center of gravity, is wondering if punching Kent Benson was worth the $5,000 fine that Commissioner Larry O'Brien levied last week. Mel Blount and Mel Morgan, two defensive backs with aggressive reputations, are wondering if they'll be suspended and/or fined by Commissioner Pete Rozelle after separate appearances on his Park Avenue carpet yesterday. And all the

title: U.S. Drug Case Against Barnes Reaches Midpoint
description: Federal prosecutors have reached the halfway point in the long narcotics trial of Leroy (Nicky) Barnes and 14 others accused of operating a highly effective business organization that allegedly sold millions of dollars of heroin in New York City.

title: Colombians, Hurt by Inflation, Express Discontent With Government
description: BOGOTA, Colombia  In the poor reighborhoods on the south side of the Bogota pleateau, long lines begin to form in front of the gasoline stations in the early morning. Gasoline is extensively used in cooking stoves and people must wait hours in line to buy it before it runs out. The price is 25 cents a gallon.

title: A Salute for General Bradley
description: LOS ANGELES, Calif., Oct. 24 (UP1)Omar N. Bradley, the nation's only surviving fivestar general, will be honored Thursday by soldiers, sailors and airmen from all branches of the armed services in a salute marking his departure from southern California to Fort Bliss, Tex. General Bradley, 84yearsold, will leave the California home he has had for the past 10 years for a new home at Fort Bliss in El Paso.

title: J. B. Priestly Among Four Named by Queen Elizabeth To British Order of Merit
2d Tucker Gala
description: The second Richard Tucker Memorial Gala, held in Carnegie Hall on Sunday night, raised $60,000 for the Richard Tucker Music Foundation. The latter organization awards scholarships and contracts with opera houses to young American singers. Among those who took part in the gala were Victoria de los Angeles, Renata Scotto, Mary Costa, Mariana Niculescu, Placido Domingo, Neil Shicoff, Sherrill Milnes, Paul Plishka Martti Talvela, James Levine and William Vendice.

title: A.F.L.C.I.O. Will Back Only Prolabor Candidates
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 24The American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations, stung by a series of defections by Democratic members of Congress on labor issues this year, will make a major shift in its political tactics in 1978 and support only candidates who

title: Congress Is Likely to Delay Until at Least Next Year DNA Research Regulations Once Thought Critical
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 24Legislation to regulate recombinant DNA research, tk hich appeared to be an urgent issue last spring with leaders of health affairs in Congress, now appears likely to be delayed until next year in both houses.

title: The Economic Scene
description: Thomas E. Mullaney discusses the White House attack on the Federal Reserve System's monetary policy. The criticism has focused attention on the importance of the velocity with which money is being used in the economy. Page 63.

title: Soviet Jew Returns Medals in a Protest
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 24A retired Jewish army colonel, a veteran of World War II, returned his medals to the Kremlin today in protest at not being allowed to emigrate.

title: People and Business
description: Marcelo Fernandez, Trade Minister of Cuba, said yesterday that, even if commercial relations with the United States were normalized, the Soviet Union would continue to be his country's major trading partner.

title: Cancer Centers Plan Coordination
description: VIENNA, Oct. 24 (Reuters)Cancer centers throughout Europe have agreed to work more closely together to coordinate research studies, officials said yesterday. Doctors from 6U research institutes in more than 30 countries agreed at a congress here to work toward setting up a European cancer research federation. Officials said it probably would be established next year.

title: Panama Ratifies Canal Treaties, Voting 21 in Favor, and Turns Its Attention to the U.S.
description: PANAMA, Oct. 24The solid approval of the new Panama Canal treaties by twothirds of Panama's voters in a national plebiscite has turned attention here to ways of obtaining ratification by the United States Senate.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in The Times Friday gave an incorrect date for payment of Inco Ltd.'s quarterly dividend. The dividend is payable Dec. 1 to holders of record Nov. 2.

title: Laker Says Skytrain Has Carried 15,079
description: LONDON, Oct. 24 (UPI)  The noreservation Laker Skytrain service linking New York and London carried 15,079 passengers in its first month and made a profit of $224,294, Freddie Laker said today.

title: Recital: A Richer Weissenberg
description: Pianist Combines Brilliance With Effort at More Depth

title: Title Fight Postponed
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Oct. 24 (Reuters)The title fight between Gustavo Espadas of Mexico, the world flyweight champion, and Betulio Gonzalez of Venezuela has been postponed until January, the promoters said today. Gonzalez's left hand is in a cast from an injury he received while sparring Saturday.

title: DOCK TALKS HALTED AS JOB SECURITY PLAN LEADS TO A NEW SNAG
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Oct 24Negotiations between striking longshoremen and the New York Shipping Association and ocean carriers broke down today over methods for implementing a proposed job security program in individual ports. The breakoff of talks dashed hopes for a settlement of the strike that has halted the loading and unloading of container ships from Maine to Texas for the last 24 days.

title: Matilda Fenberg, Darrow Associate And Advocate of Women's Rights
description: FINDLAY, Ohio, Oct. 24 (AP)Matilda Fenberg, 89 years old, who assisted Clarence Darrow in the LeopoldLoeb murder trial, died yesterday in a hospital here.

title: Racing Inquiry Impounds Data In Belmont HorseIdentity Case
description: Videotapes, identification photographs and other evidence relating to a possible ringer case last month at Belmont Park were impounded yesterday by the New York Racing Association.

title: Hijacker's Friend Pleads Guilty
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 25 (AP)George David Stewart, whose codefendant friend hijacked a jetliner last week and held the passengers and crew hostage in a futile attempt to free him, pleaded guilty to bank robbery charges in Federal court here today. A judge scheduled sentencing for Dec. 5. Mr. Stewart's release from Fulton County jail was one of the demands of Thomas Michael Hannan, who commandeered a Frontier Airlines plane last Thursday and forced it to fly from Grand Island, Neb., to Atlanta,

title: EXOFFICER INDICTED ON FIRESTONE FUNDS
description: A former executive vice president of the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company was indicted in Manhattan yesterday on charges of having stolen most of $1 million in corporate money that was supposedly being used for illegal political campaign contributions.

title: Bonn President Appeals to World to Stop Terrorism
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, Oct. 25President Walter Scheel of West Germany called on all political leaders in the East and the West today to join in a common struggle against terrorism, which, he said, threatens to spread like a brush fire all over the world.

title: A Third of Panama Votes No
description: The message for North Americans from Panama's plebiscite on the canal treaties is not that twothirds of the voters approVed but that a third did not. And their disapproval, it is safe to say, came because they felt that the treaties concede to much to the United States.

title: Fed Lifts Discount Rate to 6% Despite Pressures From Carter
description: The Federal Reserve, under pressure from the Carter Administration not to push up interest rates, showed its independence yesterday afternoon by raising the discount rate for the second time in less than two months.

title: Edwardes Replaces Dobson at Leyland
description: British Leyland, Ltd., the Governmentcontrolled automobile company, announced in London yesterday the appointment of Michael Edwardes, a top group executive, as chairman, effective Nov. 1.

title: Jersey Jobless Rate Dips Slightly
description: TRENTON, Oct. 25 (UPI)New Jersey's jobless rate dipped slightly to 8.5 percent in September, showing 282,000 to be Still out of work, according to the Department of Labor and Industry. Commissioner John Horn said the seasonly adjusted rate, which dropped onetenth of 1 percent, had declined 2.8 percent since the recession peak of 11.4 percent in November 1975.

title: Big Dow Drop Is Pared to 0.78 By a Late Rally
description: A late rally trimmed sharp declines in stock prices yesterday, the Dow Jones industrial average finishing only fractionally lower on the day.

title: National PayTV Network Announced
description: VIACOM INTERNATIONAL yesterday announced the creation of a national paytelevision network, aimed at competing with Time Inc.'s Home Box Office. It will distribute by satellite a channel of uncut current movies and entertainment specials to cabletelevision systems around the country. Transmission is scheduled to begin early next year.

title: Prisoner, 83, Is Denied Parole by Oklahoma
description: McALESTER, Okla., Oct. 25 (AP)Ardell Mesles, who at 83 years old is the oldest prisoner in Oklahoma and has spent 50 of the last 60 years in prison, was denied parole yesterday.

title: A Prospect of Less Crime in the 1980's
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J.Why will the United States crime rate in 1984 almost certainly be lower than it is today? For several reasons, one of them demography.

title: Books: 15 American Realists Of Diverse Views, Same Vision
description: THE 15 major exponents of real ism in American painting about whom Mahonri Sharp Young has chosen to write biographical essays were all artists of strong individuality and diverse character, yet they shared a common point of view. All the artists in this book painted what they saw, not what they felt,

title: China's Planner Sees Industry on Upswing
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 25China's planning chief has said that industry is on the road to recovery after years of disruption, but that there are still difficulties in agriculture, consumer goods, fuel and Dower.

title: FELIX GOUIN, WHO SERVED AS FRENCH PREMIER IN
description: NICE, France, Oct. 25 (Reuters)Felix Gouin, former head of the French provisional government set up after General de Gaulle's resignation in January 1946, died today, his family announced. He was 93.

description: Special to The New York Times

description: ENTRIES

title: Strike by British Air Controllers, Nine Weeks Old, Seems Near End
description: LONDON, Oct. 25A nineweekold strike by British airtraffic control assistants seemed to be nearing an end tonight following a new pay offer from the Civil Aviation Authority.

title: Jazz Festival Cancels Shift
description: THE NEWPORT Jazz Festival, which announced last summer that it would move to Saratoga Springs, N.Y., next year, will, instead, remain in New York to celebrate its 25th anniversary here, from June 23 through July 2.

title: Governor's Park Slope Home Burglarized; Valuables Worth $4,000 Reported Taken
description: Thieves broke into Governor Carey's Brooklyn home on Monday and stole $4,000 worth of jewelry, silverware, cameras and calculators, the police reported yesterday.

title: The Jones Boy Excels in Horse Show
description: LANDOVER, Md., Oct. 25  Katie Monahan fresh from winning the title at the Pennsylvania National event four days ago, piloted The Jones Boy to victory in the puissance (high jump) class tonight at the Washington International horse show.

title: House Panel in a Surprise Move Blocks Offshore Energy Measure
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25In a surprising victory for the oil industry, the House Rules Committee today scuttled a bill designed to provide more orderly development of offshore oil and natural gas reserves.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Baby With Pacemaker Improves
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Oct. 25 (AP)Lesley Nelson, who had a pacemaker implanted in her chest when she was just 2't! hours old, has been taken off the critical list at the age of 2 weeks. Doctors at All Children's Hospital said today that the baby's condition had been upgraded to fair.

title: SEA GULL POISONING REPORT IS DENIED BY INTERIOR DEPT.
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25 (AP)The Interior Department said today that contrary to published reports it had no plans to poison sea gulls that nest near airports and pose a threat to the safety of aircraft.

title: Aches and Pains? The Cure Is at Hand
description: When something hurts, you rub it. No one knows exactly why it works, but the touch of the hand often eases pain.

title: REMAINS OF 21 MISSING IN VIETNAM IDENTIFIED
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25 (UPI) The Defense Department today made public names of 20 servicemen and I civilian whose remains were turned over to the United States by the Vietnamese Government last month.

title: F.C.C. Head Is Moving in Amid Industry Anxiety
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25The Federal Communications Commission, at a time when it confronts some of the most serious problems since its creation, will be lied by a new chairman who owns no citizens band radio, watches television infrequently and admits he has a lot to learn about communications.

title: Gold Bullion Futures Move Up; Silver and Copper Prices Decline
description: Most prices of gold bullion futures managed to close 10 to 20 cents an ounce higher yesterday despite heavy profit taking after the recent advances.

title: Scalpers Busy in Denver
description: DENVER, Oct. 25 (AP)Scalpers are offering tickets for Sunday's Denver Broncos  Oakland Raiders National Football League showdown here at $50 to $200 a pair. With the exception of a few choice box seats, tickets for 75,000 seats in Mile High Stadium sold overthecounter for a maximum of $9.90, but the game has been sold out for weeks.

title: U.S. IS SAID TO AGREE TO ARMS SANCTIONS AGAINST SOUTH AFRICA
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25The United States has decided in principle to support a proposed move in the United Nations Security Council to impose a mandatory embargo on arms sales to South Africa, Administration officials said today.

title: P.L.O. Is Said to Consider a Provisional Government
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 25The Palestine Liberation Organization is sending a highlevel organization to Moscow in the next few days to discuss the possibility of setting up a provisional Palestinian government, according to sources close to the organization's leadership.

title: U.N. CHARGES NORTH KOREA KIDNAPPED 2 FROM SOUTH
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Wednesday, Oct. 26 (UPI)The United Nations Command said today that North Korea abducted two South Korean soldiers last week and, tried to explain the incident by falsely claiming they were defectors.

title: KEY NEWTON WITNESS IS REPORTED IN HIDING
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 25A prosecutor in a murder case against Huey P. Newton, the Black Panther leader, said today that he had put a witness in hiding to protect her after an apparent attempt on her life over the weekend.

title: The Expert Shopper
description: WITH THE exception of some of the soles and flounders, few fish are so closely twinned as the mako shark and the swordfish. Both follow the same ocean currents, going north as waters warm in summer, then turning south as winter approaches. They travel not only because of temperature, but in search of their natural prey: mackerel and herring for the swordfish, mackerel, herring and swordfish for the mako.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: RUSSELL BAKER, that Inexhaustible fount of wit, was once heard to disclaim that he was a funny man; he was, he insisted, usually dead serious. It was his way of clarifying the confusion in the public's mind between the comic writer and the satirist. The first merely entertains, the second also instructs, and hence deserves more than passing attention.

title: Bridge:
description: World Championship Final Looms as AllU.S.A. Contest

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: ONE SUNDAY afternoon not long ago, Harry Zeeman Jr. paid a visit to one of his friends to watch the Jets in action. On hand was his friend's mother, a woman of European extraction who asked why the two spectators were so excited about the televised contest and how the game was played.

title: CONFEREES AGREE ON 2 ENERGY ISSUES
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25The SenateHouse energy conference solved two lingering issues today, settling on how to assess civil penalties for violations of the prospective law and deciding to allow the costs of energy audits conducted by utility companies to be spread among all customers.

title: Bonn President Appeals to World to Stop Terrorism
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, Oct. 25President Walter Scheel of West Germany called on all political leaders in the East and the West today to join in a common struggle against terrorism, which, he said. threatens to spread like a brush fire all over the world.

title: Bomb Explodes at Thai Ministry
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Oct. 25 (Reuters) A time bomb exploded at the Foreign Ministry today while officials were at lunch. Officials said the batteryoperated bomb had been attached to an alarm clock and left in a litter box inside the passport section of the building.

title: A Night on the Tiles at Berry's
description: Although I no longer smoke Habana Claros (too much trouble finding some Fidelista in Canada to spirit them over the border), or affect spats (I wore out the last pair left me by a late uncle, a noted fidneur, or fly guy, in his time), or use a gold toothpick (I put it up at auction at Christie's in a period of financial stringency), or replace the frayed grosgrain piping on my waistcoats, nevertheless I am still, to make a mot, a fool for a wellturned ankle and a fine figure of a woman. (My wife will attest to that and so will my shins, which she is given to kicking upon provocation, real or imagined.) Some time ago, I discovered, respectively, four and two of them in a highly regarded Soho restaurant called Berry's, and, by Jove, I was drawn to them as irresistibly as an English remittance man dogging the New York branch of check from Blighty.

title: Frazier Scores 28 as Cavaliers Down Knicks
description: Walt Frazier returned to Madison Square Garden and received a standing ovation from the capacity crowd of 19,694 last night. Even the Knicks joined the applause for their former captain, who went on to score 28 points and make five steals for the Cavaliers.

description: The National Football League has concluded agreements with the three major television networks that Pete Rozelle, commissioner of the league, said yesterday he regarded as the big. gest deal in television history.

title: BRITISH IN QUANDARY OVER SOUTH AFRICA
description: LONDON, Oct. 25Britain is still struggling to find a response to South Africa's new campaign against black leaders and their sympathizers that will do minimum damage to large British economic interests, keep alive the possibility of a peaceful settlement in Rhodesia and avoid a serious rift with friendly regimes in black Africa.

title: Music: Unusual Mix Of Mozart, Mahler
description: OF THE GREAT COMPOSERS, Mozart must strike the listener as the healthiest and least morbid, white Mahler goes about in dark clothes, introspective and tortured. But both wrote music that denies any such stereotypes, and Claudio Abbado's program with the Philadelphia Orchestra at Carnegie Hall on Tuesday night stressed the less characteristic side of each genius: Mahler at his most untroubled and lightest, and Mozart in a mood to worry about the afterlife.

title: Viking Back Breaks Finger
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Oct. 25 (AP) Bobby Lee, a reserve quarterback for the Minnesota Vikings,. suffered a hairline fracture of the index finger on his throwing hand in last night's 353 loss to Los Angeles. Lee replaced the starter, Fran Tarkenton, in the second half and was sandwiched by two Ram defensive players just as he releaeed a pass. The team physician, Dr. Don Lannin, said Lee could play as early as this Sunday, when the Vikings meet Atlanta, if needed.

title: Homecomings ake a Comeback
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala., Oct. 23 The top of the national news last Saturday was Jimmy Carter on the stump in the Midwest, yet another jump in the Consumer Price Index and a Houston oilman being cleared in the murder of his soninlaw. But here in Tuscalossa, the front page of the morning Tuscaloosa news was dominated by two stories about Bear Bryantan interview and a speechand by dazzling, fullcolor photograph of 21yearold Marty Midkiff, University of Alabama Homecoming Queen for 1977.

description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Oct. 25 (Reuters) The police last night arrested 12 members of the Pakistan People's Party for having taken part in a demonstration organized to demand the release of former Prime Minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto. He is on trial for murder in connection with the ambush of a political opponent three years ago.

title: Q&A
description: Q Not long ago I dined with a French family in their farmhouse near the Swiss border. Late one afternoon they served a cheese dish that smelled embarrassingly like very old Limburger i approached it without enthusiasm, but after a bite or two found it absolutely irresistible. My hosts told me it was something called cancoillotte, but I can't find it in any cheese books.

title: Around the Nation

He characterized such tactics as amounting to blackmail.

title: Brooklyn Terror: Youth Gang Takes Over Apartment House
description: A neighborhood gang has seized a sixstory apartment house in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn, terrorizing the more than 100 tenants by ripping out the building's pipes, punching out its windows and smashing its furnishings. Only two tenants remain, and the gang has boasted of plans to burn the house down. As of late last week, the police seemed unaware of what has happened.

description: Dr. Bernard Chiego, the director since 1933, of Bioresearch Labs in Bloomfield, N.J., died Wednesday In Mountainside Hospital, Montclair, N.J. He was 73 years old and lived in Bloomfield.

60Minute Gourmet
description: NE of the recurrent questions in my life is whether any new dishes have been created in the last century, and the answer, of course, is yes. If that question were phrased differentlyHave any new principles of cookery been developed in the last 100 years ?the answer would probably ht no. The creation of new dishes is limitless, and yet they are based on the same inevitable laws known to Antonin CarCmc and La Varenne. Techniques have been refined bu: the principles remain the same. The socalled 60minute dish that appears here has, to my knowledge, never been duplicated before the day it came out of my skillet. It came about because fresh scalliops one of the finest seafuods to be found in American waters (or the world, for tnat matter). had recently come into season and were available at the local fish market.

title: British Football
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 26, 1977

title: Belfast Hotel Is Blown Up
description: BELFAST. Northern Ireland, Oct. 25 (AP)Terrorists burst into the Greenan Lodge in suburban Dunmurry, ordered the staff and guests out at gunpoint and detonated three bombs that destroyed the building, the police reported. TheIrish Republican Army's Provisional wing tried to burn down the same hotel on Saturday. Three firebombs exploded there at that time, but caused little damage.

title: High Tides Arourrl New York
Metropolitan Briefs
description: Irving Adler and Harold Blautwo former New York city school teachers who were discharged by the Board of Education in the early 1950's because of their refusal to answer questions about their political affiliationshave been awarded pensions by the board retroactive to September 1976.

title: Rozelle Suspends Morgan For One Bengals
description: Mel Morgan, Cincinnati Bengals defensive back, was suspended without pay for one game by Commissioner Pete Rozelle yesterday for what was termed a flagrant personal foul.

title: 30 in Puerto Rican Group Held in Liberty I. Protest
description: Thirty Puerto Rican nationalists demanding freedom for four Puerto Rican terrorists occupied the Statue of Liberty for eight hours yesterday, chasing tourists out of its inner passageways and locking themselves inside.

title: OffDuty Police Officer Shoots Neighbor in Queens Altercation
description: An offduty police officer shot and soriously wounded a resident of his Queen,: apartment building last night, according to the police, who said the officer opened fire after the neighbor forced his way into the officer's apartment and attacked him with a knife and fork.

title: Yonkers Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: About Education
description: The New York City Board of Education said yesterday that it spent $1,786 a child for teaching and counseling, as opposed to administration, a figure $600 higher than one arrived at in a highly critical audit by the City Comptroller last June.

title: U.S. Reports Political Prisoners Freed Abroad
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25A State Department official said today that some political prisoners had been released in more than a dozen countries after the United States had communicated its concern.

title: BID MADE TO RESTORE BOND PLAN TO BALLOT
description: ALBANY, Oct. 25  State officials argued in a special session of the Appellate Division of State Supreme Court today that Governor Carey's proposal to issue $750 million in bonds for economic development should be restored to the ballot and were asked sharp questions by two of the Lye justices that seemed to indicate their skepticism of the bond issues constitutionality.

title: For Terrorists, A U.N. Jail
description: BONNThe new type of antiterrorist operation developed by Israel and the German Federal Republic at Entebbe and Mogadishu to rescue innocent hostages from skyjacked planes has manifold implications. It demonstrates that no haven or any country amoral enough to serve as accomplice to terroristic acts can be safe from retribution legitimized by either written or unwritten international codes of honor.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Manhattan: Fifth Ave. & 48th St., 10017; Third Ave. & 58th St. 10022; Madison Ave. & 56th St., 10022; Brooklyn: Fulton St. & DeKalb Ave.. 11201; 86th St. & 19th Ave., 11214; Ave J & Coney Island Ave., 11230; Mermaid Ave. & W. 17th St.. 11224; Kings Plaza Shopping Center, Flatbush Ave. & Ave. U, 11234; Long Island: Green Acres Shopping Center, Sunrise Hwy, Valley Stream. 11582; Sunrise Mall Shopping Center, Sunrise Hwy. & Carmans Rd., Massapequa, 11758; Walt Whitman Rd. (Route 110) & Detroit Rd., Huntington Station. 11746.

title: Costs Keep the Beaumont Dark, Despite a Theater Booking Jam
description: A confidential report by the president of Lincoln Center to its board of directors discloses that it costs almost twice as much to operate the center's nonprofit Vivian Beaumont Theater as it does to run a comparable commercial Broadway house.

title: A Lofty Spot For a Food Shop
description: SoHo, ever burgeoning with art galleries, boutiques and restaurants, has an addition in the area of gourmandise which has no counterpart In SoHo, or, safe to say in terms of ambiance, uptown. It's a food and kitchen shop called Dean and Deluca, which recently opened its doors at 121 Prince Street. Not a gourmet shop, said Jack Ceglic, its designer, who normally devotes himself to painting. No jars of syrupy peaches here, clinging to the shelves for years. Quality and freshness were of first priority.

title: In memorial
description: COOPER, Clara L, In loving memory, Larry

title: U.S. Seeks Formula at U.N.
description: special to The New York Times

title: Tennis
description: AT PERTH, AUSTRALIA

title: Brooklyn Police Appeal for Witnesses In Murder, but Neighbors Remain Silent
description: We urge you to come forward, the loudspeakers of the police cars blared as they cruised along West Ninth Street in the Bensonhurst section of Brooklyn yesterday morning. Help bring this murder. er to justice. Remember, this is your neirzhborhood help protect it.

title: Head of West Point Acts to Stress Academics and End Plebe Abuse
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., Oct. 25The new superintendent of the United States Military Academy, Lieut. Gen. Andrew 3. Goodpaster, said today that he had taken steps to eliminate the abuse, harassment and denigration of firstyear cadets.

title: Child's World
description: T'S hard to be clever at Halloween timealmost everything has been tried before. Parents who are .looking for some inspiration might find it in Arnold Dobrin's 'Make a Witch, Make a Goblin (Four Winds Press, $6.95). This simply written and carefully illustrated book offers a host of clever costumes, masks, decorations, favors and Halloween recipes that are both inexpensive and easy to make.

title: Right and Wrong on Civil Rights
description: Considering how rapidly Federal civil rights laws have accumulated, confusion and red tape were probably inevitable. An employer accused of discrimination is investigated separately by four Federal agencies in a year. An aggrieved employee must sort out which of four statutes and which of three agencies to address. All told, there are some 48 different laws and 20 agencies that bear directly on civil rights. No wonder some people have started to ask if there isn't a better way, if civil rights confused are not civil rights denied.

title: HadenPerformance Puts Namath on the Sidelines
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 25That puts in end to our quarterback controversy, said Chuck Knox, coach of the Los Angeles Rams, after Pal Haden quarterbacked his team to a thumping 3 victory over the Minnesota Vikings last night.

title: Deaths
description: ALLENEdna The Rabbi officers, Trustees and Members of Temple Beth El Cedarhurst, N.Y. and its Affiliates express deepest sympathy on

title: Brooklyn Terror: Youth Gang Takes Over Apartment House
description: A neighborhood gang has seized a sixstory apartment house in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn, terrorizing the more than 100 tenants by ripping out the building's pipes, punching out its windows and smashing its furnishings. Only two tenants remain, and the gang has boasted of plans to burn the house down. As of late last week, the police seemed unaware of what has happened.

title: Concorde Called Over Noise Limit
description: The supersonic airliner Concorde registered 117 perceived noise decibels last) Friday while flying over Belie Harbol., Queens after it took off from Kennedy International Airport, according to the city's Air Resources Commissioner, Ethan C. Eldon. Decibels express the relative loudness of sound.

title: O for Halloweens Past!
description: Halloween is much too complicated these days, far too structured, somewhat joyless.

title: MALCOLM J. ROGERS JR.
description: Malcolm J. Rogers Jr., an account executive for the brokerage firm of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith Inc. died Monday at St. Barnabas Hospital in Livingston, N.J., after a brief illness. He was 48 years and lived on Persimmon Way in Springfield, N.J.

title: Philadelphia Schools Avert Closing As State Provides Payroll Funds
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 25Responding to the urgent appeals of Philadelphia's top school officials, the state moved todayto avert a fiscal crisis that threatens to close this city's 285 public schools.

title: EXOFFICER INDICTED ON FIRESTONE FUNDS
description: A former executive vice president of the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company was indicted in Manhattan yesterday for allegedly stealing most of $1 million in corporate money that was supposedly being used for illegal political campaign. contributions.

title: Going Out Guide
description: SHAPES Some 60 artists well known and new, are represented in the 40th annual exhibition of the Sculptors Guild, going on view today and running through Nov. 17 at Lever House, Park Avenue at 53d Street. New works M plastic, and glass are en display. along with pieces in traditional bronze, wood and clay. These classical materials also used experimentally.

title: Albany Special Session Votes New York City Notes Bill
description: ALBANY, Oct. 25  Summoned by Governor Carey to a oneday special session, the State Legislature today approved by an overwneiming margin a bill to strengthen New York City's fiscal safeguards and enable it to attempt the first public sale of its securities since the fiscal crisis began in early 1975.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Mrs. Zicarelli Testifies

title: Horse Show
Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: This is our statutory obligation and cannot be altered except by duly legal means.

title: Peonle in Sports
description: Dave Bristol was dismissed yesterday as manager of the Atlanta Braves after the team had two lastplace finishes. The 44yearold Bristol is only the second of eight Atlanta managers to last with the club as long as two years since the Braves moved from Milwaukee in 1966. The third year of his threevPar contract will be honored.

title: Rules on Insulation Aid Issued
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25 (AP)The Farmers Home Administration has issued new requirements on the amount of insulation that must be included in rural homes that arc bought or built with finan cial help from the agency, It said that current standards were inadermate, The new rule, known as a thermal performance standard, covers construction begin after next March 15.

title: TV: A Cavalleria That Intrigues
description: LIKE Il Pagliacci, its traditional partner on opera programs, Cavalleria Rusticana falls into the special category of audience favorite and, given at least an adequate performance, is almost immune to criticism. Based on a short story by Giovanni Verga, the book is drenched in passionate love, jealousy and revenge, Sicilian style. Pietro Mascagni's score is a solid chain of soaring melodies.

title: Sheila Younge, an Essence Editor
description: Sheila Younge, a former editor of Essence magazine, died at her family's home in Berkeley, Calif., last Thursday. She was 32 years old and had lived in New York City before returning to her parent's home last fall.

title: Rangers Post First Shutout, Top Barons, 50
description: RICHFIELD, OHIO, Oct. 25Scoring moraleboosting powerplay goals in the last minute of the first and second periods, the New York Rangers mowed down the Cleveland Barons, 50, tonight in the hollow confines of Richfield Coliseum before 4,565 spectators.

title: Saharans Report 2 Attacks
description: ALGIER, Oct. 25Saharan nationalist forces killed 151 Moroccan soldiers in atacks on two centers near the Western Sahara's border with Algeria Friday, communiqud of the Polisario independence movement said here today.

title: To Preside Over the Boroughs
description: While Grandpa Robert F. Wagner, the former New Deal Senator from New Yorlt, turns in his grave, Papa Robert F. Wagner, the former Democratic Mayor of New York, turns every stone to elect the youngest Robert F. Wagner as the Republican (and. Liberal) president of the borough of Manhattan. It is quite a spectacle of dynastic influence and partisan turnabout, all in the cause of upsetting the Democratic candidacy of Andrew J. Stein, which cliaws handsomely on the wealth and political influence of his father. Jerry Finkelstein. The exertions and expenditures on both sides have been startling; they demonstrate that the rarely heralded office of borough president must be worth something.

title: Caramanlis Chides U.S. for Not Ending Crisis Over Cyprus
description: ATHENS, Oct. 25Prime Minister Constantine Caramanlis of Greece said today that the United States had the potential I to solve the problems in the eastern Mediterranean but was not using it.

title: His Week Without Meat
description: A dinner of Italian lentil soup kicked off the cold turkey treatment. Vainly, I searched for a bit of stray meat. All vegetables. I spooned down two bowls of steaming stuff, along with three thick slices of Deb's freshbaked bread, still warm from the oven. Somehow, I was full. We toasted meal No. 1 with Gallo Chenin Blanc. So far, so good.

title: Closed End Funds
description: Tuesday, Oct. 25, 1977

title: DOLLAR STILL DOWN AGAINST YEN IN TOKYO
description: The ailing dollar slipped to another postwar low against the Japanese yen yesterday but rallied slightly against most major European currencies in foreignexchange trading,The Associated Press re!ported.

title: Her Vegetarian Discovery
description: From a nutritional standpoint, our main interest in vegetarian eating was that it would be lower in fat and cholesterol, if carefully planned, than a regime including meat and fish.

description: Rangers 2 1 25

description: A confidential report by the president of Lincoln Center to its board of directors discloses that it costs almost twice as much to operate the center's nonprofit Vivian Beaumont Theater as it does to run a comparable commercial Broadway house.

Intestinal Disorders Are Seldom Discussed and Poorly Understood
Humphrey Gets Joyful Welcome Home in Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25  Hubert Humphrey came back to the Senate today, broken in health but not in spirit and responding joyously to a 30minute tribute in which he was enveloped by the affection of his colleagues.

title: A Need Indeed
Professional Football
description: National Conference EASTERN DIVISION

title: Tucker Dealt to Vikings
description: Bob Tucker didn't leave the Giants much choice. In fact, it turned out to be only a fifthround 1978 draft choice from the Minnesota Vikings that the Giants received yesterday for the third leading passcatcher in their 53year history.

title: Abu Dhabi Attack Kills Arab Official, Apparently in Error
description: ABU DHABI, Oct. 25A high official of the United Arab Emirates was shot and killed today in a burst of gunfire that was apparently intended for the Foreign Minister of Syria. Abdel Halim Khaddam.

title: DETECTIVE UNIT HEAD ASKS REORGANIZATION
description: The head of the organization that represents New York City's 3,265 police detectives called yesterday for a major restructuring of the detective operation to end a fragmentation of command and to improve performance.

title: Lunch With a California Vintner
description: ST. HELENA, Calif.

title: Biko Autopsy Lists Damage to Brain
description: JOHANNESBURG, Oct. 25An autopsy report on Stephen Biko showing the primary cause of death to have been brain damage has been completed and delivered to the Attorney General of Transvaal Province, who will decide within days whether to order an inquest or criminal nroceedines.

title: Detroit, Memphis GetN.A. S.L. Teams
description: Detroit and Memphis were awarded franchises in the North American Soccer League yesterday, bringing the number of clubs in the league to 21. There are at leas! five other cities still under consideration for franchises next ear.

title: U. S. Officials Frustrated in Attempt to Question Park
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25The Justice Department disclosed today that the South Korean Government had refused to permit American investigators to question Tongsun Park, the Korean businessman indicted for alleged bribery of American Congressmen, even though Mr. Park was offered leniency and possibly immunity from prosecution.

title: Once More Into the Chili Powder, and a New Champion Emerges
description: ROSAMOND, CALIF.

title: House Unit Seeks Boycott Rule Data
description: WASHINGTON. Oct. 25A House suncommittee today demanded that the Commerce Denartment turn over all internal memoranda and written comments from private business, foreign governments, end other executive agencies concerning the department's proposed regulations to enforce the new antihoycott law.

title: Music: Johann S.
description: THE 10TH ANNIVERSARY season of Bach concerts got under way at Holy Trinity Church on Monday night with a cantata whose title summed up what many admirers of the composer feel about his music: Ich habe genug, which is generally translated as It is enough.

title: Jersey Survey Based On 2,115 Interviews
description: The New York TimesChannel 2 News survey was based on telephone interviews with 2,115 adult men and women in New Jersey, including 1,416 registered voters. The interviews were conducted from Oct. 15 to 19.

title: Organizing South and Fighting Jobs Loss
description: A. H. Raskin

title: World Hockey Ass'n
OTTO F. FREITAG
description: CLINTON, Mass., Oct. 25 (AP)Otto F. Freitag, the former catchermanager for the old International League Jersey City team, died Monday night at his home at the age of 80 after a long illness. Burial will be here Thursday.

title: New Auto Sales Increase 16.7%
description: DETROIT, Oct. 25Domestic new car sales for the second 10day period of October were 16.7 percent ahead of last year's level, according to industry reports released here today. The Big Four auto makers sold a total of 291,658 passenger cars for this period.

title: Landes Reports He Filed No Returns for 3 Years; State Conducting Audit
description: MINEOLA, LI., Oct. 25Assemblyman Irwin J. Landes, the Democratic candidate for Nassau County Executive, said today that he had not filed tax returns for the last three years until last March 1 because they involved complex business matters and because I was aware would not have a tax to pay.

title: White House Discounts Allegations About an Israeli Theft of Uranium,
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25The White House said today that as far as this Administration is concerned a series of allegations that Israel had stolen or had diverted weaponsgrade nuclear material from the United States were unproven.

title: Market Place
description: The perils of international trade sometimes outweigh its advantages, the Weyerhaeuser Company's recent experiences seem to suggest.

title: U.S. IS SAID TO AGREE TO ARMS SANCTIONS AGAINST SOUTHAFRICA
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25The United States has decided in principle to support a proposed move in the United Nations Security Council to impose a mandatory embargo on arms sales to South Africa, Administration officials said today.

title: Arena Stage Names David Chambers to Staff
description: Zelda Fichanciler, producing director of the Arena Stage in Washington, has announced the appointment of David Chambers as associate producjag director. Mr. Chambers will he responsible for the next two seasons at Arena Stage1978.79, and 197980 Mrs. Fichandler said. She added that she planned to disengage herself from the responsibilities of artistic administration and direct her energies to other aspects of Arena Stage activity.

title: Music: Fine Contemporary Group
description: STYLISTIC DIVERSITY and a generous number of premieres graced the opening concert of the season presented by the Group for Contemporary Music at the Manhattan School Monday night. Four of the five items on the program were new to New York, all of them composed within the last four years.

title: Abu Dhabi Attack Kills Arab Official, Apparently in Error
description: ABU DHABI, Oct. 25A high official of the United Arab Emirates was shot and killed today in a burst of gunfire that was apparently intended for the Foreign Minister of Syria, Abdel Halim Khaddam.

title: Tito's Wife Is Rumored in Disfavor for Backing Serbian Faction
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Oct. 25Serious personal and political rifts between Jovanka BrozTito and her husband are threatening to disrupt Marshal Tito's efforts to portray a country moving toward a tranquil transition after he passes from the scene.

title: Associated Press
description: CENTURYOLD CHURCH DESTROYED: The Mount Olive Baptist Church in Hoboken still smouldering yesterday after a fire yesterday that forced the evacuation of some 100 residents of nearby buildings. The church, which was undergoing a $100,000 renovation, was the only black Baptist church in the city, and had about 350 members. Eleven families in building at right were left homeless. Hoboken officials ordered the church torn down.

title: GERMAN TERROR STIRS A DEBATE ON SECRECY
description: BONN, Oct. 26Franz Josef Strauss, the conservative politician and former defense minister today called recent disclosures concerning the raid by West German commandos at the airport of Mogadishu, Somalia, absolutely irresponsible because they had supplied valuable information to wouldbe hijackers.

title: Grant for ExPsychiatric Patients
description: TRENTON, Oct. 26 (AP)The State of New Jersey has been awarded a $385,000 Federal grint to give former psychiatric patients a better chance of succeeding once they return to society. The state's Ihiman Services Commissioner, Ann Klein, said yesterday that $115,000 would be used to study services currently available and the remaining $300,000 wollld go toward expanding housing, counseling, ioh training and placement. Essex, Middlesex, Mercer and Camden Counties will receive the funds, she said.

title: General Foods Profit Falls 36.7%, Decline in Coffee Demand Blamed
description: The decline in coffee demand and $17.5 million writedown for coffee inventories caused earnings of the General Foods Corporation to fall 36.7 percent in the September quarter, the big packaged foods producer reported yesterday.

title: Meadowlands Results
BYRNE ROLE IN URGING JUDGESHIP IS STUDIED
description: TRENTON, Oct. 26  Documents released today by the State Senate show that Governor Byrne asked Chief Justice Richard J. Hughes of the New Jersey Supreme Court to help him lobby for a judicial appointment in the Senate last year.

title: Letters
description: Antiques Addenda

title: Women's Parley to Get 26 Planks
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 26 (UPI)The International Women's Year Commission today published 26 proposals, including support for the equal rights amendment, abortion and lesbian rights, to be debated at a national meeting of women next month.

title: Ministers by Mail
description: New York State, frustrated by a yearlong effort to keep mailorder ministers from getting propertytax exemptions, ordered four Tax Assessors in Ulster and Sullivan Counties yesterday to restore to the tax rolls 230 members of the Universal Life. Church.

title: WhiteCollar Employees at Nuclear Submarine Yard in Groton Ask Why? as 3,000 Layoffs Begin
description: GROTON, Conn., Oct. 26As he left the engineering building of the Electric Boat Division of General Dynamics, his arms laden with a 19year accumulation of office paraphernalia, Richard L. }Talbert unhookedhis security badge and laced it on a table.

title: Carter's Media Specialist Is Giving Up Politics for Films
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 26When Jimmy Carter was elected President last year, a new world seemed to open for Gerald Rafshoon, the Atlanta media specialist whose television commercials helped lift Mr. Carter from relative obscurity to national prominence,

title: Senate Committee Will Proceed On Mendelsohn Nomination Vote
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 26 (AP)A Senate committee has decided not to wait for completion of an investigation of the campaign spending practices of Robert Mendelsohn before voting on his nomination as an assistant Secretary of Interior.

title: NBCTV Shifts Program Executive
description: In yet another executive shuffle at the television networks ina hotly competitive season that has already seen two network presidents fall, NBCTV yesterday appointed Paul L. Klein chief of programming, with the title of executive vice president.

title: 45% in New Poll Call Carter Conservative
description: President Carter was generally perceived as a liberal in the 1976 Presidential campaign, but now a plurality of those polled consider him a conservative, according to the results of Gallup Poll made public yesterday.

title: People and Business
description: John J. Tuohy, chairman and chief executive officer of the Long Island Lighting Company, said yesterday that he planned to relinquish those positions at the end of the year. Mr. Tuohy, who is 61 years old, will be succeeded by Charles R. Pierce, 55, who is president. Wilfred O. Uhl, 50, senior vice president of engineering and project management, will become president.

title: Hankyu Is Victor in Japan
description: TOKYO, Oct. 26 (UPI)The Hankyu Braves scored four runs in the top of the ninth inning today to defeat the Yomiuri Giants, 52, and take a lead of three games to one in Japan's fourofsevengame professional baseball serie.

title: Operators of SST Agree Noise Level Passed Limit Once
description: Operators of the supersonic Concorde airliner said yesterday that a New York City official was correct in stating that the plane had emitted excessive noise climbing over the Rockaway peninsula after its takeoff from Kennedy International Airport last Friday.

title: South Africa Orders Inquest Into Biko's Death in Jail
description: JOHANNESBURG, Oct. 26South African officials decided today to open an inquest on Friday into the death of Stephen Biko, the country's foremost young black leader, who died in police custody six weeks ago. An autopsy has already found that the cause of death was extensive brain injuries.

title: North Stars 3, Bruins 0
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Oct. 26 (AP) Tim Young and Alex Piths scored firstperiod goals and Glen Sharpley added the clincher on a breakaway in the third period as the Minnesota North Stars and their goalie. Pete LoPresti, blanked the Boston Bruins, 30, tonight for their first victory of the season. The North Stars had lost their first six games.

title: Hard Truths Of Winter
description: IHAVEN'T looked at the statistics lately, but presumably a great many people are still migrating California under the mistaken assumption that the grass is greener in my native state. Actually, the grass Is brown, which was one of many reasons couldn't wait to grow up and leave California altogether.

title: Q&A
description: Q. When we had our house built 15 years ago we used very lightcdlored cedar shingles. We were told nothing could prevent them from turning black, and in about a year or two they did get very dark. We are now completing a new wing to the house, using the same kind of shingles. Is there any way we can treat them so they will stay the original color?T.F., Manhattan

title: China Wins at Table Tennis
description: HONK KONG, Oct. 26 (AP)China beat Japan, 52, to win the team championship in the first Hong Kong International Invitation table tennis tournament tonight. Japan placed second, followed by Hong Kong, the United States and England. The Americans Astros pitcher, J. R. Richard, today at and three defeats.

title: In Black, and Green
description: The successful record of black business is there for anyone to read. Since 1973, Black Enterprise magazine has published an annual list of the 100 largest blackowned businesses in the country (excluding banks, insurance companies and professional service enterprises). These businesses showed a sales total of $459 million for 1972; by 1976, this figure was up to $775 million  a 69 percent gain in five years. Even discounting for inflation, this growth record stands at 26 percent.

title: Vance Briefs U.S. Jews on Mideast; They Charge an AntiIsrael Trend
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 26A Carter Administration effort to explain its Middle East policies today turned into a forum for American Jewish leaders to express anger over what they perceive as an antiIsrael drift in those policies.

title: A BILL TO AID CONSUMERS SENT TO FLOOR OF HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct: 26A new bill to set up a consumer protection agency, backed by the White House and by :onsumer groups, cleared its  first barrier today when the House Rules Committee voted to send it to the House floor.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: WHO'S ON VERSE? Andrei Voznesensky, one of the Soviet Union's bestknown poets and a protg of the late novelist Boris Pasternak, will read from his work tonight at 8:30, with an English translator, at the Altschul Auditorium of Columbia University's International Affairs Building, 118th Street and Amsterdam Avenue. The event is free. It will be Mr. Voznesensky's first stage appearance in New York since 1972. He is in this country as a Fellow at the Kennan Institute of the Smithsonian Institution.

title: G.O.P. Whip Says Miss Costanza Should Resign Over Law Violation
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 26 (UPI)The House Republican whip, Robert H. Michel of Illinois, today called on Margaret Costanza, a presidential aide, to resign, charging she violated Federal election law by failing until recently to report campaign money raisqd early this year.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
Egypt Denounces Israel at U.N. For Settlements in Arab Lands
description: UNITED NATIONS,N.Y., Oct. 26Egypt led off an attack in the General Assembly today on Israel's establishment of settlements in occupied Arab lands, asking the United Nations to respond vigorously to what it called Israel's illegal acts.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Eugene H. Nickerson, former Nassau County Executive, and Charles P. Sifton, former chief appellate attorney in the Southern District of New York. were sworn in yesterday as Federal District Court judges in the Eastern District.

title: A Tract For All
description: NORTH PALM BEACH, Fla.Those who seek a wilderness experience by rushing off to Yellowstone National Park or the Great Smoky Mountains often find they have quite an experience, but with very little wilderness involved. They are more likely to find milling throngs, shuttle buses, and trails with beilttobelt traffic.

title: Conferees Agree on Home Solar Heating Subsidies
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 26House and Senate energy conferees agreed today on a program of federally subsidized loans for domestic solar heating units and ruled out mandatory Federal standards for fuel efficiency of pumps and motors.

title: 2 Germanys Hold Traffic Talks
description: EAST BERLIN, Oct. 26 (Reuters)East and West Germany resumed negotiations today on road improvements to speed Western traffic crossing their joint border on the way to West Berlin.

title: Bethlehem Steel Has Worst Loss In U.S. History
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corporation, the nation's second largest steel producer, reported yesterday a net loss of $477 million in the third quarter, the largest ever for a quarter for an American company.

title: Repeater BB Pistols Are Recalled
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 26 (UPI)A portion of the 25,000 repeater pistol BB guns distributed nationwide by the Crosman Arms Company are defective and owners are urged to return the weapons to an authorized service center. The Consumer Product Safety Commission announced yesterday the recall of the guns, saying they might have a defect that could cause them to fire even when the safety latch is on. Involved are model 454 repeater pistols marketed by Crosman.

title: Lava Stops Flowing At Hawaii Volcano
description: VOLCANO, ltawaii, Oct, 26 (UP1)Some 30 to 40 million cubic meters of lava poured from the east rift zone of Kilauea Volcano in a two and a halfweeklong eruption now declared officially over, scientists at the Hawaiian Volcano Observatory said yesterday.

title: Vance Adviser Urges U.S. to Make Overtures to the Next Soviet Leaders
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 26The Carter Administration's ranking Soviet specialist told a House committee today that the Soviet Union was on the verge of a wholesale generational turnover at the top and the new leaders should be encouraged to enter into constructive relations with the United States.

title: Prosecution in Trial for Perjury Of Justice Tyler Rests Its Case
description: i The prosecution in the perjury trial of 1 Justice Andrew R. Tyler of New York State Supreme Court rested its case yes! terday after presenting to the jury the parts of his grand jury testimony in which it is alleged he lied.

title: BURNS BACKS POLICY OF HIGHER INTEREST IN ANSWER TO CARTER
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 26Arthur F. Burns, implicitly rebuking the Carter Administration, today defended the Federal Reserve Board's policy of encouraging higher interest rates as a means of checking what would otherwise have been an explosion of the money supply.

title: Democrat Is Named By Carey to Replace Roth in Liquor Post
description: Michael Roth, a Republican who has served as chairman of the State Liquor Authority for three and a half years, resigned yesterday. Governor Carey immediately named Hugh B. Marious, Democratic member of tha authority, as acting chairman.

title: Australian Pacer Who Keeps Going Lame Has Won 9 of Last 12 Races
description: YONKERS, Oct. 26The Australianbred Amlin, who, at the age of 13, has been captivating Yonkers Raceway fans, will seek his fourth straight victory tomorrow night at the Westchester County harness horse track.

title: Striking Miners Are. Sentenced
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Ky. Oct. 26 (AT)Judge J. B. Johnson Jr. of Circuit Court. today sentenced 11 coal miners to jail and ordered 68 more to post $1,000 bonds after finding them guilty of violating his injunction limiting the number of pickets at a southeastern Kentucky mine. They were among 84 men charged with violating the judge's order during recent violen incidents at the Stearn's Mining Compa

title: Knicks Lose To Jazz By 123106
description: NEW ORLEANS. Oct. 26  Five months ago, the best Gail Goodrich could do was shuffle. The knifing pain In his right ankle after Achilles tendon surgery during the offceason was so great he couldn't jog.

title: Wharton of Michigan to Head State U. of New York
description: Dr. Clifton R. Wharton Jr., the president of Michigan State University, was named yesterday to he the next chancellor of the 345,000student State University of New York, the largest in the country.

title: Carey Called PartTime Governor By Union Analyst in Study on Jobs
description: A labor union analyst charged yesterday that Governor Carey had become parttime Governor who was neglecting to keep up with his job in part because of a hectic social life and latehour attendance at a bar.

title: Hers
description: HAVING RECENTLY become a statistic in the marriage fallout charts, I was forced to take stock of myself. There is a lulling complacency about being married that allows the aging process to follow a natural course and to mercifully avoid critical scrutiny in the looking glass. After all, married couples can hold the aging cycle over each other's head. It only takes one session in front of the family album where the wife can say, Gosh, I remember that trip. You still had hair then; to which the husband can respond, I'll never forget it either. That was the last trip where you could wear a bikini and the beach boys didn't snicker. The script then calls for a loving and a leisurely stroll down memory lane, waving balanceofpower flags.

title: Dance: Rudner's Brilliant As Is/...
description: IN the three years since she left Twyla Tharp's company, with which she danced for nine years, Sara Rudner has picked up a large following. In any case, the house was full Tuesday night at the Entermedia Theater, where the Dance Umbrella series is presenting the Sara Rudner Performance Ensemble this week, alternating with Dianne McIntyre's Company.

title: WILLIAM LEONARD VOORDUIN
description: William Leonard Voorduin, a retired vice president o? engineering at the Development and Resources Corporation in New York City, died Friday in a nursing home in Huntington, L.I. He was 80 years old and had lived in Sea Island. Ga.

title: 4 in Masks Set Youth Afire
description: FORT WORTH, Oct. 26 (UPI)  Four persons wearing Halloween masks kidnapped a 17yearold high school student Tuesday, set him on fire and left him outside a fire station. Cornell Sharp Jr. was in stable condition at a local hospital with firstdegree burns on his neck and face. Minnie Sharp said the four persons forced her son into a car and drove him to a place where he was doused with gasoline and set on fire.

title: Panel Approves Public Printer
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 26 (AP)The Senate Rules Committee today approved the nomination of John J. Boyle to be the United States Public Printer. Mr. Boyle, now Deputy Public Printer, was named by President Carter to succeed Thomas F. McCormick, who has resigned, as head of the Government Printing Office.

title: Knicks
Notes on People
description: CORETTA SCOTT KING will be presented he United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization's Ceres medal tomorrow morning at the United Nations headquarters here. Mrs. King, a member of the United States delegation to the General Assembly, will receive the award from Edouard Saouma, director general of the F.A.O. The medal portrays Mrs. King as Ceres, the Roman goddess of agriculture. It was struck In honor of her outstanding wont on behalf of the underprivileged and her vision of a world free from hunger and want. The reverse of the medal shows the four King children and gives a line from a sermon by Mrs. King's late husband the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.: Tell them . . . I did try to feed the hungry.

title: GARDENING
description: THERE ARE ominous signs in the suburbs that the city may be due for another severe winter. Flocks of our winter birds are already on the wing. Evening grosbeaks and red polls have moved down from the north well ahead of schedule.

title: Sadat Alters Cabinet, Stressing Economic Efficiency
description: CAIRO, Oct. 26A new Egyptian Cabinet was sworn in today with a limited shuffle of officials, as had been expected, aimed at improving economic performance and efficiency in the vast bureaucracy.

title: Wood, Field &
description: Those who do not hunt deer may he unaware that the animals have marvelously keen sense of smell, relying on it more than on hearing or eyesight for survival.

title: Two Policemen Indicted In Case Involving Beating Of 7 Brooklyn Prisoners
description: Two New York City policemen have hrrn indicted and a third is being investigatod in connection with the heating of scven prisoners while they were in a polic2 van awaiting transportation from one precinct to another.

title: Advertising
description: HOT SPRINGS, Va., Oct. 26Representatives of some of the nation's most powerful advertisers have met with TV program producers and the networks in hopes of preventing a glut of sex from replacing the glut of violence in network programming.

title: LAURENCE F. GRABER.
description: MADISON. Wis. Oct. 26 (AP)Laurence F. Graher who helped to develop a strain of alfalfa that thrives in the Wisconsin climate died yesterday. He was 90 years old.

title: Mobil's Profit Dipped by 5.1% For 3d Quarter
description: The overall softness of oil company profits in the third quarter was confirmed yesterday with the Mobil Corporation, the nation's thirdlargest oil producer, reporting a 5.1 percent decrease, to $239 million, or $2.26 a share.

title: Personal Beauty
description: WE DON'T know if Estee Lauder has been lying awake nights worrying about the contenders who keep popping up to usurp her crown as queen of the beauty makers. Everybody, these days, is getting into the cosmetics business. Not just Halston and Calvin Klein and anyone with name on a dress label, but actresses, Queens, housewives and nature buffs who mash up herbs and strain mud on remote farms.

title: Statue of Liberty Demonstrators Are All Released on Minimal Bail
description: Twentynine demonstrators who occupied the Statue of Liberty on Tuesday were released on minimal bail yesterday in Federal District Court in Manhattan. They were charged with a misdemeanor involving trespassing on Federal property.

title: Carter's News Parley On Television Today
description: President Carter's news conference, scheduled for 2:30 P.M. today, will be televised live by the three networks and their local stationsChannels 2, 4 and 7. On radio, the following stations have also scheduled live coverage: WCBSAM, WINS and WNYCAM.

title: Foreign Direct Investment in U.S. Rose 9.1% to $30.2 Billion in 76;
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 26 (UPI)Foreign direct investment in American business rose 9.1 percent last year to $30.2 billion, the Commerce Department said today.

title: Dance: Ambitious Equinox
description: ONE OF THE FINEST things about Brooklyn happens to be situated in Philadelphiait is the Pennsylvania Ballet,. the resident ballet company of the Brooklyn Academy of Music. The Pennsylvanians, happily enough, officially opened the 197778 season at the academy on Tuesday night. It was the academy's resurgence following the disastrous flood of Sept. 5, which at one time seemed to threaten the academy, or at least its immediate future.

title: Capitals 6, Flames 2
description: ATLANTA. Oct. 26 (AP)Walter McKechnie and Bill Collins scored goals in the first 73 seconds of the second period to help the Washington Capitals beat the Atlanta Flames, 62, tonight.

title: Detroit Edison Delays Offering
description: The Detroit Edison Company announced late yesterday that it was temporarily delaying its proposed offering of 4 million shares of common stock, scheduled to open today, because of an appeal by the Public Interest Research Group in Michigan challenging authorization oI the issue.

title: 3 Held in the Seizure Of Apartment House
description: The police in Brooklyn arrested three teenage boys yesterday in an apartment house that had been seized by neighborhood youth gang. Other gang members had left the building, the police reported.

title: ROBERT GAYLORD BARNES, FORMER ENVOY TO JORDAN
description: Robert Gaylord Barnes, former Ambassador to Jordan, died Monday at the Hospital of the Albert Einstein College of Medicine. Mr. Barnes, who lived in Dobbs Ferry, N.Y., was 63 years old.

title: Cautious Hope in Mideast On Avoidance of Fighting
description: KUWAITAs much on economic grounds as military, officials and diplomats in both Israel and Egypt are expressing cautious but unmistakable optimism that the uneasy peace between the two antagonists will holdfor the next few years, at

title: Bethlehem Steel Has Worst Loss In U.S History
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corporation, the nation's second largest steel producer, reported yesterday a net loss of $477 million in the third quarter, the largest ever for a quarter for an American company.

title: Fire Early in the Morning At the St. Moritz Forces 500 Guests Into the Lobby
description: A smoky, earlymorning fire in kitchen exhaust duct sent guests at the St. Moritz Hotel to the lobby in all manner of nocturnal attire. There were no injuries, damage was minimal and there was no panic.

title: Senate Puts Off Energy Tax Vote To Give Republicans Time to Agree
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 26The Senate delayed today a key test vote on the tax aspects of the energy program to give Republican members time to try to arrive at a common position.

title: Reluctant Witnesses Finally Help in Murder Arrest
description: After finally winning the cooperation of a reluctant neighborhood, Brooklyn homicide detectives arrested Joseph D'Amico yesterday evening and charged him with the murder of his neighbor, Angelo Treglia, on a crowded Bensonhurst street over the wekend.

title: A VACCINE SUCCEEDS AGAINST PNEUMONIA
description: Successful testing of a vaccine in chit dren against a major cause of pneumonia, meningitis and ear infections that can cause deafness was reported yesterday by medical scientists in California.

title: SOCIAL SECURITY PLAN FOR CIVIL SERVANTS KILLED BY THE HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 26The House of Representatives killed a provision in the pending Social Security financing bill tonight that would have made Social Security coverage mandatory in 1982 for all civilian employees of the Federal, state and local governments.

title: F.D.A. Acts to Require Warning for Prescribed Tranquilizers
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 26 (AP)The Food and Drug Administration took a first step today toward requiring manufacturers to include warning brochures with some tranquilizers.

title: A Variety of Companies Report on Their Sales and Earnings Figures for Latest Periods
Assoclatod Pross;
description: FLAMES LIGHTED THE SKY early yesterday as an ollwell fire raged at the U.S. Petroleum Reserve in Elks Hills, Calif. Red Adair, famed oilwell firefighter, arrived yester(lay to help battle the blaze that killed three on Tuesday.

title: A 2d Director Quits The Trib In Controversy
description: A second member of the board of di dectors of The Trib, the daily newspaper scheduled to come out in January, resigned yesterday in a controversy involving charges by the paper's publisher that William E. Simon, former Secretary of the Treasury, had attempted to gain editorial and financial control of the paper to further his own political ambitions.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Army Set for Heisman Day,
description: Rarely do civilians other than presidents, prime ministers, visiting monarchs, or retired generals take the review at a dress parade of the United States Corps of Cadets. CerCollege Sports Notestainty no one can remember when mere retired second lieutenant took the review at West Point. But the United States Military Academy' s students4,200 strong and in stepwill parade Saturday at 11 A.M. for the benefit of one retired second looie, one retired brigadier general and an active colonel. Each of these men has something no other graduate of West Point has earned, and for that reason the trio is being honored.

title: Books of The Times
description: MARILYN FRENCH'S first novel, The Women's Room, is a history of women from the 1950's through the 70's, and the best compliment I can pay it is that I kept forgetting that it was fiction. It seized me by my preconceptions and I kept struggling and arguing with its premises.

title: South. Africa Defies U.S. on Arms, Says It Can Surmount an Embargo
description: JOHANNESBURG, Oct. 26Defense Minister Pieter W. Botha said tonight that South Africa had a strong enough arms industry to surmount an international embargo and to put up a fight that will astonish opponents seeking to end white rule.

title: GERMAN PANEL CALLS PRISONERS SUICIDES
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, Oct. 26--A commission investigating the deaths of three imprisoned terrorists last week said today that there can be no doubt that they committed suicide. But, it added, it can he assumed that in doing so they tried to make their deaths look like murder.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Literary Lights Glow for Literary Guild
description: SOME OF THE LEADING lights of the literary world did two things last night they don't normally do: They donned evening clothes, and they gathered under the same roofthe roof of the Grand Ballroom of the WaldorfAstoria Hotel.

title: 4 Shot and a Bank Robber Is Slain After Chase Near Gramercy Park
description: A bank robber who took two hostages while trying to make a getaway was fatally shot yesterday and a policeman and three civilians were wounded in a fusillade of bullets on a busy street near Gramercy Park.

description: These are the most popular albums and singles nationwide, compiled by Record World, a trade publication. Albums are determined by sales figures from major retail outlets; singles are chosen combined sales and radio airplay. An asterisk indicates an especially fastselling record.

description: Wednesday, Oct. 26, 1977

title: Washington &
description: WASHINGTONThough it creates the nation's money and spends a fair portion of it itself, the Federal Reserve ystem is on or those rare Federal agencies not subject to audit by the General Accounting Office.

title: Feeling About Byrne Called Election Key
description: A majority of those who intend to vote in the New Jersey gubernatorial election on Nov. 8 will apparently base their choice principally on their feelings about Governor Byrne and not on their perceptions of his challenger, State Senator Raymond H. Bateman.

title: 4Goal Performance byVickers Helps Rangers Down Blues, 62
description: Steve Vickers, who was benched for Sunday's game with Montreal, came roaring back last night, scoring four goals in the Rangers 62 victory over the St. Louis Blues. Playing on a line with Don Murdoch and Walt Tkaczuk, a combination that met with success early last season, Vickers, a proud, stoic man with the brush mustache, made his point.

title: Dollar Stable Abroad
description: The dollar was stable in foreign exchange trading in Europe yesterday and was mixed against the Japanese yen; gold prices were mixed, The Associated Press reported.

title: PROSPEROUS ALBERTA WANTS BIGGER VOICE
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Oct. 20Peter Lougheed, the Premier of Canada's most dynamic province, is waiting for Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau to put forward some dramatic proposals to overcome the crisis in the country's federal system.

title: New Digital Clock In Capital Tallies World Population
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 26The Environmental Fund unveiled outside its offices today a huge digital clock that measures not time but the rate at which the group contends that the world is overpopulating itself.

title: New York Times Lists 35.9% Rise In 3dQuarter Net
description: The New York Times Company yesterday reported a 35.9 percent increase in thirdquarter earnings, to $5.S million, or 31 cents a share, compared with the yearearlier $4.3 million, or 38 cents a share.

title: Brown Says Lagging Fuel Supply Is Largest Threat to U.S. Security
description: Defense Secretary Harold Brown, declaring that the United States faced a putential energy disaster, said yesterday that lagging fuel supplies posed the single largest threat to national security.

title: Revolutionary War Iron Mine Reopens
description: MOUNT HOPE, N.J.. Oct. 26The historic, but dormant, Mount Hope iron mineacclaimed by geologists as the repository of the highestquality ore in the Western Hemispherewas officially reopened today to become the only active iron mine east of the Mississippi River.

title: Undisturbed by Fed's Rate Rise, Prices on Bonds Climb Moderately
description: Undisturbed by the Federal Reserve's discountrate increase late Tuesday, the credit markets rose moderately in price yesterday, pushing interest rates down slightly.

title: PUERTO RICAN PRICES PUSHED UP BY STRIKE
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Oct. 26The price of imported meat has climbed by 12 cents to 39 cents a pound while supermarket and grocery store shelves normally filled with canned goods are bare as a result of the 26day longshoremen's strike that has crippled cargo shipments /from Maine to Texas.
