description: David R. Berkowitz, who is accused of being the 44caliber killer, met yesterday with his natural mother, Betty Falco, at Kings County Hospital for the first time since his arrest and confinement there more than two months ago.

title: Pan Am 747 Jet Sets A New Speed Record
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 30 (Reuters) A Pan American World Airways 747 jet carrying 150 passengers landed here tonight after flying around the world in a record 54 hours and seven minutes.

title: GOING OUT
description: HOWL NIGHT Leave it to Dracula, one of the two stage vampires in town at the moment, to do a little Halloween expanding. Down in Greenwich Village, at the Cherry Lane Theater, 38 Commerce Street, where The Passion of Dracula is flapping along nicely, the showcase has scheduled some ghoulish trimmings after tonight's performance at 8, with all seats priced at $10.

title: Raymond Emerson, 90, ExEngineer And Grandson of Famed Essayist
description: CONCORD, Mass., Oct. 30 (AP)Raymond Emerson, a former civil engineer and a retired investment banker who was the last surviving grandson of Ralph Waldo Emerson, the 19thcentury essayist, poet and philosopher, died Thursday at his home. He was 90 years old.

title: Minnesota Got That Old Letdown Feeling
description: Football teams are always afraid of a letdown the week after a big victory. Coaches try to prevent this psychological change. Players try their best to play with the intensity they displayed in the previous game. Yet letdowns happen constantly. Ask Minnesota's coaches and players. They know.

title: LongInactive Oilfield Is Open  for Now
description: TAFT, Calif.Just over a year ago, with great fanfare, oil began to trickle out of the ground at the Federal Government's vast Elk Hills Petroleum Reserve near here. It had been closed most of the time since the Teapot Dome Scandal of the 1920's.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an article Saturday on plans to develop the Washington estate of former Vice President Nelson A. Rockefeller. The Times reported incorrectly that William McCormick Blair Jr., who lives nearby, had declined to support opponents of the plan publicly. Mr. Blair has signed a protest petition and has contributed to an opposition fund.

title: News Summary
description: Banning nuclear fuel for South Africa was opposed by Andrew Young, who said that such an American embargo might encourage Pretoria to step up its own capacity to develop nuclear weapons. The chief American delegate to the U.N. said in a TV interview that while he might personally favor such a ban, it was too late to impose one because South Africa had achieved a nuclear potential of uncertain extent. [Page 1, Column 6.]

title: Inhuman Creedmoor Conditions Stir Protest From Queens Group
description: A citizens group concerned about patient care at Creedmoor Psychiatric Center in Queens said yesterday that it would lobby at the State Legislature to correct what it called inhuman conditions at the institution.

title: American Dance Festival Is Lured To Duke U. With $1 Million Pledge
description: Lured by a pledge of a $1 million endowment and by an unusual outpouring of support from North Carolina's artsconscious political, educational and business leaders, the American Dance Festival has announced that after 30 years at Connecticut College, it will move next summer to Duke University in Durham, N. C.

title: Campus Concern Grows as Strike By Yale Workers Enters 2d Month
description: NEW HAVEN. Oct. 30A strike by 14,000 bluecollar workers at Yale University is entering its second month, with little progress in negotiations, but more involvement by students, faculty and the city.

title: Carey Under Growing Criticism; May Face Fight for Renomination
description: Less than two years after he was widely praised for staving off the bankruptcy of New York City and a possible fiscal collapse of the state, Governor Carey has been the target of such heavy criticism even within his own party that the possibility of a primary challenge of his renomination  once unthinkable and still unlikely  is being raised by some Democrats.

title: Beame Buys an East Side Coop
description: Mayor Beam, who will leave office on Dec. 31, has purchased a fourandonehalf room, 15thfloor cooperative apartment at 201 East 79th Street.

title: Homeakers Reported To Have Fewer Rights
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 30 (UPI)Homemakers enjoy substantially fewer rights than their husbands under state laws governing inheritance, divorce, property ownership, domestic violence and adultery, a new survey by a Federal agency reports.

title: Music: Lazar Berman Plays Uneven Piano Recital
description: Lazar Berman, who has apparently become an idol of New York audiences, attracted a full house for his Carnegie Hall recital yesterday afternoon. The audience overflowed onto the stage, and the hall was also packed with security officers. Carnegie Hall was seeing to it that there was no repetition of the disturbances from antiSoviet groups that have occurred at his recitals in the past.

title: For Baseball's 2d FreeAgent Class, Graduation Day Is Friday
description: Armed with the knowledge that wealthy free agents helped the Yankees win the championship and helped major league baseball set an attendance record, the owners of the 26 clubs are checking their checkbooks this week to find out how many millions of dollars they have for spending on the second class of free agents.

title: Commodities
description: For all practical purposes, this week marks the end of the corn harvest and the start of the annual battle of money and wits in the futures market for America's most important crop.

title: LEGISLATORS RECALL KOREAN GENEROSITY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 30  On the evening of Aug. 9, 1975, a United States Air Force transport carrying 11 Congressmen and 10 of their wives touched down at Kimpo Airport in Seoul. As the plane taxied to a stop, a flock of Korean National Assemblymen, senior officials of the Foreign Ministry and other leaders surged to the red carpet at planeside to bid the Americans welcome.

title: Pickling: A Tasty Way of Adding Spice to Walnuts
description: There are a few score meals that, over the years, have been ineradicably etched in my mind. Not the least of these was a breakfast served me in a small hotel in Torquay, England, shortly after the last World War. Rations were scarce, but somehow the owner had managed to find kippers and eggs, tomatoes and the makings of toast. As a consequence I dined on the best broiled herring I ever dined on before or since, creamy scrambled eggs and grilled tomatoes. Plus buttered toast, dark orange marmalade and cups of scaldinghot English breakfast tea. The food was devastatingly good, and I was also offered a novelty in the ?? of pickled walnuts.

title: Economic Shifts In Israel Prompt Protest Strikes
description: TEL AVIV, Oct, 30The Israeli Government's dramatic move toward a free market economy, announced late Friday, set off strikes and buying sprees today as workers demanded compensation for sudden price increases and shoppers hunted lastminute bargains.

title: Southern District Incumbents Confident of Reelection
description: MOUNT HOLLY, Oct. 30Party and voter loyalties are well defined and deeply rooted in the First, Third, Seventh and Eighth Legislative Districts in South Jersey, and the Democratic and Republican incumbents long entrenched in the region's broad expanse of rural farmland and old riverfront communities all exude confidence about their reelection to the State House.

title: Doctors Use Suction Instrument To Restore Partial Sight to Woman
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct, 30 (UPI)Using a delicate suction instrument developed only four years ago, doctors at Wills Eye Hospital here have restored partial sight to a 19yearold Mexican woman, who was blinded by disease at the age of 9.

title: In Mexican State, Aid Follows Cycle of Revolt and Repression
description: ATOYAC DE ALVAREZ, MexicoUntil recently, the Sierra Madre northwest of Acapulco echoed to the legends of Lucio Cabanas and Genaro Vazquez, two teachersturnedguerrillas who took up arms against the Government to fight the deep poverty that has plagued this region for centuries.

title: Nicaraguan Editor and Times Reporter Win Award
description: Pedro J. Chamorro Cardenal, director of the newspaper La Prensa of Managua in Nicaragua, and Jonathan Kandell, a reporter for The New York Times, will be honored by Columbia University tomorrow night as the 1977 winners of the Maria Moors Cabot Prizes for distiguished journalistic contributions to the advancement of interAmerican understanding.

title: U.S.European Mission to Venture Into Uncharted Space to Study Sun
description: PASADENA, Calif., Oct. 30American and European scientists are planning a twospacecraft mission in a region of space never before explored to obtain the first view of the solar system and the sun from a new perspective far above and below the plane in which the planets orbit the sun's equator.

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, OCTOBER 31, 1977

title: Handel's Water Music At Our Bach Concert
description: Handel's Water Music includen some of the greatest outdoor music ever written, but indoors on dry land it is best absorbed in relatively small doses.

title: Nationalist Outbreak in Lithuania Reported by a Soviet Dissident
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 30 (Reuters)A Soviet dissident said today that local people chanting nationalist slogans clashed with the police and tore down Communist posters in Vilnius, the capital of the Soviet republic of Lithuania, earlier this month, but a police official denied tonight that anything serious had happened.

title: Conrail Alters Commuter Runs On Its Hudson and Harlem Lines
description: New timetables for Conrail's Hudson and Harlem commuter lines went into effect yesterday.

title: A List of Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: Voters' Phones Ringing in Virginia As G.O.P. Dials for Governorship
description: ARLINGTON, Va., Oct. 30In the closing days of a frankly uncomplicated battle for the governorship between the Virginia business establishment and a Carterbacked liberal populist, the telephone never stops ringing.

title: Market Place
description: Many industrial companies face uncertain prospects for the next year and a half, reflecting a cloudy economic outlook. Thus, many shares that in boom times would seem cheap now find few takers.

title: B. Thoughtful Scores In Oak Leaf Stakes
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Oct. 30 (AP)B. Thoughtful, the heavy favorite, raced past Grenzen in the stretch and scored a convincing 3length victory in the $122,550 Oak Leaf Stakes today.

title: Grogan's 2dHalf Passing Breaks 1010 Deadlock
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Oct. 30Against the howling wind, and in front of a happy crowd in which many were searched for bottles and beer cans, Steve Grogan of the New England Patriots threw a pair of touchdowns after halftime today to send the Jets to a 2413 defeat.

title: Fire Upsets a Rural Setting
description: VASHON, Wash., Oct. 30 (AP)Three businesses on Vashon Island, a rural 44squaremile island near Seattle, were destroyed by fire today, and several other businesses were damaged. No cause was immediately determined. The fire may produce an unwanted result for the island's 7,500 residents, many of whom take The ferry to jobs in Seattle but cherish the oldfashioned rural nature of Vashon Island. Chuck Barrentine, the owner of a hardware store that was not damaged, said: I hate to see anything come up modern, but those old buildings will have to be replaced, and they'll be replaced with something modern. You may want to stay rural, but you can't fight Mother Nature.

title: Letter: On U.S. Medical, Students Abroad
description: To the Editor:

title: Rachel C. Mayrock Wed to Alan Sands
description: Rachel Chana Mayrock, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harry Mayrock of Old Westbury, L. I., was married yesterday afternoon to Alan Jay Sands, son of Mr. and Mrs. Sam Sands of Wantagh, L. I. Rabbi Melvin Keiffer performed the ceremony in the Sephardic Temple in Cedarhurst, L. I.

title: Leonard Silk
description: RIYADH, Saudi ArabiaTreasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal's oilmoneyandpeace mission to the Middle East wound up today after his flying visits to Egypt, Israel, Kuwait, Iran and Saudi Arabia. What did it reveal and what did it accomplish? On the crucial issue of oil prices, Mr. Blumenthal came away encouraged as he looks ahead to the meeting of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries in Venezuela in December.

title: Suzanne Holstein Married to Lee S. Saltzman
description: Suzanne Holstein, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Holstein of New York and Roslyn, L.I., was married yesterday morning to Lee S. Saltzman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Saltzman of New York and North Lauderdale, Fla. Cantor David Benedict performed the ceremony at the Harmonie Club.

title: Onegin Sung By Substitute
description: There was a good deal of groaning at the Metropolitan Opera House Satuday afternoon when Osie Hawkins announced that Sherrill Milnes would not be singing the title role in Eugene Onegin because he would be taking over Monday's Rigoletto from the indisposed Cornell MacNeil. As it turned out, the the groaning was entirely unnecessaryLenus Carlson, the young baritone who substituted for Mr. Milnes, turned in a marvelous performance.

title: Yonkers Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: Bridge:
description: Retrospectively speaking, silence is often golden at the bridge table. Once the bidding is complete, virtually all bidding by the declaring side helps the defenders, and any bidding the defenders have done tends to favor the declarer. A case in point is the diagramed deal, reported by Frank Stern of New York from a rubber bridge game.

title: Joffrey Offers Deuce Coupe And Parade
description: One needs more words in dance. Not words for the dancers to use, but more in the way of an esthetic vocabulary for the use of critics and others concerned with the mere discussion of dance rather than its execution. How. for example, is one to describe mimetic action, detailed squiggles of specific descriptive movement, fused into the dancing?

title: Corporate Profit Slowdown Expected in Latest Quarter
description: After breaching the $100 billion level for the first time earlier this year, corporate profits at an annual rate fell back in the third quarter, according to Wall Street estimates.

title: ISRAEL READY TO FREE A JAILED ARCHBISHOP
description: JERUSALEM, Oct. 30Israel said today that it was prepared to release Archbishop Hilarion Capucci, a prelate of the Greek Catholic faith convicted of arms smuggling, if it received a formal request from Pope Paul VI.

title: Friend of Fairies Is Not a Believer
description: Katharine M. Briggs, an English scholar who enters her 80th year of mortal life Saturday, approaches omniscience in airy realms. When she speaks of fairies, as on her current lecture tour of this country, she is talking about creatures such as banshees, bogies, brownies, dwarfs, elves, giants, goblins, hags, mermaids and wizards, and is careful not to slight others such as Bugganes, Doonies, Feens, Guytrash, Mumpokers, Pechs, Piskies, Pwcas, Redcaps, Shoopiltees, Skrikers, Waffs and Wulves and even Grigs, who are only pseudofairies.

title: Toward a Creative and Original Spain
description: MADRIDLess than two years ago, Spain was still a dictatorship where for four decades not a single office had been filled by means of elections, where only one political party was authorized, and where the rights of free expression, association, demonstration, unionization, etc., were nonexistent. Today, it is a democratic monarchy with any number of parties too many, without a doubt; with a Congress and a Senate chosen in absolutely free and peaceful elections, and a high degree of freedom, which some find excessive and which, indeed, has permitted an increasing number of strikes, demonstrations and debates.

title: Assemblyman Gets Carey's Help
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L.I., Oct. 30Governor Carey campaigned in Nassau County yesterday for Assemblyman Irwin J. Landes, calling the Democratic candidate for County Executive, part of the family who helped save New York.

title: 2 Die in Iran Refinery Explosion
description: TEHRAN, Iran, Oct. 30 (AP)Two persons were killed and I I injured in an explosion and fire today at the oil refinery at Abadan, about 400 miles south of here. The National Iranian Oil Company said the cause of the explosion was not known. but the fire was controlled and operations were not hampered.

title: Buffers Separating Wolf Packs May Help Insure Prey's Survival
description: The scentmarked buffer zones between wolves' territories, long known to minimize conflict between neighboring packs, may also serve to insure the survival of prey species such as deer, a new study has suggested.

title: Meadowlands
description: Horses lisled in order of post posillions

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: AT CHICAGO

title: Fund Shift to Treasury Securities By Individuals May Have Peaked
description: Individual investors eagerly bought the Treasury's new threeyear notes that were auctioned last Friday, but that sale may represent the crest in any buildup of disintermediation this fall.

title: The Secrecy Disease
description: BOSTON, Oct. 30For 39 days in the winter of 1975 the C.I.A. kept the lid on the story of the Glomar Explorer: the operation to raise a sunken Soviet submarine. A number of newspapers, magazines and broadcasters had the story, or parts of it, but they were persuaded by William E. Colby and other agency officials to suppress it on national security grounds. The C.I.A.'s campaign of media persuasion is detailed in some documents just obtained under the Freedom of Information Act, and a fascinating tale they tell. After these papers, it will be harder for journalists to believe in their selfimage as a tough, skeptical lot, immune to government cajolery. One hopes it will also be harder for anyone to believe official claims, so often made, that the sky will fall in if some secret document is disclosed.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES Winnipeg 5, Edmonton 2. Quebec 5, Houston 4.

title: Books of The Times
description: Just as there is no one alive today who hasn't heard all the jokes that W. C. Fields used to tell about Philadelphia, there is probably no one who hasn't heard of Philadelphia's own Frank L. Rizzo, the tough cop who won the mayoralty in 1971 on a crackdownoncrime platform and then proceeded to buy a $400,000 house on his $40,000ayear salary, fail a liedetector test in public and break his hip while attendine a fire. So what more there to say about this latest Philadelphia phenomenon, whom over 200,000 petitioners were prepared to throw out of office in 1976, if only a Rizzocontrolled board of elections hadn't contrived to find too many of their signatures invalid?

title: Brahms Requiem Done in Church
description: Last season the Boston Symphony Orchestra gave a performance of Berlioz's Requiem in the Church of St. Paul the Apostle, just south of Lincoln Center at 60th Street and Columbus Avenue. The venture was such a success that the Bostonians decided to repeat the experiment this season with another largescale, churchly choral work. The choice fell on Brahms's A German Requiem, which was presented on Saturday evening.

title: Body of Man Who Was Shot to Death Found in a Car Trunk in Brooklyn
description: The body of a young man was found in the trunk of a car late Saturday by the police after thieves discovered the body while stripping the vehicle, parked on Rochester Avenue and President Street and Lincoln Terrace Park in Brooklyn.

title: Shot Fired at Congressman's Home
description: MEMPHIS, Oct. 30 (AP)A bullet was fired into the home of Representative Harold E. Ford, Democrat of Tennessee, last night, the police said. The Congressman and members of his family were not injured. Capt. N.L. Harvey of the Memphis police force said that the bullet ripped through the carport of the Ford home about 10:30 P.M., when the Fords and their three children were in their bedrooms, and lodged in the dining room wall. The police said that they had no suspects and could offer no motive. Mr. Ford, Tennessee's first black Representative, is serving his second term in Congress.

title: Four Youths From Home for Boys Arrested in Beating in IRT Station
description: Four youths from the St. John's Horne Or Boys in the Rockaway Beach section of Queens were arrested early yesterday morning on charges of beating and attempting to rob a man at the IRT station at 23d Street and Lexington Avenue, according to the police.

title: Barbara Howell, Author, Is Married to Alan E. Woltz
description: In the Church Center for the United Nations yesterday morning, Barbara Howell of New York, daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. William H. Howell of Chicago, became the bride of Alan E. Woltz, son of Mrs. Robert Woltz of Fort Lee, N.J., and the late Mr. Woltz. The Rev, Melvin Hawthorne performed the nondenominational ceremony.

title: Sabres Send Canadiens To 2d Home Loss in Row
description: MONTREAL, Oct. 30 (UPI)  Rene Robert scored two goals tonight to help the Buffalo Sabres rout the Montreal Canadiens, 40, behind the goaltending of a rookie, Don Edwards.

title: Former Pittsburgh Mayor Is III
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 30 (AP)Former Mayor Joseph Barr of Pittsburgh has been admitted to Mercy Hospital after complaining of chest pains. Mr. Barr, 71 years old, was listed in stable condition today in the hospital's coronary care unit. He was hospitalized for a week earlier this month in Chicago after being stricken with a heart ailment.

title: YOUNG REJECTS BAN ON ATOM FUEL SALE TO SOUTH AFRICANS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 30  Andrew Young, the United States representative at the United Nations, ruled out today an American ban on the shipment of nuclear fuels to South Africa because such a prohibition might encourage South Africa to step up development of its own capacity to produce atomic weapons.

title: Around the Nation
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 30 (UPI)Chicago's inner city will be predominantly white by the end of the century, according to an urban affairs consultant who predicts that blacks will migrate to surrounding suburbs as whites reverse their housing patterns.

title: Japanese Official Says U.S. Is Key to Asian Peace
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Oct. 10Continued political stability in the Far East depends on the capacity and will of the United States to maintain the balance of power in that part of the world. Japan's top spokesman in the United States declared here last night.

title: Trudeau Pushes Plan for Commonwealth of FrenchSpeaking Nations
description: OTTAWA, Oct. 30To enhance Canada's image abroad as a bilingual country, and soothe the fractious French Canadian minority, the Government is pressing for a political organization of Frenchspeaking nations around the world.

title: Independence for Puerto Rico Sought in White House March
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 30 (UPI)Nearly 1.000 chanting demonstrators marched in front of the White House today, demanding independence for Puerto Rico and freedom for four nationalists in prison for violent attacks in the 1950's.

title: Sweat Equity: New Hope for South Bronx
description: Nothing less than the transformation of the whole South Bronx is the ambitious goal of the urban homesteaders who are using sweat equity to rebuild a nineblock Morrisania neighborhood.

title: Blumenthal in Rome For Economic Talks
description: ROME, Oct. 30 (Reuters)Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal arrived here tonight from the Middle East for meetings with Italian leaders to discuss economic cooperation between the two nations.

title: Divisiveness Is Continuing to Plague Episcopal Church
description: Confronted by several divisive issues, the Episcopal House of Bishops utilized artful compromise and gentlemanly deference at its recent Florida meeting to strike an uneasy peace. But the bishops, instead of quelling the storm, appear to have aroused a new round of strife in the nation's parishes.

title: Sports Today
description: FOOTBALL

title: Shepherd, Stevens Win Cardinal Classic Races
description: MARTINSVILLE Va., Oct. 30 (AP)Morgan Shepherd of Conover, N.C., grabbed the lead with five laps left and held off four challengers today for a narrow victory in the late model sportsman race, the second half of the Cardinal 500 classic autoracing doubleheader.

title: Diane Lynn Levine Wed to Mark Seiden
description: The marriage of Diane Lynn Levine, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard B. Levine of Teaneck, N. J., to Mark Alan Seiden, son of Mr. and MN. Norman Seiden of Tenafly, N. Y., took place yesterday at the Teaneck Jewish Center. Rabbi Judah Washer performed the ceremony.

title: LongDistance Marriage on Rise
description: Because they say they have a relationship characterized by love, understanding and respect for one another's individuality. Yves and Harriet Michel have separated after two children and 10 years of marriage.

title: Radio
description: 67:30 A.M., WNYCFM. Concerto Grosso No. 11, CoreIli; Serenade (K. 204), Mozart; Organ Concerto No. 8. Handel; Symphony No. 101, Haydn.

title: Brown, on Sandsablaze, Captures President's Cup
description: LANDOVER, Md., Oct. 30At the age of 21, Buddy Brown is the youngest member of the United States Equestrian team.

title: For the City Council
description: New York City's Council is one of the oldestand most stifledlegislative bodies in the United States. Multiple changes in its size, name, method of election and responsibilities emphasize how many years separate Peter Stuyvesant from Abraham Beame. The present City Council has 43 members, of whom 33 represent geographical districts. The remaining 10 are elected at large, two from each borough. But each voter may vote for only one atlarge candidate. The two with the highest vote, provided they are of different parties, win the seats. (This clumsy mechanism is a vestige of the proportional representation system that prevailed from 1938 to 1947 and under which all Council members were elected at large in each borough.)

title: 2 Thais Are Killed and 4 Wounded In Clashes on Cambodia Border
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Oct. 30 (Reuters) A Thai soldier and a policeman were killed and another four wounded yesterday in clashes with Cambodian troops along the border, the police said today.

title: LEVITT REPORT SAYS ERRORS COST NEW YORK MILLIONS
description: Errors by New York City's Human Resources Administration cost the city and state $4.9 million in Federal funds and $1.4 million additional in interest, according to a report by state auditors, released yesterday.

title: Oil Cargo Bill Went Down Despite Extensive Lobbying
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 30When the House defeated the oil cargo bill that would have given American ships a bigger part of the action in carrying imported oil, wags around here said that a $450,000 investment in the bill by maritime unions went down like the Titanic  or a rusty old Liberian tanker. Representative John M. Murphy, Democrat of Staten Island and chairman of the House Merchant Marine Committee, was the chief sponsor of the controversial bill that went down with all that money aboard. He said the bill would have revitalized the Port of New York.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n

title: Duren's Defense, Harris's Offense Help Chargers Sink Dolphins, 1413
description: The Miami Dolphins fell out of a firstplace tie with the Baltimore Colts in the National Football League's American Conference Eastern Division yesterday because of the nimble thievery of Clarence Duren and the determined running of James Harris.

title: Liza Minnelli's Act Is Fine as Cabaret
description: The Act is precisely what its name implies: It is an act, and a splendid one. On the other hand, it is a little less than its pretensions imply. Theatrical though it is as a performance, it is indifferent musical theater.

title: TV Campaign Begun Against Panama Canal Treaty
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 30The American Conservative Union began a television campaign last night against ratification of the Panama Canal treaties, showing a halfhour program that contends the retention of the canal is vital to our economy, our national defense and our spirit.

title: Article 3  No Title
Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: France and Hungary in Accord
description: BUDAPEST, Oct. 30 (Reuters)France and Hungary, agreeing that their economic exchanges were not growing fast enough. have pledged here to double their trade in the shortest possible time. A joint statement issued yesterday after a threeday visit here by Prime Minister Raymond Barre of France said the two nations had decided to stimulate sales in each other's country and aim for a better trade balance, which is in France's favor.

title: LongDistance Marriage on Rise
description: Because they say they have a relationship characterized by love, understanding and respect for one another's individuality. Yves and Harriet Michel have separated after two children and 10 years of marriage.

title: Use of Salinger's Catcher in the Rye In Salem County School Stirs a Dispute
description: OLIVET, Oct. 28After more than a quarter of a century, J. D. Salinger's novel, Catcher in the Rye, is still stirring controversy. Residents of this small Salem County community and the surrounding area are in a heated dispute over the use of the novel, first published in 1951, in a class at Pittgsrove Township High School.

title: J. GLENN GRAY, TRANSLATED THE WORKS OF HEIDEGGER
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Oct. 30 (UPI)J. Glenn Gray, who supervised English translations of the German philosopher Martin Heidegger for Harper & Row, died of a heart attack yesterday at his home. He was 64 years old.

title: White Snow, Clean Hands and Korea
description: Images of a word: For a generation, Korea to Americans connoted a feisty Harry Truman and a bold, costly defense of American vital interests. Today, it connotes a malodorous scandal involving payments to Congressmen to favor South Korean interests. South Korea refuses to cooperate with American investigations this Operation White Snow. By now, the Seoul Government must be starting to weigh the price of its obduracy.

title: 4 IN RACE FOR MAYOR HOLD BROAD DEBATE
description: As The New York City mayoral campaign entered its final full week, the four major candidates yesterday engaged in an illtempered television debate.
